THE CUSTOM OF [THE COUNTRY]424-the country by [EDITH WHARTON]190-edith wharton 1913 THE CUSTOM OF THE COUNTRY [I]0-i " Undine [Spragg]191-mr. spragg -- how can [you]191-mr. spragg ? "[426-her mother] [[her]425-her mother]426-her mother wailed , raising a prematurely - wrinkled hand heavy with rings to defend the note which [a languid " bell - boy]3740-a languid " bell - boy "[426-her mother] had just brought in . But [her]426-her mother defence was as feeble as [her]426-her mother protest , and [she]426-her mother continued to smile on [[her]426-her mother visitor]427-her visitor while [Miss Spragg]192-undine , with a turn of [her]192-undine quick young fingers , possessed [herself]192-undine of the missive and withdrew to the window to read it . " [I]192-undine guess it 's meant for [me]192-undine , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine merely threw over [her]192-undine shoulder at [[her]425-her mother]426-her mother . " Did [you]430-the mother EVER , [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny ? "[192-undine] [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg murmured with deprecating pride . [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny , [a stout professional - looking person in a waterproof , [her]193-mrs. heeny rusty veil thrown back , and a shabby alligator bag at [her]193-mrs. heeny feet]429-a stout professional - looking person in a waterproof , her rusty veil thrown back , and a shabby alligator bag at her feet , followed [the mother]430-the mother 's glance with good - humoured approval . " [I]193-mrs. heeny never met with a lovelier form , "[193-mrs. heeny] [she]193-mrs. heeny agreed , answering the spirit rather than the letter of [[her]193-mrs. heeny hostess]431-her hostess 's enquiry . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg and [[her]194-mrs. spragg visitor]427-her visitor were enthroned in two heavy gilt armchairs in [one of [the private drawing - rooms of [the Hotel Stentorian]435-the hotel stentorian]434-the private drawing - rooms of the hotel stentorian]433-one of the private drawing - rooms of the hotel stentorian . [The Spragg rooms]436-the spragg rooms were known as [one of [the Looey suites]438-the looey suites]437-one of the looey suites , and [the drawing - room]439-the drawing - room walls , above [their]436-the spragg rooms wainscoting of highly - varnished mahogany , were hung with salmon - pink damask and adorned with oval portraits of [Marie Antoinette]195-marie antoinette and [the Princess de Lamballe]196-the princess de lamballe . In the centre of the florid carpet a gilt table with a top of Mexican onyx sustained a palm in a gilt basket tied with a pink bow . But for this ornament , and a copy of " The Hound of the Baskervilles "[196-the princess de lamballe] which lay beside [it]440-it , [the room]441-the room showed no traces of human use , and [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg [herself]194-mrs. spragg wore as complete an air of detachment as if [she]194-mrs. spragg had been a wax figure in a show - window . [Her]194-mrs. spragg attire was fashionable enough to justify such a post , and [her]194-mrs. spragg pale soft - cheeked face , with puffy eye - lids and drooping mouth , suggested a partially - melted wax figure which had run to double - chin . [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny , in comparison , had a reassuring look of solidity and reality . The planting of [her]194-mrs. spragg firm black bulk in its chair , and the grasp of [her]194-mrs. spragg broad red hands on the gilt arms , bespoke an organized and self - reliant activity , accounted for by the fact that [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny was [a " society "[442-a " society " manicure and masseuse] manicure and masseuse]442-a " society " manicure and masseuse . Toward [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg and [[her]194-mrs. spragg daughter]443-her daughter [she]194-mrs. spragg filled the double role of manipulator and [friend]444-friend ; and it was in the latter capacity that , [her]194-mrs. spragg day 's task ended , [she]194-mrs. spragg had dropped in for a moment to " cheer up "[194-mrs. spragg] [the lonely ladies of [the Stentorian]446-the stentorian]445-the lonely ladies of the stentorian . [The young girl whose " form "]3741-the young girl whose " form "[3741-the young girl whose " form "] had won [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's professional commendation suddenly shifted its lovely lines as [she]194-mrs. spragg turned back from the window . " Here -- [you]426-her mother can have it after all , "[194-mrs. spragg] [she]194-mrs. spragg said , crumpling the note and tossing it with a contemptuous gesture into [[her]194-mrs. spragg mother]426-her mother 's lap . " Why -- isn't it from [Mr. Popple]197-popple ? "[194-mrs. spragg] [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg exclaimed unguardedly . " No -- it is n't . What made [you]426-her mother think [I]194-mrs. spragg thought it was ? "[194-mrs. spragg] snapped [[her]194-mrs. spragg daughter]443-her daughter ; but the next instant [she]194-mrs. spragg added , with an outbreak of childish disappointment : " It 's only from [[Mr. Marvell]198-mr. marvell 's sister]3742-mr. marvell 's sister -- at least [she]3742-mr. marvell 's sister says [she]3742-mr. marvell 's sister 's [[his]198-mr. marvell sister]3743-his sister . "[193-mrs. heeny] [Undine Spragg]192-undine , at the word , swept round on the speaker with one of the quick turns that revealed [her]192-undine youthful flexibility . [She]192-undine was always doubling and twisting on [herself]192-undine , and every movement [she]192-undine made seemed to start at the nape of [her]192-undine neck , just below the lifted roll of reddish - gold hair , and flow without a break through [her]192-undine whole slim length to the tips of [her]192-undine fingers and the points of [her]192-undine slender restless feet . "[194-mrs. spragg] [Undine]192-undine 's perceptions were more rapid , and [she]192-undine fixed [her]192-undine eyes searchingly on [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny . " [Married gentlemen]3767-married gentlemen ? "[194-mrs. spragg] enquired [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , slightly shocked , but genuinely desirous of mastering [her]194-mrs. spragg lesson . " [Mercy]205-mercy , no ! [Married ladies]3768-married ladies . "[194-mrs. spragg] " But are there never any [gentlemen present]3769-gentlemen present ? "[194-mrs. spragg] pursued [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , feeling that if this were the case [Undine]192-undine would certainly be disappointed . " Present where ? [She]193-mrs. heeny was well aware that [she]464-she was the only bright spot on [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's horizon . Since [the Spraggs]207-the spraggs , some two years previously , had moved from [Apex City]7-apex city to [New York]8-new york , [they]207-the spraggs had made little progress in establishing relations with [[their]207-the spraggs new environment]465-their new environment ; and when , about four months earlier , [[Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's doctor]466-mrs. spragg 's doctor had called in [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny to minister professionally to [[his]466-mrs. spragg 's doctor patient]467-his patient , [he]466-mrs. spragg 's doctor had done more for [her]193-mrs. heeny spirit than for [her]193-mrs. heeny body . [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny had had such " cases "[466-mrs. spragg 's doctor] before : [she]193-mrs. heeny knew [the rich helpless family]468-the rich helpless family , stranded in lonely splendour in [a sumptuous West Side hotel]469-a sumptuous west side hotel , with [a father]470-a father compelled to seek a semblance of social life at [the hotel bar]471-the hotel bar , and [a mother]472-a mother deprived of even this contact with [her]472-a mother kind , and reduced to illness by boredom and inactivity . [Poor Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg had done [her]194-mrs. spragg own washing in [her]194-mrs. spragg youth , but since [her]194-mrs. spragg rising fortunes had made this occupation unsuitable [she]194-mrs. spragg had sunk into the relative inertia which [the ladies of [Apex City]7-apex city]473-the ladies of apex city regarded as one of the prerogatives of affluence . At [Apex]192-undine , however , [she]194-mrs. spragg had belonged to a social club , and , until [they]474-they moved to [the Mealey House]475-the mealey house , had been kept busy by the incessant struggle with domestic cares ; whereas [New York]8-new york seemed to offer no field for any form of [lady - like activity]476-lady - like activity . [She]194-mrs. spragg therefore took [her]194-mrs. spragg exercise vicariously , with [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's help ; and [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny knew how to manipulate [her]193-mrs. heeny imagination as well as [her]193-mrs. heeny muscles . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg had no ambition for [herself]194-mrs. spragg -- [she]194-mrs. spragg seemed to have transferred [her]194-mrs. spragg whole personality to [[her]194-mrs. spragg child]483-her child -- but [she]194-mrs. spragg was passionately resolved that [Undine]192-undine should have what [she]194-mrs. spragg wanted , and [she]194-mrs. spragg sometimes fancied that [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny , who crossed those sacred thresholds so familiarly , might some day gain admission for [Undine]192-undine . "[191-mr. spragg] [II Undine 's white and gold bedroom , with sea - green panels and old rose carpet]522-ii undine 's white and gold bedroom , with sea - green panels and old rose carpet , looked along [Seventy - second Street]12-seventy - second street toward [the leafless tree - tops of [the Central Park]13-the central park]523-the leafless tree - tops of the central park . [She]512-his wife went to the window , and drawing back [its]524-its many layers of lace gazed eastward down the long brownstone perspective . Beyond [the Park]14-the park lay [Fifth Avenue]4-fifth avenue -- and [Fifth Avenue]4-fifth avenue was where [she]512-his wife wanted to be ! [She]512-his wife turned back into [the room]441-the room , and going to [her]512-his wife writing - table laid [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford 's note before [her]512-his wife , and began to study it minutely . [She]512-his wife had read in the " Boudoir Chat "[512-his wife] of one of the Sunday papers that [the smartest women]526-the smartest women were using the new pigeon - blood notepaper with white ink ; and rather against [[her]512-his wife mother]426-her mother 's advice [she]512-his wife had ordered a large supply , with [her]512-his wife monogram in silver . It was a disappointment , therefore , to find that [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford wrote on the old - fashioned white sheet , without even a monogram -- simply [her]204-mrs. fairford address and telephone number . It gave [Undine]192-undine rather a poor opinion of [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford 's social standing , and for a moment [she]192-undine thought with considerable satisfaction of answering the note on [her]512-his wife pigeon - blood paper . Then [she]192-undine remembered [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's emphatic commendation of [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford , and [her]512-his wife pen wavered . What if white paper were really newer than pigeon blood ? It might be more stylish , anyhow . Well , [she]192-undine did n't care if [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford did n't like red paper -- [SHE]204-mrs. fairford did ! And [she]204-mrs. fairford was n't going to truckle to [any woman who lived in [a small house down beyond [Park Avenue]6-park avenue]529-a small house down beyond park avenue]528-any woman who lived in a small house down beyond park avenue ... [Undine]192-undine was fiercely independent and yet passionately imitative . [She]192-undine wanted to surprise [every one]530-every one by [her]192-undine dash and originality , but [she]192-undine could not help modelling [herself]192-undine on [the last person [she]192-undine met]531-the last person she met , and the confusion of ideals thus produced caused [her]192-undine much perturbation when [she]192-undine had to choose between two courses . [She]192-undine hesitated a moment longer , and then took from the drawer a plain sheet with the hotel address . It was amusing to write the note in [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother 's name -- [she]192-undine giggled as [she]192-undine formed the phrase " [I]192-undine shall be happy to permit [[my]192-undine daughter]3805-my daughter to take dinner with [you]204-mrs. fairford "[192-undine] ( " take dinner "[192-undine] seemed more elegant than [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford 's " dine")--but[192-undine] when [she]192-undine came to the signature [she]192-undine was met by a new difficulty . [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford had signed [herself]204-mrs. fairford " [Laura Fairford"--just]213-laura fairford"--just[204-mrs. fairford] as [one school - girl]533-one school - girl would write to another . But could this be a proper model for [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg ? [Undine]192-undine could not tolerate the thought of [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother 's abasing [herself]426-her mother to [a denizen of [regions beyond [Park Avenue]6-park avenue]536-regions beyond park avenue]535-a denizen of regions beyond park avenue , and [she]192-undine resolutely formed the signature : " Sincerely , [Mrs. Abner E. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg . "[192-undine] Then uncertainty overcame [her]192-undine , and [she]192-undine re - wrote [her]192-undine note and copied [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford 's formula : " [Yours]194-mrs. spragg sincerely , [Leota B. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg . "[192-undine] But this struck [her]192-undine as an odd juxtaposition of formality and freedom , and [she]192-undine made a third attempt : " [Yours]194-mrs. spragg with love , [Leota B. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg . "[192-undine] This , however , seemed excessive , as [the ladies]459-the ladies had never met ; and after several other experiments [she]192-undine finally decided on a compromise , and ended the note : " [Yours]194-mrs. spragg sincerely , [Mrs. Leota B. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg . "[192-undine] That might be conventional . [Undine]192-undine reflected , but it was certainly correct . This point settled , [she]192-undine flung open [her]192-undine door , calling imperiously down [the passage]538-the passage : " [Celeste]215-celeste ! "[192-undine] and adding , as [the French maid]539-the french maid appeared : " [I]539-the french maid want to look over all [my]539-the french maid dinner - dresses . "[539-the french maid] Considering the extent of [Miss Spragg]192-undine 's wardrobe [her]192-undine dinner - dresses were not many . [She]192-undine had ordered a number the year before but , vexed at [her]192-undine lack of use for them , had tossed them over impatiently to [the maid]540-the maid . Since then , indeed , [she]192-undine and [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg had succumbed to the abstract pleasure of buying two or three more , simply because they were too exquisite and [Undine]192-undine looked too lovely in them ; but [she]192-undine had grown tired of these also -- tired of seeing them hang unworn in [her]192-undine wardrobe , like so many derisive points of interrogation . And now , as [Celeste]215-celeste spread them out on the bed , they seemed disgustingly common - place , and as familiar as if [she]215-celeste had danced them to shreds . Nevertheless , [she]192-undine yielded to [the maid]540-the maid 's persuasions and tried them on . The first and second did not gain by prolonged inspection : they looked old - fashioned already . " It 's something about the sleeves , "[192-undine] [Undine]192-undine grumbled as [she]192-undine threw them aside . The third was certainly the prettiest ; but then it was the one [she]192-undine had worn at [the hotel dance]542-the hotel dance the night before and the impossibility of wearing it again within the week was too obvious for discussion . Yet [she]192-undine enjoyed looking at [herself]192-undine in it , for it reminded [her]192-undine of [her]192-undine sparkling passages with [Claud Walsingham Popple]197-popple , and [her]192-undine quieter but more fruitful talk with [[his]197-popple little friend]543-his little friend -- [the young man [she]192-undine had hardly noticed]544-the young man she had hardly noticed . " [You]215-celeste can go , [Celeste]215-celeste -- [I'll]192-undine take off the dress [myself]192-undine , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine said : and when [Celeste]215-celeste had passed out , laden with discarded finery . [Undine]192-undine bolted [her]192-undine door , dragged the tall pier - glass forward and , rummaging in a drawer for fan and gloves , swept to a seat before the mirror with the air of [a lady arriving at an evening party]545-a lady arriving at an evening party . [Celeste]215-celeste , before leaving , had drawn down the blinds and turned on the electric light , and [the white and gold room]546-the white and gold room , with [its]546-the white and gold room blazing wall - brackets , formed a sufficiently brilliant background to carry out the illusion . So untempered a glare would have been destructive to all half - tones and subtleties of modelling ; but [Undine]192-undine 's beauty was as vivid , and almost as crude , as the brightness suffusing it . [Her]192-undine black brows , [her]192-undine reddish - tawny hair and the pure red and white of [her]192-undine complexion defied the searching decomposing radiance : [she]192-undine might have been [some fabled creature whose [home]548-home was in a beam of light . [Undine]192-undine , as [a child]549-a child , had taken but a lukewarm interest in the diversions of [[her]192-undine playmates]550-her playmates]547-some fabled creature whose home was in a beam of light . undine , as a child , had taken but a lukewarm interest in the diversions of her playmates . Even in the early days when [she]192-undine had lived with [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents in [a ragged outskirt of [Apex]192-undine]552-a ragged outskirt of apex , and hung on the fence with [Indiana Frusk]216-indiana frusk , [the freckled daughter of [the plumber]554-the plumber]553-the freckled daughter of the plumber " across the way , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine had cared little for dolls or skipping - ropes , and still less for the riotous games in which [the loud Indiana]216-indiana frusk played [Atalanta]15-atalanta to [all the boyhood of [the quarter]556-the quarter]555-all the boyhood of the quarter . Already [Undine]192-undine 's chief delight was to " dress up "[192-undine] in [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother 's Sunday skirt and " play lady "[192-undine] before the wardrobe mirror . The taste had outlasted childhood , and [she]192-undine still practised the same secret pantomime , gliding in , settling [her]192-undine skirts , swaying [her]192-undine fan , moving [her]192-undine lips in soundless talk and laughter ; but lately [she]192-undine had shrunk from everything that reminded [her]192-undine of [her]192-undine baffled social yearnings . Now , however , [she]192-undine could yield without afterthought to the joy of dramatizing [her]192-undine beauty . Within a few days [she]192-undine would be enacting the scene [she]192-undine was now mimicking ; and it amused [her]192-undine to see in advance just what impression [she]192-undine would produce on [[Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford 's guests]558-mrs. fairford 's guests . For a while [she]192-undine carried on [her]192-undine chat with an imaginary circle of [admirers]559-admirers , twisting this way and that , fanning , fidgeting , twitching at [her]192-undine draperies , as [she]192-undine did in real life when [people]560-people were noticing [her]192-undine . [Her]192-undine incessant movements were not the result of shyness : [she]192-undine thought it the correct thing to be animated in society , and noise and restlessness were [her]192-undine only notion of vivacity . [She]192-undine therefore watched [herself]192-undine approvingly , admiring the light on [her]192-undine hair , the flash of teeth between [her]192-undine smiling lips , the pure shadows of [her]192-undine throat and shoulders as [she]192-undine passed from one attitude to another . Only one fact disturbed [her]192-undine : there was a hint of too much fulness in the curves of [her]192-undine neck and in the spring of [her]192-undine hips . [She]192-undine was tall enough to carry off a little extra weight , but excessive slimness was the fashion , and [she]192-undine shuddered at the thought that [she]192-undine might some day deviate from the perpendicular . Presently [she]192-undine ceased to twist and sparkle at [her]192-undine image , and sinking into [her]192-undine chair gave [herself]192-undine up to retrospection . [She]192-undine was vexed , in looking back , to think how little notice [she]192-undine had taken of [young Marvell]199-ralph , who turned out to be so much less negligible than [[his]561-his brilliant friend]562-his brilliant friend . [She]192-undine remembered thinking [him]561-his rather shy , less accustomed to society ; and though in [his]561-his quiet deprecating way [he]561-his had said one or two droll things [he]561-his lacked [Mr. Popple]197-popple 's masterly manner , [his]561-his domineering yet caressing address . When [Mr. Popple]197-popple had fixed [his]561-his black eyes on [Undine]192-undine , and murmured something " artistic "[561-his] about the colour of [her]192-undine hair , [she]192-undine had thrilled to the depths of [her]192-undine being . Even now it seemed incredible that [he]561-his should not turn out to be more distinguished than [young Marvell]199-ralph : [he]561-his seemed so much more in the key of the world [she]192-undine read about in the Sunday papers -- the dazzling auriferous world of [the Van Degens]209-van degens , [the Driscolls]210-the driscolls and [[their]563-their peers]564-their peers . [She]192-undine was roused by the sound in [the hall]565-the hall of [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother 's last words to [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny . Soon afterward , luckily . Since then [Mabel]200-mabel had returned to [New York]8-new york and married [a stock - broker]586-a stock - broker ; and [Undine]192-undine 's first steps in social enlightenment dated from the day when [she]192-undine had met [Mrs. Harry Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb , and been again taken under [her]192-undine wing . [Harry Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb had insisted on investigating [the riding - master]587-the riding - master 's record , and had found that [his]587-the riding - master real name was [Aaronson]222-aaronson , and that [he]587-the riding - master had left [Cracow]18-cracow under a charge of swindling [servant - girls]588-servant - girls out of [their]588-servant - girls savings ; in the light of which [discoveries Undine]192-undine noticed for the first time that [his]587-the riding - master lips were too red and that [his]587-the riding - master hair was pommaded . That was one of the episodes that sickened [her]192-undine as [she]192-undine looked back , and made [her]192-undine resolve once more to trust less to [her]192-undine impulses -- especially in the matter of giving away rings . In the interval , however , [she]192-undine felt [she]192-undine had learned a good deal , especially since , by [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel 's advice , [the Spraggs]207-the spraggs had moved to [the Stentorian]446-the stentorian , where [that lady]590-that lady was [herself]590-that lady established . There was nothing of the monopolist about [Mabel]200-mabel , and [she]200-mabel lost no time in making [Undine]192-undine free of [the Stentorian group]591-the stentorian group and [its affiliated branches]592-its affiliated branches : a society addicted to " days , "[200-mabel] and linked together by membership in [countless clubs , mundane , cultural or " earnest]3810-countless clubs , mundane , cultural or " earnest . "[200-mabel] Some of these reunions took place in [the lofty hotels moored like a sonorously named fleet of [battle - ships]595-battle - ships along [the upper reaches of [the West Side]21-the west side]596-the upper reaches of the west side]594-the lofty hotels moored like a sonorously named fleet of battle - ships along the upper reaches of the west side : [the Olympian]22-the olympian , [the Incandescent]226-the incandescent , [the Ormolu]23-the ormolu ; while others , perhaps the more exclusive , were held in [the equally lofty but more romantically styled apartment - houses]597-the equally lofty but more romantically styled apartment - houses : [the Parthenon]24-the parthenon , [the Tintern Abbey]598-the tintern abbey or [the Lido]25-the lido . [Undine]192-undine 's preference was for the worldly parties , at which games were played , and [she]192-undine returned [home]548-home laden with prizes in Dutch silver ; but [she]192-undine was duly impressed by the debating clubs , where [ladies of local distinction]600-ladies of local distinction addressed [the company]601-the company from an improvised platform , or [the members]602-the members argued on subjects of such imperishable interest as : " What is charm ? "[602-the members] or " The Problem - Novel "[602-the members] after which pink lemonade and rainbow sandwiches were consumed amid heated discussion of the " ethical aspect "[192-undine] of the question . It was all very novel and interesting , and at first [Undine]192-undine envied [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel for having made [herself]192-undine a place in such circles ; but in time [she]192-undine began to despise [her]200-mabel for being content to remain [there]603-there . For it did not take [Undine]192-undine long to learn that introduction to [Mabel]200-mabel 's " set "[200-mabel] had brought [her]192-undine no nearer to [Fifth Avenue]4-fifth avenue . Even in [Apex]192-undine , [Undine]192-undine 's tender imagination had been nurtured on the feats and gestures of [Fifth Avenue]4-fifth avenue . [She]192-undine knew [all of [New York]8-new york 's golden aristocracy]604-all of new york 's golden aristocracy by name , and the lineaments of [its most distinguished scions]605-its most distinguished scions had been made familiar by passionate poring over the daily press . In [Mabel]200-mabel 's world [she]192-undine sought in vain for the originals , and only now and then caught a tantalizing glimpse of one of [their]606-their familiars : as when [Claud Walsingham Popple]197-popple , engaged on the portrait of [a lady whom [the Lipscombs]227-the lipscombs described as " [the wife of [a Steel Magnet]3816-a steel magnet]3815-the wife of a steel magnet]3814-a lady whom the lipscombs described as " the wife of a steel magnet , "[197-popple] felt it [his]197-popple duty to attend one of [[his]197-popple client]607-his client 's teas , where it became [Mabel]200-mabel 's privilege to make [his]197-popple acquaintance and to name to [him]197-popple [[her]200-mabel friend]608-her friend [Miss Spragg]192-undine . Unsuspected social gradations were thus revealed to [the attentive Undine]192-undine , but [she]192-undine was beginning to think that [her]192-undine sad proficiency had been acquired in vain when [her]192-undine hopes were revived by the appearance of [Mr. Popple]197-popple and [[his]197-popple friend]609-his friend at the Stentorian dance . [She]192-undine thought [she]192-undine had learned enough to be safe from any risk of repeating the hideous [Aaronson]222-aaronson mistake ; yet [she]192-undine now saw [she]192-undine had blundered again in distinguishing [Claud Walsingham Popple]197-popple while [she]192-undine almost snubbed [[his]197-popple more retiring companion]610-his more retiring companion . It was all very puzzling , and [her]192-undine perplexity had been farther increased by [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's tale of the great [Mrs. Harmon B. Driscoll]201-driscoll 's despair . Hitherto [Undine]192-undine had imagined that [the Driscoll]201-driscoll and [Van Degen]228-clare clans and [[their]611-their allies]612-their allies held undisputed suzerainty over [New York]8-new york society . [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel thought so too , and was given to bragging of [her]200-mabel acquaintance with [a Mrs. Spoff]229-a mrs. spoff , who was merely a second cousin of [Mrs. Harmon B. Driscoll]201-driscoll 's . Yet here was [she]192-undine . [Undine Spragg of [Apex]192-undine]192-undine , about to be introduced into an inner circle to which [Driscolls]210-the driscolls and [Van Degens]209-van degens had laid siege in vain ! It was enough to make [her]192-undine feel a little dizzy with [her]192-undine triumph -- to work [her]192-undine up into that state of perilous self - confidence in which all [her]192-undine worst follies had been committed . [She]192-undine stood up and , going close to the glass , examined the reflection of [her]192-undine bright eyes and glowing cheeks . This time [her]192-undine fears were superfluous : there were to be no more mistakes and no more follies now ! [She]192-undine was going to know [the right people]613-the right people at last -- [she]192-undine was going to get what [she]192-undine wanted ! As [she]192-undine stood there , smiling at [her]192-undine happy image , [she]192-undine heard [[her]192-undine father]614-her father 's voice in [the room beyond]615-the room beyond , and instantly began to tear off [her]192-undine dress , strip the long gloves from [her]192-undine arms and unpin the rose in [her]192-undine hair . Tossing the fallen finery aside , [she]192-undine slipped on a dressing - gown and opened the door into [the drawing - room]439-the drawing - room . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg was standing near [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother , who sat in a drooping attitude , [her]426-her mother head sunk on [her]426-her mother breast , as [she]426-her mother did when [she]426-her mother had one of [her]426-her mother " turns . "[191-mr. spragg] [He]191-mr. spragg looked up abruptly as [Undine]192-undine entered . " [Father]3817-father -- has [mother]3774-mother told [you]3817-father ? "[192-undine] [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg surveyed [her]192-undine with humorous fondness . " That so ? What do [they]3821-they want to know [you]192-undine for , [I]191-mr. spragg wonder ? "[191-mr. spragg] [he]191-mr. spragg jeered . " Ca n't imagine -- unless [they]3821-they think [I]192-undine 'll introduce [YOU]192-undine ! "[192-undine] [she]192-undine jeered back in the same key , [her]192-undine arms around [his]191-mr. spragg stooping shoulders , [her]192-undine shining hair against [his]191-mr. spragg cheek . " Well -- and are [you]191-mr. spragg going to ? Have [you]191-mr. spragg accepted ? "[191-mr. spragg] [he]191-mr. spragg took up [her]192-undine joke as [she]192-undine held [him]191-mr. spragg pinioned ; while [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , behind [them]618-them , stirred in [her]194-mrs. spragg seat with a little moan . [Undine]192-undine threw back [her]192-undine head , plunging [her]192-undine eyes in [his]191-mr. spragg , and pressing so close that to [his]191-mr. spragg tired elderly sight [her]192-undine face was a mere bright blur . " [I]192-undine want to awfully , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine declared , " but [I]192-undine have n't got a single thing to wear . "[192-undine] [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , at this , moaned more audibly . " [Undine]192-undine , [I]192-undine would n't ask [father]3817-father to buy any more clothes right on top of those last bills . "[192-undine] " [I]191-mr. spragg ai n't on top of those last bills yet -- I'm way down under them , "[191-mr. spragg] [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg interrupted , raising [his]191-mr. spragg hands to imprison [[his]191-mr. spragg daughter]500-his daughter 's slender wrists . " Oh , well -- if [you]191-mr. spragg want [me]191-mr. spragg to look like [a scarecrow]3824-a scarecrow , and not get asked again , [I]191-mr. spragg 've got a dress that 'll do PERFECTLY , "[191-mr. spragg] [Undine]192-undine threatened , in a tone between banter and vexation . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg held [her]192-undine away at arm 's length , a smile drawing up the loose wrinkles about [his]191-mr. spragg eyes . " Well , that kind of dress might come in mighty handy on SOME occasions ; so [I]191-mr. spragg guess [you]192-undine 'd better hold on to it for future use , and go and select another for this Fairford dinner , "[191-mr. spragg] [he]191-mr. spragg said ; and before [he]191-mr. spragg could finish [he]191-mr. spragg was in [her]192-undine arms again , and [she]192-undine was smothering [his]191-mr. spragg last word in little cries and kisses . III Though [she]192-undine would not for [the world]620-the world have owned [it]621-it to [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents , [Undine]192-undine was disappointed in [the Fairford]204-mrs. fairford dinner . [The house]623-the house , to begin with , was small and rather shabby . There was no gilding , no lavish diffusion of light : [the room [they]625-they sat in after dinner]624-the room they sat in after dinner , with [its]624-the room they sat in after dinner green - shaded lamps making faint pools of brightness , and [its]624-the room they sat in after dinner rows of books from floor to ceiling , reminded [Undine]192-undine of [the old circulating library at [Apex]192-undine]626-the old circulating library at apex , before [the new marble building]627-the new marble building was put up . Then , instead of a gas - log , or a polished grate with electric bulbs behind ruby glass , there was an old - fashioned wood - fire , like pictures of " Back to [the farm]3825-the farm for Christmas "[230-mrs. pairford] ; and when the logs fell forward [Mrs. Pairford]230-mrs. pairford or [[her]230-mrs. pairford brother]628-her brother had to jump up to push them in place , and the ashes scattered over the hearth untidily . The dinner too was disappointing . [Undine]192-undine was too young to take note of culinary details , but [she]192-undine had expected to view the company through a bower of orchids and eat pretty - coloured entrees in ruffled papers . Instead , there was only a low centre - dish of ferns , and plain roasted and broiled meat that [one]629-one could recognize -- as if [they]625-they 'd been dyspeptics on a diet ! With all the hints in the Sunday papers , [she]192-undine thought it dull of [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford not to have picked up something newer ; and as the evening progressed [she]192-undine began to suspect that it was n't a real " dinner party , "[625-they] and that [they]625-they had just asked [her]192-undine in to share what [they]625-they had when [they]625-they were alone . But a glance about the table convinced [her]192-undine that [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford could not have meant to treat [[her]204-mrs. fairford other guests]630-her other guests so lightly . [They]625-they were only eight in number , but [one]629-one was no less [a person than [young Mrs. Peter Van Degen]231-van degen]632-a person than young mrs. peter van degen -- the one who had been [a Dagonet]232-clare dagonet -- and the consideration which [this young lady]633-this young lady , [herself]633-this young lady one of the choicest ornaments of [the Society Column]634-the society column , displayed toward the rest of [the company]601-the company , convinced [Undine]192-undine that they must be more important than [they]625-they looked . [She]192-undine liked [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford , [a small incisive woman , with a big nose and good teeth revealed by frequent smiles]636-a small incisive woman , with a big nose and good teeth revealed by frequent smiles . In [her]204-mrs. fairford dowdy black and antiquated ornaments [she]204-mrs. fairford was not what [Undine]192-undine would have called " stylish "[204-mrs. fairford] ; but [she]204-mrs. fairford had a droll kind way which reminded [the girl]449-the girl of [[her]449-the girl father]614-her father 's manner when [he]614-her father was not tired or worried about money . One of [the other ladies , having white hair]639-the other ladies , having white hair , did not long arrest [Undine]192-undine 's attention ; and the fourth , [a girl like [herself]192-undine]640-a girl like herself , who was introduced as [Miss Harriet Ray]233-harriet , [she]192-undine dismissed at a glance as plain and wearing [a last year 's " model]3826-a last year 's " model . "[192-undine] [The men]641-the men , too , were less striking than [she]192-undine had hoped . [She]192-undine had not expected much of [Mr. Fairford]234-mr. fairford , since [married men]642-married men were intrinsically uninteresting , and [his]234-mr. fairford baldness and grey moustache seemed naturally to relegate [him]234-mr. fairford to the background ; but [she]192-undine had looked for [some brilliant youths of [her]192-undine own age]643-some brilliant youths of her own age -- in [her]192-undine inmost heart [she]192-undine had looked for [Mr. Popple]197-popple . [He]197-popple was not [there]603-there , however , and of [the other men one , whom [they]646-they called [Mr. Bowen]235-mr. bowen]645-the other men one , whom they called mr. bowen , was hopelessly elderly -- [she]192-undine supposed [he]235-mr. bowen was [the husband of [the white - haired lady]648-the white - haired lady]647-the husband of the white - haired lady -- and the other two , who seemed to be [friends of [young Marvell]218-paul 's]649-friends of young marvell 's , were both lacking in [Claud Walsingham]197-popple 's dash . [Undine]192-undine sat between [Mr. Bowen]235-mr. bowen and [young Marvell]218-paul , who struck [her]192-undine as very " sweet "[192-undine] ( it was [her]192-undine word for friendliness ) , but even shyer than at [the hotel dance]542-the hotel dance . Yet [she]192-undine was not sure if [he]197-popple were shy , or if [his]197-popple quietness were only a new kind of self - possession which expressed itself negatively instead of aggressively . Small , well - knit , fair , [he]197-popple sat stroking [his]197-popple slight blond moustache and looking at [her]192-undine with kindly , almost tender eyes ; but [he]197-popple left it to [[his]197-popple sister]3743-his sister and [the others]652-the others to draw [her]192-undine out and fit [her]192-undine into the pattern . [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford talked so well that [the girl]449-the girl wondered why [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny had found [her]192-undine lacking in conversation . But though [Undine]192-undine thought [silent people]654-silent people awkward [she]192-undine was not easily impressed by verbal fluency . [All the ladies in [Apex City]7-apex city]655-all the ladies in apex city were more voluble than [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford , and had a larger vocabulary : the difference was that with [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford conversation seemed to be a concert and not a solo . [She]204-mrs. fairford kept drawing in [the others]652-the others , giving each a turn , beating time for [them]652-the others with [her]204-mrs. fairford smile , and somehow harmonizing and linking together what [they]652-the others said . [She]204-mrs. fairford took particular pains to give [Undine]192-undine [her]192-undine due part in the performance ; but [the girl]449-the girl 's expansive impulses were always balanced by odd reactions of mistrust , and to - night the latter prevailed . [She]204-mrs. fairford meant to watch and listen without letting [herself]204-mrs. fairford go , and [she]204-mrs. fairford sat very straight and pink , answering promptly but briefly , with the nervous laugh that punctuated all [her]204-mrs. fairford phrases -- saying " [I]204-mrs. fairford do n't care if [I]204-mrs. fairford do "[204-mrs. fairford] when [[her]204-mrs. fairford host]658-her host asked [her]204-mrs. fairford to try some grapes , and " [I]204-mrs. fairford would n't wonder "[204-mrs. fairford] when [she]204-mrs. fairford thought [any one]659-any one was trying to astonish [her]204-mrs. fairford . This state of lucidity enabled [her]204-mrs. fairford to take note of all that was being said . The talk ran more on general questions , and less on [people]560-people , than [she]204-mrs. fairford was used to ; but though the allusions to pictures and books escaped [her]204-mrs. fairford , [she]204-mrs. fairford caught and stored up every personal reference , and the pink in [her]204-mrs. fairford cheeks deepened at a random mention of [Mr. Popple]197-popple . " Yes -- [he]197-popple 's doing [me]231-van degen , "[231-van degen] [Mrs. Peter Van Degen]231-van degen was saying , in [her]231-van degen slightly drawling voice . " [He]197-popple 's doing [everybody]3748-everybody this year , [you]231-van degen know-- "[231-van degen] " As if that were a reason ! "[204-mrs. fairford] [Undine]192-undine heard [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford breathe to [Mr. Bowen]235-mr. bowen ; who replied , at the same pitch : " It 's [a Van Degen]3828-a van degen reason , is n't it?"--to[235-mr. bowen] which [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford shrugged assentingly . " [That delightful Popple]197-popple -- [he]197-popple paints so exactly as [he]197-popple talks ! "[204-mrs. fairford] [the white - haired lady]648-the white - haired lady took it up . " All [his]197-popple portraits seem to proclaim what [a gentleman]3829-a gentleman [he]197-popple is , and how [he]197-popple fascinates [women]3830-women ! "[648-the white - haired lady] [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford smiled . "[204-mrs. fairford] [Undine]192-undine 's ear was too well attuned to the national note of irony for [her]192-undine not to perceive that [[her]192-undine companions]662-her companions were making sport of [the painter]663-the painter . [She]192-undine winced at [their]662-her companions banter as if it had been at [her]192-undine own expense , yet it gave [her]192-undine a dizzy sense of being at last in the very stronghold of fashion . [Her]192-undine attention was diverted by hearing [Mrs. Van Degen]231-van degen , under cover of the general laugh , say in a low tone to [young Marvell]218-paul : " [I]231-van degen thought [you]218-paul liked [his]197-popple things , or [I]231-van degen would n't have had [him]197-popple paint [me]231-van degen . "[231-van degen] Something in [her]231-van degen tone made all [Undine]192-undine 's perceptions bristle , and [she]192-undine strained [her]192-undine ears for the answer . " [I]192-undine think [he]197-popple 'll do [you]218-paul capitally -- [you]218-paul must let [me]192-undine come and see some day soon . "[192-undine] [Marvell]218-paul 's tone was always so light , so unemphasized , that [she]192-undine could not be sure of its being as indifferent as it sounded . [She]192-undine looked down at the fruit on [her]192-undine plate and shot a side - glance through [her]192-undine lashes at [Mrs. Peter Van Degen]231-van degen . [Mrs. Van Degen]231-van degen was neither beautiful nor imposing : just [a dark girlish - looking creature with plaintive eyes and a fidgety frequent laugh]664-a dark girlish - looking creature with plaintive eyes and a fidgety frequent laugh . But [she]231-van degen was more elaborately dressed and jewelled than [the other ladies]665-the other ladies , and [her]231-van degen elegance and [her]231-van degen restlessness made [her]231-van degen seem less alien to [Undine]192-undine . [She]231-van degen had turned on [Marvell]218-paul a gaze at once pleading and possessive ; but whether betokening merely an inherited intimacy ( [Undine]192-undine had noticed that [they]666-they were all more or less [cousins]667-cousins ) or a more personal feeling , [[her]192-undine observer]668-her observer was unable to decide ; just as the tone of [the young man]669-the young man 's reply might have expressed the open avowal of good - fellowship or the disguise of a different sentiment . All was blurred and puzzling to [the girl]449-the girl in this world of half - lights , half - tones , eliminations and abbreviations ; and [she]192-undine felt a violent longing to brush away the cobwebs and assert [herself]192-undine as [the dominant figure of the scene]671-the dominant figure of the scene . Yet in [the drawing - room]439-the drawing - room , with [the ladies]459-the ladies , where [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford came and sat by [her]192-undine , the spirit of caution once more prevailed . [She]192-undine wanted to be noticed but [she]192-undine dreaded to be patronized , and here again [[her]192-undine hostess]431-her hostess 's gradations of tone were confusing . [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford made no tactless allusions to [her]192-undine being [a newcomer in [New York]8-new york]675-a newcomer in new york -- there was nothing as bitter to [the girl]449-the girl as that -- but [her]204-mrs. fairford questions as to what pictures had interested [Undine]192-undine at the various exhibitions of the moment , and which of the new books [she]192-undine had read , were almost as open to suspicion , since they had to be answered in the negative . [Undine]192-undine did not even know that there were any pictures to be seen , much less that " [people]560-people "[192-undine] went to see [them]677-them ; and [she]192-undine had read no new book but " When The Kissing Had to Stop , "[192-undine] of which [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford seemed not to have heard . On [the theatre]678-the theatre [they]679-they were equally at odds , for while [Undine]192-undine had seen " Oolaloo "[236-ned norris] fourteen times , and was " wild "[192-undine] about [Ned Norris]236-ned norris in " [The Soda - Water Fountain]3837-the soda - water fountain , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine had not heard of [the famous [Berlin]26-berlin comedians who were performing Shakespeare at [the German Theatre]681-the german theatre , and knew only by name [the clever American actress who was trying to give " repertory "[682-the clever american actress who was trying to give " repertory " plays with a good stock company] plays with [a good stock company]683-a good stock company]682-the clever american actress who was trying to give " repertory " plays with a good stock company]680-the famous berlin comedians who were performing shakespeare at the german theatre , and knew only by name the clever american actress who was trying to give " repertory " plays with a good stock company . The conversation was revived for a moment by [her]192-undine recalling that [she]192-undine had seen [Sarah Bernhard]237-sarah bernhard in a play [she]192-undine called " Leg - long , "[192-undine] and another which [she]192-undine pronounced " Fade "[192-undine] ; but even this did not carry them far , as [she]192-undine had forgotten what both plays were about and had found [the actress]684-the actress a good deal older than [she]192-undine expected . Matters were not improved by the return of [the men]641-the men from [the smoking - room]686-the smoking - room . [Henley Fairford]204-mrs. fairford replaced [[his]687-his wife]512-his wife at [Undine]192-undine 's side ; and since it was unheard - of at [Apex]192-undine for [a married man]689-a married man to force [his]687-his society on [a young girl]690-a young girl , [she]192-undine inferred that [the others]652-the others did n't care to talk to [her]192-undine , and that [[her]192-undine host]658-her host and [hostess]693-hostess were in league to take [her]192-undine off [their]652-the others hands . "[192-undine] to all [Mr. Fairford]234-mr. fairford 's ventures ; and as these were neither numerous nor striking it was a relief to both when the rising of [the elderly lady]694-the elderly lady gave the signal for departure . In [the hall]565-the hall , where young [Marvell]218-paul had managed to precede [her]192-undine . [Undine]192-undine found [Mrs. Van Degen]231-van degen putting on [her]192-undine cloak . [The street]705-the street was coated with ice , and [she]192-undine had a delicious moment descending the steps on [Marvell]218-paul 's arm , and holding it fast while [they]706-they waited for [her]192-undine cab to come up ; but when [he]699-a much - furred footman waited with more furs on his arm had helped [her]192-undine in [he]699-a much - furred footman waited with more furs on his arm closed the door and held [his]699-a much - furred footman waited with more furs on his arm hand out over the lowered window . "[192-undine] IV " [Father]239-father , [you]239-father 've got to take a box for [me]192-undine at [the opera]3840-the opera next Friday . "[192-undine] From the tone of [her]192-undine voice [[Undine]192-undine 's parents]494-undine 's parents knew at once that [she]192-undine was " nervous . "[192-undine] [They]494-undine 's parents had counted a great deal on the Fairford dinner as a means of tranquillization , and it was a blow to detect signs of the opposite result when , late the next morning , [[their]494-undine 's parents daughter]486-their daughter came dawdling into the sodden splendour of [the Stentorian breakfast - room]709-the stentorian breakfast - room . The symptoms of [Undine]192-undine 's nervousness were unmistakable to [Mr.]710-mr. and [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg . [They]494-undine 's parents could read the approaching storm in the darkening of [her]192-undine eyes from limpid grey to slate - colour , and in the way [her]192-undine straight black brows met above them and the red curves of [her]192-undine lips narrowed to a parallel line below . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg , having finished the last course of [his]191-mr. spragg heterogeneous meal , was adjusting [his]191-mr. spragg gold eye - glasses for a glance at the paper when [Undine]192-undine trailed down [the sumptuous stuffy room]711-the sumptuous stuffy room , where coffee - fumes hung perpetually under the emblazoned ceiling and the spongy carpet might have absorbed a year 's crumbs without a sweeping . About [them]494-undine 's parents sat [other pallid families]712-other pallid families , richly dressed , and silently eating [their]712-other pallid families way through a bill - of - fare which seemed to have ransacked the globe for gastronomic incompatibilities ; and in the middle of [the room]441-the room [a knot of equally pallid waiters , engaged in languid conversation]714-a knot of equally pallid waiters , engaged in languid conversation , turned [their]714-a knot of equally pallid waiters , engaged in languid conversation backs by common consent on [the persons [they]714-a knot of equally pallid waiters , engaged in languid conversation were supposed to serve]715-the persons they were supposed to serve . [Undine]192-undine , who rose too late to share the family breakfast , usually had [her]192-undine chocolate brought to [her]192-undine in bed by [Celeste]215-celeste , after the manner described in the articles on " [A Society Woman]3841-a society woman 's Day "[215-celeste] which were appearing in [Boudoir Chat]27-boudoir chat . [Her]192-undine mere appearance in [the restaurant]716-the restaurant therefore prepared [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents for those symptoms of excessive tension which a nearer inspection confirmed , and [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg folded [his]191-mr. spragg paper and hooked [his]191-mr. spragg glasses to [his]191-mr. spragg waistcoat with the air of [a man who prefers to know the worst and have it over]718-a man who prefers to know the worst and have it over . " An opera box ! "[194-mrs. spragg] faltered [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , pushing aside the bananas and cream with which [she]194-mrs. spragg had been trying to tempt an appetite too languid for fried liver or crab mayonnaise . " A parterre box , "[194-mrs. spragg] [Undine]192-undine corrected , ignoring the exclamation , and continuing to address [herself]192-undine to [[her]192-undine father]614-her father . " Friday 's the stylish night , and [that new tenor]3842-that new tenor 's going to sing again in ' [Cavaleeria]28-cavaleeria , ' "[192-undine] [she]192-undine condescended to explain . " That so ? "[192-undine] [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg thrust [his]191-mr. spragg hands into [his]191-mr. spragg waistcoat pockets , and began to tilt [his]191-mr. spragg chair till [he]191-mr. spragg remembered there was no wall to meet it . [He]191-mr. spragg regained [his]191-mr. spragg balance and said : " Would n't a couple of good orchestra seats do [you]192-undine ? "[191-mr. spragg] " No ; [they]3843-they would n't , "[192-undine] [Undine]192-undine answered with a darkening brow . [He]191-mr. spragg looked at [her]192-undine humorously . " [You]192-undine invited the whole dinner - party , [I]191-mr. spragg suppose ? "[191-mr. spragg] " No -- [no one]3844-no one . "[192-undine] " Going all alone in a box ? "[192-undine] [She]192-undine was disdainfully silent . " [I]192-undine do n't s'pose [you]192-undine 're thinking of taking [mother]3774-mother and [me]192-undine ? [Undine]192-undine went for a ride , not because [she]192-undine felt particularly disposed for the exercise , but because [she]192-undine wished to discipline [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother . [She]192-undine was almost sure [she]192-undine would get [her]192-undine opera box , but [she]192-undine did not see why [she]192-undine should have to struggle for [her]192-undine rights , and [she]192-undine was especially annoyed with [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg for seconding [her]192-undine so half - heartedly . [Undine]192-undine hated " scenes "[192-undine] : [she]192-undine was essentially peace - loving , and would have preferred to live on terms of unbroken harmony with [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents . But [she]192-undine could not help it if [they]551-her parents were unreasonable . It was therefore natural to conclude that there were ample funds to draw upon , and that [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's occasional resistances were merely due to an imperfect understanding of what constituted the necessities of life . [Undine]192-undine was instantly struck by the opportunities which this toy presented for graceful wrist movements and supercilious turns of the head . It seemed suddenly plebeian and promiscuous to look at [the world]620-the world with a naked eye , and all [her]192-undine floating desires were merged in the wish for a jewelled eye - glass and chain . It was one of [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's chief occupations to watch the nightly lighting of [New York]8-new york . [Undine]192-undine lay silent , [her]192-undine hands clasped behind [her]192-undine head . [She]192-undine was plunged in one of the moods of bitter retrospection when all [her]192-undine past seemed like a long struggle for something [she]192-undine could not have , from a trip to [Europe]29-europe to an opera - box ; and when [she]192-undine felt sure that , as the past had been , so the future would be . And yet , as [she]192-undine had often told [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents , all [she]192-undine sought for was improvement : [she]192-undine honestly wanted the best . [Her]192-undine first struggle -- after [she]192-undine had ceased to scream for candy , or sulk for a new toy -- had been to get away from [Apex]192-undine in summer . [Her]192-undine summers , as [she]192-undine looked back on them , seemed to typify all that was dreariest and most exasperating in [her]192-undine life . The earliest had been spent in [the yellow " frame "[192-undine] cottage where [she]192-undine had hung on the fence , kicking [her]192-undine toes against the broken palings and exchanging moist chewing - gum and half - eaten apples with [Indiana Frusk]216-indiana frusk]794-the yellow " frame " cottage where she had hung on the fence , kicking her toes against the broken palings and exchanging moist chewing - gum and half - eaten apples with indiana frusk . Later on , [she]192-undine had returned from [[her]192-undine boarding - school]795-her boarding - school to the comparative gentility of summer vacations at [the Mealey House]475-the mealey house , whither [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents , forsaking [[their]551-her parents squalid suburb]798-their squalid suburb , had moved in the first flush of [their]551-her parents rising fortunes . The tessellated floors , the plush parlours and organ - like radiators of [the Mealey House]475-the mealey house had , aside from their intrinsic elegance , the immense advantage of lifting the Spraggs high above the Frusks , and making it possible for [Undine]192-undine , when [she]192-undine met [Indiana]216-indiana frusk in [the street]705-the street or at [school]801-school , to chill [her]192-undine advances by a careless allusion to the splendours of hotel life . But even in such a setting , and in spite of the social superiority it implied , the long months of the middle western summer , fly - blown , torrid , exhaling stale odours , soon became as insufferable as [they]551-her parents had been in [the little yellow house]802-the little yellow house . At [school]801-school [Undine]192-undine met [other girls whose parents]804-other girls whose parents took [them]804-other girls whose parents to [the Great Lakes]805-the great lakes for August ; [some]806-some even went to [California]30-california , [others]807-others -- oh bliss ineffable!--went " east . "[807-others] Pale and listless under the stifling boredom of the [Mealey House]31-mealey house routine , [Undine]192-undine secretly sucked lemons , nibbled slate - pencils and drank pints of bitter coffee to aggravate [her]192-undine look of ill - health ; and when [she]192-undine learned that even [Indiana Frusk]216-indiana frusk was to go on a month 's visit to [Buffalo]32-buffalo it needed no artificial aids to emphasize the ravages of envy . [[Her]192-undine parents]551-her parents , alarmed by [her]192-undine appearance , were at last convinced of the necessity of change , and timidly , tentatively , [they]551-her parents transferred [themselves]551-her parents for a month to [a staring hotel on [a glaring lake]810-a glaring lake]809-a staring hotel on a glaring lake . There [Undine]192-undine enjoyed the satisfaction of sending ironic post - cards to [Indiana]216-indiana frusk , and discovering that [she]192-undine could more than hold [her]192-undine own against the youth and beauty of [the other visitors]811-the other visitors . Then [she]192-undine made the acquaintance of [a pretty woman from [Richmond]34-richmond , whose husband]812-a pretty woman from richmond , whose husband , [a mining engineer]813-a mining engineer , had brought [her]192-undine west with [him]813-a mining engineer while [he]813-a mining engineer inspected [the newly developed Eubaw mines]814-the newly developed eubaw mines ; and [the southern visitor]815-the southern visitor 's dismay , [her]192-undine repugnances , [her]192-undine recoil from the faces , the food , the amusements , the general bareness and stridency of the scene , were a terrible initiation to [Undine]192-undine . There was something still better beyond , then -- more luxurious , more exciting , more worthy of [her]192-undine ! [She]192-undine once said to [herself]192-undine , afterward , that it was always [her]192-undine fate to find out just too late about the " something beyond . "[192-undine] But in this case it was not too late -- and obstinately , inflexibly , [she]192-undine set [herself]192-undine to the task of forcing [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents to take [her]192-undine " east "[192-undine] the next summer . Yielding to the inevitable , [they]551-her parents suffered [themselves]551-her parents to be impelled to [a [Virginia]35-virginia " resort]3865-a virginia " resort , "[192-undine] where [Undine]192-undine had [her]192-undine first glimpse of more romantic possibilities -- leafy moonlight rides and drives , picnics in [mountain glades]817-mountain glades , and an atmosphere of Christmas - chromo sentimentality that tempered [her]192-undine hard edges a little , and gave [her]192-undine glimpses of a more delicate kind of pleasure . But here again everything was spoiled by a peep through another door . [Undine]192-undine , after a first mustering of [the other girls in [the hotel]819-the hotel]818-the other girls in the hotel , had , as usual , found [herself]192-undine easily first -- till the arrival , from [Washington]36-washington , of [Mr.]820-mr. and [Mrs. Wincher]243-mrs. wincher and [[their]551-her parents daughter]486-their daughter . [Undine]192-undine was much handsomer than [Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher , but [she]192-undine saw at a glance that [she]192-undine did not know how to use [her]192-undine beauty as the other used [her]192-undine plainness . [She]192-undine was exasperated too , by the discovery that [Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher seemed not only unconscious of any possible rivalry between [them]822-them , but actually unaware of [her]244-miss wincher existence . Listless , long - faced , supercilious , [the young lady from [Washington]36-washington]823-the young lady from washington sat apart reading novels or playing solitaire with [[her]823-the young lady from washington parents]551-her parents , as though [the huge hotel]825-the huge hotel 's loud life of gossip and flirtation were invisible and inaudible to [her]823-the young lady from washington . [Undine]192-undine never even succeeded in catching [her]823-the young lady from washington eye : [she]192-undine always lowered it to [her]192-undine book when the Apex beauty trailed or rattled past [her]823-the young lady from washington secluded corner . But one day an acquaintance of [the Winchers]245-the winchers ' turned up -- [a lady from [Boston]37-boston , who had come to [Virginia]35-virginia on a botanizing tour]826-a lady from boston , who had come to virginia on a botanizing tour ; and from scraps of [Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher 's conversation with [the newcomer]827-the newcomer , [Undine]192-undine , straining [her]192-undine ears behind a column of [the long veranda]828-the long veranda , obtained a new glimpse into the unimagined . [The Winchers]245-the winchers , it appeared , found [themselves]245-the winchers at [Potash Springs]38-potash springs merely because a severe illness of [Mrs. Wincher]243-mrs. wincher 's had made it impossible , at the last moment , to move [her]244-miss wincher farther from [Washington]36-washington . [They]245-the winchers had let [[their]245-the winchers house on [the North Shore]39-the north shore]829-their house on the north shore , and as soon as [they]245-the winchers could leave " this dreadful hole "[244-miss wincher] were going to [Europe]29-europe for the autumn . [Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher simply did n't know how [she]244-miss wincher got through the days ; though no doubt it was as good as a rest - cure after the rush of the winter . Of course [they]245-the winchers would have preferred to hire [a house]830-a house , but the " hole , "[244-miss wincher] if [one]629-one could believe it , did n't offer one ; so [they]245-the winchers had simply shut [themselves]245-the winchers off as best [they]245-the winchers could from the " hotel crew"--had[608-her friend] [[her]244-miss wincher friend]608-her friend , [Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher parenthetically asked , happened to notice [the Sunday young men]833-the sunday young men ? [They]833-the sunday young men were queerer even than the " belles "[833-the sunday young men] [they]833-the sunday young men came for -- and had escaped the promiscuity of the dinner - hour by turning one of [[their]245-the winchers rooms]834-their rooms into [a dining - room]835-a dining - room , and picnicking there -- with the Persimmon House standards , one could n't describe it in any other way ! But luckily [the awful place]836-the awful place was doing mamma good , and now [they]245-the winchers had nearly served [their]245-the winchers term ... [Undine]192-undine turned sick as [she]192-undine listened . Only the evening before [she]192-undine had gone on a " buggy - ride "[192-undine] with [a young gentleman from [Deposit]40-deposit]837-a young gentleman from deposit -- [[a dentist]838-a dentist 's assistant]839-a dentist 's assistant -- and had let [him]837-a young gentleman from deposit kiss [her]192-undine , and given [him]837-a young gentleman from deposit the flower from [her]192-undine hair . [She]192-undine loathed the thought of [him]837-a young gentleman from deposit now : [she]192-undine loathed [all the people]840-all the people about [her]192-undine , and most of all [the disdainful Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher . It enraged [her]192-undine to think that [the Winchers]245-the winchers classed [her]192-undine with the " hotel crew"--with[245-the winchers] [the " belles "[245-the winchers] who awaited [[their]245-the winchers Sunday young men]842-their sunday young men]841-the " belles " who awaited their sunday young men . [The place]491-the place was forever blighted for [her]192-undine , and the next week [she]192-undine dragged [[her]192-undine amazed but thankful parents]844-her amazed but thankful parents back to [Apex]192-undine . But [Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher 's depreciatory talk had opened ampler vistas , and [the pioneer blood in [Undine]192-undine]845-the pioneer blood in undine would not let [her]192-undine rest . [She]192-undine had heard the call of [the Atlantic seaboard]846-the atlantic seaboard , and the next summer found [the Spraggs]207-the spraggs at [Skog Harbour]41-skog harbour , [Maine]42-maine . Even now [Undine]192-undine felt a shiver of boredom as [she]192-undine recalled it . That summer had been the worst of all . [The bare wind - beaten inn]847-the bare wind - beaten inn , all shingles without and blueberry pie within , was " exclusive , "[207-the spraggs] parochial , [Bostonian]43-bostonian ; and [the Spraggs]207-the spraggs wore through the interminable weeks in blank unmitigated isolation . The incomprehensible part of it was that [every other woman in [the hotel]819-the hotel]848-every other woman in the hotel was plain , dowdy or elderly -- and most of [them]848-every other woman in the hotel all three . If there had been any competition on ordinary lines [Undine]192-undine would have won , as [Van Degen]231-van degen said , " hands down . "[231-van degen] But there wasn't -- [the other " guests]3866-the other " guests "[231-van degen] simply formed a cold impenetrable group who walked , boated , played golf , and discussed Christian Science and the Subliminal , unaware of the tremulous organism drifting helplessly against [their]207-the spraggs rock - bound circle . It was on the day [the Spraggs]207-the spraggs left [Skog Harbour]41-skog harbour that [Undine]192-undine vowed to [herself]192-undine with set lips : " [I]192-undine 'll never try anything again till [I]192-undine try [New York]8-new york . "[192-undine] Now [she]192-undine had gained [her]192-undine point and tried [New York]8-new york , and so far , it seemed , with no better success . From small things to great , everything went against [her]192-undine . In such hours of self - searching [she]192-undine was ready enough to acknowledge [her]192-undine own mistakes , but they exasperated [her]192-undine less than the blunders of [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents . [She]192-undine was sure , for instance , that [she]192-undine was on what [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny called " the right tack "[193-mrs. heeny] at last : yet just at the moment when [her]192-undine luck seemed about to turn [she]192-undine was to be thwarted by [[her]192-undine father]614-her father 's stupid obstinacy about the opera - box ... "[488-her husband] V [She]194-mrs. spragg had looked down at [them]858-them , enviously , from [the balcony]859-the balcony -- [she]194-mrs. spragg had looked up at [them]858-them , reverentially , from [the stalls]860-the stalls ; but now at last [she]194-mrs. spragg was on a line with [them]858-them , among [them]858-them , [she]194-mrs. spragg was part of [the sacred semicircle whose privilege it is , between the acts , to make the mere public forget that the curtain has fallen]861-the sacred semicircle whose privilege it is , between the acts , to make the mere public forget that the curtain has fallen . As [she]194-mrs. spragg swept to the left - hand seat of [[their]858-them crimson niche]862-their crimson niche , waving [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel to the opposite corner with a gesture learned during [her]194-mrs. spragg apprenticeship in [the stalls]860-the stalls , [Undine]192-undine felt that quickening of the faculties that comes in the high moments of life . [Her]192-undine consciousness seemed to take in at once the whole bright curve of [the auditorium]864-the auditorium , from the unbroken lines of [spectators]865-spectators below [her]192-undine to the culminating blaze of the central chandelier ; and [she]192-undine [herself]192-undine was the core of that vast illumination , the sentient throbbing surface which gathered all the shafts of light into a centre . It was almost a relief when , a moment later , the lights sank , the curtain rose , and the focus of illumination was shifted . The music , the scenery , and the movement on the stage , were like a rich mist tempering the radiance that shot on [her]192-undine from every side , and giving [her]192-undine time to subside , draw breath , adjust [herself]192-undine to this new clear medium which made [her]192-undine feel so oddly brittle and transparent . When the curtain fell on the first act [she]192-undine began to be aware of a subtle change in [the house]623-the house . In all the boxes cross - currents of movement had set in : [groups]867-groups were coalescing and breaking up , [fans]868-fans waving and heads twinkling , black coats emerging among white shoulders , [late comers]869-late comers dropping [their]869-late comers furs and laces in the red penumbra of the background . [Undine]192-undine , for the moment unconscious of [herself]192-undine , swept [the house]623-the house with [her]192-undine opera - glass , searching for [familiar faces]871-familiar faces . Some [she]192-undine knew without being able to name [them]871-familiar faces -- [fixed figure - heads of the social prow]872-fixed figure - heads of the social prow -- others [she]192-undine recognized from [their]873-their portraits in the papers ; but of the few from whom [she]192-undine could [herself]192-undine claim recognition not one was visible , and as [she]192-undine pursued [her]192-undine investigations the whole scene grew blank and featureless . Almost all the boxes were full now , but one , just opposite , tantalized [her]192-undine by its continued emptiness . How queer to have an opera - box and not use [it]874-it ! What on earth could [the people]875-the people be doing -- what rarer delight could [they]875-the people be tasting ? [Undine]192-undine remembered that the numbers of the boxes and the names of [[their]871-familiar faces owners]876-their owners were given on the back of the programme , and after a rapid computation [she]192-undine turned to consult the list . Mondays and Fridays , [Mrs. Peter Van Degen]231-van degen . That was it : the box was empty because [Mrs. Van Degen]231-van degen was dining alone with [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph ! " [PETER]231-van degen WILL BE AT ONE OF [HIS]878-his DINNERS . "[199-ralph] [Undine]192-undine had a sharp vision of [the Van Degen dining - room]877-the van degen dining - room -- [she]192-undine pictured [it]877-the van degen dining - room as oak - carved and sumptuous with gilding --with a small table in the centre , and rosy lights and flowers , and [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph , across the hot - house grapes and champagne , leaning to take a light from [[his]878-his hostess]879-his hostess 's cigarette . [Undine]192-undine had seen such scenes on [the stage]880-the stage , [she]192-undine had come upon them in the glowing pages of fiction , and it seemed to [her]192-undine that every detail was before [her]192-undine now , from the glitter of jewels on [Mrs. Van Degen]231-van degen 's bare shoulders to the way [young Marvell]199-ralph stroked [his]878-his slight blond moustache while [he]878-his smiled and listened . [Undine]192-undine blushed with anger at [her]192-undine own simplicity in fancying that [he]878-his had been " taken "[878-his] by [her]192-undine -- that [she]192-undine could ever really count among [these happy self - absorbed people]881-these happy self - absorbed people ! [They]881-these happy self - absorbed people all had [[their]881-these happy self - absorbed people friends]882-their friends , [their]881-these happy self - absorbed people ties , [their]881-these happy self - absorbed people delightful crowding obligations : why should [they]881-these happy self - absorbed people make room for [an intruder]883-an intruder in a circle so packed with the initiated ? As [her]192-undine imagination developed the details of the scene in [the Van Degen dining - room]877-the van degen dining - room it became clear to [her]192-undine that fashionable society was horribly immoral and that [she]192-undine could never really be happy in such a poisoned atmosphere . [She]192-undine remembered that [an eminent divine]885-an eminent divine was preaching a series of sermons against Social Corruption , and [she]192-undine determined to go and hear [him]885-an eminent divine on the following Sunday . This train of thought was interrupted by the feeling that [she]192-undine was being intently observed from the neighbouring box . [She]192-undine turned around with a feint of speaking to [Mrs. Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb , and met the bulging stare of [Peter Van Degen]231-van degen . [He]885-an eminent divine was standing behind [the lady of the eye - glass]770-the lady of the eye - glass , who had replaced [her]770-the lady of the eye - glass tortoise - shell implement by one of closely - set brilliants , which , at word from [[her]770-the lady of the eye - glass companion]887-her companion , [she]770-the lady of the eye - glass critically bent on [Undine]192-undine . " No -- [I]192-undine do n't remember , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine said ; and [the girl]449-the girl reddened , divining [herself]449-the girl unidentified after this protracted scrutiny . But there was no doubt as to [young Van Degen]231-van degen 's remembering [her]192-undine . [She]192-undine was even conscious that [he]885-an eminent divine was trying to provoke in [her]192-undine some reciprocal sign of recognition ; and the attempt drove [her]192-undine to the haughty study of [her]192-undine programme . " Why , there 's [Mr. Popple]197-popple over there ! "[200-mabel] exclaimed [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel , making large signs across [the house]623-the house with fan and play - bill . [Undine]192-undine had already become aware that [Mabel]200-mabel , planted , blond and brimming , too near the edge of the box , was somehow out of scale and out of drawing ; and the freedom of [her]200-mabel demonstrations increased the effect of disproportion . [No one else]890-no one else was wagging and waving in that way : a gestureless mute telegraphy seemed to pass between the other boxes . Still , [Undine]192-undine could not help following [Mrs. Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb 's glance , and there in fact was [Claud Popple]197-popple , taller and more dominant than ever , and bending easily over what [she]192-undine felt must be the back of [a brilliant woman]891-a brilliant woman . [He]885-an eminent divine replied by a discreet salute to [Mrs. Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb 's intemperate motions , and [Undine]192-undine saw [the brilliant woman]892-the brilliant woman 's opera - glass turn in [their]893-their direction , and said to [herself]192-undine that in a moment [Mr. Popple]197-popple would be " round . "[197-popple] But the entr'acte wore on , and [no one]3844-no one turned the handle of [their]893-their door , or disturbed the peaceful somnolence of [Harry Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb , who , not being ( as [he]885-an eminent divine put it ) " onto "[885-an eminent divine] grand opera , had abandoned the struggle and withdrawn to the seclusion of the inner box . " [Undie]240-undie , do look -- there 's [Mr. Marvell]198-mr. marvell ! [The two]899-the two seemed to be alone in [the box]900-the box -- as [they]899-the two had doubtless been alone all the evening!--and [Undine]192-undine furtively turned to see if [Mr. Van Degen]246-van degen shared [her]192-undine disapproval .
