"[192-undine] gasped [Undine]192-undine as the curtain rose . [She]192-undine was no longer capable of following the action on the stage . Two presences possessed [her]192-undine imagination : that of [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph , small , unattainable , remote , and that of [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel , near - by , immense and irrepressible . It had become clear to [Undine]192-undine that [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel was ridiculous . That was the reason why [Popple]197-popple did not come to the box . [No one]3844-no one would care to be seen talking to [her]192-undine while [Mabel]200-mabel was at [her]192-undine side : [Mabel]200-mabel , monumental and moulded while the fashionable were flexible and diaphanous , [Mabel]200-mabel strident and explicit while [they]902-they were subdued and allusive . At [the Stentorian]446-the stentorian [she]192-undine was [the centre of [[her]192-undine group]905-her group]904-the centre of her group -- here [she]192-undine revealed [herself]192-undine as unknown and unknowing . Why , [she]192-undine did n't even know that [Mrs. Peter Van Degen]231-van degen was not [[Ralph Marvell]199-ralph 's sister]906-ralph marvell 's sister ! And [she]192-undine had a way of trumpeting out [her]192-undine ignorances that jarred on [Undine]192-undine 's subtler methods . It was precisely at this point that there dawned on [Undine]192-undine what was to be one of the guiding principles of [her]192-undine career : " [IT]3878-it 'S BETTER TO [WATCH THAN TO ASK QUESTIONS]247-watch than to ask questions . "[192-undine] The curtain fell again , and [Undine]192-undine 's eyes flew back to [the Van Degen box]907-the van degen box . [Several men]908-several men were entering [it]907-the van degen box together , and a moment later [she]192-undine saw [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph rise from [his]909-his seat and pass out . Half - unconsciously [she]192-undine placed [herself]192-undine in such a way as to have an eye on the door of the box . But its handle remained unturned , and [Harry Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb , leaning back on the sofa , [his]910-his head against the opera cloaks , continued to breathe stentorously through [his]910-his open mouth and stretched [his]910-his legs a little farther across the threshold ... The entr'acte was nearly over when the door opened and [two gentlemen]911-two gentlemen stumbled over [Mr. Lipscomb]248-mr. lipscomb 's legs . The foremost was [Claud Walsingham Popple]197-popple ; and above [his]197-popple shoulder shone the batrachian countenance of [Peter Van Degen]231-van degen . A brief murmur from [Mr. Popple]197-popple made [[his]197-popple companion]912-his companion known to [the two ladies]913-the two ladies , and [Mr. Van Degen]246-van degen promptly seated [himself]246-van degen behind [Undine]192-undine , relegating [the painter]663-the painter to [Mrs. Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb 's elbow . " Queer go -- [I]192-undine happened to see [[your]192-undine friend]3879-your friend there waving to [old Popp]249-old popp across [the house]623-the house . So [I]192-undine bolted over and collared [him]3879-your friend : told [him]3879-your friend [he]3879-your friend 'd got to introduce [me]192-undine before [he]3879-your friend was a minute older . [I]192-undine tried to find out who [you]192-undine were the other day at [the Motor Show]45-the motor show -- no , where was it ? Oh , those pictures at [Goldmark 's]46-goldmark 's . What d'you think of ['em]3881-'em , by the way ? [You]192-undine ought to be painted [yourself]192-undine -- no , [I]192-undine mean it , [you]192-undine know -- [you]192-undine ought to get [old Popp]249-old popp to do [you]192-undine . "[192-undine] [Undine]192-undine sat well forward , curving toward [him]915-him a little , as [she]192-undine had seen [the other women]916-the other women do , but holding back sufficiently to let it be visible to [the house]623-the house that [she]192-undine was conversing with [no less a person than [Mr. Peter Van Degen]246-van degen]918-no less a person than mr. peter van degen . [Mr. Popple]197-popple 's talk was certainly more brilliant and purposeful , and [she]192-undine saw [him]915-him cast longing glances at [her]192-undine from behind [Mrs. Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb 's shoulder ; but [she]192-undine remembered how lightly [he]915-him had been treated at the Fairford dinner , and [she]192-undine wanted -- oh , how [she]192-undine wanted!--to have [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph see [her]192-undine talking to [Van Degen]246-van degen . [She]192-undine poured out [her]192-undine heart to [him]915-him , improvising an opinion on the pictures and an opinion on the music , falling in gaily with [his]915-him suggestion of a jolly little dinner some night soon , at the Caf [Martin]250-martin , and strengthening [her]192-undine position , as [she]192-undine thought , by an easy allusion to [her]192-undine acquaintance with [Mrs. Van Degen]231-van degen . But at the word [[her]192-undine companion]887-her companion 's eye clouded , and a shade of constraint dimmed [his]915-him enterprising smile . " [[My]915-him wife--]3883-my wife-- ? Oh , [SHE]3883-my wife-- does n't go to [restaurants]3884-restaurants -- [she]3883-my wife-- moves on too high [a plane]3885-a plane . But [we]3886-we 'll get [old Popp]249-old popp , and [Mrs.--]251-mrs.-- , [Mrs.--]251-mrs.-- , what 'd [you]251-mrs.-- say [[your]251-mrs.-- fat friend]3887-your fat friend 's name was ? [Just a select little crowd of four -- and some kind of a cheerful show]3888-just a select little crowd of four -- and some kind of a cheerful show afterward ... Jove ! There 's the curtain , and [I]915-him must skip . "[915-him] As the door closed on [him]915-him [Undine]192-undine 's cheeks burned with resentment . If [Mrs. Van Degen]231-van degen did n't go to [restaurants]3884-restaurants , why had [he]915-him supposed that [SHE]231-van degen would ? and to have to drag [Mabel]200-mabel in [her]231-van degen wake ! The leaden sense of failure overcame [her]192-undine again . Here was the evening nearly over , and what had it led to ? Looking up from [the stalls]860-the stalls , [she]192-undine had fancied that to sit in a box was to be in society -- now [she]192-undine saw it might but emphasize [one]629-one 's exclusion . And [she]192-undine was burdened with the box for the rest of the season ! It was really stupid of [[her]192-undine father]614-her father to have exceeded [his]614-her father instructions : why had [he]614-her father not done as [she]192-undine told [him]614-her father ? ... [Undine]192-undine felt helpless and tired ... hateful memories of [Apex]192-undine crowded back on [her]192-undine . Was it going to be as dreary here as there ? [She]192-undine felt [Lipscomb]200-mabel 's loud whisper in [her]192-undine back : " Say , [[you]924-you girls]3889-you girls , [I]200-mabel guess [I]200-mabel 'll cut this and come back for [you]924-you when the show busts up . "[200-mabel] [They]924-you heard [him]614-her father shuffle out of the box , and [Mabel]200-mabel settled back to undisturbed enjoyment of the stage . When the last entr'acte began [Undine]192-undine stood up , resolved to stay no longer . [Mabel]200-mabel , lost in the study of [the audience]925-the audience , had not noticed [her]192-undine movement , and as [she]200-mabel passed alone into the back of the box the door opened and [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph came in . [Undine]192-undine stood with one arm listlessly raised to detach [her]192-undine cloak from the wall . [Her]192-undine attitude showed the long slimness of [her]192-undine figure and the fresh curve of the throat below [her]192-undine bent - back head . [Her]192-undine face was paler and softer than usual , and the eyes [she]192-undine rested on [Marvell]199-ralph 's face looked deep and starry under [their]924-you fixed brows . " Oh -- [you're]192-undine not going ? "[614-her father] [he]614-her father exclaimed . " [I]192-undine thought [you]614-her father were n't coming , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine answered simply . " [I]192-undine waited till now on purpose to dodge [[your]614-her father other visitors]3890-your other visitors . "[192-undine] [She]192-undine laughed with pleasure . " Oh , [we]926-they had n't so many ! "[192-undine] Some intuition had already told [her]192-undine that frankness was the tone to take with [him]614-her father . [They]926-they sat down together on the red damask sofa , against the hanging cloaks . As [Undine]192-undine leaned back [her]192-undine hair caught in the spangles of the wrap behind [her]192-undine , and [she]192-undine had to sit motionless while [the young man]669-the young man freed [the captive mesh]928-the captive mesh . Then [they]926-they settled [themselves]926-they again , laughing a little at the incident . A glance had made the situation clear to [Mrs. Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb , and [they]926-they saw [her]221-mrs. lipscomb return to [her]221-mrs. lipscomb rapt inspection of the boxes . In [their]926-they mirror - hung recess the light was subdued to a rosy dimness and the hum of [the audience]925-the audience came to [them]926-they through half - drawn silken curtains . [Undine]192-undine noticed the delicacy and finish of [[her]192-undine companion]887-her companion 's features as [his]614-her father head detached itself against the red silk walls . The hand with which [he]614-her father stroked [his]614-her father small moustache was finely - finished too , but sinewy and not effeminate . [She]192-undine had always associated finish and refinement entirely with [her]192-undine own sex , but [she]192-undine began to think [they]931-they might be even more agreeable in [a man]932-a man . [Marvell]199-ralph 's eyes were grey , like [her]192-undine own , with chestnut eyebrows and darker lashes ; and [his]614-her father skin was as clear as [a woman]933-a woman 's , but pleasantly reddish , like [his]614-her father hands . As [he]614-her father sat talking in a low tone , questioning [her]192-undine about the music , asking [her]192-undine what [she]192-undine had been doing since [he]614-her father had last seen [her]192-undine , [she]192-undine was aware that [he]614-her father looked at [her]192-undine less than usual , and [she]192-undine also glanced away ; but when [she]192-undine turned [her]192-undine eyes suddenly they always met [his]614-her father gaze . [His]614-her father talk remained impersonal . [She]192-undine was a little disappointed that [he]614-her father did not compliment [her]192-undine on [her]192-undine dress or [her]192-undine hair -- [Undine]192-undine was accustomed to hearing a great deal about [her]192-undine hair , and the episode of the spangles had opened the way to a graceful allusion -- but the instinct of sex told [her]192-undine that , under [his]614-her father quiet words , [he]614-her father was throbbing with the sense of [her]192-undine proximity . And [his]614-her father self - restraint sobered [her]192-undine , made [her]192-undine refrain from the flashing and fidgeting which were the only way [she]192-undine knew of taking part in the immemorial love - dance . [She]192-undine talked simply and frankly of [herself]192-undine , of [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents , of how [few people [they]551-her parents knew in [New York]8-new york]935-few people they knew in new york , and of how , at times , [she]192-undine was almost sorry [she]192-undine had persuaded [them]551-her parents to give up [Apex]192-undine . "[197-popple] [Marvell]199-ralph was not coming into [the club]3903-the club , and [he]942-he drew a long breath of relief as [[his]942-he companion]912-his companion left [him]942-he . Was it possible that [he]942-he had ever thought leniently of [the egregious Popple]197-popple ? The tone of social omniscience which [he]942-he had once found so comic was now as offensive to [him]942-he as a coarse physical touch . And the worst of it was that [Popple]197-popple , with the slight exaggeration of a caricature , really expressed the ideals of [the world]620-the world [he]942-he frequented . As [he]942-he spoke of [Miss Spragg]192-undine , so [others at any rate]945-others at any rate would think of [her]192-undine : almost [every one in [[Ralph]199-ralph 's set]947-ralph 's set]946-every one in ralph 's set would agree that it was luck for [a girl from [Apex]192-undine]948-a girl from apex to be started by [Peter Van Degen]231-van degen at a Caf Martin dinner ... " [They]3904-they 're right,--after all , in some ways [they]3904-they 're right , "[942-he] [he]942-he murmured , slipping [his]942-he key into the door . " [They]3904-they "[942-he] were [[his]942-he mother]3752-his mother and [old Mr. Urban Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet , both , from [Ralph]199-ralph 's earliest memories , so closely identified with [the old house in [Washington Square]2-washington square]953-the old house in washington square that [they]954-their might have passed for [its]953-the old house in washington square inner consciousness as [it]953-the old house in washington square might have stood for [their]954-their outward form ; and the question as to which [the house]623-the house now seemed to affirm [their]954-their intrinsic rightness was that of the social disintegration expressed by widely - different architectural physiognomies at [the other end of [Fifth Avenue]4-fifth avenue]956-the other end of fifth avenue . As [Ralph]199-ralph pushed the bolts behind [him]942-he , and passed into [the hall]565-the hall , with [its]565-the hall dark mahogany doors and the quiet " Dutch interior "[942-he] effect of [its]565-the hall black and white marble paving , [he]942-he said to [himself]942-he that what [Popple]197-popple called society was really just like [the houses [it]565-the hall lived in]958-the houses it lived in : a muddle of misapplied ornament over a thin steel shell of utility . The steel shell was built up in [Wall Street]47-wall street , the social trimmings were hastily added in [Fifth Avenue]4-fifth avenue ; and the union between [them]954-their was as monstrous and factitious , as unlike the gradual homogeneous growth which flowers into what [other countries]959-other countries know as society , as that between [the Blois gargoyles on [Peter Van Degen]231-van degen 's roof]960-the blois gargoyles on peter van degen 's roof and the skeleton walls supporting [them]954-their . That was what " [they]964-the aborigines "[964-the aborigines] had always said ; what , at least , the Dagonet attitude , the Dagonet view of life , the very lines of the furniture in [the old Dagonet house]961-the old dagonet house expressed . [Ralph]199-ralph sometimes called [[his]942-he mother]3752-his mother and [grandfather]963-grandfather [the Aborigines]964-the aborigines , and likened [them]964-the aborigines to [those vanishing denizens of [the American continent doomed to rapid extinction]966-the american continent doomed to rapid extinction with the advance of [the invading race]967-the invading race]965-those vanishing denizens of the american continent doomed to rapid extinction with the advance of the invading race . [He]942-he was fond of describing [Washington Square]2-washington square as [the " Reservation]3905-the " reservation , "[942-he] and of prophesying that before long [[its]2-washington square inhabitants]968-its inhabitants would be exhibited at ethnological shows , pathetically engaged in the exercise of [[their]968-its inhabitants primitive industries]969-their primitive industries . [Small , cautious , middle - class]970-small , cautious , middle - class , had been the ideals of aboriginal [New York]8-new york ; but it suddenly struck [the young man]669-the young man that [they]970-small , cautious , middle - class were singularly coherent and respectable as contrasted with the chaos of indiscriminate appetites which made up its modern tendencies . [He]669-the young man too had wanted to be " modern , "[669-the young man] had revolted , half - humorously , against the restrictions and exclusions of the old code ; and it must have been by one of the ironic reversions of heredity that , at this precise point , [he]669-the young man began to see what there was to be said on the other side -- [his]669-the young man side , as [he]669-the young man now felt it to be . [VI Upstairs]49-vi upstairs , in [[his]669-the young man brown firelit room]972-his brown firelit room , [he]669-the young man threw [himself]669-the young man into an armchair , and remembered ... [Harvard]50-harvard first -- then [Oxford]51-oxford ; then a year of wandering and rich initiation . Returning to [New York]8-new york , [he]669-the young man had read law , and now had [his]669-the young man desk in [the office of [the respectable firm in whose charge [the Dagonet estate]975-the dagonet estate had mouldered for several generations]974-the respectable firm in whose charge the dagonet estate had mouldered for several generations]973-the office of the respectable firm in whose charge the dagonet estate had mouldered for several generations . But [his]669-the young man profession was the least real thing in [his]669-the young man life . The realities lay about [him]669-the young man now : the books jamming [his]669-the young man old college bookcases and overflowing on chairs and tables ; sketches too -- [he]669-the young man could do charming things , if only [he]669-the young man had known how to finish them!--and , on the writing - table at [his]669-the young man elbow , scattered sheets of prose and verse ; charming things also , but , like the sketches , unfinished . Nothing in the Dagonet and [Marvell]199-ralph tradition was opposed to this desultory dabbling with life . For four or five generations it had been the rule of [both houses]976-both houses that [a young fellow]977-a young fellow should go to [Columbia]52-columbia or [Harvard]50-harvard , read law , and then lapse into more or less cultivated inaction . The only essential was that [he]669-the young man should live " like [a gentleman"--that]3906-a gentleman"--that[669-the young man] is , with a tranquil disdain for mere money - getting , a passive openness to the finer sensations , one or two fixed principles as to the quality of wine , and an archaic probity that had not yet learned to distinguish between private and " business "[669-the young man] honour . No equipment could more thoroughly have unfitted [the modern youth]978-the modern youth for getting on : it hardly needed the scribbled pages on the desk to complete the hopelessness of [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph 's case . [He]669-the young man had accepted the fact with a humorous fatalism . Material resources were limited on both sides of [the house]623-the house , but there would always be enough for [his]669-the young man frugal wants -- enough to buy books ( not " editions "[669-the young man] ) , and pay now and then for a holiday dash to the great centres of art and ideas . And meanwhile there was the world of wonders within [him]669-the young man . As [a boy]980-a boy at [the sea - side]981-the sea - side , [Ralph]199-ralph , between tides , had once come on [a cave]982-a cave -- [a secret inaccessible place with glaucous lights , mysterious murmurs]983-a secret inaccessible place with glaucous lights , mysterious murmurs , and a single shaft of communication with the sky . [He]669-the young man had kept [his]669-the young man find from [the other boys]984-the other boys , not churlishly , for [he]669-the young man was always [an outspoken lad]985-an outspoken lad , but because [he]669-the young man felt there were things about [the cave]986-the cave that [the others]652-the others , [good fellows]988-good fellows as [they]652-the others all were , could n't be expected to understand , and that , anyhow , it would never be quite [[his]669-the young man cave]989-his cave again after [he]669-the young man had let [[his]669-the young man thick - set freckled cousins]990-his thick - set freckled cousins play [smuggler]991-smuggler and [pirate]992-pirate in [it]986-the cave . And so with [his]669-the young man inner world . Though so coloured by outer impressions , it wove a secret curtain about [him]669-the young man , and [he]669-the young man came and went in [it]986-the cave with the same joy of furtive possession . One day , of course , [some one]993-some one would discover it and reign there with [him]669-the young man -- no , reign over it and [him]669-the young man . Once or twice already a light foot had reached the threshold . [[His]669-the young man cousin]939-his cousin [Clare Dagonet]232-clare dagonet , for instance : there had been a summer when [her]939-his cousin voice had sounded far down the windings ... but [he]669-the young man had run over to [Spain]53-spain for the autumn , and when [he]669-the young man came back [she]939-his cousin was engaged to [Peter Van Degen]231-van degen , and for a while it looked black in [the cave]986-the cave . That was long ago , as time is reckoned under thirty ; and for three years now [he]669-the young man had felt for [her]939-his cousin only a half - contemptuous pity . To have stood at the mouth of [[his]669-the young man cave]989-his cave , and have turned from [it]986-the cave to [the Van Degen lair--]997-the van degen lair-- ! [Poor Clare]257-poor clare repented , indeed -- [she]257-poor clare wanted it clearly but [she]257-poor clare repented in [the Van Degen diamonds]998-the van degen diamonds , and [the Van Degen]231-van degen motor bore [her]257-poor clare broken heart from opera to ball . [She]257-poor clare had been subdued to what [she]257-poor clare worked in , and [she]257-poor clare could never again find [her]257-poor clare way to [the enchanted cave]999-the enchanted cave ... [Ralph]199-ralph , since then , had reached the point of deciding that [he]669-the young man would never marry ; reached it not suddenly or dramatically , but with such sober advisedness as is urged on [those about to take the opposite step]1000-those about to take the opposite step . What [he]669-the young man most wanted , now that the first flutter of being was over , was to learn and to do -- to know what [the great people]1001-the great people had thought , think about [their]1001-the great people thinking , and then launch [his]669-the young man own boat : write some good verse if possible ; if not , then critical prose . A dramatic poem lay among the stuff at [his]669-the young man elbow ; but [the prose critic]1002-the prose critic was at [his]669-the young man elbow too , and not to be satisfied about the poem ; and [poet]1003-poet and [critic]1004-critic passed the nights in hot if unproductive debate . On the whole , it seemed likely that [the critic]1005-the critic would win the day , and the essay on " The Rhythmical Structures of [Walt Whitman]258-walt whitman "[1005-the critic] take shape before " [The Banished God]259-god . "[1004-critic] Yet if the light in [the cave]986-the cave was less supernaturally blue , the chant of [its]986-the cave tides less laden with unimaginable music , it was still a thronged and echoing place when [Undine Spragg]192-undine appeared on [its]986-the cave threshold ... [[His]669-the young man mother]3752-his mother and sister of course wanted [him]669-the young man to marry . [They]1008-they had the usual theory that [he]669-the young man was " made "[1008-they] for conjugal bliss : [women]3830-women always thought that of [a fellow who did n't get drunk and have low tastes]1010-a fellow who did n't get drunk and have low tastes . [Ralph]199-ralph smiled at the idea as [he]669-the young man sat crouched among [his]669-the young man secret treasures . Marry -- but whom , in the name of light and freedom ? [The daughters of [his]669-the young man own race]1011-the daughters of his own race sold [themselves]1011-the daughters of his own race to [the Invaders]1012-the invaders ; [the daughters of [the Invaders]1012-the invaders]1013-the daughters of the invaders bought [[their]1013-the daughters of the invaders husbands]1015-their husbands as [they]1013-the daughters of the invaders bought an opera - box . [[His]669-the young man mother]3752-his mother , [he]669-the young man knew , had no such ambitions for [him]669-the young man : [she]3752-his mother would have liked [him]669-the young man to fancy [a " nice girl "[3752-his mother] like [Harriet Ray]233-harriet]1018-a " nice girl " like harriet ray . [Harriet Ray]233-harriet was neither vulgar nor ambitious . [She]233-harriet regarded [Washington Square]2-washington square as the birthplace of Society , knew by heart [all the cousinships of early [New York]8-new york]1019-all the cousinships of early new york , hated [motor - cars]1020-motor - cars , could not make [herself]233-harriet understood on the telephone , and was determined , if [she]233-harriet married , never to receive [a divorced woman]1021-a divorced woman . As [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph often said , [such girls as [Harriet]233-harriet]1022-such girls as harriet were growing rare . [Ralph]199-ralph was not sure about this . [He]669-the young man was inclined to think that , certain modifications allowed for , there would always be plenty of [Harriet Rays]260-harriet rays for [unworldly mothers]1023-unworldly mothers to commend to [[their]1023-unworldly mothers sons]1024-their sons ; and [he]669-the young man had no desire to diminish [their]1023-unworldly mothers number by removing one from the ranks of [the marriageable]1025-the marriageable . [He]669-the young man had no desire to marry at all -- that had been the whole truth of it till [he]669-the young man met [Undine Spragg]192-undine . And now-- ? [He]669-the young man lit a cigar , and began to recall [his]669-the young man hour 's conversation with [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg . [Ralph]199-ralph had never taken [[his]669-the young man mother]3752-his mother 's social faiths very seriously . But [most of those [he]669-the young man had met]1029-most of those he had met had already been modified by contact with [the indigenous]1030-the indigenous : [they]1029-most of those he had met spoke the same language as [his]669-the young man , though on [their]1029-most of those he had met lips it had often so different a meaning . [He]669-the young man felt obscurely that in [the girl]449-the girl 's presence -- frank and simple as [he]669-the young man thought [her]449-the girl -- [he]669-the young man should have learned less of life in early [Apex]192-undine . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , once reconciled -- or at least resigned -- to the mysterious necessity of having to " entertain "[194-mrs. spragg] [a friend of [Undine]192-undine 's]1035-a friend of undine 's , had yielded to the first touch on the weak springs of [her]194-mrs. spragg garrulity . [She]194-mrs. spragg had not seen [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny for two days , and [this friendly young man with the gentle manner]1036-this friendly young man with the gentle manner was almost as easy to talk to as [the masseuse]460-the masseuse . And then [she]194-mrs. spragg could tell [him]1036-this friendly young man with the gentle manner things that [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny already knew , and [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg liked to repeat [her]194-mrs. spragg stories . To do so gave [her]194-mrs. spragg almost [her]194-mrs. spragg sole sense of permanence among the shifting scenes of life . So that , after [she]194-mrs. spragg had lengthily deplored the untoward accident of [Undine]192-undine 's absence , and [[her]194-mrs. spragg visitor]427-her visitor , with a smile , and echoes of divers et ondoyant in [his]1036-this friendly young man with the gentle manner brain , had repeated [[her]194-mrs. spragg daughter]443-her daughter 's name after [her]194-mrs. spragg , saying : " It 's a wonderful find -- how could [you]194-mrs. spragg tell it would be such a fit?"--it[194-mrs. spragg] came to [her]194-mrs. spragg quite easily to answer : " Why , [we]3907-we called [her]443-her daughter after [a hair - waver father]3908-a hair - waver father put on the market the week [she]443-her daughter was born-- "[194-mrs. spragg] and then to explain , as [he]1036-this friendly young man with the gentle manner remained struck and silent : " It 's from [UNdoolay]54-undoolay , [you]194-mrs. spragg know , the French for crimping ; [father]3817-father always thought the name made it take . "[194-mrs. spragg] [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , when [she]194-mrs. spragg found [herself]194-mrs. spragg embarked on a long sentence , always ballasted it by italicizing the last word . [[Her]194-mrs. spragg husband]488-her husband , [she]194-mrs. spragg continued , could not , at the time , do much for [[his]488-her husband father - in - law]1041-his father - in - law . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had come to [Apex]192-undine as [a poor boy]1042-a poor boy , and [their]1043-their early married life had been a protracted struggle , darkened by domestic affliction . [Two of [[their]1043-their three children]1045-their three children]1044-two of their three children had died of typhoid in the epidemic which devastated [Apex]192-undine before [the new water - works]1046-the new water - works were built ; and this calamity , by causing [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg to resolve that thereafter [Apex]192-undine should drink pure water , had led directly to the founding of [his]191-mr. spragg fortunes . " [He]191-mr. spragg had taken over some of [[poor father]3916-poor father 's land]3917-poor father 's land for a bad debt , and when [he]191-mr. spragg got up the Pure Water move [the company]601-the company voted to buy [the land]3919-the land and build [the new reservoir up there]3920-the new reservoir up there : and after that [we]3921-we began to be better off , and it DID seem as if it had come out so to comfort [us]3921-we some about [the children]3922-the children . "[191-mr. spragg] [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg , thereafter , had begun to be a power in [Apex]192-undine , and fat years had followed on the lean . [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph was too little versed in affairs to read between the lines of [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's untutored narrative , and [he]191-mr. spragg understood no more than [she]194-mrs. spragg the occult connection between [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's domestic misfortunes and [his]191-mr. spragg business triumph . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had " helped out "[194-mrs. spragg] [[his]191-mr. spragg ruined father - in - law]1047-his ruined father - in - law , and had vowed on [[his]191-mr. spragg children]1048-his children 's graves that [no Apex child]1049-no apex child should ever again drink poisoned water -- and out of those two disinterested impulses , by some impressive law of compensation , material prosperity had come . What [Ralph]199-ralph understood and appreciated was [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's unaffected frankness in talking of [her]194-mrs. spragg early life . Here was no retrospective pretense of an opulent past , such as [the other Invaders]1050-the other invaders were given to parading before [the bland but undeceived subject race]1051-the bland but undeceived subject race . [The Spraggs]207-the spraggs had been " [plain people]3923-plain people "[207-the spraggs] and had not yet learned to be ashamed of it . The fact drew [them]207-the spraggs much closer to the Dagonet ideals than any sham elegance in the past tense . [Ralph]199-ralph felt that [[his]191-mr. spragg mother]3752-his mother , who shuddered away from [Mrs. Harmon B. Driscoll]201-driscoll , would understand and esteem [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg . But how long would [their]207-the spraggs virgin innocence last ? [Popple]197-popple 's vulgar hands were on it already -- [Popple]197-popple 's and [the unspeakable Van Degen]1053-the unspeakable van degen 's ! Once [they]207-the spraggs and [theirs]207-the spraggs had begun the process of initiating [Undine]192-undine , there was no knowing -- or rather there was too easy knowing -- how it would end ! It was incredible that [she]194-mrs. spragg too should be destined to swell the ranks of the cheaply fashionable ; yet were not [her]194-mrs. spragg very freshness , [her]194-mrs. spragg malleability , the mark of [her]194-mrs. spragg fate ? [She]194-mrs. spragg was still at the age when the flexible soul offers itself to the first grasp . That the grasp should chance to be [Van Degen's]261-van degen's -- that was what made [Ralph]199-ralph 's temples buzz , and swept away all [his]191-mr. spragg plans for [his]191-mr. spragg own future like a beaver 's dam in a spring flood . To save [her]194-mrs. spragg from [Van Degen]231-van degen and [Van Degenism]262-van degenism : was that really to be [his]191-mr. spragg mission -- the " call "[262-van degenism] for which [his]191-mr. spragg life had obscurely waited ? It was not in the least what [he]191-mr. spragg had meant to do with the fugitive flash of consciousness [he]191-mr. spragg called self ; but all that [he]191-mr. spragg had purposed for that transitory being sank into insignificance under the pressure of [Undine]192-undine 's claims . [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph 's notion of [women]3830-women had been formed on the experiences common to [good - looking young men of [his]191-mr. spragg kind]1055-good - looking young men of his kind . [Women]3830-women were drawn to [him]191-mr. spragg as much by [his]191-mr. spragg winning appealing quality , by the sense of a youthful warmth behind [his]191-mr. spragg light ironic exterior , as by [his]191-mr. spragg charms of face and mind . Except during [Clare Dagonet]232-clare dagonet 's brief reign the depths in [him]191-mr. spragg had not been stirred ; but in taking what each sentimental episode had to give [he]191-mr. spragg had preserved , through all [his]191-mr. spragg minor adventures , [his]191-mr. spragg faith in the great adventure to come . It was this faith that made [him]191-mr. spragg so easy [a victim when love]1057-a victim when love had at last appeared clad in the attributes of romance : [the imaginative man]1058-the imaginative man 's indestructible dream of a rounded passion . The clearness with which [he]191-mr. spragg judged [the girl]449-the girl and [himself]191-mr. spragg seemed the surest proof that [his]191-mr. spragg feeling was more than a surface thrill . [He]191-mr. spragg was not blind to [her]449-the girl crudity and [her]449-the girl limitations , but they were a part of [her]449-the girl grace and [her]449-the girl persuasion . Diverse et ondoyante -- so [he]191-mr. spragg had seen [her]449-the girl from the first . But was not that merely the sign of a quicker response to [the world]620-the world 's manifold appeal ? There was [Harriet Ray]233-harriet , sealed up tight in the vacuum of inherited opinion , where not a breath of fresh sensation could get at [her]233-harriet : there could be no call to rescue [young ladies]1061-young ladies so secured from the perils of reality ! [Undine]192-undine had no such traditional safeguards -- [Ralph]199-ralph guessed [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's opinions to be as fluid as [[her]194-mrs. spragg daughter's]1062-her daughter's -- and [the girl]449-the girl 's very sensitiveness to new impressions , combined with [her]449-the girl obvious lack of any sense of relative values , would make [her]449-the girl an easy prey to the powers of folly . [He]191-mr. spragg seemed to see [her]449-the girl -- as [he]191-mr. spragg sat there , pressing [his]191-mr. spragg fists into [his]191-mr. spragg temples -- [he]191-mr. spragg seemed to see [her]449-the girl like a lovely rock - bound [Andromeda]55-andromeda , with the devouring monster Society careering up to make a mouthful of [her]449-the girl ; and [himself]191-mr. spragg whirling down on [his]191-mr. spragg winged horse -- just [Pegasus]263-pegasus turned [Rosinante]264-rosinante for the nonce -- to cut [her]449-the girl bonds , snatch [her]449-the girl up , and whirl [her]449-the girl back into the blue ... "[1080-mrs. lipscomb 's large blond person] [Undine]192-undine forced a smile , but [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , [her]194-mrs. spragg soft wrinkles deepening with resentment , muttered to [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny , as [she]194-mrs. spragg bent down to shake out [the girl]449-the girl 's train : " [I]194-mrs. spragg guess [[my]194-mrs. spragg daughter]3805-my daughter 's only got to show [herself--]3805-my daughter "[194-mrs. spragg] The first meeting with [old Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet was less formidable than [Undine]192-undine had expected . [She]192-undine had been once before to [the house in [Washington Square]2-washington square]1082-the house in washington square , when , with [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother , [she]192-undine had returned [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph 's ceremonial visit ; but on that occasion [[Ralph]199-ralph 's grandfather]1084-ralph 's grandfather had not been present . All the rites connected with [her]192-undine engagement were new and mysterious to [Undine]192-undine , and none more so than the unaccountable necessity of " dragging"--as[192-undine] [she]192-undine phrased it -- [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg into the affair . It was an accepted article of the Apex creed that parental detachment should be completest at the moment when the filial fate was decided ; and to find that [New York]8-new york reversed this rule was as puzzling to [Undine]192-undine as to [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg was so unprepared for the part [she]194-mrs. spragg was to play that on the occasion of [her]194-mrs. spragg visit to [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph [her]192-undine helplessness had infected [Undine]192-undine , and [their]1086-their half - hour in [the sober faded drawing - room]1087-the sober faded drawing - room remained among [the girl]449-the girl 's most unsatisfactory memories . [She]194-mrs. spragg re - entered [it]1087-the sober faded drawing - room alone with more assurance . [Her]194-mrs. spragg confidence in [her]194-mrs. spragg beauty had hitherto carried [her]194-mrs. spragg through every ordeal ; and it was fortified now by the feeling of power that came with the sense of being loved . If [they]1086-their would only leave [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother out [she]194-mrs. spragg was sure , in [her]194-mrs. spragg own phrase , of being able to " run the thing "[194-mrs. spragg] ; and [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg had providentially been left out of the Dagonet dinner . It was to consist , it appeared , only of [the small family group [Undine]192-undine had already met]1090-the small family group undine had already met ; and , seated at [[old Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet 's right]1091-old mr. dagonet 's right , in [the high dark dining - room]1092-the high dark dining - room with mahogany doors and dim portraits of " [Signers "]3938-signers "[256-mr. dagonet] and [[their]1093-their females]1094-their females , [she]194-mrs. spragg felt a conscious joy in [her]194-mrs. spragg ascendancy . [Old Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet -- small , frail and softly sardonic -- appeared to fall at once under [her]194-mrs. spragg spell . If [she]194-mrs. spragg felt , beneath [his]256-mr. dagonet amenity , a kind of delicate dangerousness , like that of some fine surgical instrument , [she]194-mrs. spragg ignored it as unimportant ; for [she]194-mrs. spragg had as yet no clear perception of forces that did not directly affect [her]194-mrs. spragg . [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph , low - voiced , faded , yet impressive , was less responsive to [her]199-ralph arts , and [Undine]192-undine divined in [her]192-undine the head of the opposition to [Ralph]199-ralph 's marriage . [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny had reported that [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph had other views for [[her]199-ralph son]1095-her son ; and this was confirmed by such echoes of the short sharp struggle as reached [the throbbing listeners]1096-the throbbing listeners at [the Stentorian]3-the stentorian . But the conflict over , the air had immediately cleared , showing [the enemy]1097-the enemy in the act of unconditional surrender . It surprised [Undine]192-undine that there had been no reprisals , no return on the points conceded . That was not [her]192-undine idea of warfare , and [she]192-undine could ascribe the completeness of the victory only to the effect of [her]192-undine charms . [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph 's manner did not express entire subjugation ; yet [she]192-undine seemed anxious to dispel any doubts of [her]192-undine good faith , and if [she]192-undine left the burden of the talk to [[her]192-undine lively daughter]1098-her lively daughter it might have been because [she]192-undine felt more capable of showing indulgence by [her]192-undine silence than in [her]192-undine speech . As for [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford , [she]204-mrs. fairford had never seemed more brilliantly bent on fusing the various elements under [her]204-mrs. fairford hand . [Undine]192-undine had already discovered that [she]192-undine adored [[her]192-undine brother]628-her brother , and had guessed that this would make [her]192-undine either [a strong ally]1100-a strong ally or [a determined enemy]1101-a determined enemy . The latter alternative , however , did not alarm [the girl]449-the girl . [She]192-undine thought [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford " bright , "[192-undine] and wanted to be liked by [her]204-mrs. fairford ; and [she]192-undine was in the state of dizzy self - assurance when it seemed easy to win any sympathy [she]192-undine chose to seek . For [the only other guests]1103-the only other guests -- [[Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford 's husband]1104-mrs. fairford 's husband , and [the elderly Charles Bowen who seemed to be [[her]192-undine special friend]1106-her special friend]1105-the elderly charles bowen who seemed to be her special friend -- [Undine]192-undine had no attention to spare : [they]1103-the only other guests remained on [a plane]3885-a plane with the dim pictures hanging at [her]192-undine back . [She]192-undine had expected a larger party ; but [she]192-undine was relieved , on the whole , that it was small enough to permit of [her]192-undine dominating it . Not that [she]192-undine wished to do so by any loudness of assertion . [Her]192-undine quickness in noting external differences had already taught [her]192-undine to modulate and lower [her]192-undine voice , and to replace " The I - dea ! "[192-undine] and " [I]192-undine would n't wonder "[192-undine] by more polished locutions ; and [she]192-undine had not been ten minutes at table before [she]192-undine found that to seem very much in love , and a little confused and subdued by the newness and intensity of the sentiment , was , to [the Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet mind , the becoming attitude for [a young lady in [her]1108-a young lady in her situation situation]1108-a young lady in her situation . The part was not hard to play , for [she]192-undine WAS in love , of course . It was pleasant , when [she]192-undine looked across the table , to meet [Ralph]199-ralph 's grey eyes , with that new look in them , and to feel that [she]192-undine had kindled it ; but [I]0-i it was only part of [her]192-undine larger pleasure in the general homage to [her]192-undine beauty , in the sensations of interest and curiosity excited by everything about [her]192-undine , from the family portraits overhead to the old Dagonet silver on the table -- which were to be [hers]192-undine too , after all ! The talk , as at [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford 's , confused [her]192-undine by its lack of the personal allusion , its tendency to turn to books , pictures and politics . " Politics , "[192-undine] to [Undine]192-undine , had always been like a kind of back - kitchen to business -- the place where the refuse was thrown and the doubtful messes were brewed . As a drawing - room topic , and one to provoke disinterested sentiments , it had the hollowness of Fourth of July orations , and [her]192-undine mind wandered in spite of the desire to appear informed and competent . [Old Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet , with [his]256-mr. dagonet reedy staccato voice , that gave polish and relief to every syllable , tried to come to [her]192-undine aid by questioning [her]192-undine affably about [[her]192-undine family]1109-her family and [the friends [she]192-undine had made in [New York]8-new york]1110-the friends she had made in new york . "[192-undine] " [I]192-undine want what [the others]652-the others want , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine answered , frowning and pouting a little . [She]192-undine was already beginning to resent in [Ralph]199-ralph the slightest sign of resistance to [her]192-undine pleasure ; and [her]192-undine resentment took the form -- a familiar one in Apex courtships -- of turning on [him]1167-he , in the next entr'acte , a deliberately averted shoulder . The result of this was to bring [her]192-undine , for the first time , in more direct relation to [[her]192-undine other neighbour]1168-her other neighbour . As [she]192-undine turned [he]1167-he turned too , showing [her]192-undine , above a shining shirt - front fastened with a large imitation pearl , a ruddy plump snub face without an angle in it , which yet looked sharper than a razor . [Undine]192-undine 's eyes met [his]1167-he with a startled look , and for a long moment [they]1169-they remained suspended on [each other]3877-each other 's stare . [Undine]192-undine at length shrank back with an unrecognizing face ; but [her]192-undine movement made [her]192-undine opera - glass slip to the floor , and [[her]192-undine neighbour]1164-her neighbour bent down and picked it up . " Well -- don't [you]192-undine know [me]1167-he yet ? "[1167-he] [he]1167-he said with a slight smile , as [he]1167-he restored the glass to [her]192-undine . [She]192-undine had grown white to the lips , and when [she]192-undine tried to speak the effort produced only a faint click in [her]192-undine throat . [She]192-undine felt that the change in [her]192-undine appearance must be visible , and the dread of letting [Marvell]199-ralph see it made [her]192-undine continue to turn [her]192-undine ravaged face to [[her]192-undine other neighbour]1168-her other neighbour . The round black eyes set prominently in the latter 's round glossy countenance had expressed at first only an impersonal and slightly ironic interest ; but a look of surprise grew in [them]1173-them as [Undine]192-undine 's silence continued . " What 's the matter ? Do n't [you]1168-her other neighbour want [me]192-undine to speak to [you]1168-her other neighbour ? "[192-undine] [She]192-undine became aware that [Marvell]199-ralph , as if unconscious of [her]192-undine slight show of displeasure , had left [his]1167-he seat , and was making [his]1167-he way toward the aisle ; and this assertion of independence , which a moment before [she]192-undine would so deeply have resented , now gave [her]192-undine a feeling of intense relief . "[192-undine] [She]192-undine moved toward the toilet - table , and began to demolish with feverish hands the structure which [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny , a few hours earlier , had so lovingly raised . "[192-undine] [IX Undine]271-undine , late the next day , waited alone under the leafless trellising of a wistaria arbour on [the west side of [the Central Park]478-the central park]1198-the west side of the central park . [She]192-undine had put on [her]192-undine plainest dress , and wound a closely , patterned veil over [her]192-undine least vivid hat ; but even thus toned down to the situation [she]192-undine was conscious of blazing out from it inconveniently . The habit of meeting [young men]1200-young men in sequestered spots was not unknown to [her]192-undine : the novelty was in feeling any embarrassment about it . Even now [she]192-undine -- was disturbed not so much by the unlikely chance of an accidental encounter with [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph as by the remembrance of similar meetings , far from accidental , with [the romantic Aaronson]222-aaronson . Could it be that the hand now adorned with [Ralph]199-ralph 's engagement ring had once , in this very spot , surrendered itself to [the riding - master]587-the riding - master 's pressure ? At the thought a wave of physical disgust passed over [her]192-undine , blotting out another memory as distasteful but more remote . It was revived by the appearance of [a ruddy middle - sized young man]1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man , [his]1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man stoutish figure tightly buttoned into a square - shouldered over - coat , who presently approached along [the path that led to [the arbour]58-the arbour]1203-the path that led to the arbour . Silhouetted against the slope of [the asphalt]1204-the asphalt , [the newcomer]827-the newcomer revealed [an outline thick yet compact , with a round head set on a neck in which , at the first chance , prosperity would be likely to develop a red crease]1206-an outline thick yet compact , with a round head set on a neck in which , at the first chance , prosperity would be likely to develop a red crease . [His]1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man face , with its rounded surfaces , and the sanguine innocence of a complexion belied by prematurely astute black eyes , had a look of jovial cunning which [Undine]271-undine had formerly thought " smart "[271-undine] but which now struck [her]271-undine as merely vulgar . [She]271-undine felt that in the Marvell set [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt would have been stamped as " not [a gentleman]3829-a gentleman . "[212-moffatt] Nevertheless something in [his]1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man look seemed to promise the capacity to develop into any character [he]1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man might care to assume ; though it did not seem probable that , for the present , that of [a gentleman]3829-a gentleman would be among [them]1208-them . [He]1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man had always had a brisk swaggering step , and the faintly impudent tilt of the head that [she]271-undine had once thought " dashing "[1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man] ; but whereas this look had formerly denoted a somewhat desperate defiance of [the world]620-the world and its judgments it now suggested an almost assured relation to these powers ; and [Undine]271-undine 's heart sank at the thought of what the change implied . As [he]1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man drew nearer , [the young man]669-the young man 's air of assurance was replaced by an expression of mildly humorous surprise . " Well -- this is white of [you]271-undine . [Undine]271-undine ! "[1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man] [he]1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man said , taking [her]271-undine lifeless fingers into [his]1202-a ruddy middle - sized young man dapperly gloved hand . " That 's so too . Suppose [we]1212-we walk along a little ways ? It 's rather chilly standing round . [X Mr.]279-x mr. and [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg were both given to such long periods of ruminating apathy that [the student of inheritance]1235-the student of inheritance might have wondered whence [Undine]192-undine derived [her]192-undine overflowing activity . The answer would have been obtained by observing [[her]192-undine father]614-her father 's business life . From the moment [he]1232-his set foot in [Wall Street]47-wall street [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg became [another man]1237-another man . Physically the change revealed itself only by the subtlest signs . As [he]1232-his steered [his]1232-his way to [[his]1232-his office]737-his office through the jostling crowd of [William Street]280-william street [his]1232-his relaxed muscles did not grow more taut or [his]1232-his lounging gait less desultory . [His]1232-his shoulders were hollowed by the usual droop , and [his]1232-his rusty black waistcoat showed the same creased concavity at the waist , the same flabby prominence below . It was only in [his]1232-his face that the difference was perceptible , though even here it rather lurked behind the features than openly modified them : showing itself now and then in the cautious glint of half - closed eyes , the forward thrust of black brows , or a tightening of the lax lines of the mouth -- as the gleam of [a night - watchman]1239-a night - watchman 's light might flash across the darkness of [a shuttered house]1240-a shuttered house - front . The shutters were more tightly barred than usual , when , on a morning some two weeks later than the date of the incidents last recorded , [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg approached [the steel and concrete tower in which [[his]1232-his office]737-his office occupied [a lofty pigeon - hole]1243-a lofty pigeon - hole]1241-the steel and concrete tower in which his office occupied a lofty pigeon - hole . Events had moved rapidly and somewhat surprisingly in the interval , and [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had already accustomed [himself]191-mr. spragg to the fact that [[his]1232-his daughter]500-his daughter was to be married within the week , instead of awaiting the traditional post - Lenten date . Conventionally the change meant little to [him]191-mr. spragg ; but on the practical side it presented unforeseen difficulties . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had learned within the last weeks that a [New York]8-new york marriage involved material obligations unknown to [Apex]192-undine . [Marvell]199-ralph , indeed , had been loftily careless of such questions ; but [[his]1232-his grandfather]949-his grandfather , on the announcement of the engagement , had called on [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg and put before [him]191-mr. spragg , with polished precision , [the young man]669-the young man 's financial situation . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg , at the moment , had been inclined to deal with [[his]191-mr. spragg visitor]1247-his visitor in a spirit of indulgent irony . The results of this friendly conference had been more serious than [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg could have foreseen -- and the victory remained with [[his]191-mr. spragg antagonist]1252-his antagonist . It had not entered into [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's calculations that [he]191-mr. spragg would have to give [[his]191-mr. spragg daughter]500-his daughter any fixed income on [her]500-his daughter marriage . [He]191-mr. spragg meant that [she]500-his daughter should have the " handsomest "[191-mr. spragg] wedding the [New York]8-new york press had ever celebrated , and [[her]500-his daughter mother]426-her mother 's fancy was already afloat on a sea of luxuries -- a motor , [a Fifth Avenue house]1255-a fifth avenue house , and a tiara that should out - blaze [Mrs. Van Degen]231-van degen 's ; but these were movable benefits , to be conferred whenever [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg happened to be " on the right side "[500-his daughter] of the market . Such scissions were almost painless in [Apex]192-undine , and [he]191-mr. spragg had fancied it would be easy , by an appeal to [the girl]449-the girl 's pride , to make [her]500-his daughter see that [she]500-his daughter owed it to [herself]500-his daughter to do better . " [You]500-his daughter 'd better wait awhile and look round again , "[191-mr. spragg] was the way [he]191-mr. spragg had put it to [her]500-his daughter at the opening of the talk of which , even now , [he]191-mr. spragg could not recall the close without a tremor . [Undine]192-undine , when [she]192-undine took [his]191-mr. spragg meaning , had been terrible . Did n't [he]191-mr. spragg see it was all a question , now and here , of the kind of people [she]192-undine wanted to " go with "[191-mr. spragg] ? Did [he]191-mr. spragg want to throw [her]192-undine straight back into [the Lipscomb set]1262-the lipscomb set , to have [her]192-undine marry [a dentist]838-a dentist and live in [a West Side flat]1264-a west side flat ? [She]192-undine might as well have married [Millard Binch]272-millard binch , instead of handing [him]191-mr. spragg over to [Indiana Frusk]216-indiana frusk ! [They]613-the right people had better go back to [Apex]192-undine right off -- it was [they]613-the right people and not [SHE]192-undine who had wanted to leave [Apex]192-undine , anyhow -- [she]192-undine could call [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother to witness it . [She]192-undine had always , when it came to that , done what [[her]192-undine father]614-her father and [mother]3774-mother wanted , but [she]192-undine 'd given up trying to make out what [they]613-the right people were after , unless it was to make [her]192-undine miserable ; and if that was it , had n't [they]613-the right people had enough of it by this time ? [She]192-undine had , anyhow . XI The July sun enclosed in a ring of fire the ilex grove of [a villa in [the hills near [Siena]66-siena]1334-the hills near siena]1333-a villa in the hills near siena . Below , by [the roadside]1335-the roadside , [the long yellow house]1336-the long yellow house seemed to waver and palpitate in the glare ; but steep by steep , behind [it]1336-the long yellow house , the cool ilex - dusk mounted to the ledge where [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph , stretched on [his]212-moffatt back in the grass , lay gazing up at a black reticulation of branches between which bits of sky gleamed with the hardness and brilliancy of blue enamel . Up there too the air was thick with heat ; but compared with the white fire below it was a dim and tempered warmth , like that of [the churches in which [he]212-moffatt and [Undine]192-undine]1337-the churches in which he and undine sometimes took refuge at the height of the torrid days . [Ralph]199-ralph loved the heavy Italian summer , as [he]212-moffatt had loved the light spring days leading up to it : the long line of dancing days that had drawn [them]1250-the two men on and on ever since [they]1250-the two men had left [[their]1250-the two men ship]1338-their ship at [Naples]67-naples four months earlier . Four months of beauty , changeful , inexhaustible , weaving itself about [him]212-moffatt in shapes of softness and strength ; and beside [him]212-moffatt , hand in hand with [him]212-moffatt , embodying that spirit of shifting magic , the radiant creature through whose eyes [he]212-moffatt saw it . This was what [their]1250-the two men hastened marriage had blessed [them]1250-the two men with , giving [them]1250-the two men leisure , before summer came , to penetrate to [remote folds of [the southern mountains]1340-the southern mountains]1339-remote folds of the southern mountains , to linger in the shade of [Sicilian orange - groves]1341-sicilian orange - groves , and finally , travelling by slow stages to [the Adriatic]68-the adriatic , to reach [the central hill - country where even in July [they]1250-the two men might hope for a breathable air]1342-the central hill - country where even in july they might hope for a breathable air . To [Ralph]199-ralph the Sienese air was not only breathable but intoxicating . The sun , treading [the earth]1343-the earth like [a vintager]1344-a vintager , drew from it heady fragrances , crushed out of it new colours . All the values of [the temperate landscape]1345-the temperate landscape were reversed : the noon high - lights were whiter but the shadows had unimagined colour . On the blackness of cork and ilex and cypress lay the green and purple lustres , the coppery iridescences , of old bronze ; and night after night the skies were wine - blue and bubbling with stars . [Ralph]199-ralph said to [himself]199-ralph that [no one who had not seen [Italy]72-italy thus prostrate beneath the sun]1346-no one who had not seen italy thus prostrate beneath the sun knew what secret treasures [she]72-italy could yield . As [he]212-moffatt lay there , fragments of past states of emotion , fugitive felicities of thought and sensation , rose and floated on the surface of [his]212-moffatt thoughts . It was one of those moments when the accumulated impressions of life converge on heart and brain , elucidating , enlacing each other , in a mysterious confusion of beauty . [He]212-moffatt had had glimpses of such a state before , of such mergings of the personal with the general life that [one]629-one felt [one]629-one 's self a mere wave on the wild stream of being , yet thrilled with a sharper sense of individuality than can be known within the mere bounds of the actual . But now [he]212-moffatt knew the sensation in its fulness , and with it came the releasing power of language . Words were flashing like brilliant birds through the boughs overhead ; [he]212-moffatt had but to wave [his]212-moffatt magic wand to have them flutter down to [him]212-moffatt . Only [they]1250-the two men were so beautiful up there , weaving [their]1250-the two men fantastic flights against the blue , that it was pleasanter , for the moment , to watch [them]1250-the two men and let the wand lie . [He]212-moffatt stared up at the pattern [they]1250-the two men made till [his]212-moffatt eyes ached with excess of light ; then [he]212-moffatt changed [his]212-moffatt position and looked at [[his]212-moffatt wife]512-his wife . [Undine]192-undine , near by , leaned against a gnarled tree with the slightly constrained air of [a person unused to sylvan abandonments]1350-a person unused to sylvan abandonments . [Her]192-undine beautiful back could not adapt itself to the irregularities of the tree - trunk , and [she]192-undine moved a little now and then in the effort to find an easier position . But [her]192-undine expression was serene , and [Ralph]199-ralph , looking up at [her]192-undine through drowsy lids , thought [her]192-undine face had never been more exquisite . " [You]192-undine look as cool as a wave , "[212-moffatt] [he]212-moffatt said , reaching out for the hand on [her]192-undine knee . [She]192-undine let [him]212-moffatt have it , and [he]212-moffatt drew it closer , scrutinizing it as if it had been a bit of precious porcelain or ivory . It was small and soft , a mere featherweight , a puff - ball of a hand -- not quick and thrilling , not a speaking hand , but one to be fondled and dressed in rings , and to leave a rosy blur in the brain . The fingers were short and tapering , dimpled at the base , with nails as smooth as rose - leaves . [Ralph]199-ralph lifted them one by one , like [a child playing with piano - keys]1351-a child playing with piano - keys , but they were inelastic and did not spring back far -- only far enough to show the dimples . [He]212-moffatt turned the hand over and traced the course of its blue veins from the wrist to the rounding of the palm below the fingers ; then [he]212-moffatt put a kiss in the warm hollow between . [The upper world]1352-the upper world had vanished : [his]212-moffatt universe had shrunk to the palm of a hand . But there was no sense of diminution . In the mystic depths whence [his]212-moffatt passion sprang , earthly dimensions were ignored and the curve of beauty was boundless enough to hold whatever the imagination could pour into it . [Ralph]199-ralph had never felt more convinced of [his]212-moffatt power to write a great poem ; but now it was [Undine]192-undine 's hand which held the magic wand of expression . [She]192-undine stirred again uneasily , answering [his]212-moffatt last words with a faint accent of reproach . " [I]192-undine do n't FEEL cool . [You]212-moffatt said there 'd be a breeze up here . "[192-undine] . [He]212-moffatt laughed . " [[You]192-undine poor darling]4105-you poor darling ! " [I]212-moffatt wonder what [you]192-undine DID marry [me]212-moffatt for ? "[212-moffatt] " Mercy ! It 's too hot for conundrums . [He]1354-his remembered afterward that at that moment the cup of life seemed to brim over . " Come , [dear]3838-dear -- here or there -- it 's all divine ! "[191-mr. spragg] [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's astonishment on learning that [[his]191-mr. spragg son - in - law]1364-his son - in - law contemplated maintaining a household on the earnings of [[his]191-mr. spragg Muse]1365-his muse was still matter for pleasantry between [the pair]1366-the pair ; and one of the humours of [their]1366-the pair first weeks together had consisted in picturing [themselves]1366-the pair as [a primeval couple setting forth across [a virgin continent]1368-a virgin continent]1367-a primeval couple setting forth across a virgin continent and subsisting on the adjectives which [Ralph]199-ralph was to trap for [his]191-mr. spragg epic . On this occasion , however , [[his]191-mr. spragg wife]512-his wife did not take up the joke , and [he]191-mr. spragg remained silent while [[their]1366-the pair carriage]1370-their carriage climbed [the long dusty hill to the Fontebranda gate]1371-the long dusty hill to the fontebranda gate . [He]191-mr. spragg had seen [her]512-his wife face droop as [he]191-mr. spragg suggested the possibility of an escape from the crowds in [Switzerland]69-switzerland , and it came to [him]191-mr. spragg , with the sharpness of a knife - thrust , that [a crowd]1372-a crowd was what [she]512-his wife wanted -- that [she]512-his wife was sick to death of being alone with [him]191-mr. spragg . [He]191-mr. spragg sat motionless , staring ahead at the red - brown walls and towers on [the steep above [them]1366-the pair]1373-the steep above them . After all there was nothing sudden in [his]191-mr. spragg discovery . For weeks it had hung on the edge of consciousness , but [he]191-mr. spragg had turned from it with the heart 's instinctive clinging to the unrealities by which it lives . Even now a hundred qualifying reasons rushed to [his]191-mr. spragg aid . [They]1374-they told [him]191-mr. spragg it was not of [himself]191-mr. spragg that [Undine]192-undine had wearied , but only of [their]1366-the pair present way of life . [He]191-mr. spragg had said a moment before , without conscious exaggeration , that [her]512-his wife presence made any place [the one place]4122-the one place ; yet how willingly would [he]191-mr. spragg have consented to share in such a life as [she]512-his wife was leading before [their]1366-the pair marriage ? And [he]191-mr. spragg had to acknowledge [their]1366-the pair months of desultory wandering from [one remote Italian hill - top]1376-one remote italian hill - top to another must have seemed as purposeless to [her]512-his wife as balls and dinners would have been to [him]191-mr. spragg . An imagination like [his]191-mr. spragg , peopled with such varied images and associations , fed by so many currents from the long stream of human experience , could hardly picture the bareness of the small half - lit place in which [[his]191-mr. spragg wife]512-his wife 's spirit fluttered . [Her]512-his wife mind was as destitute of beauty and mystery as [the prairie school - house in which [she]512-his wife had been educated]1378-the prairie school - house in which she had been educated ; and [her]512-his wife ideals seemed to Ralph as pathetic as the ornaments made of corks and cigar - bands with which [her]512-his wife infant hands had been taught to adorn it . [He]191-mr. spragg was beginning to understand this , and learning to adapt [himself]191-mr. spragg to the narrow compass of [her]512-his wife experience . The task of opening new windows in [her]512-his wife mind was inspiring enough to give [him]191-mr. spragg infinite patience ; and [he]191-mr. spragg would not yet own to [himself]191-mr. spragg that [her]512-his wife pliancy and variety were imitative rather than spontaneous . Meanwhile [he]191-mr. spragg had no desire to sacrifice [her]512-his wife wishes to [his]191-mr. spragg , and it distressed [him]191-mr. spragg that [he]191-mr. spragg dared not confess [his]191-mr. spragg real reason for avoiding [the Engadine]288-the engadine . The truth was that [their]1379-their funds were shrinking faster than [he]191-mr. spragg had expected . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg , after bluntly opposing [their]1379-their hastened marriage on the ground that [he]191-mr. spragg was not prepared , at such short notice , to make the necessary provision for [[his]191-mr. spragg daughter]500-his daughter , had shortly afterward ( probably , as [Undine]192-undine observed to [Ralph]199-ralph , in consequence of a lucky " turn "[191-mr. spragg] in [the Street]705-the street ) met [their]1379-their wishes with all possible liberality , bestowing on [them]1379-their a wedding in conformity with [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's ideals and up to the highest standard of [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's clippings , and pledging [himself]191-mr. spragg to provide [Undine]192-undine with an income adequate to so brilliant a beginning . It was understood that [Ralph]199-ralph , on [their]1379-their return , should renounce the law for some more paying business ; but this seemed the smallest of sacrifices to make for the privilege of calling [Undine]192-undine [[his]191-mr. spragg wife]512-his wife ; and besides , [he]191-mr. spragg still secretly hoped that , in the interval , [his]191-mr. spragg real vocation might declare itself in some work which would justify [his]191-mr. spragg adopting the life of letters . [He]191-mr. spragg had assumed that [Undine]192-undine 's allowance , with the addition of [his]191-mr. spragg own small income , would be enough to satisfy [their]1379-their needs . [His]191-mr. spragg own were few , and had always been within [his]191-mr. spragg means ; but [[his]191-mr. spragg wife]512-his wife 's daily requirements , combined with [her]512-his wife intermittent outbreaks of extravagance , had thrown out all [his]191-mr. spragg calculations , and [they]1379-their were already seriously exceeding [their]1379-their income . If [any one]659-any one had prophesied before [his]191-mr. spragg marriage that [he]191-mr. spragg would find it difficult to tell this to [Undine]192-undine [he]191-mr. spragg would have smiled at the suggestion ; and during [their]1379-their first days together it had seemed as though pecuniary questions were the last likely to be raised between [them]1379-their . But [his]191-mr. spragg marital education had since made strides , and [he]191-mr. spragg now knew that a disregard for money may imply not the willingness to get on without it but merely a blind confidence that it will somehow be provided . If [Undine]192-undine , like [the lilies of the field]1385-the lilies of the field , took no care , it was not because [her]192-undine wants were as few but because [she]192-undine assumed that care would be taken for [her]192-undine by those whose privilege it was to enable [her]192-undine to unite floral insouciance with [Sheban]1386-sheban elegance . [She]192-undine had met [Ralph]199-ralph 's first note of warning with the assurance that [she]192-undine " did n't mean to worry "[192-undine] ; and [her]192-undine tone implied that it was [his]191-mr. spragg business to do so for [her]192-undine . [He]191-mr. spragg certainly wanted to guard [her]192-undine from this as from all other cares ; [he]191-mr. spragg wanted also , and still more passionately after the topic had once or twice recurred between [them]1379-their , to guard [himself]191-mr. spragg from the risk of judging where [he]191-mr. spragg still adored . These restraints to frankness kept [him]191-mr. spragg silent during the remainder of the drive , and when , after dinner , [Undine]192-undine again complained of [her]192-undine headache , [he]191-mr. spragg let [her]192-undine go up to [[her]192-undine room]461-her room and wandered out into [the dimly lit streets]1388-the dimly lit streets to renewed communion with [his]191-mr. spragg problems . [They]1389-they hung on [him]191-mr. spragg insistently as darkness fell , and [Siena]66-siena grew vocal with that shrill diversity of sounds that breaks , on summer nights , from every cleft of the masonry in [old Italian towns]1390-old italian towns . Then the moon rose , unfolding depth by depth the lines of [the antique land]1391-the antique land ; and [Ralph]199-ralph , leaning against [an old brick parapet]1392-an old brick parapet , and watching each silver - blue remoteness disclose itself between the dark masses of the middle distance , felt [his]191-mr. spragg spirit enlarged and pacified . For the first time , as [his]191-mr. spragg senses thrilled to the deep touch of beauty , [he]191-mr. spragg asked [himself]191-mr. spragg if out of these floating and fugitive vibrations [he]191-mr. spragg might not build something concrete and stable , if even such dull common cares as now oppressed [him]191-mr. spragg might not become the motive power of creation . If [he]191-mr. spragg could only , on the spot , do something with all the accumulated spoils of the last months -- something that should both put money into [his]191-mr. spragg pocket and harmony into the rich confusion of [his]191-mr. spragg spirit ! " [I]191-mr. spragg 'll write -- [I'll]191-mr. spragg write : that must be what the whole thing means , "[191-mr. spragg] [he]191-mr. spragg said to [himself]191-mr. spragg , with a vague clutch at some solution which should keep [him]191-mr. spragg a little longer hanging half - way down the steep of disenchantment . [He]191-mr. spragg would have stayed on , heedless of time , to trace the ramifications of [his]191-mr. spragg idea in the complex beauty of the scene , but for the longing to share [his]191-mr. spragg mood with [Undine]192-undine . For the last few months every thought and sensation had been instantly transmuted into such emotional impulses and , though the currents of communication between [himself]191-mr. spragg and [Undine]192-undine were neither deep nor numerous , each fresh rush of feeling seemed strong enough to clear a way to [her]192-undine heart . [He]191-mr. spragg hurried back , almost breathlessly , to [the inn]1393-the inn ; but even as [he]191-mr. spragg knocked at [her]192-undine door the subtle emanation of other influences seemed to arrest and chill [him]191-mr. spragg . [She]192-undine had put out the lamp , and sat by the window in the moonlight , [her]192-undine head propped on a listless hand . As [Marvell]199-ralph entered [she]192-undine turned ; then , without speaking , [she]192-undine looked away again . [He]191-mr. spragg was used to this mute reception , and had learned that it had no personal motive , but was the result of an extremely simplified social code . [Mr.]1394-mr. and [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg seldom spoke to [each other]3877-each other when [they]1396-they met , and words of greeting seemed almost unknown to [their]1396-they domestic vocabulary . [Marvell]199-ralph , at first , had fancied that [his]191-mr. spragg own warmth would call forth a response from [[his]191-mr. spragg wife]512-his wife , who had been so quick to learn the forms of worldly intercourse ; but [he]191-mr. spragg soon saw that [she]192-undine regarded intimacy as a pretext for escaping from such forms into a total absence of expression . To - night , however , [he]191-mr. spragg felt another meaning in [her]192-undine silence , and perceived that [she]192-undine intended [him]191-mr. spragg to feel it . [He]191-mr. spragg met it by silence , but of a different kind ; letting [his]191-mr. spragg nearness speak for [him]191-mr. spragg as [he]191-mr. spragg knelt beside [her]192-undine and laid [his]191-mr. spragg cheek against [hers]192-undine . [She]192-undine seemed hardly aware of the gesture ; but to that [he]191-mr. spragg was also used . [She]192-undine had never shown any repugnance to [his]191-mr. spragg tenderness , but such response as it evoked was remote and [Ariel]291-ariel - like , suggesting , from the first , not so much of the recoil of ignorance as the coolness of the element from which [she]192-undine took [her]192-undine name . As [he]191-mr. spragg pressed [her]192-undine to [him]191-mr. spragg [she]192-undine seemed to grow less impassive and [he]191-mr. spragg felt [her]192-undine resign [herself]192-undine like [a tired child]1398-a tired child . [He]191-mr. spragg held [his]191-mr. spragg breath , not daring to break the spell . XII In [the quiet place with the green water - fall]1401-the quiet place with the green water - fall [Ralph]199-ralph 's vision might have kept faith with [him]1403-his ; but how could [he]1403-his hope to surprise it in [the midsummer crowds of [St. Moritz]73-st. moritz]1405-the midsummer crowds of st. moritz ? [Undine]192-undine , at any rate , had found there what [she]1402-her wanted ; and when [he]1403-his was at [her]1402-her side , and [her]1402-her radiant smile included [him]1403-his , every other question was in abeyance . But there were hours of solitary striding over [bare grassy slopes]1406-bare grassy slopes , face to face with the ironic interrogation of sky and [mountains]1407-mountains , when [his]1403-his anxieties came back , more persistent and importunate . Sometimes they took the form of merely material difficulties . How , for instance , was [he]1403-his to meet the cost of [[their]1408-their ruinous suite]1409-their ruinous suite at [the Engadine Palace]1410-the engadine palace while [he]1403-his awaited [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's next remittance ? And once the hotel bills were paid , what would be left for the journey back to [Paris]76-paris , the looming expenses there , the price of the passage to [America]77-america ? These questions would fling [him]1403-his back on the thought of [his]1403-his projected book , which was , after all , to be what the masterpieces of literature had mostly been -- a pot - boiler . Well ! Why not ? Did not [the worshipper]1411-the worshipper always heap the rarest essences on the altar of [his]1411-the worshipper divinity ? [Ralph]199-ralph still rejoiced in the thought of giving back to [Undine]192-undine something of the beauty of [their]1408-their first months together . But even on [his]1403-his solitary walks the vision eluded [him]1403-his ; and [he]1403-his could spare so few hours to its pursuit ! [Undine]192-undine 's days were crowded , and it was still a matter of course that where [she]192-undine went [he]1403-his should follow . [He]1403-his had risen visibly in [her]192-undine opinion since [they]1408-their had been absorbed into the life of [the big hotels]1412-the big hotels , and [she]192-undine had seen that [his]1403-his command of foreign tongues put [him]1403-his at an advantage even in circles where English was generally spoken if not understood . [Undine]192-undine [herself]192-undine , hampered by [her]192-undine lack of languages , was soon drawn into [the group of compatriots who struck the social pitch of [[their]1408-their hotel]1414-their hotel]1413-the group of compatriots who struck the social pitch of their hotel .
