Foremost among [them]1413-the group of compatriots who struck the social pitch of their hotel was [Mrs. Harvey Shallum]293-mrs. shallum , [a showy Parisianized figure , with a small wax - featured husband whose ultra - fashionable clothes seemed a tribute to [[his]1403-his wife]512-his wife 's importance rather than the mark of [his]1403-his personal taste]1415-a showy parisianized figure , with a small wax - featured husband whose ultra - fashionable clothes seemed a tribute to his wife 's importance rather than the mark of his personal taste . [Mr. Shallum]294-mr. shallum , in fact , could not be said to have any personal bent . Though [he]294-mr. shallum conversed with a colourless fluency in the principal European tongues , [he]294-mr. shallum seldom exercised [his]294-mr. shallum gift except in intercourse with [hotel - managers]1417-hotel - managers and [head - waiters]1418-head - waiters ; and [his]294-mr. shallum long silences were broken only by resigned allusions to the enormities [he]294-mr. shallum had suffered at the hands of [this gifted but unscrupulous class]1419-this gifted but unscrupulous class . [Mrs. Shallum]293-mrs. shallum , though in command of but a few verbs , all of which , on [her]293-mrs. shallum lips , became irregular , managed to express a polyglot personality as vivid as [[her]293-mrs. shallum husband]488-her husband 's was effaced . [Her]293-mrs. shallum only idea of intercourse with [[her]293-mrs. shallum kind]1421-her kind was to organize it into bands and subject it to frequent displacements ; and society smiled at [her]293-mrs. shallum for these exertions like [an infant vigorously rocked]1422-an infant vigorously rocked . [She]293-mrs. shallum saw at once [Undine]192-undine 's value as a factor in [her]293-mrs. shallum scheme , and [the two]899-the two formed an alliance on which [Ralph]199-ralph refrained from shedding the cold light of depreciation . It was a point of honour with [him]488-her husband not to seem to disdain any of [Undine]192-undine 's amusements : the noisy interminable picnics , the hot promiscuous balls , the concerts , bridge - parties and theatricals which helped to disguise the difference between [the high Alps]78-the high alps and [Paris]76-paris or [New York]8-new york . [He]488-her husband told [himself]488-her husband that there is always a Narcissus - element in youth , and that what [Undine]192-undine really enjoyed was the image of [her]192-undine own charm mirrored in the general admiration . With [her]192-undine quick perceptions and adaptabilities [she]192-undine would soon learn to care more about the quality of the reflecting surface ; and meanwhile no criticism of [his]488-her husband should mar [her]192-undine pleasure . " [I]1465-his do n't know -- [I'll]1465-his see , "[1465-his] [he]1465-his said , rising and moving away from [her]192-undine . At that moment the touch of [her]192-undine hand was repugnant . But the necessity was bitter to [him]1465-his , and [Undine]192-undine 's unconsciousness of the fact hurt [him]1465-his more than [her]192-undine indifference to [[her]192-undine father]614-her father 's misfortune . What hurt [him]1465-his most was the curious fact that , for all [her]192-undine light irresponsibility , it was always [she]192-undine who made the practical suggestion , hit the nail of expediency on the head . No sentimental scruple made the blow waver or deflected [her]192-undine resolute aim . [She]192-undine had thought at once of [Laura]203-laura , and [Laura]203-laura was [his]1465-his only , [his]1465-his inevitable , resource . [His]1465-his anxious mind pictured [[his]1465-his sister]3743-his sister 's wonder , and made [him]1465-his wince under the sting of [Henley Fairford]204-mrs. fairford 's irony : [Fairford]203-laura , who at the time of the marriage had sat silent and pulled [his]1465-his moustache while [every one else]1469-every one else argued and objected , yet under whose silence [Ralph]199-ralph had felt a deeper protest than under all the reasoning of [the others]652-the others . It was no comfort to reflect that [Fairford]203-laura would probably continue to say nothing ! But necessity made light of these twinges , and [Ralph]199-ralph set [his]1465-his teeth and cabled . [Undine]192-undine 's chief surprise seemed to be that [Laura]203-laura 's response , though immediate and generous , did not enable [them]1471-them to stay on at [St. Moritz]73-st. moritz . But [she]192-undine apparently read in [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's look the uselessness of such a hope , for , with one of the sudden changes of mood that still disarmed [him]488-her husband , [she]192-undine accepted the need of departure , and took leave philosophically of [the Shallums]298-the shallums and [[their]298-the shallums band]1473-their band . After all , [Paris]76-paris was ahead , and in September one would have a chance to see [the new models]1474-the new models and surprise [the secret councils of [the dressmakers]1476-the dressmakers]1475-the secret councils of the dressmakers . [Ralph]199-ralph was astonished at the tenacity with which [she]192-undine held to [her]192-undine purpose . [He]1465-his tried , when [they]1471-them reached [Paris]76-paris , to make [her]192-undine feel the necessity of starting at once for [home]548-home ; but [she]192-undine complained of fatigue and of feeling vaguely unwell , and [he]1465-his had to yield to [her]192-undine desire for rest . The word , however , was to strike [him]1465-his as strangely misapplied , for from the day of [their]1471-them arrival [she]192-undine was in state of perpetual activity . [She]192-undine seemed to have mastered [her]192-undine [Paris]76-paris by divination , and between the hounds of [the Boulevards]1478-the boulevards and [the Place Vendome]1479-the place vendome [she]192-undine moved at once with supernatural ease . " Of course , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine explained to [him]1465-his , " [I]192-undine understand how little [we]1471-them 've got to spend ; but [I]192-undine left [New York]8-new york without a rag , and it was [you]1465-his who made [me]192-undine countermand [my]192-undine trousseau , instead of having it sent after [us]1471-them . "[192-undine] So it went on , obtusely and persistently , whenever [he]1480-he tried to sound the note of prudence . But on other themes [she]1480-he was more than usually responsive . [Paris]76-paris enchanted [her]1480-he , and [they]1481-they had delightful hours at [the theatres]1482-the theatres -- [the " little "[1483-the " little " ones] ones]1483-the " little " ones -- amusing dinners at [fashionable restaurants]1484-fashionable restaurants , and reckless evenings in haunts where [she]1480-he thrilled with simple glee at the thought of what [she]1480-he must so obviously be " taken for . "[1480-he] All these familiar diversions regained , for [Ralph]199-ralph , a fresh zest in [her]1480-he company . [Her]1480-he innocence , [her]1480-he high spirits , [her]1480-he astounding comments and credulities , renovated the old Parisian adventure and flung a veil of romance over its hackneyed scenes . Beheld through such a medium the future looked less near and implacable , and [Ralph]199-ralph , when [he]1480-he had received a reassuring letter from [[his]1480-he sister]3743-his sister , let [his]1480-he conscience sleep and slipped forth on the high tide of pleasure . After all , in [New York]8-new york amusements would be fewer , and [their]1481-they life , for a time , perhaps more quiet . Moreover , [Ralph]199-ralph 's dim glimpses of [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's past suggested that [the latter]573-the latter was likely to be on [his]573-the latter feet again at any moment , and atoning by redoubled prodigalities for [his]573-the latter temporary straits ; and beyond all these possibilities there was the book to be written -- the book on which [Ralph]199-ralph was sure [he]1480-he should get a real hold as soon as [they]1487-they settled down in [New York]8-new york . Meanwhile the daily cost of living , and the bills that could not be deferred , were eating deep into [Laura]203-laura 's subsidy . [Ralph]199-ralph 's anxieties returned , and [his]1480-he plight was brought [home]548-home to [him]1480-he with a shock when , on going one day to engage passages , [he]1480-he learned that the prices were that of the " rush season , "[203-laura] and one of the conditions immediate payment . At other times , [he]1480-he was told the rules were easier ; but in September and October no exception could be made . As [he]1480-he walked away with this fresh weight on [his]1480-he mind [he]1480-he caught sight of the strolling figure of [Peter Van Degen]231-van degen -- [Peter]231-van degen lounging and luxuriating among the seductions of [the Boulevard]1489-the boulevard with the disgusting ease of [a man whose wants are all measured by money , and who always has enough to gratify them]1490-a man whose wants are all measured by money , and who always has enough to gratify them . [His]1480-he present sense of these advantages revealed itself in the affability of [his]1480-he greeting to [Ralph]199-ralph , and in [his]1480-he off - hand request that [the latter]573-the latter should " look up [Clare]228-clare , "[1480-he] who had come over with [him]1480-he to get [her]1492-her winter finery . "[4194-the sorceress] [The Sorceress]4194-the sorceress was [[Van Degen]228-clare 's steam - yacht , most huge and complicated of [her]4194-the sorceress kind]1494-van degen 's steam - yacht , most huge and complicated of her kind : it was [his]1480-he habit , after [his]1480-he semi - annual flights to [Paris]76-paris and [London]83-london , to take a joyous company back on [her]4194-the sorceress and let [Clare]228-clare return by [steamer]1495-steamer . "[1480-he] [Peter]231-van degen 's glassy eye grew livelier . " Ah , to be sure -- [you're]199-ralph not over the honeymoon yet . How 's [the bride]4198-the bride ? Stunning as ever ? "[1480-he] [He]1480-he hurried on in pursuit of a flitting petticoat and [Ralph]199-ralph continued [his]1480-he walk [home]548-home . But [he]1480-he knew how unwelcome this plan would be , and [he]1480-he shrank the more from seeing [Undine]192-undine 's face harden ; since , of late , [he]1480-he had so basked in its brightness . " Of course not -- how silly [you]1480-he are ! [I]192-undine only wanted a few old things reset . But [I]192-undine wo n't if [you]1480-he 'd rather not . "[1480-he] [he]1480-he said , smiling and twisting the ring about on [her]192-undine finger ; then [he]1480-he went on with [his]1480-he thankless explanation . " It 's not that [I]1480-he do n't want [you]192-undine to do this or that ; it 's simply that , for the moment , [we]1502-we 're rather strapped . "[1480-he] [He]1480-he mentioned the sum and the fact that [he]1480-he must give an answer the next day . Would [she]192-undine consent to sail that very Saturday ? Or should [they]1502-we go a fortnight later , in [a slow boat]1503-a slow boat from [Plymouth]84-plymouth ? [Undine]192-undine frowned on both alternatives . [She]192-undine was [an indifferent sailor]1504-an indifferent sailor and shrank from the possible " nastiness "[1504-an indifferent sailor] of [the cheaper boat]1505-the cheaper boat . [She]192-undine wanted to get the voyage over as quickly and luxuriously as possible -- [Bertha Shallum]297-bertha shallum had told [her]192-undine that in [a " deck - suite]4207-a " deck - suite "[297-bertha shallum] [no one]3844-no one need be sea - sick -- but [she]192-undine wanted still more to have another week or two of [Paris]76-paris ; and it was always hard to make [her]192-undine see why circumstances could not be bent to [her]192-undine wishes . " This week ? But how on earth can [I]192-undine be ready ? Besides , [we]1502-we 're dining at [Enghien]85-enghien with [the Shallums]298-the shallums on Saturday , and motoring to [Chantilly]86-chantilly with [the Jim Driscolls]210-the driscolls on Sunday . [I]192-undine ca n't imagine how [you]192-undine thought [we]1502-we could go this week ! "[192-undine] But [she]192-undine still opposed [the cheap steamer]1507-the cheap steamer , and after [they]1508-their had carried the question on to [[Voisin]299-voisin 's]1509-voisin 's , and there unprofitably discussed it through a long luncheon , it seemed no nearer a solution . " Well , think it over -- let [me]199-ralph know this evening , "[199-ralph] [Ralph]199-ralph said , proportioning [the waiter]1510-the waiter 's fee to a bill burdened by [Undine]192-undine 's reckless choice of primeurs . [[His]1511-his wife]512-his wife was to join the newly - arrived [Mrs. Shallum]293-mrs. shallum in [a round of [the rue de la Paix]1514-the rue de la paix]1513-a round of the rue de la paix ; and [he]1511-his had seized the opportunity of slipping off to a classical performance at [the Franais]1515-the franais . On [their]1508-their arrival in [Paris]76-paris [he]1511-his had taken [Undine]192-undine to one of these entertainments , but it left [her]192-undine too weary and puzzled for [him]1511-his to renew the attempt , and [he]1511-his had not found time to go back without [her]192-undine . [He]1511-his was glad now to shed [his]1511-his cares in such an atmosphere . The play was of the greatest , the interpretation that of the vanishing grand manner which lived in [his]1511-his first memories of the Parisian stage , and [his]1511-his surrender such influences as complete as in [his]1511-his early days . [XIII]300-xiii [He]1511-his had expected to find [Undine]192-undine still out ; but on the stairs [he]1511-his crossed [Mrs. Shallum]293-mrs. shallum , who threw at [him]1511-his from under an immense hat - brim : " Yes , [she]192-undine 's in , but [you]1511-his 'd better come and have tea with [me]293-mrs. shallum at [the Luxe]87-the luxe . "[293-mrs. shallum] In [the sitting - room]1517-the sitting - room [Ralph]199-ralph found [Undine]192-undine seated behind a tea - table on the other side of which , in an attitude of easy intimacy , [Peter Van Degen]231-van degen stretched [his]1511-his lounging length . [Peter]231-van degen in intimacy was given to miscalculations of the sort , and [Ralph]199-ralph 's first movement was to glance at [Undine]192-undine and see how it affected [her]192-undine . But [her]192-undine eyes gave out the vivid rays that noise and banter always struck from [them]1518-them ; [her]192-undine face , at such moments , was like [a theatre]1519-a theatre with all the lustres blazing . "[192-undine] [Ralph]199-ralph was beginning to learn that the only road to [her]192-undine reason lay through [her]192-undine vanity , and [he]1528-he fancied that if [she]192-undine could be made to see [Van Degen]231-van degen as an object of ridicule [she]192-undine might give up the idea of [the Sorceress]4194-the sorceress of [her]192-undine own accord . But [her]192-undine will hardened slowly under [his]1528-he joking opposition , and [she]192-undine became no less formidable as [she]192-undine grew more calm . [He]1528-he was used to [women who , in such cases , yielded as a matter of course to masculine judgments]1530-women who , in such cases , yielded as a matter of course to masculine judgments : if [one]629-one pronounced [a man " not decent "]4240-a man " not decent "[192-undine] the question was closed . But it was [Undine]192-undine 's habit to ascribe all interference with [her]192-undine plans to personal motives , and [he]1528-he could see that [she]192-undine attributed [his]1528-he opposition to the furtive machinations of poor [Clare]228-clare . It was odious to [him]1528-he to prolong the discussion , for the accent of recrimination was the one [he]1528-he most dreaded on [her]192-undine lips . But the moment came when [he]1528-he had to take the brunt of it , averting [his]1528-he thoughts as best [he]1528-he might from the glimpse it gave of a world of mean familiarities , of reprisals drawn from the vulgarest of vocabularies . Certain retorts sped through the air like the flight of household utensils , certain charges rang out like accusations of tampering with the groceries . [He]1528-he stiffened [himself]1528-he against such comparisons , but they stuck in [his]1528-he imagination and left [him]1528-he thankful when [Undine]192-undine 's anger yielded to a burst of tears . [He]1528-he had held [his]1528-he own and gained [his]1528-he point . The trip on [the Sorceress]4194-the sorceress was given up , and a note of withdrawal despatched to [Van Degen]228-clare ; but at the same time [Ralph]199-ralph cabled [[his]1528-he sister]3743-his sister to ask if [she]3743-his sister could increase [her]3743-his sister loan . For [he]1528-he had conquered only at the cost of a concession : [Undine]192-undine was to stay in [Paris]76-paris till October , and [they]1534-they were to sail on [a fast steamer]1535-a fast steamer , in [a deck - suite]1536-a deck - suite , like the Harvey Shallums . [Undine]192-undine 's ill - humour was soon dispelled by any new distraction , and [she]192-undine gave [herself]192-undine to the untroubled enjoyment of [Paris]76-paris . [The Shallums]298-the shallums were the centre of [a like - minded group]1537-a like - minded group , and in the hours [the ladies]459-the ladies could spare from [their]459-the ladies dress - makers [the restaurants]1539-the restaurants shook with [their]459-the ladies hilarity and [the suburbs]1540-the suburbs with the shriek of [their]459-the ladies motors . [Van Degen]228-clare , who had postponed [his]1528-he sailing , was [a frequent sharer in these amusements]1541-a frequent sharer in these amusements ; but [Ralph]199-ralph counted on [New York]8-new york influences to detach [him]1528-he from [[Undine]192-undine 's train]1542-undine 's train . [He]1528-he was learning to influence [her]192-undine through [her]192-undine social instincts where [he]1528-he had once tried to appeal to other sensibilities . [His]1528-he worst moment came when [he]1528-he went to see [Clare Van Degen]228-clare , who , on the eve of departure , had begged [him]1528-he to come to [[her]228-clare hotel]1543-her hotel . [He]1528-he found [her]192-undine less restless and rattling than usual , with a look in [her]192-undine eyes that reminded [him]1528-he of the days when [she]192-undine had haunted [his]1528-he thoughts . The visit passed off without vain returns to the past ; but as [he]1528-he was leaving [she]192-undine surprised [him]1528-he by saying : " Do n't let [Peter]231-van degen make a goose of [[your]1528-he wife]4211-your wife . "[192-undine] [Ralph]199-ralph reddened , but laughed . " Oh , [Undine]192-undine 's wonderfully able to defend [herself]192-undine , even against such seductions as [Peter]231-van degen 's . "[192-undine] [Mrs. Van Degen]231-van degen looked down with a smile at the bracelets on [her]231-van degen thin brown wrist . " [His]1528-he personal seductions -- yes . But as [an inventor of amusements]4242-an inventor of amusements [he]1528-he 's inexhaustible ; and [Undine]192-undine likes to be amused . "[231-van degen] [Ralph]199-ralph made no reply but showed no annoyance . [He]1528-he simply took [her]192-undine hand and kissed it as [he]1528-he said good - bye ; and [she]192-undine turned from [him]1528-he without audible farewell . As the day of departure approached . [Undine]192-undine 's absorption in [her]192-undine dresses almost precluded the thought of amusement . Early and late [she]192-undine was closeted with [fitters]1544-fitters and [packers]1545-packers -- even [the competent Celeste]1546-the competent celeste not being trusted to handle the treasures now pouring in -- and [Ralph]199-ralph cursed [his]1528-he weakness in not restraining [her]192-undine , and then fled for solace to [museums]1547-museums and [galleries]1548-galleries . [He]1528-he could not rouse in [her]192-undine any scruple about incurring fresh debts , yet [he]1528-he knew [she]192-undine was no longer unaware of the value of money . [She]192-undine had learned to bargain , pare down prices , evade fees , brow - beat [the small tradespeople]1549-the small tradespeople and wheedle concessions from [the great]1550-the great -- not , as [Ralph]199-ralph perceived , from any effort to restrain [her]192-undine expenses , but only to prolong and intensify the pleasure of spending . Pained by the trait , [he]1528-he tried to laugh [her]192-undine out of it . [He]1528-he told [her]192-undine once that [she]192-undine had a miserly hand -- showing [her]192-undine , in proof , that , for all [their]1551-their softness , the fingers would not bend back , or the pink palm open . But [she]192-undine retorted a little sharply that it was no wonder , since [she]192-undine 'd heard nothing talked of since [their]1551-their marriage but economy ; and this left [him]1528-he without any answer . So [the purveyors]1552-the purveyors continued to mount to [[their]1551-their apartment]1553-their apartment , and [Ralph]199-ralph , in the course of [his]1528-he frequent nights from [it]1553-their apartment , found [himself]1528-he always dodging the corners of black glazed boxes and swaying pyramids of pasteboard ; always lifting [his]1528-he hat to [sidling [milliners]1555-milliners ' girls]1554-sidling milliners ' girls , or effacing [himself]1528-he before slender vendeuses floating by in a mist of opopanax . [He]1528-he felt incompetent to pronounce on the needs to which [these visitors]1556-these visitors ministered ; but the reappearance among [them]1556-these visitors of [the blond - bearded jeweller]1557-the blond - bearded jeweller gave [him]1528-he ground for fresh fears . [Undine]192-undine had assured [him]1528-he that [she]192-undine had given up the idea of having [her]192-undine ornaments reset , and there had been ample time for [their]1551-their return ; but on [his]1528-he questioning [her]192-undine [she]192-undine explained that there had been delays and " bothers "[192-undine] and put [him]1528-he in the wrong by asking ironically if [he]1528-he supposed [she]192-undine was buying things " for pleasure "[192-undine] when [she]192-undine knew as well as [he]1528-he that there was n't any money to pay for them . But [his]1528-he thoughts were not all dark . [Undine]192-undine 's moods still infected [him]1528-he , and when [she]192-undine was happy [he]1528-he felt an answering lightness . Even when [her]192-undine amusements were too primitive to be shared [he]1528-he could enjoy [their]1551-their reflection in [her]192-undine face . Only , as [he]1528-he looked back , [he]1528-he was struck by the evanescence , the lack of substance , in [their]1551-their moments of sympathy , and by the permanent marks left by each breach between [them]1551-their . Yet [he]1528-he still fancied that some day the balance might be reversed , and that as [she]192-undine acquired a finer sense of values the depths in [her]192-undine would find a voice . Something of this was in [his]1528-he mind when , the afternoon before [their]1551-their departure , [he]1528-he came [home]548-home to help [her]192-undine with [their]1551-their last arrangements . [She]192-undine had begged [him]1528-he , for the day , to leave [her]192-undine alone in [[their]1551-their cramped salon]1559-their cramped salon , into which belated bundles were still pouring ; and it was nearly dark when [he]1528-he returned . The evening before [she]192-undine had seemed pale and nervous , and at the last moment had excused [herself]192-undine from dining with [the Shallums]298-the shallums at [a suburban restaurant]1560-a suburban restaurant . It was so unlike [her]192-undine to miss any opportunity of the kind that [Ralph]199-ralph had felt a little anxious . But with the arrival of [the packers]1561-the packers [she]192-undine was afoot and in command again , and [he]1528-he withdrew submissively , as [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg , in the early Apex days , might have fled from the spring storm of " [house]4243-house - cleaning . "[192-undine] When [he]1528-he entered [the sitting - room]1517-the sitting - room , [he]1528-he found [it]1517-the sitting - room still in disorder . [Every chair]1563-every chair was hidden under scattered dresses , tissue - paper surged from the yawning trunks and , prone among [her]192-undine heaped - up finery . [Undine]192-undine lay with closed eyes on the sofa . [She]192-undine raised [her]192-undine head as [he]1528-he entered , and then turned listlessly away . " [[My]192-undine poor girl]4205-my poor girl , what 's the matter ? Have n't [they]4245-they finished yet ? "[192-undine] Instead of answering [she]192-undine pressed [her]192-undine face into the cushion and began to sob . The violence of [her]192-undine weeping shook [her]192-undine hair down on [her]192-undine shoulders , and [her]192-undine hands , clenching the arm of the sofa , pressed it away from [her]192-undine as if any contact were insufferable . [Ralph]199-ralph bent over [her]192-undine in alarm . " Why , what 's wrong , [dear]3838-dear ? What 's happened ? "[199-ralph] [Her]192-undine fatigue of the previous evening came back to [him]1528-he -- a puzzled hunted look in [her]192-undine eyes ; and with the memory a vague wonder revived . [He]1528-he had fancied [himself]1528-he fairly disencumbered of the stock formulas about the hallowing effects of motherhood , and there were many reasons for not welcoming the news [he]1528-he suspected [she]192-undine had to give ; but [the woman]1564-the woman [a man]932-a man loves is always a special case , and everything was different that befell [Undine]192-undine . If this was what had befallen [her]192-undine it was wonderful and divine : for the moment that was all [he]1528-he felt . " [Dear]3838-dear , tell [me]1528-he what 's the matter , "[1528-he] [he]1528-he pleaded . [She]192-undine sobbed on unheedingly and [he]1528-he waited for [her]192-undine agitation to subside . [He]1528-he shrank from the phrases considered appropriate to the situation , but [he]1528-he wanted to hold [her]192-undine close and give [her]192-undine the depth of [his]1528-he heart in long kiss . Suddenly [she]192-undine sat upright and turned a desperate face on [him]1528-he . " Why on earth are [you]1528-he staring at [me]192-undine like that ? [Anybody]3822-anybody can see what 's the matter ! "[192-undine] [He]1528-he winced at [her]192-undine tone , but managed to get one of [her]192-undine hands in [his]1528-he ; and [they]1566-they stayed thus in silence , eye to eye . " Are [you]192-undine as sorry as all that ? "[1528-he] [he]1528-he began at length conscious of the flatness of [his]1528-he voice . " Sorry -- sorry ? [I'm]192-undine -- I'm-- "[1528-he] [She]192-undine snatched [her]192-undine hand away , and went on weeping . " But , [Undine]192-undine -- dearest -- bye and bye [you]192-undine 'll feel differently -- [I]192-undine know [you]192-undine will ! "[192-undine] " Differently ? Differently ? When ? In a year ? It TAKES a year -- a whole year out of life ! What do [I]192-undine care how [I]192-undine shall feel in a year ? "[192-undine] The chill of [her]192-undine tone struck in . This was more than a revolt of the nerves : it was a settled , a reasoned resentment . [Ralph]199-ralph found [himself]199-ralph groping for extenuations , evasions -- anything to put a little warmth into [her]192-undine ! " Who knows ? Perhaps , after all , it 's a mistake . "[192-undine] There was no answering light in [her]192-undine face . [She]192-undine turned [her]192-undine head from [him]1528-he wearily . " Do n't [you]1528-he think , [dear]3838-dear , [you]1528-he may be mistaken ? "[192-undine] " Mistaken ? How on earth can [I]192-undine be mistaken ? "[192-undine] Even in that moment of confusion [he]1528-he was struck by the cold competence of [her]192-undine tone , and wondered how [she]192-undine could be so sure . " [You]1528-he mean [you]1528-he 've asked -- you've consulted-- ? "[192-undine] The irony of it took [him]1528-he by the throat . They were the very words [he]1528-he might have spoken in some miserable secret colloquy -- the words [he]1528-he was speaking to [[his]1528-he wife]512-his wife ! [She]192-undine repeated dully : " [I]192-undine know [I]192-undine 'm not mistaken . "[192-undine] There was another long silence . [Undine]192-undine lay still , [her]192-undine eyes shut , drumming on the arm of the sofa with a restless hand . The other lay cold in [Ralph]199-ralph 's clasp , and through it there gradually stole to [him]1528-he the benumbing influence of the thoughts [she]192-undine was thinking : the sense of the approach of illness , anxiety , and expense , and of the general unnecessary disorganization of [their]1568-their lives . " That 's all [you]1528-he feel , then ? "[1528-he] [he]1528-he asked at length a little bitterly , as if to disguise from [himself]1528-he the hateful fact that [he]1528-he felt it too . [He]1528-he stood up and moved away . " That 's all ? "[1528-he] [he]1528-he repeated . " Why , what else do [you]1528-he expect [me]1528-he to feel ? [I]1528-he feel horribly ill , if that 's what [you]1528-he want . "[1528-he] [He]1528-he saw the sobs trembling up through [her]192-undine again . " [Poor dear]4250-poor dear -- poor girl ... [I'm]1528-he so sorry -- so dreadfully sorry ! "[1528-he] The senseless reiteration seemed to exasperate [her]192-undine . [He]1528-he knew it by the quiver that ran through [her]192-undine like the premonitory ripple on smooth water before the coming of the wind . [She]192-undine turned about on [him]1528-he and jumped to [her]192-undine feet . " [Sorry]303-sorry -- [you're]1528-he sorry ? [YOU'RE]1528-he sorry ? Why , what earthly difference will it make to [YOU]1528-he ? "[192-undine] [She]192-undine drew back a few steps and lifted [her]192-undine slender arms from [her]192-undine sides . " Look at [me]192-undine -- see how [I]192-undine look -- how [I]192-undine 'm going to look ! [YOU]1528-he wo n't hate [yourself]1528-he more and more every morning when [you]1528-he get up and see [yourself]1528-he in the glass ! [YOUR]1528-he life 's going on just as usual ! But what 's [mine]192-undine going to be for months and months ? And just as [I]192-undine 'd been to all this bother -- fagging [myself]192-undine to death about all these things-- "[192-undine] [her]192-undine tragic gesture swept the disordered room--"just as [I]192-undine thought [I]192-undine was going [home]548-home to enjoy [myself]192-undine , and look nice , and see [people]560-people again , and have a little pleasure after all [our]4253-our worries-- "[192-undine] [She]192-undine dropped back on the sofa with another burst of tears . " For all the good this rubbish will do [me]192-undine now ! [I]192-undine loathe the very sight of it ! "[192-undine] [she]192-undine sobbed with [her]192-undine face in [her]192-undine hands . XIV It was one of the distinctions of [Mr. Claud Walsingham Popple]197-popple that [[his]197-popple studio]1569-his studio was never too much encumbered with the attributes of [his]197-popple art to permit the installing , in one of [its]1569-his studio cushioned corners , of an elaborately furnished tea - table flanked by the most varied seductions in sandwiches and pastry . [Mr. Popple]197-popple , like [all great men]1570-all great men , had at first had [his]197-popple ups and downs ; but [his]197-popple reputation had been permanently established by the verdict of [a wealthy patron who , returning from an excursion into other fields of portraiture]1571-a wealthy patron who , returning from an excursion into other fields of portraiture , had given it as the final fruit of [his]197-popple experience that [Popple]197-popple was [the only man who could " do pearls]4254-the only man who could " do pearls . "[1572-sitters for whom this was of the first consequence] To [sitters for whom this was of the first consequence]1572-sitters for whom this was of the first consequence it was another of [the artist]1165-the artist 's merits that [he]197-popple always subordinated art to elegance , in life as well as in [his]197-popple portraits . The " messy "[1572-sitters for whom this was of the first consequence] element of production was no more visible in [[his]197-popple expensively screened and tapestried studio]1574-his expensively screened and tapestried studio than its results were perceptible in [his]197-popple painting ; and it was often said , in praise of [his]197-popple work , that [he]197-popple was [the only artist who kept [[his]197-popple studio]1569-his studio]1575-the only artist who kept his studio tidy enough for [a lady]1146-a lady to sit to [him]197-popple in a new dress . [Mr. Popple]197-popple , in fact , held that the personality of [the artist]1165-the artist should at all times be dissembled behind that of [the man]1579-the man . It was [his]197-popple opinion that the essence of good - breeding lay in tossing off a picture as easily as [you]1580-you lit a cigarette . [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph had once said of [him]197-popple that when [he]197-popple began a portrait [he]197-popple always turned back [his]197-popple cuffs and said : " [Ladies]4255-ladies and [gentlemen]3778-gentlemen , [you]1580-you can see there 's absolutely nothing here , "[197-popple] and [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford supplemented the description by defining [his]197-popple painting as " chafing - dish "[204-mrs. fairford] art . On a certain late afternoon of December , some four years after [Mr. Popple]197-popple 's first meeting with [Miss Undine Spragg of Apex]192-undine , even the symbolic chafing - dish was nowhere visible in [[his]197-popple studio]1569-his studio ; the only evidence of [its]1569-his studio recent activity being the full - length portrait of [Mrs. Ralph Marvell]199-ralph , who , from [her]199-ralph lofty easel and [her]199-ralph heavily garlanded frame , faced the doorway with the air of having been invited to " receive "[199-ralph] for [Mr. Popple]197-popple . [The artist]1165-the artist [himself]1165-the artist , becomingly clad in mouse - coloured velveteen , had just turned away from the picture to hover above the tea - cups ; but [his]1165-the artist place had been taken by the considerably broader bulk of [Mr. Peter Van Degen]246-van degen , who , tightly moulded into a coat of the latest cut , stood before the portrait in the attitude of [a first arrival]1583-a first arrival . " Yes , it 's good -- it 's damn good , [Popp]249-old popp ; [you]249-old popp 've hit the hair off ripplingly ; but the pearls ai n't big enough , "[1165-the artist] [he]1165-the artist pronounced . A slight laugh sounded from the raised dais behind [the easel]1584-the easel . " Of course they 're not ! But it 's not [HIS]1165-the artist fault , [poor man]4257-poor man ; [HE]1165-the artist did n't give them to [me]199-ralph ! "[199-ralph] As [she]199-ralph spoke [Mrs. Ralph Marvell]199-ralph rose from a monumental gilt arm - chair of pseudo - Venetian design and swept [her]199-ralph long draperies to [Van Degen]246-van degen 's side . " [He]1165-the artist might , then -- for the privilege of painting [you]199-ralph ! "[573-the latter] [the latter]573-the latter rejoined , transferring [his]1165-the artist bulging stare from the counterfeit to the original . [His]1165-the artist eyes rested on [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph 's in what seemed a quick exchange of understanding ; then [they]1586-they passed on to a critical inspection of [[her]199-ralph person]1587-her person . [She]199-ralph was dressed for the sitting in something faint and shining , above which the long curves of [her]199-ralph neck looked dead white in the cold light of [the studio]1588-the studio ; and [her]199-ralph hair , all a shadowless rosy gold , was starred with a hard glitter of diamonds . " The privilege of painting [me]199-ralph ? [Mercy]205-mercy , _ [I]199-ralph _ have to pay for being painted ! [He]1165-the artist 'll tell [you]246-van degen [he]1165-the artist 's giving [me]199-ralph the picture -- but what do [you]246-van degen suppose this cost ? "[199-ralph] [She]199-ralph laid a finger - tip on [her]199-ralph shimmering dress . [Van Degen]246-van degen 's eye rested on [her]199-ralph with cold enjoyment . " Does the price come higher than the dress ? "[199-ralph] [She]199-ralph ignored the allusion . " Of course what [they]4258-they charge for is the cut-- "[199-ralph] " What [they]4258-they cut away ? That 's what [they]4258-they ought to charge for , ai n't it , [Popp]249-old popp ? "[192-undine] [Undine]192-undine took this with cool disdain , but [Mr. Popple]197-popple 's sensibilities were offended . " [[My]197-popple dear]4259-my dear [Peter]246-van degen -- really -- [the artist]1165-the artist , [you]246-van degen understand , sees all this as a pure question of colour , of pattern ; and it 's a point of honour with [the MAN]1579-the man to steel [himself]1579-the man against the personal seduction . "[197-popple] [Mr. Van Degen]246-van degen received this protest with a sound of almost vulgar derision , but Undine thrilled agreeably under the glance which [[her]199-ralph portrayer]1589-her portrayer cast on [her]199-ralph . [She]199-ralph was flattered by [Van Degen]246-van degen 's notice , and thought [his]197-popple impertinence witty ; but [she]199-ralph glowed inwardly at [Mr. Popple]197-popple 's eloquence . After more than three years of social experience [she]199-ralph still thought [he]197-popple " spoke beautifully , "[199-ralph] like [the hero of a novel]1590-the hero of a novel , and [she]199-ralph ascribed to jealousy the lack of seriousness with which [[her]199-ralph husband]488-her husband 's friends regarded [him]197-popple . [His]197-popple conversation struck [her]199-ralph as intellectual , and [his]197-popple eagerness to have [her]199-ralph share [his]197-popple thoughts was in flattering contrast to [Ralph]199-ralph 's growing tendency to keep [his]197-popple to [himself]199-ralph . [Popple]197-popple 's homage seemed the , subtlest proof of what [Ralph]199-ralph could have made of [her]199-ralph if [he]197-popple had " really understood "[197-popple] [her]199-ralph . It was but another step to ascribe all [her]199-ralph past mistakes to the lack of such understanding ; and the satisfaction derived from this thought had once impelled [her]199-ralph to tell [the artist]1165-the artist that [he]197-popple alone knew how to rouse [her]199-ralph ' higher self . ' [He]197-popple had assured [her]199-ralph that the memory of [her]199-ralph words would thereafter hallow [his]197-popple life ; and as [he]197-popple hinted that it had been stained by the darkest errors [she]199-ralph was moved at the thought of the purifying influence [she]199-ralph exerted . Thus it was that [a man]932-a man should talk to [a true woman]1594-a true woman -- but how few whom [she]199-ralph had known possessed the secret ! [Ralph]199-ralph , in the first months of [their]1595-their marriage , had been eloquent too , had even gone the length of quoting poetry ; but [he]197-popple disconcerted [her]199-ralph by [his]197-popple baffling twists and strange allusions ( [she]199-ralph always scented ridicule in the unknown ) , and the poets [he]197-popple quoted were esoteric and abstruse . [Mr. Popple]197-popple 's rhetoric was drawn from more familiar sources , and abounded in favourite phrases and in moving reminiscences of [the Fifth Reader]1596-the fifth reader . [He]197-popple was moreover as literary as [he]197-popple was artistic ; possessing an unequalled acquaintance with contemporary fiction , and dipping even into the lighter type of memoirs , in which [the old acquaintances of history]1597-the old acquaintances of history are served up in the disguise of " [A Royal Sorceress]4262-a royal sorceress "[1165-the artist] or " Passion in [a Palace]4263-a palace . "[1165-the artist] The mastery with which [Mr. Popple]197-popple discussed the novel of the day , especially in relation to the sensibilities of [its hero]1598-its hero and [heroine]1599-heroine , gave [Undine]192-undine a sense of intellectual activity which contrasted strikingly with [Marvell]199-ralph 's flippant estimate of such works . " Passion , "[1165-the artist] [the artist]1165-the artist implied , would have been the dominant note of [his]197-popple life , had it not been held in check by a sentiment of exalted chivalry , and by the sense that a nature of such emotional intensity as [his]197-popple must always be " ridden on the curb . "[1165-the artist] [Van Degen]246-van degen was helping [himself]246-van degen from the tray of iced cocktails which stood near the tea - table , and [Popple]197-popple , turning to [Undine]192-undine , took up the thread of [his]197-popple discourse . But why , [he]197-popple asked , why allude before [others]807-others to feelings so few could understand ? [The average man]1602-the average man -- [lucky devil!--(with]304-lucky devil!--(with a compassionate glance at [Van Degen]246-van degen 's back ) [the average man]1602-the average man knew nothing of the fierce conflict between the lower and higher natures ; and even [the woman whose eyes had kindled it]1604-the woman whose eyes had kindled it -- how much did [SHE]1604-the woman whose eyes had kindled it guess of its violence ? Did [she]1604-the woman whose eyes had kindled it know -- [Popple]197-popple recklessly asked -- how often [the artist]1165-the artist was forgotten in [the man]1579-the man -- how often [the man]1579-the man would take the bit between [his]1579-the man teeth , were it not that the look in [her]1604-the woman whose eyes had kindled it eyes recalled some sacred memory , some lesson learned perhaps beside [[his]1579-the man mother]3752-his mother 's knee ? " [I]246-van degen say , [Popp]249-old popp -- was that where [you]249-old popp learned to mix this drink ? Because it does [the old lady]4264-the old lady credit , "[246-van degen] [Van Degen]246-van degen called out , smacking [his]246-van degen lips ; while [the artist]1165-the artist , dashing a nervous hand through [his]1165-the artist hair , muttered : " Hang it , [Peter]246-van degen -- is NOTHING sacred to [you]246-van degen ? "[1165-the artist] It pleased [Undine]192-undine to feel [herself]192-undine capable of inspiring such emotions . [She]192-undine would have been fatigued by the necessity of maintaining [her]192-undine own talk on [Popple]197-popple 's level , but [she]192-undine liked to listen to [him]197-popple , and especially to have [others]807-others overhear what [he]197-popple said to [her]192-undine . [Her]192-undine feeling for [Van Degen]246-van degen was different . There was more similarity of tastes between [them]1611-them , though [his]197-popple manner flattered [her]192-undine vanity less than [Popple]197-popple 's . [She]192-undine felt the strength of [Van Degen]246-van degen 's contempt for everything [he]197-popple did not understand or could not buy : that was the only kind of " exclusiveness "[197-popple] that impressed [her]192-undine . And [he]197-popple was still to [her]192-undine , as in [her]192-undine inexperienced days , [the master of the mundane science [she]192-undine had once imagined that [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph possessed]1612-the master of the mundane science she had once imagined that ralph marvell possessed . During the three years since [her]192-undine marriage [she]192-undine had learned to make distinctions unknown to [her]192-undine girlish categories . [She]192-undine had found out that [she]192-undine had given [herself]192-undine to the exclusive and the dowdy when the future belonged to [the showy]1613-the showy and the promiscuous ; that [she]192-undine was in the case of [those who have cast in [their]1614-those who have cast in their lot with a fallen cause lot with [a fallen cause]1615-a fallen cause]1614-those who have cast in their lot with a fallen cause , or -- to use an analogy more within [her]192-undine range -- who have hired an opera box on the wrong night . It was all confusing and exasperating . [Apex]192-undine ideals had been based on the myth of " old families "[192-undine] ruling [New York]8-new york from a throne of Revolutionary tradition , with [the new millionaires]1616-the new millionaires paying [them]1616-the new millionaires feudal allegiance . But experience had long since proved the delusiveness of the simile . [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph 's classification of [the world]620-the world into the visited and the unvisited was as obsolete as a mediaeval cosmogony . [Some of those whom [Washington Square]305-washington square left unvisited]1618-some of those whom washington square left unvisited were [the centre of social systems far outside [its]305-washington square ken , and as indifferent to its opinions as the constellations to the reckonings of [the astronomers]1620-the astronomers]1619-the centre of social systems far outside its ken , and as indifferent to its opinions as the constellations to the reckonings of the astronomers ; and all these systems joyously revolved about [their]1618-some of those whom washington square left unvisited central sun of gold . There were moments after [Undine]192-undine 's return to [New York]8-new york when [she]192-undine was tempted to class [her]192-undine marriage with the hateful early mistakes from the memories of which [she]192-undine had hoped it would free [her]192-undine . Since it was never [her]192-undine habit to accuse [herself]192-undine of such mistakes it was inevitable that [she]192-undine should gradually come to lay the blame on [Ralph]199-ralph . [She]192-undine found a poignant pleasure , at this stage of [her]192-undine career , in the question : " What does [a young girl]690-a young girl know of life ? "[192-undine] And the poignancy was deepened by the fact that each of [the friends to whom]1621-the friends to whom [she]192-undine put the question seemed convinced that -- had the privilege been [his]1622-his -- [he]1622-his would have known how to spare [her]192-undine the disenchantment it implied . The conviction of having blundered was never more present to [her]192-undine than when , on this particular afternoon , [the guests invited by [Mr. Popple]197-popple to view [her]192-undine portrait]1623-the guests invited by mr. popple to view her portrait began to assemble before it . [Some of [the principal figures of [Undine]192-undine 's group]1625-the principal figures of undine 's group]1624-some of the principal figures of undine 's group had rallied for the occasion , and almost all were in exasperating enjoyment of the privileges for which [she]192-undine pined . There was [young Jim Driscoll]306-young jim driscoll , [heir - apparent of [the house]623-the house]1626-heir - apparent of the house , with [[his]1626-heir - apparent of the house short stout mistrustful wife]1628-his short stout mistrustful wife , who hated society , but went everywhere lest it might be thought [she]192-undine had been left out ; the " beautiful [Mrs. Beringer]307-mrs. beringer , "[1629-a lovely aimless being , who kept ( as laura fairford said ) a home for stray opinions , and could never quite tell them apart] [a lovely aimless being , who kept ( as [Laura Fairford]203-laura said ) a home for stray opinions , and could never quite tell them apart]1629-a lovely aimless being , who kept ( as laura fairford said ) a home for stray opinions , and could never quite tell them apart ; [little Dicky Bowles]308-dicky bowles , whom [every one]530-every one invited because [he]530-every one was understood to " say things "[530-every one] if [one]629-one did n't ; [the Harvey Shallums]298-the shallums , fresh from [Paris]76-paris , and dragging in [their]298-the shallums wake [a bewildered nobleman vaguely designated as " [the Count]4266-the count , "[1632-a bewildered nobleman vaguely designated as " the count , " who offered cautious conversational openings , like an explorer trying beads on savages] who offered cautious conversational openings , like [an explorer trying beads on savages]1633-an explorer trying beads on savages]1632-a bewildered nobleman vaguely designated as " the count , " who offered cautious conversational openings , like an explorer trying beads on savages ; and , behind [these more salient types]1634-these more salient types , the usual filling in of [those who are seen everywhere because [they]1634-these more salient types have learned to catch the social eye . [Such a company]1636-such a company was one to flatter [the artist]1165-the artist as much [[his]1165-the artist sitter]1638-his sitter]1635-those who are seen everywhere because they have learned to catch the social eye . such a company was one to flatter the artist as much his sitter , so completely did it represent that unamity of opinion which constitutes social strength . Not one the number was troubled by any personal theory of art : all [they]1639-they asked of a portrait was that the costume should be sufficiently " life - like , "[1639-they] and the face not too much so ; and a long experience in idealizing flesh and realizing dress - fabrics had enabled [Mr. Popple]197-popple to meet both demands . " Hang it , "[246-van degen] [Peter Van Degen]246-van degen pronounced , standing before the easel in an attitude of inspired interpretation , " the great thing in [a man]932-a man 's portrait is to catch the likeness -- [we]4268-we all know that ; but with [a woman]933-a woman 's it 's different -- [a woman]933-a woman 's picture has got to be pleasing . Who wants it about if it is n't ? [Those big chaps who blow about what [they]4271-those big chaps who blow about what they call realism call realism]4271-those big chaps who blow about what they call realism -- how do [THEIR]4271-those big chaps who blow about what they call realism portraits look in [a drawing - room]4272-a drawing - room ? Do [you]4273-you suppose [they]4271-those big chaps who blow about what they call realism ever ask [themselves]4271-those big chaps who blow about what they call realism that ? [THEY]4271-those big chaps who blow about what they call realism do n't care -- [they're]4271-those big chaps who blow about what they call realism not going to live with the things ! And what do [they]4271-those big chaps who blow about what they call realism know of drawing - rooms , anyhow ? [Lots of [them]4271-those big chaps who blow about what they call realism]4274-lots of them have n't even got a dress - suit . There 's where [old Popp]249-old popp has the pull over ['em]4275-'em -- [HE]249-old popp knows how [we]4276-we live and what [we]4276-we want . "[246-van degen] This was received by [the artist]1165-the artist with a deprecating murmur , and by [[his]1165-the artist public]1641-his public with warm expressions of approval . " Happily in this case , "[197-popple] [Popple]197-popple began ( " as in that of so many of [[my]197-popple sitters]4277-my sitters , "[197-popple] [he]197-popple hastily put in ) , " there has been no need to idealize - nature [herself]192-undine has outdone [the artist]1165-the artist 's dream . "[197-popple] [Undine]192-undine , radiantly challenging comparison with [her]192-undine portrait , glanced up at it with a smile of conscious merit , which deepened as [young Jim Driscoll]306-young jim driscoll declared : " By [Jove]309-jove , [Mamie]195-marie antoinette , [you]195-marie antoinette must be done exactly like that for [the new music - room]4279-the new music - room . "[306-young jim driscoll] [[His]1165-the artist wife]512-his wife turned a cautious eye upon the picture . " How big is it ? For [[our]4280-our house]4281-our house it would have to be a good deal bigger , "[512-his wife] [she]512-his wife objected ; and [Popple]197-popple , fired by the thought of such a dimensional opportunity , rejoined that it would be the chance of [all others]1643-all others to . "[246-van degen] The winter twilight was deliriously cold , and as [they]1676-they swept through [Central Park]13-the central park , and gathered impetus for [their]1676-they northward flight along [the darkening Boulevard]1678-the darkening boulevard , [Undine]192-undine felt the rush of physical joy that drowns scruples and silences memory . [Her]192-undine scruples , indeed , were not serious ; but [Ralph]199-ralph disliked [her]192-undine being too much with [Van Degen]246-van degen , and it was [her]192-undine way to get what [she]192-undine wanted with as little " fuss "[192-undine] as possible . [She]4331-the european woman 's not [a parenthesis]4333-a parenthesis , as [she]4331-the european woman is here -- [she]4331-the european woman 's in the very middle of the picture . [I]314-bowen 'm not implying that [Ralph]199-ralph is n't interested in [[his]4323-the american man wife]512-his wife -- [he]4323-the american man 's a passionate , a pathetic exception . But even [he]4323-the american man has to conform to an environment where all the romantic values are reversed . Where does the real life of [most American men]4335-most american men lie ? In [[some woman]4336-some woman 's drawing - room]4337-some woman 's drawing - room or in [[their]641-the men offices]4338-their offices ? The answer 's obvious , is n't it ? The emotional centre of gravity 's not the same in [the two hemispheres]4339-the two hemispheres . In the effete societies it 's love , in [[our]4340-we new one]4341-our new one it 's business . "[314-bowen] [Bowen]314-bowen paused to light another cigarette , and then took up [his]314-bowen theme . " Is n't that the key to [our]4340-we easy divorces ? If [we]4340-we cared for [women]3830-women in the old barbarous possessive way do [you]4346-you suppose [we]4340-we 'd give [them]3830-women up as readily as [we]4340-we do ? The real paradox is the fact that [the men who make , materially , the biggest sacrifices for [[their]4347-the men who make , materially , the biggest sacrifices for their women women]731-their women]4347-the men who make , materially , the biggest sacrifices for their women , should do least for [them]3830-women ideally and romantically . And what 's the result -- how do [the women]4349-the women avenge [themselves]4349-the women ? All [my]314-bowen sympathy 's with [them]4349-the women , [poor deluded dears]4350-poor deluded dears , when [I]314-bowen see [their]4349-the women fallacious little attempt to trick out the leavings tossed [them]4349-the women by [the preoccupied male]4351-the preoccupied male -- the money and the motors and the clothes -- and pretend to [themselves]4349-the women and [each other]3877-each other that THAT 'S what really constitutes life ! Oh , [I]314-bowen know what [you]4353-you 're going to say -- it 's less and less of a pretense with [them]4349-the women , [I]314-bowen grant [you]4353-you ; [they]4349-the women 're more and more succumbing to the force of the suggestion ; but here and there [I]314-bowen fancy there 's one who still sees through the humbug , and knows that money and motors and clothes are simply the big bribe [she]4354-she 's paid for keeping out of [some man]4355-some man 's way ! "[314-bowen] [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford presented an amazed silence to the rush of this tirade ; but when [she]204-mrs. fairford rallied it was to murmur : " And is [Undine]192-undine one of the exceptions ? "[204-mrs. fairford] [[Her]204-mrs. fairford companion]887-her companion took the shot with a smile . " No -- [she]192-undine 's a monstrously perfect result of the system : the completest proof of its triumph . It 's [Ralph]199-ralph who 's [the victim]4356-the victim and the exception . "[887-her companion] " Ah , [poor Ralph]199-ralph ! "[204-mrs. fairford] [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford raised [her]204-mrs. fairford head quickly . " [I]204-mrs. fairford hear [him]314-bowen now . [I]204-mrs. fairford suppose , "[204-mrs. fairford] [she]204-mrs. fairford added in an undertone , " [we]4357-we ca n't give [him]314-bowen [your]314-bowen explanation for [[his]314-bowen wife]512-his wife 's having forgotten to come ? "[204-mrs. fairford] [Bowen]314-bowen echoed [her]204-mrs. fairford sigh , and then seemed to toss it from [him]314-bowen with [his]314-bowen cigarette - end ; but [he]314-bowen stood in silence while the door opened and [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph entered . " Well , [Laura]203-laura ! [Hallo]252-hallo , [Charles]314-bowen -- have [you]199-ralph been celebrating too ? "[199-ralph] [Ralph]199-ralph turned to [[his]314-bowen sister]3743-his sister . " Do n't tell [me]314-bowen the party 's over , and [the guest of honour]4361-the guest of honour gone to bed ? "[314-bowen] As [he]314-bowen stood before [them]1692-them , laughing and a little flushed , the strain of long fatigue sounding through [his]314-bowen gaiety and looking out of [his]314-bowen anxious eyes , [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford threw a glance at [Bowen]314-bowen and then turned away to ring the bell . "[314-bowen] [He]314-bowen sat down again . " Yes , make the strong , please . [I]314-bowen 've had a beastly fagging sort of day . ' But [you]1696-you do n't remember what [I]228-clare 'm like . "[228-clare] [She]228-clare turned away to glance at the clock . " It 's late , and [I]228-clare must be off . [You]1696-you 'd better let [me]228-clare drive [you]1696-you [home]548-home . "[228-clare] In the motor [Ralph]199-ralph leaned back in silence , while the rug was drawn over [their]1699-their knees , and [Clare]228-clare restlessly fingered the row of gold - topped objects in the rack at [her]228-clare elbow . It was restful to be swept through [the crowded streets]1700-the crowded streets in this smooth fashion , and [Clare]228-clare 's presence at [his]1701-he side gave [him]1701-he a vague sense of ease . For a long time now feminine nearness had come to mean to [him]1701-he , not this relief from tension , but the ever - renewed dread of small daily deceptions , evasions , subterfuges . The change had come gradually , marked by one disillusionment after another ; but there had been one moment that formed the point beyond which there was no returning . It was the moment , a month or two before [[his]1701-he boy]1702-his boy 's birth , when , glancing over a batch of belated Paris bills , [he]1701-he had come on one from [the jeweller [he]1701-he had once found in private conference with [Undine]192-undine]1703-the jeweller he had once found in private conference with undine . The bill was not large , but two of its items stood out sharply . " Resetting pearl and diamond pendant . Resetting sapphire and diamond ring . "[1701-he] The pearl and diamond pendant was [[his]1701-he mother]3752-his mother 's wedding present ; the ring was the one [he]1701-he had given [Undine]192-undine on [their]1699-their engagement . That [they]1699-their were both family relics , kept unchanged through several generations , scarcely mattered to [him]1701-he at the time : [he]1701-he felt only the stab of [[his]1701-he wife]512-his wife 's deception . [She]512-his wife had assured [him]1701-he in [Paris]76-paris that [she]512-his wife had not had [her]512-his wife jewels reset . [He]1701-he had noticed , soon after [their]1699-their return to [New York]8-new york , that [she]512-his wife had left off [her]512-his wife engagement - ring ; but the others were soon discarded also , and in answer to [his]1701-he question [she]512-his wife had told [him]1701-he that , in [her]512-his wife ailing state , rings " worried "[512-his wife] [her]512-his wife . Now [he]1701-he saw [she]512-his wife had deceived [him]1701-he , and , forgetting everything else , [he]1701-he went to [her]512-his wife , bill in hand . [Her]512-his wife tears and distress filled [him]1701-he with immediate contrition . Was this a time to torment [her]512-his wife about trifles ? [His]1701-he anger seemed to cause [her]512-his wife actual physical fear , and at the sight [he]1701-he abased [himself]1701-he in entreaties for forgiveness . When the scene ended [she]512-his wife had pardoned [him]1701-he , and the reset ring was on [her]512-his wife finger ... Soon afterward , the birth of [the boy]4296-the boy seemed to wipe out these humiliating memories ; yet [Marvell]199-ralph found in time that they were not effaced , but only momentarily crowded out of sight . In reality , the incident had a meaning out of proportion to its apparent seriousness , for it put in [his]1701-he hand a clue to a new side of [[his]1701-he wife]512-his wife 's character . [He]1701-he no longer minded [her]512-his wife having lied about [the jeweller]1708-the jeweller ; what pained [him]1701-he was that [she]512-his wife had been unconscious of the wound [she]512-his wife inflicted in destroying the identity of the jewels . [He]1701-he saw that , even after [their]1709-their explanation , [she]512-his wife still supposed [he]1701-he was angry only because [she]512-his wife had deceived [him]1701-he ; and the discovery that [she]512-his wife was completely unconscious of states of feeling on which so much of [his]1701-he inner life depended marked a new stage in [their]1709-their relation . [He]1701-he was not thinking of all this as [he]1701-he sat beside [Clare Van Degen]228-clare ; but it was part of the chronic disquietude which made [him]1701-he more alive to [[his]1701-he cousin]939-his cousin 's sympathy , [her]939-his cousin shy unspoken understanding . After all , [he]1701-he and [she]939-his cousin were of the same blood and had the same traditions . [She]939-his cousin was light and frivolous , without strength of will or depth of purpose ; but [she]939-his cousin had the frankness of [her]939-his cousin foibles , and [she]939-his cousin would never have lied to [him]1701-he or traded on [his]1701-he tenderness . [Clare]228-clare 's nervousness gradually subsided , and [she]939-his cousin lapsed into a low - voiced mood which seemed like an answer to [his]1701-he secret thought . But [she]939-his cousin did not sound the personal note , and [they]1709-their chatted quietly of commonplace things : of the dinner - dance at which [they]1709-their were presently to meet , of the costume [she]939-his cousin had chosen for the Driscoll fancy - ball , the recurring rumours of [old Driscoll]317-mamie driscoll 's financial embarrassment , and the mysterious personality of [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt , on whose movements [Wall Street]47-wall street was beginning to fix a fascinated eye . When [Ralph]199-ralph , the year after [his]1701-he marriage , had renounced [his]1701-he profession to go into partnership with [a firm of real - estate agents]1711-a firm of real - estate agents , [he]1701-he had come in contact for the first time with the drama of " business , "[212-moffatt] and whenever [he]1701-he could turn [his]1701-he attention from [his]1701-he own tasks [he]1701-he found a certain interest in watching the fierce interplay of its forces . In [the down - town world]1712-the down - town world [he]1701-he had heard things of [Moffatt]212-moffatt that seemed to single [him]212-moffatt out from the common herd of [money - makers]1713-money - makers : anecdotes of [his]212-moffatt coolness , [his]212-moffatt lazy good - temper , the humorous detachment [he]212-moffatt preserved in the heat of conflicting interests ; and [his]212-moffatt figure was enlarged by the mystery that hung about it -- the fact that [no one]3844-no one seemed to know whence [he]212-moffatt came , or how [he]212-moffatt had acquired the information which , for the moment , was making [him]212-moffatt so formidable . " [I]199-ralph should like to see [him]212-moffatt , "[199-ralph] [Ralph]199-ralph said ; " [he]212-moffatt must be a good specimen of [the one of the few picturesque types [we]4387-we 've got]4386-the one of the few picturesque types we 've got . "[199-ralph] " Yes -- it might be amusing to fish [him]212-moffatt out ; but the most picturesque types in [Wall Street]47-wall street are generally the tamest in [a drawing - room]4272-a drawing - room . "[228-clare] [Clare]228-clare considered . " But does n't [Undine]192-undine know [him]212-moffatt ? [I]228-clare seem to remember seeing [them]4389-them together . "[228-clare] " [Undine]192-undine and [Moffatt]212-moffatt ? Then [you]199-ralph KNOW [him]212-moffatt -- [you've]199-ralph ' met [him]212-moffatt ? "[199-ralph] " Not actually met [him]212-moffatt -- but [he]212-moffatt 's been pointed out to [me]1715-he . It must have been some years ago . Yes -- it was one night at [the theatre]678-the theatre , just after [you]1715-he announced [your]1715-he engagement . "[1715-he] [He]1715-he fancied [her]228-clare voice trembled slightly , as though [she]228-clare thought [he]1715-he might notice [her]228-clare way of dating [her]228-clare memories . " [You]1715-he came into [our]4391-our box , "[228-clare] [she]228-clare went on , " and [I]228-clare asked [you]1715-he the name of [the red - faced man who was sitting in the stall next to [Undine]192-undine]4392-the red - faced man who was sitting in the stall next to undine . [You]1715-he did n't know , but [some one]993-some one told [us]4391-our it was [Moffatt]212-moffatt . "[228-clare] [Marvell]199-ralph was more struck by [her]228-clare tone than by what [she]228-clare was saying . " If [Undine]192-undine knows [him]212-moffatt it 's odd [she]192-undine 's never mentioned it , "[1715-he] [he]1715-he answered indifferently . [The motor]1716-the motor stopped at [his]1715-he door and [Clare]228-clare , as [she]228-clare held out [her]228-clare hand , turned a first full look on [him]1715-he . " Why do [you]1715-he never come to see [me]228-clare ? [I]228-clare miss [you]1715-he more than ever , "[228-clare] [she]228-clare said . [He]1715-he pressed [her]228-clare hand without answering , but after the motor had rolled away [he]1715-he stood for a while on [the pavement]757-the pavement , looking after it . When [he]1715-he entered [the house]623-the house [the hall]565-the hall was still dark and [the small over - furnished drawing - room]1720-the small over - furnished drawing - room empty . [The parlour - maid]1721-the parlour - maid told [him]1715-he that [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph had not yet come in , and [he]1715-he went [upstairs]4364-upstairs to [the nursery]1723-the nursery . But on the threshold [the nurse]4300-the nurse met [him]1715-he with the whispered request not to make a noise , as it had been hard to quiet [the boy]4296-the boy after the afternoon 's disappointment , and [she]4300-the nurse had just succeeded in putting [him]4296-the boy to sleep . [Ralph]199-ralph went down to [[his]1715-he own room]1726-his own room and threw [himself]1715-he in [the old college arm - chair in which , four years previously , [he]1715-he had sat the night out , dreaming of [Undine]192-undine]1727-the old college arm - chair in which , four years previously , he had sat the night out , dreaming of undine . [He]1715-he had [no study of [his]1715-he own]1728-no study of his own , and [he]1715-he had crowded into [[his]1715-he narrow bed - room]1729-his narrow bed - room [his]1715-he prints and bookshelves , and the other relics of [his]1715-he youth . As [he]1715-he sat among [them]1730-them now the memory of that other night swept over [him]1715-he -- the night when [he]1715-he had heard the " call "[1730-them] ! Fool as [he]1715-he had been not to recognize its meaning then , [he]1715-he knew [himself]1715-he triply mocked in being , even now , at its mercy . The flame of love that had played about [his]1715-he passion for [[his]1715-he wife]512-his wife had died down to its embers ; all the transfiguring hopes and illusions were gone , but they had left an unquenchable ache for [her]512-his wife nearness , [her]512-his wife smile , [her]512-his wife touch . [His]1715-he life had come to be nothing but a long effort to win these mercies by one concession after another : the sacrifice of [his]1715-he literary projects , the exchange of [his]1715-he profession for an uncongenial business , and the incessant struggle to make enough money to satisfy [her]512-his wife increasing exactions . That was where the " call "[512-his wife] had led [him]1715-he ... The clock struck eight , but it was useless to begin to dress till [Undine]192-undine came in , and [he]1715-he stretched [himself]1715-he out in [his]1715-he chair , reached for a pipe and took up the evening paper . [His]1715-he passing annoyance had died out ; [he]1715-he was usually too tired after [his]1715-he day 's work for such feelings to keep their edge long . But [he]1715-he was curious -- disinterestedly curious -- to know what pretext [Undine]192-undine would invent for being so late , and what excuse [she]192-undine would have found for forgetting [the little boy]1732-the little boy 's birthday . [He]1715-he read on till half - past eight ; then [he]1715-he stood up and sauntered to the window . [The avenue below]1733-the avenue below [it]1733-the avenue below was deserted ; not [a carriage or motor]1734-a carriage or motor turned the corner around which [he]1715-he expected [Undine]192-undine to appear , and [he]1715-he looked idly in the opposite direction . There too the perspective was nearly empty , so empty that [he]1715-he singled out , a dozen blocks away , the blazing lamps of [a large touring - car that was bearing furiously]1735-a large touring - car that was bearing furiously down [the avenue]1736-the avenue from [Morningside]93-morningside . As [it]1735-a large touring - car that was bearing furiously drew nearer [its]1735-a large touring - car that was bearing furiously speed slackened , and [he]1715-he saw [it]1735-a large touring - car that was bearing furiously hug [the curb]1737-the curb and stop at [his]1715-he door . By the light of [the street lamp]1738-the street lamp [he]1715-he recognized [[his]1715-he wife]512-his wife as [she]512-his wife sprang out and detected a familiar silhouette in [[her]512-his wife companion]887-her companion 's fur - coated figure . Then the motor flew on and [Undine]192-undine ran up the steps . [Ralph]199-ralph went out on [the landing]1741-the landing . [He]1715-he saw [her]512-his wife coming up quickly , as if to reach [[her]512-his wife room]461-her room unperceived ; but when [she]512-his wife caught sight of [him]1715-he [she]512-his wife stopped , [her]512-his wife head thrown back and the light falling on [her]512-his wife blown hair and glowing face . " Well ? "[512-his wife] [she]512-his wife said , smiling up at [him]1715-he . " [They]4394-they waited for [you]1715-he all the afternoon in [Washington Square]2-washington square -- [the boy]4296-the boy never had [his]4296-the boy birthday , "[1715-he] [he]1715-he answered . [Her]512-his wife colour deepened , but [she]512-his wife instantly rejoined : " Why , what happened ? Why did n't [the nurse]4300-the nurse take [him]4296-the boy ? " Is that all ? "[512-his wife] [she]512-his wife asked with a slight smile .
