[XVI]318-xvi The turnings of life seldom show a sign - post ; or rather , though the sign is always there , it is usually placed some distance back , like the notices that give warning of [a bad hill]1749-a bad hill or [a level railway - crossing]1750-a level railway - crossing . [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph , pondering upon this , reflected that for [him]1746-he the sign had been set , more than three years earlier , in [an Italian ilex - grove]1751-an italian ilex - grove . That day [his]1746-he life had brimmed over -- so [he]1746-he had put it at the time . [He]1746-he saw now that it had brimmed over indeed : brimmed to the extent of leaving the cup empty , or at least of uncovering the dregs beneath the nectar . [He]1746-he knew now that [he]1746-he should never hereafter look at [[his]1746-he wife]512-his wife 's hand without remembering something [he]1746-he had read in it that day . Its surface - language had been sweet enough , but under the rosy lines [he]1746-he had seen the warning letters . Since then [he]1746-he had been walking with [a ghost]1753-a ghost : the miserable ghost of [his]1746-he illusion . Only [he]1746-he had somehow vivified , coloured , substantiated it , by the force of [his]1746-he own great need -- as [a man]932-a man might breathe a semblance of life into a dear drowned body that [he]932-a man can not give up for dead . All this came to [him]1746-he with aching distinctness the morning after [his]1746-he talk with [[his]1746-he wife]512-his wife on the stairs . [He]1746-he had accused [himself]1746-he , in midnight retrospect , of having failed to press home [his]1746-he conclusion because [he]1746-he dared not face the truth . But [he]1746-he knew this was not the case . It was not the truth [he]1746-he feared , it was another lie . If [he]1746-he had foreseen a chance of [her]512-his wife saying : " Yes , [I]512-his wife was with [Peter Van Degen]231-van degen , and for the reason [you]512-his wife think , "[512-his wife] [he]1746-he would have put it to the touch , stood up to the blow like [a man]932-a man ; but [he]1746-he knew [she]512-his wife would never say that . [She]512-his wife would go on eluding and doubling , watching [him]1746-he as [he]1746-he watched [her]512-his wife ; and at that game [she]512-his wife was sure to beat [him]1746-he in the end . On [their]1757-their way [home]548-home from the Elling dinner this certainty had become so insufferable that it nearly escaped [him]1746-he in the cry : " [You]512-his wife need n't watch [me]1746-he -- [I]1746-he shall never again watch [you]512-his wife ! "[1746-he] But [he]1746-he had held [his]1746-he peace , knowing [she]512-his wife would not understand . How little , indeed , [she]512-his wife ever understood , had been made clear to [him]1746-he when , the same night , [he]1746-he had followed [her]512-his wife [upstairs]4364-upstairs through [the sleeping house]1760-the sleeping house . [She]512-his wife had gone on ahead while [he]1746-he stayed below to lock doors and put out lights , and [he]1746-he had supposed [her]512-his wife to be already in [[her]512-his wife room]461-her room when [he]1746-he reached [the upper landing]1762-the upper landing ; but [she]512-his wife stood there waiting in the spot where [he]1746-he had waited for [her]512-his wife a few hours earlier . [She]512-his wife had shone [her]512-his wife vividest at dinner , with revolving brilliancy that collective approval always struck from [her]512-his wife ; and the glow of it still hung on [her]512-his wife as [she]512-his wife paused there in the dimness , [her]512-his wife shining cloak dropped from [her]512-his wife white shoulders . " [Ralphie--]319-ralphie-- "[512-his wife] [she]512-his wife began , a soft hand on [his]1746-he arm . [He]1746-he stopped , and [she]512-his wife pulled [him]1746-he about so that [their]1763-their faces were close , and [he]1746-he saw [her]512-his wife lips curving for a kiss . Every line of [her]512-his wife face sought [him]1746-he , from the sweep of the narrowed eyelids to the dimples that played away from [her]512-his wife smile . [His]1746-he eye received the picture with distinctness ; but for the first time it did not pass into [his]1746-he veins . It was as if [he]1746-he had been struck with a subtle blindness that permitted images to give their colour to the eye but communicated nothing to the brain . " Good - night , "[1746-he] [he]1746-he said , as [he]1746-he passed on . When [a man]932-a man felt in that way about [a woman]933-a woman [he]932-a man was surely in a position to deal with [his]932-a man case impartially . This came to [Ralph]199-ralph as the joyless solace of the morning . At last the bandage was off and [he]1746-he could see . And what did [he]1746-he see ? Only the uselessness of driving [[his]932-a man wife]512-his wife to subterfuges that were no longer necessary . Was [Van Degen]231-van degen [[her]231-van degen lover]1767-her lover ? Probably not -- the suspicion died as it rose . [She]512-his wife would not take more risks than [she]512-his wife could help , and it was admiration , not love , that [she]512-his wife wanted . [She]512-his wife wanted to enjoy [herself]512-his wife , and [her]512-his wife conception of enjoyment was publicity , promiscuity -- [the band]1768-the band , the banners , [the crowd]3861-the crowd , the close contact of covetous impulses , and the sense of walking among [them]1770-them in cool security . Any personal entanglement might mean " bother , "[512-his wife] and bother was the thing [she]512-his wife most abhorred . Probably , as the queer formula went , [his]932-a man " honour "[932-a man] was safe : [he]932-a man could count on the letter of [her]512-his wife fidelity . At moment the conviction meant no more to [him]932-a man than if [he]932-a man had been assured of the honesty of [the first strangers [he]932-a man met in [the street]705-the street]1771-the first strangers he met in the street . [A stranger]1430-a stranger -- that was what [she]512-his wife had always been to [him]932-a man . So malleable outwardly , [she]512-his wife had remained insensible to the touch of the heart . These thoughts accompanied [him]932-a man on [his]932-a man way to business the next morning . Then , as the routine took [him]932-a man back , the feeling of strangeness diminished . There [he]932-a man was again at [his]932-a man daily task -- nothing tangible was altered . [He]932-a man was there for the same purpose as yesterday : to make money for [[his]932-a man wife]512-his wife and [child]4044-child . [The woman [he]932-a man had turned from on the stairs a few hours earlier]1776-the woman he had turned from on the stairs a few hours earlier was still [[his]932-a man wife]512-his wife and [the mother of [Paul Marvell]218-paul]1778-the mother of paul marvell . [She]1776-the woman he had turned from on the stairs a few hours earlier was an inherent part of [his]932-a man life ; the inner disruption had not resulted in any outward upheaval . And with the sense of inevitableness there came a sudden wave of pity . [Poor Undine]192-undine ! [She]1776-the woman he had turned from on the stairs a few hours earlier was what [the gods]1779-the gods had made [her]1776-the woman he had turned from on the stairs a few hours earlier -- [a creature of skin - deep reactions]1780-a creature of skin - deep reactions , a mote in the beam of pleasure . [He]932-a man had no desire to " preach down "[1776-the woman he had turned from on the stairs a few hours earlier] such heart as [she]1776-the woman he had turned from on the stairs a few hours earlier had -- [he]932-a man felt only a stronger wish to reach it , teach it , move it to something of the pity that filled [his]932-a man own . [They]1781-they were fellow - victims in the noyade of marriage , but if [they]1781-they ceased to struggle perhaps the drowning would be easier for both ... Meanwhile the first of the month was at hand , with its usual batch of bills ; and there was no time to think of any struggle less pressing than that connected with paying [them]1781-they ... [Undine]192-undine had been surprised , and a little disconcerted , at [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's acceptance of the birthday incident . Since the resetting of [her]192-undine bridal ornaments the relations between [Washington Square]2-washington square and [West End Avenue]11-west end avenue had been more and more strained ; and the silent disapproval of [the Marvell ladies]1783-the marvell ladies was more irritating to [her]192-undine than open recrimination . [She]192-undine knew how keenly [Ralph]199-ralph must feel [her]192-undine last slight to [[his]932-a man family]504-his family , and [she]192-undine had been frightened when [she]192-undine guessed that [he]932-a man had seen [her]192-undine returning with [Van Degen]231-van degen . [He]932-a man must have been watching from the window , since , credulous as [he]932-a man always was , [he]932-a man evidently had a reason for not believing [her]192-undine when [she]192-undine told [him]932-a man [she]192-undine had come from [the studio]1588-the studio . There was therefore something both puzzling and disturbing in [his]932-a man silence ; and [she]192-undine made up [her]192-undine mind that it must be either explained or cajoled away . These thoughts were with [her]192-undine as [she]192-undine dressed ; but at [the Ellings]211-the chauncey ellings ' they fled like ghosts before light and laughter . [She]192-undine had never been more open to the suggestions of immediate enjoyment . At last [she]192-undine had reached the envied situation of [the pretty woman with whom society must reckon]1786-the pretty woman with whom society must reckon , and if [she]192-undine had only had the means to live up to [her]192-undine opportunities [she]192-undine would have been perfectly content with life , with [herself]192-undine and [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband . [She]192-undine still thought [Ralph]199-ralph " sweet "[199-ralph] when [she]192-undine was not bored by [his]932-a man good advice or exasperated by [his]932-a man inability to pay [her]192-undine bills . The question of money was what chiefly stood between [them]1788-them ; and now that this was momentarily disposed of by [Van Degen]231-van degen 's offer [she]192-undine looked at [Ralph]199-ralph more kindly -- [she]192-undine even felt a return of [her]192-undine first impersonal affection for [him]932-a man . [Everybody]320-everybody could see that [Clare Van Degen]228-clare was " gone "[228-clare] on [him]932-a man , and [Undine]192-undine always liked to know that what belonged to [her]192-undine was coveted by [others]807-others . [Her]192-undine reassurance had been fortified by the news [she]192-undine had heard at the Elling dinner -- the published fact of [Harmon B. Driscoll]201-driscoll 's unexpected victory . The [Ararat]94-ararat investigation had been mysteriously stopped -- quashed , in the language of the law -- and [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt " turned down , "[212-moffatt] as [Van Degen]228-clare ( who sat next to [her]192-undine ) expressed it . " [I]932-a man do n't believe [we]1790-we 'll ever hear of [that gentleman]4411-that gentleman again , "[932-a man] [he]932-a man said contemptuously ; and [their]1790-we eyes crossed gaily as [she]192-undine exclaimed : " Then [they]1790-we 'll give the fancy ball after all ? "[192-undine] " [I]192-undine should have given [you]932-a man one anyhow -- shouldn't [you]932-a man have liked that as well ? "[192-undine] " Oh , [you]932-a man can give [me]192-undine one too ! "[192-undine] [she]192-undine returned ; and [he]932-a man bent closer to say : " By [Jove]309-jove , [I]932-a man will -- and anything else [you]192-undine want . "[932-a man] But on the way [home]548-home [her]192-undine fears revived . [Ralph]199-ralph 's indifference struck [her]192-undine as unnatural . [He]932-a man had not returned to the subject of [Paul]218-paul 's disappointment , had not even asked [her]192-undine to write a word of excuse to [[his]932-a man mother]3752-his mother . [Van Degen]228-clare 's way of looking at [her]192-undine at dinner -- [he]932-a man was incapable of graduating [his]932-a man glances -- had made it plain that the favour [she]192-undine had accepted would necessitate [her]192-undine being more conspicuously in [his]932-a man company ( though [she]192-undine was still resolved that it should be on just such terms as [she]192-undine chose ) ; and it would be extremely troublesome if , at this juncture , [Ralph]199-ralph should suddenly turn suspicious and secretive . [Undine]192-undine , hitherto , had found more benefits than drawbacks in [her]192-undine marriage ; but now the tie began to gall . It was hard to be criticized for every grasp at opportunity by [a man so avowedly unable to do the reaching for [her]192-undine]1793-a man so avowedly unable to do the reaching for her ! [Ralph]199-ralph had gone into business to make more money for [her]192-undine ; but it was plain that the " more "[932-a man] would never be much , and that [he]932-a man would not achieve the quick rise to affluence which was [man]728-man 's natural tribute to [woman]1795-woman 's merits . [Undine]192-undine felt [herself]192-undine trapped , deceived ; and it was intolerable that [the agent of [her]192-undine disillusionment]1796-the agent of her disillusionment should presume to be the critic of [her]192-undine conduct . [Her]192-undine annoyance , however , died out with [her]192-undine fears . [Ralph]199-ralph , the morning after the Elling dinner , went [his]932-a man way as usual , and after nerving [herself]192-undine for the explosion which did not come [she]192-undine set down [his]932-a man indifference to the dulling effect of " business . "[192-undine] No wonder [poor women whose [husbands]4208-husbands were always " down - town "]4412-poor women whose husbands were always " down - town "[192-undine] had to look elsewhere for sympathy ! [Van Degen]228-clare 's cheque helped to calm [her]192-undine , and the weeks whirled on toward the Driscoll ball . The ball was as brilliant as [she]192-undine had hoped , and [her]192-undine own part in it as thrilling as a page from one of the " society novels "[228-clare] with which [she]192-undine had cheated the monotony of Apex days . [She]192-undine had no time for reading now : every hour was packed with what [she]192-undine would have called life , and the intensity of [her]192-undine sensations culminated on that triumphant evening . What could be more delightful than to feel that , while [all the women]1798-all the women envied [her]192-undine dress , [the men]641-the men did not so much as look at it ? [Their]641-the men admiration was all for [herself]192-undine , and [her]192-undine beauty deepened under it as flowers take a warmer colour in the rays of sunset . Only [Van Degen]228-clare 's glance weighed on [her]192-undine a little too heavily . Was it possible that [he]932-a man might become a " bother "[228-clare] less negligible than those [he]932-a man had relieved [her]192-undine of ? [Undine]192-undine was not greatly alarmed -- [she]192-undine still had full faith in [her]192-undine powers of self - defense ; but [she]192-undine disliked to feel the least crease in the smooth surface of existence . [She]192-undine had always been what [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents called " sensitive . "[192-undine] As the winter passed , material cares once more assailed [her]192-undine . In the thrill of liberation produced by [Van Degen]228-clare 's gift [she]192-undine had been imprudent -- had launched into fresh expenses . Not that [she]192-undine accused [herself]192-undine of extravagance : [she]192-undine had done nothing not really necessary . [The drawing - room]439-the drawing - room , for instance , cried out to be " done over , "[197-popple] and [Popple]197-popple , who was [an authority on decoration]1802-an authority on decoration , had shown [her]192-undine , with a few strokes of [his]197-popple pencil how easily it might be transformed into [a French " period "[197-popple] room]1803-a french " period " room , all curves and cupids : just the setting for [a pretty woman]1804-a pretty woman and [his]197-popple portrait of [her]1804-a pretty woman . But [Undine]192-undine , still hopeful of leaving [West End Avenue]11-west end avenue , had heroically resisted the suggestion , and contented [herself]192-undine with the renewal of the curtains and carpet , and the purchase of some fragile gilt chairs which , as [she]192-undine told [Ralph]199-ralph , would be " so much to the good "[192-undine] when [they]1805-they moved -- the explanation , as [she]192-undine made it , seemed an additional evidence of [her]192-undine thrift . Partly as a result of these exertions [she]192-undine had a " nervous breakdown "[192-undine] toward the middle of the winter , and [[her]192-undine physician]1806-her physician having ordered massage and a daily drive it became necessary to secure [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's attendance and to engage [a motor]1807-a motor by the month . Other unforeseen expenses -- the bills , that , at such times , seem to run up without visible impulsion -- were added to by a severe illness of [little Paul]218-paul 's : a long costly illness , with [three nurses and frequent consultations]1808-three nurses and frequent consultations . During these days [Ralph]199-ralph 's anxiety drove [him]197-popple to what seemed to [Undine]192-undine foolish excesses of expenditure and when [the boy]4296-the boy began to get better [the doctors]1810-the doctors advised country air . [Ralph]199-ralph at once hired [a small house at [Tuxedo]95-tuxedo]1811-a small house at tuxedo and [Undine]192-undine of course accompanied [[her]192-undine son]1095-her son to [the country]424-the country ; but [she]192-undine spent only the Sundays with [him]197-popple , running up to [town]3770-town during the week to be with [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband , as [she]192-undine explained . This necessitated the keeping up of [two households]1816-two households , and even for so short a time the strain on [Ralph]199-ralph 's purse was severe . So it came about that the bill for the fancy - dress was still unpaid , and [Undine]192-undine left to wonder distractedly what had become of [Van Degen]228-clare 's money . That [Van Degen]228-clare seemed also to wonder was becoming unpleasantly apparent : [his]488-her husband cheque had evidently not brought in the return [he]488-her husband expected , and [he]488-her husband put [his]488-her husband grievance to [her]192-undine frankly one day when [he]488-her husband motored down to lunch at [Tuxedo]95-tuxedo . [They]1817-they were sitting , after luncheon , in [the low - ceilinged drawing - room to which [Undine]192-undine]1818-the low - ceilinged drawing - room to which undine had adapted [her]192-undine usual background of cushions , bric - a - brac and flowers -- since one must make [one]629-one 's setting " [home]548-home - like , "[629-one] however [little one]1820-little one 's habits happened to correspond with that particular effect . [Undine]192-undine , conscious of the intimate charm of [her]192-undine mise - en - scene , and of the recovered freshness and bloom which put [her]192-undine in harmony with it , had never been more sure of [her]192-undine power to keep [[her]192-undine friend]608-her friend in the desired state of adoring submission . But [Peter]231-van degen , as [he]488-her husband grew more adoring , became less submissive ; and there came a moment when [she]192-undine needed all [her]192-undine wits to save the situation . It was easy enough to rebuff [him]488-her husband , the easier as [his]488-her husband physical proximity always roused in [her]192-undine a vague instinct of resistance ; but it was hard so to temper the rebuff with promise that the game of suspense should still delude [him]488-her husband . [He]488-her husband put it to [her]192-undine at last , standing squarely before [her]192-undine , [his]488-her husband batrachian sallowness unpleasantly flushed , and [primitive man]1822-primitive man looking out of the eyes from which [a frock - coated gentleman]1823-a frock - coated gentleman usually pined at [her]192-undine . " Look here -- the installment plan 's all right ; but ai n't [you]192-undine a bit behind even on that ? "[1822-primitive man] ( [She]192-undine had brusquely eluded a nearer approach . ) " Anyhow , [I]1822-primitive man think [I]1822-primitive man 'd rather let the interest accumulate for a while . Why , when are [you]488-her husband sailing ? "[1822-primitive man] " On the first of April : good day for [a fool]4414-a fool to acknowledge [his]4414-a fool folly . [I]192-undine 'm beaten , and [I]192-undine 'm running away . "[192-undine] [She]192-undine sat looking down , [her]192-undine hand absently occupied with the twist of pearls [he]488-her husband had given [her]192-undine . In a flash [she]192-undine saw the peril of this departure . Once off on [the Sorceress]4194-the sorceress , [he]488-her husband was lost to [her]192-undine -- the power of old associations would prevail . Yet if [she]192-undine were as " nice "[192-undine] to [him]488-her husband as [he]488-her husband asked--"nice "[192-undine] enough to keep [him]488-her husband -- the end might not be much more to [her]192-undine advantage . Hitherto [she]192-undine had let [herself]192-undine drift on the current of [their]1825-their adventure , but [she]192-undine now saw what port [she]192-undine had half - unconsciously been trying for . Even that defective surface could not disfigure [her]192-undine , and [she]192-undine drew fresh hope from the sight of [her]192-undine beauty . "[192-undine] [XVIII Undine]192-undine stood alone on the landing outside [[[her]192-undine father]614-her father 's office]1883-her father 's office . Only once before had [she]192-undine failed to gain [her]192-undine end with [him]614-her father -- and there was a peculiar irony in the fact that [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's intrusion should have brought before [her]192-undine the providential result of [her]192-undine previous failure . Not that [she]192-undine confessed to any real resemblance between the two situations . In the present case [she]192-undine knew well enough what [she]192-undine wanted , and how to get it . But the analogy had served [[her]192-undine father]614-her father 's purpose , and [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's unlucky entrance had visibly strengthened [his]212-moffatt resistance . The worst of it was that the obstacles in the way were real enough . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had not put [her]192-undine off with vague asseverations -- somewhat against [her]192-undine will [he]191-mr. spragg had forced [his]191-mr. spragg proofs on [her]192-undine , showing [her]192-undine how much above [his]191-mr. spragg promised allowance [he]191-mr. spragg had contributed in the last three years to the support of [[her]192-undine household]1885-her household . Since [she]192-undine could not accuse [herself]192-undine of extravagance -- having still full faith in [her]192-undine gift of " managing"--she[192-undine] could only conclude that it was impossible to live on what [[her]192-undine father]614-her father and [Ralph]199-ralph could provide ; and this seemed a practical reason for desiring [her]192-undine freedom . If [she]192-undine and [Ralph]199-ralph parted [he]191-mr. spragg would of course return to [[his]191-mr. spragg family]504-his family , and [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg would no longer be burdened with [a helpless son]1888-a helpless son - in - law . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg did not regard divorce as intrinsically wrong or even inexpedient ; and of its social disadvantages [he]191-mr. spragg had never even heard . [Lots of women]1889-lots of women did it , as [Undine]192-undine said , and if [their]1889-lots of women reasons were adequate they were justified . The fact was characteristic . Under all [his]212-moffatt incalculableness there had always been a hard foundation of reliability : it seemed to be a matter of choice with [him]212-moffatt whether [he]212-moffatt let [one]629-one feel that solid bottom or not . " [[My]212-moffatt husband]4486-my husband ? Why , what can [he]4486-my husband do for [you]212-moffatt ? " By [Jove]309-jove , that 's [an amazing fellow]4489-an amazing fellow ! "[199-ralph] [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph exclaimed , turning back into [the drawing - room]439-the drawing - room , a few evenings later , at the conclusion of one of [their]1911-their little dinners . [He]212-moffatt seemed to have nothing to hold back : all the details of the prodigious exploit poured from [him]212-moffatt with Homeric volume . "[199-ralph] As [he]488-her husband leaned against the chimney - piece , lighting [his]488-her husband cigarette , it struck [Undine]192-undine that [he]488-her husband looked less fagged and lifeless than usual , and [she]192-undine felt more and more sure that something important had happened during the moment of isolation [she]192-undine had contrived . [She]192-undine opened and shut [her]192-undine fan reflectively . " Yes -- years ago ; [father]3817-father had some business with [him]488-her husband and brought [him]488-her husband [home]548-home to dinner one day . "[192-undine] " And [you]199-ralph 've never seen [him]488-her husband since ? "[192-undine] [She]192-undine waited , as if trying to piece [her]192-undine recollections together . " [I]192-undine suppose [I]192-undine must have ; but all that seems so long ago , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine said sighing . [She]192-undine had been given , of late , to such plaintive glances toward [her]192-undine happy girlhood but [Ralph]199-ralph seemed not to notice the allusion . " Do [you]192-undine know , "[488-her husband] [he]488-her husband exclaimed after a moment , " [I]488-her husband do n't believe [the fellow]4066-the fellow 's beaten yet . "[488-her husband] [She]192-undine looked up quickly . " Do n't [you]199-ralph ? "[488-her husband] " No ; and [I]192-undine could see that [Bowen]314-bowen did n't either . [He]314-bowen strikes [me]192-undine as the kind of man who develops slowly , needs a big field , and perhaps makes some big mistakes , but gets where [he]314-bowen wants to in the end . [Jove]309-jove , [I]192-undine wish [I]192-undine could put [him]314-bowen in a book ! There 's something epic about [him]314-bowen -- a kind of epic effrontery . "[192-undine] [Undine]192-undine 's pulses beat faster as [she]192-undine listened . Was it not what [Moffatt]212-moffatt had always said of [himself]212-moffatt -- that all [he]212-moffatt needed was time and elbow - room ? How odd that [Ralph]199-ralph , who seemed so dreamy and unobservant , should instantly have reached the same conclusion ! But what [she]192-undine wanted to know was the practical result of [their]1932-we meeting . " What did [you]199-ralph and [he]314-bowen talk about when [you]199-ralph were smoking ? "[192-undine] " Oh , [he]314-bowen got on [the Driscoll]201-driscoll fight again -- gave [us]1932-we some extraordinary details . [The man]1579-the man 's [a thundering brute]4495-a thundering brute , but [he]1579-the man 's full of observation and humour . Then , after [Bowen]314-bowen joined [you]199-ralph , [he]314-bowen told [me]1933-he about a new deal [he]314-bowen 's gone into -- rather a promising scheme , but on the same Titanic scale . "[1933-he] [He]1933-he paused , knowing [Undine]192-undine 's indifference to business matters ; but the face [she]192-undine turned to [him]1933-he was alive with interest . " [You]1933-he mean [you]1933-he might sell [the property]4497-the property to [him]314-bowen ? "[192-undine] " Well , if the thing comes off . There would be a big commission if [we]1932-we did . "[1933-he] [He]1933-he glanced down on [her]192-undine half ironically . " [You]1933-he 'd like that , would n't [you]1933-he ? "[1933-he] [She]192-undine answered with a shade of reproach : " Why do [you]1933-he say that ? [I]1933-he have n't complained . "[1933-he] " Oh , no ; but [I]192-undine know [I]192-undine 've been a disappointment as [a money - maker]4498-a money - maker . "[192-undine] [She]192-undine leaned back in [her]192-undine chair , closing [her]192-undine eyes as if in utter weariness and indifference , and in a moment [she]192-undine felt [him]1933-he bending over [her]192-undine . " What 's the matter ? Do n't [you]192-undine feel well ? "[1933-he] " [I]192-undine 'm a little tired . It 's nothing . "[192-undine] [She]192-undine pulled [her]192-undine hand away and burst into tears . [Ralph]199-ralph knelt down by [her]192-undine chair and put [his]1933-he arm about [her]192-undine . It was the first time [he]1933-he had touched [her]192-undine since the night of [the boy]4296-the boy 's birthday , and the sense of [her]192-undine softness woke a momentary warmth in [his]1933-he veins . " What is it , [dear]3838-dear ? What is it ? "[1933-he] Without turning [her]192-undine head [she]192-undine sobbed out : " [You]1933-he seem to think [I]192-undine 'm too selfish and odious -- that [I]192-undine 'm just pretending to be ill . "[192-undine] " No , no , "[1933-he] [he]1933-he assured [her]192-undine , smoothing back [her]192-undine hair . But [she]192-undine continued to sob on in a gradual crescendo of despair , till the vehemence of [her]192-undine weeping began to frighten [him]1933-he , and [he]1933-he drew [her]192-undine to [her]192-undine feet and tried to persuade [her]192-undine to let [herself]192-undine be led [upstairs]4364-upstairs . [She]192-undine yielded to [his]1933-he arm , sobbing in short exhausted gasps , and leaning [her]192-undine whole weight on [him]1933-he as [he]1933-he guided [her]192-undine along [the passage]538-the passage to [[her]192-undine bedroom]1181-her bedroom . On the lounge to which [he]1933-he lowered [her]192-undine [she]192-undine lay white and still , tears trickling through [her]192-undine lashes and [her]192-undine handkerchief pressed against [her]192-undine lips . [He]1933-he recognized the symptoms with a sinking heart : [she]192-undine was on the verge of a nervous attack such as [she]192-undine had had in the winter , and [he]1933-he foresaw with dismay the disastrous train of consequences , [the doctors]1810-the doctors ' and [nurses]1939-nurses ' bills , and all the attendant confusion and expense . If only [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's project might be realized -- if for once [he]1933-he could feel a round sum in [his]1933-he pocket , and be freed from the perpetual daily strain ! The next morning [Undine]192-undine , though calmer , was too weak to leave [her]192-undine bed , and [[her]192-undine doctor]1940-her doctor prescribed rest and absence of worry -- later , perhaps , a change of scene . [He]1933-he explained to [Ralph]199-ralph that nothing was so wearing to a high - strung nature as monotony , and that if [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph were contemplating a Newport season it was necessary that [she]192-undine should be fortified to meet it . In such cases [he]1933-he often recommended a dash to [Paris]76-paris or [London]83-london , just to tone up the nervous system . [Undine]192-undine regained [her]192-undine strength slowly , and as the days dragged on the suggestion of the European trip recurred with increasing frequency . But it came always from [[her]192-undine medical adviser]1941-her medical adviser : [she]192-undine [herself]192-undine had grown strangely passive and indifferent . [She]192-undine continued to remain [upstairs]4364-upstairs on [[her]192-undine lounge]1943-her lounge , seeing [no one]3844-no one but [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny , whose daily ministrations had once more been prescribed , and asking only that the noise of [Paul]218-paul 's play should be kept from [her]192-undine . [His]1933-he scamperings overhead disturbed [her]192-undine sleep , and [his]1933-he bed was moved into [the day nursery]1945-the day nursery , above [[[his]1933-he father]1946-his father 's room]1947-his father 's room . [The child]1948-the child 's early romping did not trouble [Ralph]199-ralph , since [he]1933-he [himself]1933-he was always awake before daylight . The days were not long enough to hold [his]1933-he cares , and [they]1949-they came and stood by [him]1933-he through the silent hours , when there was no other sound to drown [their]1949-they voices . [Ralph]199-ralph had not made a success of [his]1933-he business . [The real - estate brokers who had taken [him]1933-he into partnership]1950-the real - estate brokers who had taken him into partnership had done so only with the hope of profiting by [his]1933-he social connections ; and in this respect the alliance had been a failure . It was in such directions that [he]1933-he most lacked facility , and so far [he]1933-he had been of use to [[his]1933-he partners]1951-his partners only as an office - drudge . [He]1933-he was resigned to the continuance of such drudgery , though all [his]1933-he powers cried out against it ; but even for the routine of business [his]1933-he aptitude was small , and [he]1933-he began to feel that [he]1933-he was not considered an addition to [the firm]1952-the firm . The difficulty of finding another opening made [him]1933-he fear a break ; and [his]1933-he thoughts turned hopefully to [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt 's hint of a " deal . "[212-moffatt] The success of the negotiation might bring advantages beyond the immediate pecuniary profit ; and that , at the present juncture , was important enough in itself . [Moffatt]212-moffatt reappeared two days after the dinner , presenting [himself]212-moffatt in [West End Avenue]11-west end avenue in the late afternoon with the explanation that the business in hand necessitated discretion , and that [he]212-moffatt preferred not to be seen in [[Ralph]199-ralph 's office]1953-ralph 's office . It was a question of negotiating with the utmost privacy for the purchase of [a small strip of land]1954-a small strip of land between [two large plots already acquired by [purchasers]1955-purchasers cautiously designated by [Moffatt]212-moffatt as [his]212-moffatt " parties]4500-two large plots already acquired by purchasers cautiously designated by moffatt as his " parties . "[1933-he] How far [he]1933-he " stood in "[199-ralph] with [the parties]1956-the parties [he]1933-he left it to [Ralph]199-ralph to conjecture ; but it was plain that [he]1933-he had a large stake in the transaction , and that it offered [him]1933-he [his]1933-he first chance of recovering [himself]1933-he since [Driscoll]201-driscoll had " thrown "[212-moffatt] [him]1933-he . [The owners of [the coveted plot]1958-the coveted plot]1957-the owners of the coveted plot did not seem anxious to sell , and there were personal reasons for [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's not approaching [them]1957-the owners of the coveted plot through [[Ralph]199-ralph 's partners]1959-ralph 's partners , who were [the regular agents of [the estate]1961-the estate]1960-the regular agents of the estate : so that [Ralph]199-ralph 's acquaintance with the conditions , combined with [his]1933-he detachments from the case , marked [him]1933-he out as [a useful intermediary]1962-a useful intermediary . [Their]1963-their first talk left [Ralph]199-ralph with a dazzled sense of [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's strength and keenness , but with a vague doubt as to the " straightness "[1933-he] of the proposed transaction . [Ralph]199-ralph had never seen [his]1933-he way clearly in that dim underworld of affairs where [men of the Moffatt]1964-men of the moffatt and [Driscoll]201-driscoll type moved like shadowy destructive monsters beneath the darting small fry of the surface . [He]1933-he knew that " business "[1933-he] has created its own special morality ; and [his]1933-he musings on [man]728-man 's relation to [his]1933-he self imposed laws had shown [him]1933-he how little human conduct is generally troubled about its own sanctions . [He]1933-he had a vivid sense of the things [[a man]932-a man of [his]1933-he kind]1967-a man of his kind did n't do ; but [his]1933-he inability to get a mental grasp on large financial problems made it hard to apply to [them]1968-them so simple a measure as this inherited standard . [He]1933-he only knew , as [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's plan developed , that it seemed all right while [he]1933-he talked of it with [its originator]1969-its originator , but vaguely wrong when [he]1933-he thought it over afterward . It occurred to [him]1933-he to consult [[his]1933-he grandfather]949-his grandfather ; and if [he]1933-he renounced the idea for the obvious reason that [Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet 's ignorance of business was as fathomless as [his]1933-he own , this was not [his]1933-he sole motive . Finally it occurred to [him]1933-he to put the case hypothetically to [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg . As far as [Ralph]199-ralph knew , [[his]1933-he father - in - law]1041-his father - in - law 's business record was unblemished ; yet [one]629-one felt in [him]1933-he an elasticity of adjustment not allowed for in the Dagonet code . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg listened thoughtfully to [Ralph]199-ralph 's statement of the case , growling out here and there a tentative correction , and turning [his]191-mr. spragg cigar between [his]191-mr. spragg lips as [he]191-mr. spragg seemed to turn the problem over in the loose grasp of [his]191-mr. spragg mind . [Ralph]199-ralph 's fancy wandered off on a long trail of speculation from which [he]1041-his father - in - law was pulled back with a jerk by the need of immediate action . [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's " deal "[1041-his father - in - law] could not wait : quick decisions were essential to effective action , and brooding over ethical shades of difference might work more ill than good in a world committed to swift adjustments . The arrival of [several unforeseen bills]1985-several unforeseen bills confirmed this view , and once [Ralph]199-ralph had adopted it [he]1041-his father - in - law began to take a detached interest in the affair . In [Paris]76-paris , in [his]1041-his father - in - law younger days , [he]1041-his father - in - law had once attended a lesson in acting given at [the Conservatoire]1986-the conservatoire by [one of the great lights of [the theatre]678-the theatre]1987-one of the great lights of the theatre , and had seen an apparently uncomplicated role of the classic repertory , familiar to [him]1041-his father - in - law through repeated performances , taken to pieces before [his]1041-his father - in - law eyes , dissolved into its component elements , and built up again with a minuteness of elucidation and a range of reference that made [him]1041-his father - in - law feel as though [he]1041-his father - in - law had been let into the secret of some age - long natural process . As [he]1041-his father - in - law listened to [Moffatt]212-moffatt the remembrance of that lesson came back to [him]1041-his father - in - law . At the outset the " deal , "[212-moffatt] and [his]1041-his father - in - law own share in it , had seemed simple enough : [he]1041-his father - in - law would have put on [his]1041-his father - in - law hat and gone out on the spot in the full assurance of being able to transact the affair . The affair was in fact difficult and complex , and [Moffatt]212-moffatt saw at once just where the difficulties lay and how the personal idiosyncrasies of " the parties "[212-moffatt] affected [them]1991-them . Such insight fascinated [Ralph]199-ralph , and [he]1041-his father - in - law strayed off into wondering why it did not qualify [every financier]1992-every financier to be [a novelist]1993-a novelist , and what intrinsic barrier divided the two arts . [Both men]1994-both men had strong incentives for hastening the affair ; and within a fortnight after [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's first advance [Ralph]199-ralph was able to tell [him]1041-his father - in - law that [his]1041-his father - in - law offer was accepted . " Well , [I]191-mr. spragg 'd let [her]192-undine do it this time -- [I'd]191-mr. spragg let [her]192-undine do it , "[191-mr. spragg] [he]191-mr. spragg said as [he]191-mr. spragg turned down [the steps of [the Subway]736-the subway]2007-the steps of the subway . [Ralph]199-ralph was surprised , for [he]191-mr. spragg had gathered from some frightened references of [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's that [[Undine]192-undine 's parents]494-undine 's parents had wind of [her]192-undine European plan and were strongly opposed to it . [He]191-mr. spragg concluded that [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had long since measured the extent of profitable resistance , and knew just when it became vain to hold out against [[his]191-mr. spragg daughter]500-his daughter or advise [others]807-others to do so . [Ralph]199-ralph , for [his]191-mr. spragg own part , had no inclination to resist . As [he]191-mr. spragg left [[Moffatt]212-moffatt 's office]1897-moffatt 's office [his]191-mr. spragg inmost feeling was one of relief . [He]191-mr. spragg had reached the point of recognizing that it was best for both that [[his]191-mr. spragg wife]512-his wife should go . When [she]512-his wife returned perhaps [their]2014-their lives would readjust [themselves]2014-their -- but for the moment [he]191-mr. spragg longed for some kind of benumbing influence , something that should give relief to the dull daily ache of feeling [her]512-his wife so near and yet so inaccessible . Certainly there were more urgent uses for [their]2014-their brilliant wind - fall : heavy arrears of household debts had to be met , and the summer would bring its own burden . But perhaps another stroke of luck might befall [him]191-mr. spragg : [he]191-mr. spragg was getting to have the drifting dependence on " luck "[192-undine] of [the man]1579-the man conscious of [his]191-mr. spragg inability to direct [his]191-mr. spragg life . And meanwhile it seemed easier to let [Undine]192-undine have what [she]192-undine wanted . [Undine]192-undine , on the whole , behaved with discretion . [She]192-undine received the good news languidly and showed no unseemly haste to profit by it . But it was as hard to hide the light in [her]192-undine eyes as to dissemble the fact that [she]192-undine had not only thought out every detail of the trip in advance , but had decided exactly how [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband and [son]2017-son were to be disposed of in [her]192-undine absence . [Her]192-undine suggestion that [Ralph]199-ralph should take [Paul]218-paul to [[his]191-mr. spragg grandparents]2018-his grandparents , and that [the West End Avenue house]2019-the west end avenue house should be let for the summer , was too practical not to be acted on ; and [Ralph]199-ralph found [she]192-undine had already put [her]192-undine hand on the [Harry Lipscombs]227-the lipscombs , who , after three years of neglect , were to be dragged back to favour and made to feel , as the first step in [their]2020-their reinstatement , the necessity of hiring for the summer months [a cool airy house on [the West Side]21-the west side]2021-a cool airy house on the west side . On [her]192-undine return from [Europe]29-europe , [Undine]192-undine explained , [she]192-undine would of course go straight to [Ralph]199-ralph and [the boy]4296-the boy in [the Adirondacks]98-the adirondacks ; and it seemed a foolish extravagance to let [the house]623-the house stand empty when [the Lipscombs]227-the lipscombs were so eager to take it . As the day of departure approached it became harder for [her]192-undine to temper [her]192-undine beams ; but [her]192-undine pleasure showed itself so amiably that [Ralph]199-ralph began to think [she]192-undine might , after all , miss [the boy]4296-the boy and [himself]4296-the boy more than [she]192-undine imagined . [She]192-undine was tenderly preoccupied with [Paul]218-paul 's welfare , and , to prepare for [his]4296-the boy translation to [[his]4296-the boy grandparents]2018-his grandparents ' [she]192-undine gave [the household in [Washington]36-washington Square]2026-the household in washington square more of [her]192-undine time than [she]192-undine had accorded it since [her]192-undine marriage . [She]192-undine explained that [she]192-undine wanted [Paul]218-paul to grow used to [his]4296-the boy new surroundings ; and with that object [she]192-undine took [him]4296-the boy frequently to [[his]4296-the boy grandmother]4297-his grandmother 's , and won [her]192-undine way into [old Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet 's sympathies by [her]192-undine devotion to [the child]1948-the child and [her]192-undine pretty way of joining in [his]256-mr. dagonet games . [Undine]192-undine was not consciously acting a part : this new phase was as natural to [her]192-undine as the other . In the joy of [her]192-undine gratified desires [she]192-undine wanted to make [everybody]3748-everybody about [her]192-undine happy . If only [everyone]2030-everyone would do as [she]192-undine wished [she]192-undine would never be unreasonable . [She]192-undine much preferred to see smiling faces about [her]192-undine , and [her]192-undine dread of the reproachful and dissatisfied countenance gave the measure of what [she]192-undine would do to avoid it . These thoughts were in [her]192-undine mind when , a day or two before sailing , [she]192-undine came out of [the Washington Square house]2031-the washington square house with [[her]192-undine boy]1665-her boy . It was a late spring afternoon , and [she]192-undine and [Paul]218-paul had lingered on till long past the hour sacred to [[his]1665-her boy grandfather]949-his grandfather 's nap . Now , as [she]192-undine came out into [the square]2034-the square [she]192-undine saw that , however well [Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet had borne [their]2035-their protracted romp , it had left [[his]256-mr. dagonet playmate]2036-his playmate flushed and sleepy ; and [she]192-undine lifted [Paul]218-paul in [her]192-undine arms to carry [him]1665-her boy to [the nearest cab - stand]2037-the nearest cab - stand . As [she]192-undine raised [herself]192-undine [she]192-undine saw a thick - set figure approaching [her]192-undine across [the square]2034-the square ; and a moment later [she]192-undine was shaking hands with [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt . In the bright spring air [he]1665-her boy looked seasonably glossy and prosperous ; and [she]192-undine noticed that [he]1665-her boy wore a bunch of violets in [his]1665-her boy buttonhole . [His]1665-her boy small black eyes twinkled with approval as they rested on [her]192-undine , and [Undine]192-undine reflected that , with [Paul]218-paul 's arms about [her]192-undine neck , and [his]1665-her boy little flushed face against [her]192-undine own , [she]192-undine must present a not unpleasing image of [young motherhood]2039-young motherhood . " That [the heir apparent]4516-the heir apparent ? " [He]4296-the boy 's been spending the afternoon with [[his]4296-the boy grandfather]949-his grandfather , and [they]4519-they played so hard that [he]4296-the boy 's sleepy , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine explained . [Little Paul]218-paul , at that stage in [his]1665-her boy career , had a peculiar grace of wide - gazing deep - lashed eyes and arched cherubic lips , and [Undine]192-undine saw that [Moffatt]212-moffatt was not insensible to the picture [she]192-undine and [[her]192-undine son]1095-her son composed . [She]192-undine did not dislike [his]212-moffatt admiration , for [she]192-undine no longer felt any shrinking from [him]212-moffatt -- [she]192-undine would even have been glad to thank [him]212-moffatt for the service [he]212-moffatt had done [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband if [she]192-undine had known how to allude to it without awkwardness . " [He]212-moffatt 's [a mighty fine fellow]4520-a mighty fine fellow and no mistake -- but is n't [he]212-moffatt rather an armful for [you]192-undine ? "[212-moffatt] The quick blood rushed to [her]192-undine cheeks . "[212-moffatt] [Apex]192-undine was too remote for [her]192-undine to understand the reference , and [he]212-moffatt went on : " Why , [[Millard Binch]272-millard binch 's wife]4538-millard binch 's wife -- [Indiana Frusk]216-indiana frusk that was . "[212-moffatt] " Oh-- "[192-undine] [she]192-undine stammered with a laugh , astonished and agitated by [his]212-moffatt news . [Indiana Frusk]216-indiana frusk and [Rolliver]284-james j. rolliver ! It showed how easily the thing could be done . If only [[her]216-indiana frusk father]614-her father had listened to [her]216-indiana frusk ! XIX " [The Parisian Diamond Company]4542-the parisian diamond company -- [Anglo - American branch]4543-anglo - american branch . "[314-bowen] [Charles Bowen]314-bowen , seated , one rainy evening of the [Paris]76-paris season , in [a corner of [the great Nouveau Luxe restaurant]2066-the great nouveau luxe restaurant]2065-a corner of the great nouveau luxe restaurant , was lazily trying to resolve [his]314-bowen impressions of the scene into the phrases of a letter to [[his]314-bowen old friend]2067-his old friend [Mrs. Henley Fairford]204-mrs. fairford . The long habit of unwritten communion with [this lady]2068-this lady -- in no way conditioned by the short rare letters [they]2069-they actually exchanged -- usually caused [his]314-bowen notations , in absence , to fall into such terms when [the subject]2070-the subject was of a kind to strike an answering flash from [her]2068-this lady . And who but [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford would see , from [his]314-bowen own precise angle , the fantastic improbability , the layers on layers of unsubstantialness , on which the seemingly solid scene before [him]314-bowen rested ? [The dining - room of [the Nouveau Luxe]2072-the nouveau luxe]2071-the dining - room of the nouveau luxe was at its fullest , and , having contracted on the garden side through stress of weather , had even overflowed to the farther end of [the long hall beyond]2073-the long hall beyond ; so that [Bowen]314-bowen , from [his]314-bowen corner , surveyed a seemingly endless perspective of plumed and jewelled heads , of shoulders bare or black - coated , encircling the close - packed tables . [He]314-bowen had come half an hour before the time [he]314-bowen had named to [[his]314-bowen expected guest]2074-his expected guest , so that [he]314-bowen might have the undisturbed amusement of watching the picture compose itself again before [his]314-bowen eyes . During some forty years ' perpetual exercise of [his]314-bowen perceptions [he]314-bowen had never come across anything that gave [them]2075-them the special titillation produced by the sight of the dinner - hour at [the Nouveau Luxe]102-the nouveau luxe : the same sense of putting [his]314-bowen hand on human nature 's passion for the factitious , its incorrigible habit of imitating the imitation . As [he]314-bowen sat watching the familiar faces swept toward [him]314-bowen on the rising tide of arrival -- for it was one of the joys of the scene that [the type]2076-the type was always the same even when [the individual]2077-the individual was not -- [he]314-bowen hailed with renewed appreciation this costly expression of a social ideal . [The dining - room at the Nouveau Luxe]2078-the dining - room at the nouveau luxe represented , on such a spring evening , what unbounded material power had devised for the delusion of its leisure : a phantom " society , "[2079-its] with all the rules , smirks , gestures of [its]2079-its model , but evoked out of promiscuity and incoherence while [the other had been the product of continuity and choice]2080-the other had been the product of continuity and choice . And the instinct which had driven [a new class of world - compellers]2081-a new class of world - compellers to bind [themselves]2081-a new class of world - compellers to slavish imitation of the superseded , and [their]2081-a new class of world - compellers prompt and reverent faith in the reality of the sham [they]2081-a new class of world - compellers had created , seemed to [Bowen]314-bowen the most satisfying proof of human permanence . With this thought in [his]314-bowen mind [he]314-bowen looked up to greet [[his]314-bowen guest]2082-his guest . [The Comte [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond , straight , slim and gravely smiling]382-raymond , came toward [him]314-bowen with frequent pauses of salutation at the crowded tables ; saying , as [he]382-raymond seated [himself]382-raymond and turned [his]382-raymond pleasant eyes on the scene : " Il n'y a pas dire , [[my]382-raymond dear]4259-my dear [Bowen]314-bowen , it 's charming and sympathetic and original -- [we]4545-we owe [America]77-america a debt of gratitude for inventing it ! "[382-raymond] [Bowen]314-bowen felt a last touch of satisfaction : they were the very words to complete [his]314-bowen thought . " [[My]382-raymond dear fellow]3974-my dear fellow , it 's really [you]314-bowen and [[your]314-bowen kind]4547-your kind who are responsible . It 's the direct creation of feudalism , like all the great social upheavals ! "[382-raymond] [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond stroked [his]382-raymond handsome brown moustache . " [I]314-bowen should have said , on the contrary , that [one]629-one enjoyed it for the contrast . It 's such a refreshing change from [our]4545-we institutions -- which are , nevertheless , the necessary foundations of [society]3945-society . But just as [one]629-one may have an infinite admiration for [[one]629-one 's wife]4552-one 's wife , and yet occasionally-- "[314-bowen] [he]314-bowen waved a light hand toward the spectacle . " This , in the social order , is the diversion , the permitted diversion , that [your]314-bowen original race has devised : a kind of superior Bohemia , where [one]629-one may be respectable without being bored . "[314-bowen] [Bowen]314-bowen laughed . " [You]314-bowen 've put it in a nutshell : the ideal of [the American woman]4554-the american woman is to be respectable without being bored ; and from that point of view this world [they]4554-the american woman 've invented has more originality than [I]314-bowen gave it credit for . "[314-bowen] [Chelles]382-raymond thoughtfully unfolded [his]382-raymond napkin . " [My]314-bowen impression 's a superficial one , of course -- for as to what goes on underneath-- ! "[314-bowen] [He]314-bowen looked across [the room]441-the room . " If [I]314-bowen married [I]314-bowen should n't care to have [[my]314-bowen wife]4218-my wife come [here]3758-here too often . "[314-bowen] [Bowen]314-bowen laughed again . " [She]4218-my wife 'd be as safe as in [a bank]4557-a bank ! Nothing ever goes on ! Nothing that ever happens here is real . "[314-bowen] " Ah , quant cela-- "[2084-the frenchman] [the Frenchman]2084-the frenchman murmured , inserting a fork into [his]2084-the frenchman melon . [Bowen]314-bowen looked at [him]2084-the frenchman with enjoyment -- [he]2084-the frenchman was such a precious foot - note to the page ! [The two men]1250-the two men , accidentally thrown together some years previously during a trip up [the Nile]103-the nile , always met again with pleasure when [Bowen]314-bowen returned to [France]104-france . [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond , who came of [a family of moderate fortune]2086-a family of moderate fortune , lived for the greater part of the year on [[[his]382-raymond father]1946-his father 's estates in [Burgundy]105-burgundy]2088-his father 's estates in burgundy ; but [he]382-raymond came up every spring to [the entresol of [the old Marquis 's hotel]2090-the old marquis 's hotel]2089-the entresol of the old marquis 's hotel for a two months ' study of human nature , applying to the pursuit the discriminating taste and transient ardour that give the finest bloom to pleasure . [Bowen]314-bowen liked [him]382-raymond as [a companion]2091-a companion and admired [him]382-raymond as [a charming specimen of [the Frenchman of [his]382-raymond class]2093-the frenchman of his class , embodying in [[his]382-raymond lean , fatigued and finished person]2094-his lean , fatigued and finished person that happy mean of simplicity and intelligence of which [no other race]2095-no other race has found the secret]2092-a charming specimen of the frenchman of his class , embodying in his lean , fatigued and finished person that happy mean of simplicity and intelligence of which no other race has found the secret . If [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond had been [English]2096-english [he]382-raymond would have been a mere fox - hunting animal , with appetites but without tastes ; but in [his]382-raymond lighter Gallic clay the wholesome territorial savour , the inherited passion for sport and agriculture , were blent with an openness to finer sensations , a sense of the come - and - go of ideas , under which one felt the tight hold of two or three inherited notions , religious , political , and domestic , in total contradiction to [his]382-raymond surface attitude . That the inherited notions would in the end prevail , everything in [his]382-raymond appearance declared from the distinguished slant of [his]382-raymond nose to the narrow forehead under [his]382-raymond thinning hair ; [he]382-raymond was [the kind of man who would inevitably " revert "[2097-the kind of man who would inevitably " revert " when he married] when [he]382-raymond married]2097-the kind of man who would inevitably " revert " when he married . But meanwhile the surface [he]382-raymond presented to the play of life was broad enough to take in the fantastic spectacle of the Nouveau Luxe ; and to see its gestures reflected in a Latin consciousness was an endless entertainment to [Bowen]314-bowen . The tone of [[his]382-raymond guest]2082-his guest 's last words made [him]314-bowen take them up . " But is [the lady]593-the lady [you]382-raymond allude to more than a hypothesis ? Surely [you]382-raymond 're not thinking of getting married ? "[382-raymond] [Chelles]382-raymond raised [his]382-raymond eye - brows ironically . " When has n't one to think of it , in [my]382-raymond situation ? [One]629-one hears of nothing else at [home]548-home -- [one]629-one knows that , like death , it has to come . "[382-raymond] [His]382-raymond glance , which was still mustering [the room]441-the room , came to a sudden pause and kindled . " Who 's [the lady over there]4562-the lady over there -- fair - haired , in white -- the one who 's just come in with [the red - faced man]4563-the red - faced man ? [They]4564-they seem to be with [a party of [[your]314-bowen compatriots]4566-your compatriots]4565-a party of your compatriots . "[382-raymond] [Bowen]314-bowen followed [his]382-raymond glance to a neighbouring table , where , at the moment , [Undine Marvell]192-undine was seating [herself]192-undine at [Peter Van Degen]231-van degen 's side , in the company of [the Harvey Shallums]298-the shallums , [the beautiful [Mrs. Beringer]307-mrs. beringer and [a dozen other New York figures]2101-a dozen other new york figures]2100-the beautiful mrs. beringer and a dozen other new york figures . [She]192-undine was so placed that as [she]192-undine took [her]192-undine seat [she]192-undine recognized [Bowen]314-bowen and sent [him]314-bowen a smile across the tables . [She]192-undine was more simply dressed than usual , and the pink lights , warming [her]192-undine cheeks and striking gleams from [her]192-undine hair , gave [her]192-undine face a dewy freshness that was new to [Bowen]314-bowen . [He]314-bowen had always thought [her]192-undine beauty too obvious , too bathed in the bright publicity of the American air ; but to - night [she]192-undine seemed to have been brushed by the wing of poetry , and its shadow lingered in [her]192-undine eyes . [Chelles]382-raymond ' gaze made it evident that [he]314-bowen had received the same impression . " [One]629-one is sometimes inclined to deny [[your]314-bowen compatriots]4566-your compatriots actual beauty -- to charge [them]4566-your compatriots with producing the effect without having the features ; but in this case -- [you]314-bowen say [you]314-bowen know [the lady]593-the lady ? "[314-bowen] " Yes : [she]593-the lady 's [the wife of [an old friend]4571-an old friend]4570-the wife of an old friend . "[382-raymond] " [The wife]4572-the wife ? [She]4572-the wife 's married ? There , again , it 's so puzzling ! [[Your]314-bowen young girls]4573-your young girls look so experienced , and [[your]314-bowen married women]4574-your married women sometimes so -- unmarried . "[2102-the other] " Well , [they]4574-your married women often are -- in these days of divorce ! "[2102-the other] [The other]2102-the other 's interest quickened . " [[Your]314-bowen friend]3879-your friend 's divorced ? "[2102-the other] " Oh , no ; heaven forbid ! [Mrs. Marvell]192-undine has n't been long married ; and it was a love - match of the good old kind . "[2102-the other] " Ah -- and [the husband]4576-the husband ? Which is [he]4576-the husband ? "[2102-the other] " [He]4576-the husband 's not [here]3758-here -- [he]4576-the husband 's in [New York]8-new york . "[2102-the other] " Feverishly adding to a fortune already monstrous ? "[2102-the other] " No ; not precisely monstrous . [The Marvells]202-the marvells are not well off , "[314-bowen] said [Bowen]314-bowen , amused by [[his]314-bowen friend]609-his friend 's interrogations . " And [he]4576-the husband allows [an exquisite being like that]4578-an exquisite being like that to come to [Paris]76-paris without [him]4576-the husband -- and in company with [the red - faced gentleman who seems so alive to [his]4576-the husband advantages]4579-the red - faced gentleman who seems so alive to his advantages ? "[314-bowen] " [We]4580-we do n't ' allow ' [[our]4580-we women]4322-our women this or that ; [I]912-his companion do n't think [we]4580-we set much store by the compulsory virtues . "[382-raymond] [Chelles]382-raymond laughed again ; but [his]382-raymond straying eye still followed the same direction , and [Bowen]314-bowen noticed that the fact was not unremarked by the object of [his]382-raymond contemplation . [Undine]192-undine 's party was one of the liveliest in [the room]441-the room : the American laugh rose above the din of the orchestra as the American toilets dominated the less daring effects at the other tables . [Undine]192-undine , on entering , had seemed to be in the same mood as [[her]192-undine companions]662-her companions ; but [Bowen]314-bowen saw that , as [she]192-undine became conscious of [[his]314-bowen friend]609-his friend 's observation , [she]192-undine isolated [herself]192-undine in a kind of soft abstraction ; and [he]314-bowen admired the adaptability which enabled [her]192-undine to draw from such surroundings the contrasting graces of reserve . [They]2108-they had greeted [each other]3877-each other with all the outer signs of cordiality , but [Bowen]314-bowen fancied [she]192-undine would not care to have [him]314-bowen speak to [her]192-undine . [She]192-undine was evidently dining with [Van Degen]231-van degen , and [Van Degen]231-van degen 's proximity was the last fact [she]192-undine would wish to have transmitted to [the critics in [Washington Square]2-washington square]2110-the critics in washington square . [Bowen]314-bowen was therefore surprised when , as [he]314-bowen rose to leave [the restaurant]716-the restaurant , [he]314-bowen heard [himself]314-bowen hailed by [Peter]231-van degen . " [Hallo]252-hallo -- hold on ! When did [you]192-undine come over ? [Mrs. Marvell]192-undine 's dying for the last news about [the old homestead]4583-the old homestead . "[231-van degen] [Undine]192-undine 's smile confirmed the appeal . [She]192-undine wanted to know how lately [Bowen]314-bowen had left [New York]8-new york , and pressed [him]314-bowen to tell [her]192-undine when [he]314-bowen had last seen [[her]192-undine boy]1665-her boy , how [he]314-bowen was looking , and whether [Ralph]199-ralph had been persuaded to go down to [Clare]228-clare 's on Saturdays and get a little riding and tennis ? And dear [Laura]203-laura -- was [she]192-undine well too , and was [Paul]218-paul with [her]192-undine , or still with [[his]314-bowen grandmother]4297-his grandmother ? [They]2114-they were [all dreadfully bad correspondents]2115-all dreadfully bad correspondents , and so was [she]192-undine . [Undine]192-undine laughingly admitted ; and when [Ralph]199-ralph had last written [her]192-undine these questions had still been undecided . As [she]192-undine smiled up at [Bowen]314-bowen [he]314-bowen saw [her]192-undine glance stray to the spot where [[his]314-bowen companion]912-his companion hovered ; and when [the diners]2117-the diners rose to move toward [the garden]2118-the garden for coffee [she]192-undine said , with a sweet note and a detaining smile : " Do come with [us]2117-the diners -- [I]192-undine have n't half finished . "[192-undine] [Van Degen]228-clare echoed the request , and [Bowen]314-bowen , amused by [Undine]192-undine 's arts , was presently introducing [Chelles]382-raymond , and joining with [him]382-raymond in [the party]2119-the party 's transit to [the terrace]2120-the terrace . The rain had ceased , and under the clear evening sky [the restaurant garden]2121-the restaurant garden opened green depths that skilfully hid [its]2121-the restaurant garden narrow boundaries . [[Van Degen]228-clare 's company]2122-van degen 's company was large enough to surround two of the tables on [the terrace]2120-the terrace , and [Bowen]314-bowen noted the skill with which [Undine]192-undine , leaving [him]382-raymond to [Mrs. Shallum]293-mrs. shallum 's care , contrived to draw [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond to the other table . Still more noticeable was the effect of this stratagem on [Van Degen]228-clare , who also found [himself]382-raymond relegated to [[Mrs. Shallum]293-mrs. shallum 's group]2124-mrs. shallum 's group . Poor [Peter]231-van degen 's state was betrayed by the irascibility which wreaked itself on [a jostling waiter]2125-a jostling waiter , and found cause for loud remonstrance in the coldness of the coffee and the badness of the cigars ; and [Bowen]314-bowen , with something more than the curiosity of [the looker - on]2126-the looker - on , wondered whether this were the real clue to [Undine]192-undine 's conduct . [He]314-bowen had always smiled at [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford 's fears for [Ralph]199-ralph 's domestic peace . [He]314-bowen thought [Undine]192-undine too clear - headed to forfeit the advantages of [her]192-undine marriage ; but it now struck [him]314-bowen that [she]192-undine might have had a glimpse of larger opportunities . [Bowen]314-bowen , at the thought , felt the pang of the sociologist over the individual havoc wrought by every social readjustment : it had so long been clear to [him]314-bowen that poor [Ralph]199-ralph was a survival , and destined , as such , to go down in any conflict with [the rising forces]2127-the rising forces . XX Some six weeks later . [Undine Marvell]192-undine stood at the window smiling down on [her]192-undine recovered [Paris]76-paris . [[Her]192-undine hotel sitting - room]2128-her hotel sitting - room had , as usual , been flowered , cushioned and lamp - shaded into a delusive semblance of stability ; and [she]192-undine had really felt , for the last few weeks , that the life [she]192-undine was leading there must be going to last -- it seemed so perfect an answer to all [her]192-undine wants ! As [she]192-undine looked out at [the thronged street]2129-the thronged street , on which the summer light lay like a blush of pleasure , [she]192-undine felt [herself]192-undine naturally akin to all the bright and careless freedom of the scene . [She]192-undine had been away from [Paris]76-paris for two days , and the spectacle before [her]192-undine seemed more rich and suggestive after [her]192-undine brief absence from it . [Her]192-undine senses luxuriated in all its material details : [the thronging motors]2130-the thronging motors , [the brilliant shops]2131-the brilliant shops , the novelty and daring of [the women]4349-the women 's dresses , the piled - up colours of the ambulant flower - carts , the appetizing expanse of [the fruiterers]2133-the fruiterers ' windows , even the chromatic effects of the petits fours behind the plate - glass of [the pastry - cooks]2134-the pastry - cooks : all the surface - sparkle and variety of [the inexhaustible streets of [Paris]76-paris]2135-the inexhaustible streets of paris . The scene before [her]192-undine typified to [Undine]192-undine [her]192-undine first real taste of life . How meagre and starved the past appeared in comparison with this abundant present ! The noise , the crowd , the promiscuity beneath [her]192-undine eyes symbolized the glare and movement of [her]192-undine life . Every moment of [her]192-undine days was packed with excitement and exhilaration . Everything amused [her]192-undine : the long hours of bargaining and debate with [dress - makers]2136-dress - makers and [jewellers]2137-jewellers , the crowded lunches at [fashionable restaurants]1484-fashionable restaurants , the perfunctory dash through a picture - show or the lingering visit to [the last new milliner]2139-the last new milliner ; the afternoon motor - rush to [some leafy suburb]2140-some leafy suburb , where tea and musics and sunset were hastily absorbed on [a crowded terrace above [the Seine]106-the seine]2141-a crowded terrace above the seine ; the whirl home through [the Bois]107-the bois to dress for dinner and start again on the round of evening diversions ; the dinner at [the Nouveau Luxe]2072-the nouveau luxe or [the Caf de [Paris]76-paris]2143-the caf de paris , and the little play at [the Capucines]108-the capucines or [the Varits]2144-the varits , followed , because the night was " too lovely , "[None-None] and it was a shame to waste it , by a breathless flight back to [the Bois]107-the bois , with supper in one of [[its]107-the bois lamp - hung restaurants]2145-its lamp - hung restaurants , or , if the weather forbade , a tumultuous progress through the midnight haunts where " [ladies]4255-ladies "[488-her husband] were not supposed to show [themselves]2146-themselves , and might consequently taste the thrill of being occasionally taken for [their]2146-themselves opposites . As the varied vision unrolled itself , [Undine]192-undine contrasted it with the pale monotony of [her]192-undine previous summers . The one [she]192-undine most resented was the first after [her]192-undine marriage , the European summer out of whose joys [she]192-undine had been cheated by [her]192-undine own ignorance and [Ralph]199-ralph 's perversity . [They]2147-their had been free then , there had been [no child]2148-no child to hamper [their]2147-their movements , [their]2147-their money anxieties had hardly begun , the face of life had been fresh and radiant , and [she]192-undine had been doomed to waste such opportunities on a succession of ill - smelling [Italian towns]2149-italian towns . [She]192-undine still felt it to be [her]192-undine deepest grievance against [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband ; and now that , after four years of petty household worries , another chance of escape had come , [he]488-her husband already wanted to drag [her]192-undine back to bondage ! This fit of retrospection had been provoked by two letters which had come that morning . One was from [Ralph]199-ralph , who began by reminding [her]192-undine that [he]488-her husband had not heard from [her]192-undine for weeks , and went on to point out , in [his]488-her husband usual tone of good - humoured remonstrance , that since [her]192-undine departure the drain on [her]192-undine letter of credit had been deep and constant . " [I]488-her husband wanted [you]192-undine , "[488-her husband] [he]488-her husband wrote , " to get all the fun [you]192-undine could out of the money [I]192-undine made last spring ; but [I]192-undine did n't think [you]192-undine 'd get through it quite so fast . Try to come [home]548-home without leaving too many bills behind [you]192-undine . [Your]192-undine illness and [Paul]218-paul 's cost more than [I]192-undine expected , and [Lipscomb]200-mabel has had a bad knock in [Wall Street]47-wall street , and has n't yet paid [his]488-her husband first quarter ... "[192-undine] Always the same monotonous refrain ! Was it [her]192-undine fault that [she]192-undine and [the boy]4296-the boy had been ill ? Or that [Harry Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb had been " on the wrong side "[192-undine] of [Wall Street]47-wall street ? [Ralph]199-ralph seemed to have money on the brain : [his]488-her husband business life had certainly deteriorated [him]488-her husband . And , since [he]488-her husband had n't made a success of it after all , why should n't [he]488-her husband turn back to literature and try to write [his]488-her husband novel ? [Undine]192-undine , the previous winter , had been dazzled by the figures which [a well - known magazine editor]2152-a well - known magazine editor , whom [she]192-undine had met at dinner had named as within reach of [the successful novelist]2153-the successful novelist . [She]192-undine perceived for the first time that literature was becoming fashionable , and instantly decided that it would be amusing and original if [she]192-undine and [Ralph]199-ralph should owe [their]2154-their prosperity to [his]488-her husband talent . [She]192-undine already saw [herself]192-undine , as [the wife of [a celebrated author]2156-a celebrated author , wearing " artistic "[382-raymond] dresses and doing the drawing - room over with Gothic tapestries and dim lights in altar candle - sticks]2155-the wife of a celebrated author , wearing " artistic " dresses and doing the drawing - room over with gothic tapestries and dim lights in altar candle - sticks . But when [she]192-undine suggested [Ralph]199-ralph 's taking up [his]488-her husband novel [he]488-her husband answered with a laugh that [his]488-her husband brains were sold to [the firm]1952-the firm -- that when [he]488-her husband came back at night the tank was empty ... And now [he]488-her husband wanted [her]192-undine to sail for [home]548-home in a week ! The other letter excited a deeper resentment . It was an appeal from [Laura Fairford]203-laura to return and look after [Ralph]199-ralph . [He]488-her husband was overworked and out of spirits , [she]192-undine wrote , and [[his]488-her husband mother]3752-his mother and sister , reluctant as [they]2160-they were to interfere , felt [they]2160-they ought to urge [Undine]192-undine to come back to [him]488-her husband . Details followed , unwelcome and officious . What right had [Laura Fairford]203-laura to preach to [her]203-laura of wifely obligations ? No doubt [Charles Bowen]314-bowen had sent [home]548-home a highly - coloured report -- and there was really a certain irony in [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford 's criticizing [[her]204-mrs. fairford sister - in - law]2162-her sister - in - law 's conduct on information obtained from such a source ! [Undine]192-undine turned from the window and threw [herself]192-undine down on [her]192-undine deeply cushioned sofa . [She]192-undine was feeling the pleasant fatigue consequent on [her]192-undine trip to [the country]424-the country , whither [she]192-undine and [Mrs. Shallum]293-mrs. shallum had gone with [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond to spend a night at [the old Marquis 's chateau]2164-the old marquis 's chateau . When [[her]192-undine travelling companions]2165-her travelling companions , an hour earlier , had left [her]192-undine at [her]192-undine door , [she]192-undine had half - promised to rejoin [them]2165-her travelling companions for a late dinner in [the Bois]107-the bois ; and as [she]192-undine leaned back among the cushions disturbing thoughts were banished by the urgent necessity of deciding what dress [she]192-undine should wear . These bright weeks of the Parisian spring had given [her]192-undine a first real glimpse into the art of living . From [the experts who had taught [her]192-undine to subdue the curves of [her]192-undine figure and soften [her]192-undine bright free stare with dusky pencillings]2166-the experts who had taught her to subdue the curves of her figure and soften her bright free stare with dusky pencillings , to the skilled purveyors of countless forms of pleasure -- [the theatres]1482-the theatres and [restaurants]3884-restaurants , [the green and blossoming suburbs]2169-the green and blossoming suburbs , the whole shining shifting spectacle of nights and days -- every sight and sound and word had combined to charm [her]192-undine perceptions and refine [her]192-undine taste . And [her]192-undine growing friendship with [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond had been the most potent of these influences . [Chelles]382-raymond , at once immensely " taken , "[382-raymond] had not only shown [his]382-raymond eagerness to share in the helter - skelter motions of [Undine]192-undine 's party , but had given [her]192-undine glimpses of another , still more brilliant existence , that life of the inaccessible " [Faubourg]364-faubourg "[244-miss wincher] of which the first tantalizing hints had but lately reached [her]192-undine . Hitherto [she]192-undine had assumed that [Paris]76-paris existed for [the stranger]2170-the stranger , that [its]76-paris native life was merely an obscure foundation for the dazzling superstructure of hotels and restaurants in which [[her]192-undine compatriots]2171-her compatriots disported [themselves]2171-her compatriots . But lately [she]192-undine had begun to hear about [other American women]2172-other american women , [the women who had married into [the French aristocracy]2174-the french aristocracy]2173-the women who had married into the french aristocracy , and who led , in [the high - walled houses beyond [the Seine]106-the seine which [she]192-undine had once thought so dull and dingy , a life that made [her]192-undine own seem as undistinguished as the social existence of [the Mealey House]475-the mealey house]2175-the high - walled houses beyond the seine which she had once thought so dull and dingy , a life that made her own seem as undistinguished as the social existence of the mealey house . Perhaps what most exasperated [her]192-undine was the discovery , in [this impenetrable group]2177-this impenetrable group , of [the Miss Wincher who had poisoned [her]2178-the miss wincher who had poisoned her far - off summer at potash springs far - off summer at [Potash Springs]38-potash springs]2178-the miss wincher who had poisoned her far - off summer at potash springs .
