Once more all the accepted values were reversed , and it turned out that [Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher had been in possession of some key to success on which [Undine]192-undine had not yet put [her]192-undine hand . To know that [others]807-others were indifferent to what [she]192-undine had thought important was to cheapen all present pleasure and turn the whole force of [her]192-undine desires in a new direction . What [she]192-undine wanted for the moment was to linger on in [Paris]76-paris , prolonging [her]192-undine flirtation with [Chelles]382-raymond , and profiting by it to detach [herself]192-undine from [[her]192-undine compatriots]2171-her compatriots and enter doors closed to [their]2171-her compatriots approach . And [Chelles]382-raymond [himself]382-raymond attracted [her]192-undine : [she]192-undine thought [him]382-raymond as " sweet "[382-raymond] as [she]192-undine had once thought [Ralph]199-ralph , whose fastidiousness and refinement were blent in [him]382-raymond with a delightful foreign vivacity . [His]382-raymond chief value , however , lay in [his]382-raymond power of exciting [Van Degen]228-clare 's jealousy . [She]192-undine knew enough of French customs to be aware that such devotion as [Chelles]382-raymond ' was not likely to have much practical bearing on [her]192-undine future ; but [Peter]231-van degen had an alarming way of lapsing into security , and as a spur to [his]382-raymond ardour [she]192-undine knew the value of [other men]2182-other men 's attentions . It had become [Undine]192-undine 's fixed purpose to bring [Van Degen]228-clare to a definite expression of [his]382-raymond intentions . The case of [Indiana Frusk]216-indiana frusk , whose brilliant marriage the journals of [two continents]2183-two continents had recently chronicled with unprecedented richness of detail , had made less impression on [him]382-raymond than [she]192-undine hoped . [He]382-raymond treated it as a comic episode without special bearing on [their]2184-their case , and once , when [Undine]192-undine cited [Rolliver]330-mrs. rolliver 's expensive fight for freedom as an instance of the power of love over the most invulnerable natures , had answered carelessly : " Oh , [[his]382-raymond first wife]4587-his first wife was [a laundress]4588-a laundress , [I]382-raymond believe . "[382-raymond] But all about [them]2184-their [couples]2185-couples were unpairing and pairing again with an ease and rapidity that encouraged [Undine]192-undine to bide [her]192-undine time . It was simply a question of making [Van Degen]228-clare want [her]192-undine enough , and of not being obliged to abandon the game before [he]382-raymond wanted [her]192-undine as much as [she]192-undine meant [he]382-raymond should . This was precisely what would happen if [she]192-undine were compelled to leave [Paris]76-paris now . Already the event had shown how right [she]192-undine had been to come abroad : the attention [she]192-undine attracted in [Paris]76-paris had reawakened [Van Degen]228-clare 's fancy , and [her]192-undine hold over [him]382-raymond was stronger than when [they]2186-they had parted in [America]77-america . But the next step must be taken with coolness and circumspection ; and [she]192-undine must not throw away what [she]192-undine had gained by going away at a stage when [he]382-raymond was surer of [her]192-undine than [she]192-undine of [him]382-raymond . [She]192-undine was still intensely considering these questions when the door behind [her]192-undine opened and [he]382-raymond came in . [She]192-undine looked up with a frown and [he]382-raymond gave a deprecating laugh . " Did n't [I]192-undine knock ? Do n't look so savage ! [They]4589-they told [me]192-undine downstairs [you]192-undine 'd got back , and [I]192-undine just bolted in without thinking . "[192-undine] [He]382-raymond had widened and purpled since [their]2186-they first encounter , five years earlier , but [his]382-raymond features had not matured . [His]382-raymond face was still the face of [a covetous bullying boy]2187-a covetous bullying boy , with a large appetite for primitive satisfactions and a sturdy belief in [his]382-raymond intrinsic right to [them]2188-them . "[2190-i] [She]2189-she sighed a little , and turned [her]2189-she head away . [Undine]192-undine turned away to the window with the narrow blue slip . [She]192-undine was glad of the interruption : the sense of what [she]192-undine had at stake made [her]192-undine want to pause a moment and to draw breath . The message was a long cable signed with [Laura Fairford]203-laura 's name . It told [her]192-undine that [Ralph]199-ralph had been taken suddenly ill with pneumonia , that [his]2209-his condition was serious and that [the doctors]1810-the doctors advised [[his]2209-his wife]512-his wife 's immediate return . [Undine]192-undine had to read the words over two or three times to get them into [her]192-undine crowded mind ; and even after [she]192-undine had done so [she]192-undine needed more time to see [their]2212-their bearing on [her]192-undine own situation . If the message had concerned [[her]192-undine boy]1665-her boy [her]192-undine brain would have acted more quickly . [She]192-undine had never troubled [herself]192-undine over the possibility of [Paul]218-paul 's falling ill in [her]192-undine absence , but [she]192-undine understood now that if the cable had been about [him]2209-his [she]192-undine would have rushed to the earliest steamer . With [Ralph]199-ralph it was different . [Ralph]199-ralph was always perfectly well -- [she]192-undine could not picture [him]2209-his as being suddenly at death 's door and in need of [her]192-undine . Probably [[his]2209-his mother]3752-his mother and [sister]2215-sister had had a panic : [they]2216-they were always full of sentimental terrors . The next moment an angry suspicion flashed across [her]192-undine : what if the cable were a device of [the Marvell women]2217-the marvell women to bring [her]192-undine back ? Perhaps it had been sent with [Ralph]199-ralph 's connivance ! No doubt [Bowen]314-bowen had written [home]548-home about [her]192-undine -- [Washington Square]2-washington square had received some monstrous report of [her]192-undine doings ! ... Yes , the cable was clearly an echo of [Laura]203-laura 's letter -- [mother]3774-mother and [daughter]480-daughter had cooked it up to spoil [her]192-undine pleasure . Once the thought had occurred to [her]192-undine it struck root in [her]192-undine mind and began to throw out giant branches . [Van Degen]231-van degen followed [her]192-undine to the window , [his]2221-i face still flushed and working . " What 's the matter ? " As if [I]2225-he did n't HAVE to go anyhow ? "[2225-he] [she]192-undine exclaimed . [Van Degen]231-van degen 's eyes still hung on [her]192-undine : [she]192-undine guessed that [he]2225-he was intensely engaged in trying to follow what was passing through [her]192-undine mind . Presently [he]2225-he came up to [her]192-undine again , no longer perilous and importunate , but awkwardly tender , ridiculously moved by [her]192-undine distress . " [Undine]192-undine , listen : wo n't [you]192-undine let [me]192-undine make it all right for [you]192-undine to stay ? [I]2225-he 'd rather never see [you]192-undine again-- "[2225-he] [He]2225-he gave [her]192-undine a baffled stare . " Oh , damn it -- if that 's the way [you]192-undine feel ! "[2225-he] [He]2225-he turned and flung away toward the door . [She]192-undine stood motionless where [he]2225-he left [her]192-undine , every nerve strung to the highest pitch of watchfulness . As [she]192-undine stood there , the scene about [her]192-undine stamped itself on [her]192-undine brain with the sharpest precision . [She]192-undine was aware of the fading of the summer light outside , of the movements of [[her]192-undine maid]2227-her maid , who was laying out [her]2227-her maid dinner - dress in [the room beyond]615-the room beyond , and of the fact that the tea - roses on [her]2227-her maid writing - table , shaken by [Van Degen]231-van degen 's tread , were dropping their petals over [Ralph]199-ralph 's letter , and down on the crumpled telegram which [she]192-undine could see through the trellised sides of the scrap - basket . In another moment [Van Degen]231-van degen would be gone . Worse yet , while [he]2225-he wavered in the doorway [the Shallums]298-the shallums and [Chelles]382-raymond , after vainly awaiting [her]192-undine , might dash back from [the Bois]2229-the bois and break in on [them]2230-them . These and other chances rose before [her]192-undine , urging [her]192-undine to action ; but [she]192-undine held fast , immovable , unwavering , a proud yet plaintive image of renunciation . [Van Degen]231-van degen 's hand was on the door . [He]2225-he half - opened it and then turned back . " That 's all [you]192-undine 've got to say , then ? "[2225-he] " That 's all . "[192-undine] [He]2225-he jerked the door open and passed out . [She]192-undine saw [him]2225-he stop in [the ante - room]2231-the ante - room to pick up [his]2225-he hat and stick , [his]2225-he heavy figure silhouetted against the glare of the wall - lights . A ray of the same light fell on [her]192-undine where [she]192-undine stood in [the unlit sitting - room]2232-the unlit sitting - room , and [her]192-undine reflection bloomed out like a flower from the mirror that faced [her]192-undine . [She]192-undine looked at the image and waited . [Van Degen]231-van degen put [his]2225-he hat on [his]2225-he head and slowly opened the door into [the outer hall]2233-the outer hall . Then [he]2225-he turned abruptly , [his]2225-he bulk eclipsing [her]192-undine reflection as [he]2225-he plunged back into [the room]441-the room and came up to [her]192-undine . " [I]192-undine 'll do anything [you]192-undine say . [Undine]192-undine ; [I]192-undine 'll do anything in [[God]259-god 's world]4646-god 's world to keep [you]192-undine ! "[192-undine] [She]192-undine turned [her]192-undine eyes from the mirror and let them rest on [his]2225-he face , which looked as small and withered as [an old man]2235-an old man 's , with a lower lip that trembled queerly [[.... XXI]336-.... xxi]2236-.... xxi [The spring in [New York]8-new york]2237-the spring in new york proceeded through more than [its]2237-the spring in new york usual extremes of temperature to the threshold of a sultry June . [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph , wearily bent to [his]2225-he task , felt the fantastic humours of the weather as only one more incoherence in the general chaos of [his]2225-he case . It was strange enough , after four years of marriage , to find [himself]199-ralph again in [[his]2225-he old brown room in [Washington Square]2-washington square]2238-his old brown room in washington square . It was hardly there that [he]2225-he had expected [Pegasus]263-pegasus to land [him]2225-he ; and , like [a man]932-a man returning to the scenes of [his]2225-he childhood , [he]2225-he found everything on a much smaller scale than [he]2225-he had imagined . Had the Dagonet boundaries really narrowed , or had the breach in the walls of [his]2225-he own life let in a wider vision ? Certainly there had come to be other differences between [his]2225-he present and [his]2225-he former self than that embodied in the presence of [[his]2225-he little boy]2240-his little boy in [the next room]2241-the next room . [Paul]218-paul , in fact , was now the chief link between [Ralph]199-ralph and [his]2225-he past . Concerning [[his]2225-he son]1973-his son [he]2225-he still felt and thought , in a general way , in the terms of the Dagonet tradition ; [he]2225-he still wanted to implant in [Paul]218-paul some of the reserves and discriminations which divided that tradition from the new spirit of limitless concession . But for [himself]2225-he it was different . Since [his]2225-he transaction with [Moffatt]212-moffatt [he]2225-he had had the sense of living under a new dispensation . [He]2225-he was not sure that it was any worse than the other ; but then [he]2225-he was no longer very sure about anything . Perhaps this growing indifference was merely the reaction from a long nervous strain : that [[his]2225-he mother]3752-his mother and [sister]2215-sister thought it so was shown by the way in which [they]2245-they mutely watched and hovered . [Their]2245-they discretion was like the hushed tread about a sick - bed . [They]2245-they permitted [themselves]2245-they no criticism of [Undine]192-undine ; [he]2225-he was asked no awkward questions , subjected to no ill - timed sympathy . [They]2245-they simply took [him]2225-he back , on [his]2225-he own terms , into the life [he]2225-he had left [them]2245-they to ; and [their]2245-they silence had none of those subtle implications of disapproval which may be so much more wounding than speech . For a while [he]2225-he received a weekly letter from [Undine]192-undine . Vague and disappointing though they were , these missives helped [him]2225-he through the days ; but [he]2225-he looked forward to them rather as a pretext for replies than for [their]2245-they actual contents . [Undine]192-undine was never at a loss for the spoken word : [Ralph]199-ralph had often wondered at [her]192-undine verbal range and [her]192-undine fluent use of terms outside the current vocabulary . [She]192-undine had certainly not picked these up in books , since [she]192-undine never opened one : they seemed rather like some odd transmission of [her]192-undine preaching grandparent 's oratory . But in [her]192-undine brief and colourless letters [she]192-undine repeated the same bald statements in the same few terms . [She]192-undine was well , [she]192-undine had been " round "[199-ralph] with [Bertha Shallum]297-bertha shallum , [she]192-undine had dined with [the Jim Driscolls]210-the driscolls or [May Beringer]337-may beringer or [Dicky Bowles]308-dicky bowles , the weather was too lovely or too awful ; such was the gist of [her]192-undine news . On the last page [she]192-undine hoped [Paul]218-paul was well and sent [him]2246-he a kiss ; but [she]192-undine never made a suggestion concerning [his]2246-he care or asked a question about [his]2246-he pursuits . [One]629-one could only infer that , knowing in what good hands [he]2246-he was , [she]192-undine judged such solicitude superfluous ; and it was thus that [Ralph]199-ralph put the matter to [[his]2246-he mother]3752-his mother . " Of course [she]192-undine 's not worrying about [the boy]4296-the boy -- why should [she]192-undine ? [She]192-undine knows that with [you]199-ralph and [Laura]203-laura [he]4296-the boy 's as happy as [a king]4648-a king . "[199-ralph] To which [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph would answer gravely : " When [you]199-ralph write , be sure to say [I]199-ralph sha n't put on [his]4296-the boy thinner flannels as long as this east wind lasts . "[199-ralph] As for [[her]199-ralph husband]488-her husband 's welfare . [Undine]192-undine 's sole allusion to it consisted in the invariable expression of the hope that [he]2246-he was getting along all right : the phrase was always the same , and [Ralph]199-ralph learned to know just how far down the third page to look for it . In a postscript [she]199-ralph sometimes asked [him]2246-he to tell [[her]199-ralph mother]426-her mother about a new way of doing hair or cutting a skirt ; and this was usually the most eloquent passage of the letter . What satisfaction [he]2246-he extracted from these communications [he]2246-he would have found it hard to say ; yet when they did not come [he]2246-he missed them hardly less than if [they]2251-they had given [him]2246-he all [he]2246-he craved . Sometimes the mere act of holding the blue or mauve sheet and breathing its scent was like holding [[his]2246-he wife]512-his wife 's hand and being enveloped in [her]199-ralph fresh young fragrance : the sentimental disappointment vanished in the penetrating physical sensation . In other moods it was enough to trace the letters of the first line and the last for the desert of perfunctory phrases between the two to vanish , leaving [him]2246-he only the vision of [their]2253-their interlaced names , as of a mystic bond which [her]199-ralph own hand had tied . Or else [he]2246-he saw [her]199-ralph , closely , palpably before [him]2246-he , as [she]199-ralph sat at [her]199-ralph writing - table , frowning and a little flushed , [her]199-ralph bent nape showing the light on [her]199-ralph hair , [her]199-ralph short lip pulled up by the effort of composition ; and this picture had the violent reality of dream - images on the verge of waking . At other times , as [he]2246-he read [her]199-ralph letter , [he]2246-he felt simply that at least in the moment of writing it [she]199-ralph had been with [him]2246-he . But in one of the last [she]199-ralph had said ( to excuse a bad blot and an incoherent sentence ): " [Everybody]3748-everybody 's talking to [me]2246-he at once , and [I]2246-he do n't know what [I]2246-he 'm writing . "[2246-he] That letter [he]2246-he had thrown into the fire .... After the first few weeks , the letters came less and less regularly : at the end of two months they ceased . [Ralph]199-ralph had got into the habit of watching for [them]2254-them on the days when a foreign post was due , and as the weeks went by without a sign [he]2246-he began to invent excuses for leaving [the office]1866-the office earlier and hurrying back to [Washington Square]2-washington square to search the letter - box for a big tinted envelope with a straggling blotted superscription . [Undine]192-undine 's departure had given [him]2246-he a momentary sense of liberation : at that stage in [their]2256-their relations any change would have brought relief . But now that [she]192-undine was gone [he]2246-he knew [she]192-undine could never really go . Though [his]2246-he feeling for [her]192-undine had changed , it still ruled [his]2246-he life . If [he]2246-he saw [her]192-undine in [her]192-undine weakness [he]2246-he felt [her]192-undine in [her]192-undine power : the power of youth and physical radiance that clung to [his]2246-he disenchanted memories as the scent [she]192-undine used clung to [her]192-undine letters . Looking back at [their]2256-their four years of marriage [he]2246-he began to ask [himself]2246-he if [he]2246-he had done all [he]2246-he could to draw [her]192-undine half - formed spirit from its sleep . Had [he]2246-he not expected too much at first , and grown too indifferent in the sequel ? After all , [she]192-undine was still in the toy age ; and perhaps the very extravagance of [his]2246-he love had retarded [her]192-undine growth , helped to imprison [her]192-undine in a little circle of frivolous illusions . But the last months had made [a man of [him]2246-he]2257-a man of him , and when [she]192-undine came back [he]2246-he would know how to lift [her]192-undine to the height of [his]2246-he experience . So [he]2246-he would reason , day by day , as [he]2246-he hastened back to [Washington Square]2-washington square ; but when [he]2246-he opened the door , and [his]2246-he first glance at the hall table showed [him]2246-he there was no letter there , [his]2246-he illusions shrivelled down to their weak roots . [She]192-undine had not written : [she]192-undine did not mean to write . [He]2246-he and [the boy]4296-the boy were no longer a part of [her]192-undine life . When [she]192-undine came back everything would be as it had been before , with the dreary difference that [she]192-undine had tasted new pleasures and that [their]2259-their absence would take the savour from all [he]2246-he had to give [her]192-undine . Then the coming of another foreign mail would lift [his]2246-he hopes , and as [he]2246-he hurried [home]548-home [he]2246-he would imagine new reasons for expecting a letter .... Week after week [he]2246-he swung between the extremes of hope and dejection , and at last , when the strain had become unbearable , [he]2246-he cabled [her]192-undine . The answer ran : " Very well best love writing "[2246-he] ; but the promised letter never came .... [He]2246-he went on steadily with [his]2246-he work : [he]2246-he even passed through a phase of exaggerated energy . But [his]2246-he baffled youth fought in [him]2246-he for air . Was this to be the end ? Was [he]2246-he to wear [his]2246-he life out in useless drudgery ? The plain prose of it , of course , was that the economic situation remained unchanged by the sentimental catastrophe and that [he]2246-he must go on working for [[his]2246-he wife]512-his wife and [child]4044-child . But at any rate , as it was mainly for [Paul]218-paul that [he]2246-he would henceforth work , it should be on [his]2246-he own terms and according to [his]2246-he inherited notions of " straightness . "[2268-his associates] [He]2246-he would never again engage in any transaction resembling [his]2246-he compact with [Moffatt]212-moffatt . Even now [he]2246-he was not sure there had been anything crooked in that ; but the fact of [his]2246-he having instinctively referred the point to [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg rather than to [[his]2246-he grandfather]949-his grandfather implied a presumption against it . [[His]2246-he partners]1951-his partners were quick to profit by [his]2246-he sudden spurt of energy , and [his]2246-he work grew no lighter . [He]2246-he was not only [the youngest and most recent member of [the firm]1952-the firm]2265-the youngest and most recent member of the firm , but [the one who had so far added least to the volume of [its]1952-the firm business]2267-the one who had so far added least to the volume of its business . [His]2246-he hours were the longest , [his]2246-he absences , as summer approached , the least frequent and the most grudgingly accorded . No doubt [[his]2246-he associates]2268-his associates knew that [he]2246-he was pressed for money and could not risk a break . [They]2268-his associates " worked "[194-mrs. spragg] [him]2246-he , and [he]2246-he was aware of it , and submitted because [he]2246-he dared not lose [his]2246-he job . But the long hours of mechanical drudgery were telling on [his]2246-he active body and undisciplined nerves . [He]2246-he had begun too late to subject [himself]2246-he to the persistent mortification of spirit and flesh which is a condition of the average business life ; and after the long dull days in [the office]1866-the office the evenings at [[his]2246-he grandfather]949-his grandfather 's whist - table did not give [him]2246-he the counter - stimulus [he]2246-he needed . [Almost every one]2271-almost every one had gone out of [town]3770-town ; but now and then [Miss Ray]233-harriet came to dine , and [Ralph]199-ralph , seated beneath the family portraits and opposite the desiccated [Harriet]233-harriet , who had already faded to the semblance of [one of [[her]233-harriet own great - aunts]2274-her own great - aunts]2273-one of her own great - aunts , listened languidly to the kind of talk that [the originals]2275-the originals might have exchanged about the same table when [New York]8-new york gentility centred in [the Battery]2276-the battery and [the Bowling Green]2277-the bowling green . [Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet was always pleasant to see and hear , but [his]256-mr. dagonet sarcasms were growing faint and recondite : they had as little bearing on life as the humours of a Restoration comedy . As for [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph and [Miss Ray]233-harriet , [they]2278-them seemed to [the young man]669-the young man even more spectrally remote : hardly anything that mattered to [him]2246-he existed for [them]2278-them , and [their]2278-them prejudices reminded [him]2246-he of sign - posts warning off trespassers who have long since ceased to intrude . Now and then [he]2246-he dined at [[his]2246-he club]1134-his club and went on to [the theatre]678-the theatre with [some young men of [his]2246-he own age]2282-some young men of his own age ; but [he]2246-he left [them]2278-them afterward , half vexed with [himself]2246-he for not being in the humour to prolong the adventure . There were moments when [he]2246-he would have liked to affirm [his]2246-he freedom in however commonplace a way : moments when the vulgarest way would have seemed the most satisfying . But [he]2246-he always ended by walking [home]548-home alone and tip - toeing [upstairs]4364-upstairs through [the sleeping house]1760-the sleeping house lest [he]2246-he should wake [[his]2246-he boy]1702-his boy .... On Saturday afternoons , when [the business world]2287-the business world was hurrying to [the country]424-the country for golf and tennis , [he]2246-he stayed in [town]3770-town and took [Paul]218-paul to see [the Spraggs]207-the spraggs . Several times since [[his]2246-he wife]512-his wife 's departure [he]2246-he had tried to bring about closer relations between [[his]2246-he own family]2291-his own family and [[Undine]192-undine 's]2292-undine 's ; and [the ladies of [Washington Square]2-washington square]2293-the ladies of washington square , in [their]2293-the ladies of washington square eagerness to meet [his]2246-he wishes , had made various friendly advances to [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg . But [they]2294-they were met by a mute resistance which made [Ralph]199-ralph suspect that [Undine]192-undine 's strictures on [[his]2246-he family]504-his family had taken root in [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother 's brooding mind ; and [he]2246-he gave up the struggle to bring together what had been so effectually put asunder . If [he]2246-he regretted [his]2246-he lack of success it was chiefly because [he]2246-he was so sorry for [the Spraggs]207-the spraggs . Soon after [Undine]192-undine 's marriage [they]2297-their had abandoned [[their]2297-their polychrome suite at [the Stentorian]446-the stentorian]2298-their polychrome suite at the stentorian , and since then [their]2297-their peregrinations had carried [them]2297-their through [half the hotels of [the metropolis]4020-the metropolis]2300-half the hotels of the metropolis . [Undine]192-undine , who had early discovered [her]192-undine mistake in thinking hotel life fashionable , had tried to persuade [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents to take [a house of [their]551-her parents own]2303-a house of their own ; but though [they]551-her parents refrained from taxing [her]192-undine with inconsistency [they]551-her parents did not act on [her]192-undine suggestion . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg seemed to shrink from the thought of " going back to [house - keeping]4650-house - keeping , "[191-mr. spragg] and [Ralph]199-ralph suspected that [she]192-undine depended on the transit from [hotel]2304-hotel to [hotel]2304-hotel as the one element of variety in [her]192-undine life . As for [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg , it was impossible to imagine [any one in whom the domestic sentiments were more completely unlocalized and disconnected from any fixed habits]2306-any one in whom the domestic sentiments were more completely unlocalized and disconnected from any fixed habits ; and [he]191-mr. spragg was probably aware of [his]191-mr. spragg changes of abode chiefly as they obliged [him]191-mr. spragg to ascend from [the Subway]736-the subway , or descend from the " Elevated , "[1428-wife] a few blocks higher up or lower down . [Neither husband]2308-neither husband nor [wife]1428-wife complained to [Ralph]199-ralph of [their]551-her parents frequent displacements , or assigned to [them]551-her parents any cause save the vague one of " guessing [they]551-her parents could do better "[1428-wife] ; but [Ralph]199-ralph noticed that the decreasing luxury of [their]551-her parents life synchronized with [Undine]192-undine 's growing demands for money . During the last few months [they]551-her parents had transferred [themselves]551-her parents to [the " Malibran]4651-the " malibran , "[1428-wife] [a tall narrow structure resembling [a grain - elevator divided into cells]2311-a grain - elevator divided into cells , where linoleum and lincrusta simulated the stucco and marble of [the Stentorian]446-the stentorian]2310-a tall narrow structure resembling a grain - elevator divided into cells , where linoleum and lincrusta simulated the stucco and marble of the stentorian , and [fagged business men]2313-fagged business men and [[their]2313-fagged business men families]2314-their families consumed the watery stews dispensed by " coloured help "[194-mrs. spragg] in the grey twilight of [a basement dining - room]2315-a basement dining - room . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg had [no sitting - room]2316-no sitting - room , and [Paul]218-paul and [[his]2317-his father]1946-his father had to be received in [one of [the long public parlours]2320-the long public parlours]2319-one of the long public parlours , between [ladies seated at rickety desks in the throes of correspondence]2321-ladies seated at rickety desks in the throes of correspondence and groups of [listlessly conversing residents]2322-listlessly conversing residents and [callers]2323-callers . [The Spraggs]207-the spraggs were intensely proud of [[their]207-the spraggs grandson]2324-their grandson , and [Ralph]199-ralph perceived that [they]207-the spraggs would have liked to see [Paul]218-paul charging uproariously from group to group , and thrusting [his]2317-his bright curls and cherubic smile upon the general attention . The fact that [the boy]4296-the boy preferred to stand between [[his]4296-the boy grandfather]949-his grandfather 's knees and play with [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's Masonic emblem , or dangle [his]4296-the boy legs from the arm of [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's chair , seemed to [[his]4296-the boy grandparents]2018-his grandparents evidence of ill - health or undue repression , and [he]4296-the boy was subjected by [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg to searching enquiries as to how [his]4296-the boy food set , and whether [he]4296-the boy did n't think [[his]4296-the boy Popper]2328-his popper was too strict with [him]4296-the boy . A more embarrassing problem was raised by the " surprise "[193-mrs. heeny] ( in the shape of peanut candy or chocolate creams ) which [he]4296-the boy was invited to hunt for in [Gran'ma]338-gran'ma 's pockets , and which [Ralph]199-ralph had to confiscate on the way [home]548-home lest the dietary rules of [Washington Square]2-washington square should be too visibly infringed . Sometimes [Ralph]199-ralph found [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny , ruddy and jovial , seated in the arm - chair opposite [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , and regaling [her]193-mrs. heeny with selections from a new batch of clippings . During [Undine]192-undine 's illness of the previous winter [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny had become a familiar figure to [Paul]218-paul , who had learned to expect almost as much from [her]193-mrs. heeny bag as from [[his]4296-the boy grandmother]4297-his grandmother 's pockets ; so that the intemperate Saturdays at [the Malibran]2331-the malibran were usually followed by languid and abstemious Sundays in [Washington Square]2-washington square . [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny , being unaware of this sequel to [her]193-mrs. heeny bounties , formed the habit of appearing regularly on Saturdays , and while [she]193-mrs. heeny chatted with [[his]4296-the boy grandmother]4297-his grandmother [the little boy]1732-the little boy was encouraged to scatter the grimy carpet with face - creams and bunches of clippings in [his]4296-the boy thrilling quest for the sweets at the bottom of [her]193-mrs. heeny bag . " [I]193-mrs. heeny declare , if [he]4296-the boy ai n't in just as much of a hurry f'r everything as [[his]4296-the boy mother]3752-his mother ! "[193-mrs. heeny] [she]193-mrs. heeny exclaimed one day in [her]193-mrs. heeny rich rolling voice ; and stooping to pick up a long strip of newspaper which [Paul]218-paul had flung aside [she]193-mrs. heeny added , as [she]193-mrs. heeny smoothed it out : " [I]193-mrs. heeny guess ' f [he]4296-the boy was a little mite older [he]4296-the boy 'd be better pleased with this ' n with the candy . It 's the very thing [I]193-mrs. heeny was trying to find for [you]218-paul the other day , [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , "[193-mrs. heeny] [she]193-mrs. heeny went on , holding the bit of paper at arm 's length ; and [she]193-mrs. heeny began to read out , with a loudness proportioned to the distance between [her]193-mrs. heeny eyes and the text : " With two such sprinters as ' [Pete ' Van Degen]231-van degen and [Dicky Bowles]308-dicky bowles to set the pace , it 's no wonder the New [York]17-york set in [Paris]76-paris has struck a livelier gait than ever this spring . It 's a high - pressure season and no mistake , and [no one]3844-no one lags behind less than the fascinating [Mrs. Ralph Marvell]199-ralph , who is to be seen daily and nightly in [all the smartest restaurants and naughtiest theatres]4654-all the smartest restaurants and naughtiest theatres , with so many [devoted swains in attendance that the rival beauties of both worlds]4655-devoted swains in attendance that the rival beauties of both worlds are said to be making catty comments . But then [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph 's gowns are almost as good as [her]199-ralph looks -- and how can [you]4656-you expect [the other women]916-the other women to stand for such a monopoly ? "[338-gran'ma] To escape the strain of these visits , [Ralph]199-ralph once or twice tried the experiment of leaving [Paul]218-paul with [[his]2334-his grand - parents]2335-his grand - parents and calling for [him]2334-his in the late afternoon ; but one day , on re - entering [the Malibran]120-the malibran , [he]2334-his was met by [a small abashed figure clad in a kaleidoscopic tartan and a green velvet cap with a silver thistle]2336-a small abashed figure clad in a kaleidoscopic tartan and a green velvet cap with a silver thistle . After this experience of the " surprises "[194-mrs. spragg] of which [Gran'ma]338-gran'ma was capable when [she]338-gran'ma had a chance to take [Paul]218-paul shopping [Ralph]199-ralph did not again venture to leave [[his]2334-his son]1973-his son , and [their]2338-their subsequent Saturdays were passed together in the sultry gloom of [the Malibran]120-the malibran . Conversation with [the Spraggs]207-the spraggs was almost impossible . [Ralph]199-ralph could talk with [[his]2334-his father - in - law]1041-his father - in - law in [[his]2334-his office]737-his office , but in [the hotel parlour]2341-the hotel parlour [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg sat in a ruminating silence broken only by the emission of an occasional " Well -- well "[2343-her son - in - law] addressed to [[his]191-mr. spragg grandson]2342-his grandson . As for [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , [[her]194-mrs. spragg son - in - law]2343-her son - in - law could not remember having had a sustained conversation with [her]194-mrs. spragg since the distant day when [he]2343-her son - in - law had first called at [the Stentorian]3-the stentorian , and had been " entertained , "[194-mrs. spragg] in [Undine]192-undine 's absence , by [[her]194-mrs. spragg astonished mother]2344-her astonished mother . The shock of that encounter had moved [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg to eloquence ; but [Ralph]199-ralph 's entrance into [the family]2345-the family , without making [him]2343-her son - in - law seem less of [a stranger]1430-a stranger , appeared once for all to have relieved [her]194-mrs. spragg of the obligation of finding something to say to [him]2343-her son - in - law . The one question [she]194-mrs. spragg invariably asked : " [You]2343-her son - in - law heard from [Undie]240-undie ? "[193-mrs. heeny] had been relatively easy to answer while [[his]2343-her son - in - law wife]512-his wife 's infrequent letters continued to arrive ; but a Saturday came when [he]2343-her son - in - law felt the blood rise to [his]2343-her son - in - law temples as , for the fourth consecutive week , [he]2343-her son - in - law stammered out , under the snapping eyes of [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny : " No , not by this post either -- [I]2375-he begin to think [I]2375-he must have lost a letter "[2375-he] ; and it was then that [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg , who had sat silently looking up at the ceiling , cut short [[his]191-mr. spragg wife]512-his wife 's exclamation by an enquiry about real estate in [the Bronx]121-the bronx . After that , [Ralph]199-ralph noticed , [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg never again renewed [her]194-mrs. spragg question ; and [he]2343-her son - in - law understood that [[his]2343-her son - in - law father - in - law]1041-his father - in - law had guessed [his]2343-her son - in - law embarrassment and wished to spare it . [Ralph]199-ralph had never thought of looking for any delicacy of feeling under [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's large lazy irony , and the incident drew [the two men]1250-the two men nearer together . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , for [her]194-mrs. spragg part , was certainly not delicate ; but [she]194-mrs. spragg was simple and without malice , and [Ralph]199-ralph liked [her]194-mrs. spragg for [her]194-mrs. spragg silent acceptance of [her]194-mrs. spragg diminished state . Sometimes , as [he]2343-her son - in - law sat between [the lonely primitive old couple]2351-the lonely primitive old couple , [he]2343-her son - in - law wondered from what source [Undine]192-undine 's voracious ambitions had been drawn : all [she]192-undine cared for , and attached importance to , was as remote from [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents ' conception of life as [her]192-undine impatient greed from [their]551-her parents passive stoicism . One hot afternoon toward the end of [June Ralph]199-ralph suddenly wondered if [Clare Van Degen]228-clare were still in [town]3770-town . [She]228-clare had dined in [Washington Square]2-washington square some ten days earlier , and [he]2343-her son - in - law remembered [her]228-clare saying that [she]228-clare had sent [the children]3922-the children down to [Long Island]122-long island , but that [she]228-clare [herself]228-clare meant to stay on in [town]3770-town till the heat grew unbearable . [She]228-clare hated [[her]228-clare big showy place on [Long Island]122-long island]2356-her big showy place on long island , [she]228-clare was tired of the spring trip to [London]83-london and [Paris]76-paris , where [one]629-one met at every turn the faces one had grown sick of seeing all winter , and [she]228-clare declared that in the early summer [New York]8-new york was [the only place in which [one]629-one could escape from [New Yorkers]123-new yorkers]2358-the only place in which one could escape from new yorkers ... [She]228-clare put the case amusingly , and it was like [her]228-clare to take up any attitude that went against the habits of [her]228-clare set ; but [she]228-clare lived at the mercy of [her]228-clare moods , and [one]629-one could never tell how long any one of [them]2361-them would rule [her]228-clare . As [he]2362-he sat in [[his]2362-he office]737-his office , with the noise and glare of the endless afternoon rising up in hot waves from [the street]705-the street , there wandered into [Ralph]199-ralph 's mind a vision of [[her]228-clare shady drawing - room]2365-her shady drawing - room . All day it hung before [him]2362-he like the mirage of a spring before a dusty traveller : [he]2362-he felt a positive thirst for [her]228-clare presence , for the sound of [her]228-clare voice , the wide spaces and luxurious silences surrounding [her]228-clare . It was perhaps because , on that particular day , a spiral pain was twisting around in the back of [his]2362-he head , and digging in a little deeper with each twist , and because the figures on the balance sheet before [him]2362-he were hopping about like black imps in an infernal forward - and - back , that the picture hung there so persistently . It was a long time since [he]2362-he had wanted anything as much as , at that particular moment , [he]2362-he wanted to be with [Clare]228-clare and hear [her]228-clare voice ; and as soon as [he]2362-he had ground out the day 's measure of work [he]2362-he rang up [the Van Degen palace]2366-the van degen palace and learned that [she]228-clare was still in [town]3770-town . The lowered awnings of [[her]228-clare inner drawing - room]2368-her inner drawing - room cast a luminous shadow on old cabinets and consoles , and on the pale flowers scattered here and there in vases of bronze and porcelain . [Clare]228-clare 's taste was as capricious as [her]228-clare moods , and [the rest of [the house]623-the house]2369-the rest of the house was not in harmony with [this room]2371-this room . There was , in particular , [another drawing - room , which [she]228-clare now described as [Peter]231-van degen 's creation]2372-another drawing - room , which she now described as peter 's creation , but which [Ralph]199-ralph knew to be partly [hers]2373-hers : [a heavily decorated apartment]2374-a heavily decorated apartment , where [Popple]197-popple 's portrait of [her]228-clare throned over a waste of gilt furniture . It was characteristic that to - day [she]228-clare had had [Ralph]199-ralph shown in by another way ; and that , as [she]228-clare had spared [him]2375-he [the polyphonic drawing - room]2376-the polyphonic drawing - room , so [she]228-clare had skilfully adapted [her]228-clare own appearance to [her]228-clare soberer background . [She]228-clare sat near the window , reading , in a clear cool dress : and at [his]2375-he entrance [she]228-clare merely slipped a finger between the pages and looked up at [him]2375-he . [Her]228-clare way of receiving [him]2375-he made [him]2375-he feel that restlessness and stridency were as unlike [her]228-clare genuine self as [the gilded drawing - room]2377-the gilded drawing - room , and that [this quiet creature]2378-this quiet creature was the only real [Clare]228-clare , [the Clare who had once been so nearly [his]2375-he , and who seemed to want [him]2375-he to know that [she]228-clare had never wholly been [any one else]2380-any one else 's]2379-the clare who had once been so nearly his , and who seemed to want him to know that she had never wholly been any one else 's . " Why did n't [you]228-clare let [me]228-clare know [you]228-clare were still in [town]3770-town ? "[228-clare] [he]2375-he asked , as [he]2375-he sat down in the sofa - corner near [her]228-clare chair . [Her]228-clare dark smile deepened . " [I]2375-he hoped [you]2375-he 'd come and see . "[2375-he] " [One]629-one never knows , with [you]228-clare . "[199-ralph] [He]2375-he was looking about [the room]441-the room with a kind of confused pleasure in its pale shadows and spots of dark rich colour . The old lacquer screen behind [Clare]228-clare 's head looked like a lustreless black pool with gold leaves floating on it ; and another piece , a little table at [her]228-clare elbow , had the brown bloom and the pear - like curves of an old violin . " [I]228-clare like to be [here]3758-here , "[228-clare] [Ralph]199-ralph said . [She]228-clare did not make the mistake of asking : " Then why do [you]2375-he never come ? "[2375-he] Instead , [she]228-clare turned away and drew an inner curtain across the window to shut out the sunlight which was beginning to slant in under the awning . The mere fact of [her]228-clare not answering , and the final touch of well - being which [her]228-clare gesture gave , reminded [him]2375-he of other summer days [they]2382-they had spent together long rambling boy - and - girl days in [the hot woods and fields]2383-the hot woods and fields , when [they]2382-they had never thought of talking to [each other]3877-each other unless there was something [they]2382-they particularly wanted to say . [His]2375-he tired fancy strayed off for a second to the thought of what it would have been like come back , at the end of the day , to such a sweet community of silence ; but [his]2375-he mind was too crowded with importunate facts for any lasting view of visionary distances . The thought faded , and [he]2375-he merely felt how restful it was to have [her]228-clare near ... " [I]228-clare 'm glad [you]228-clare stayed in [town]3770-town : [you]228-clare must let [me]228-clare come again , "[228-clare] [he]2375-he said . " [I]2375-he suppose [you]2375-he ca n't always get away , "[2375-he] [she]228-clare answered ; and [she]228-clare began to listen , with grave intelligent eyes , to [his]2375-he description of [his]2375-he tedious days . With [her]228-clare eyes on [him]2375-he [he]2375-he felt the exquisite relief of talking about [himself]2375-he as [he]2375-he had not dared to talk to [any one]659-any one since [his]2375-he marriage . [He]2375-he would not for [the world]620-the world have confessed [his]2375-he discouragement , [his]2375-he consciousness of incapacity ; to Undine and in [Washington]36-washington Square any hint of failure would have been taken as a criticism of what [[his]2375-he wife]512-his wife demanded of [him]2375-he . Only to [Clare Van Degen]228-clare could [he]2375-he cry out [his]2375-he present despondency and [his]2375-he loathing of the interminable task ahead . " [A man]932-a man does n't know till [he]932-a man tries it how killing uncongenial work is , and how it destroys the power of doing what [one]629-one 's fit for , even if there 's time for both . But there 's [Paul]218-paul to be looked out for , and [I]228-clare dare n't chuck [my]228-clare job -- [I'm]228-clare in mortal terror of its chucking [me]228-clare ... "[228-clare] Little by little [he]2375-he slipped into a detailed recital of all [his]2375-he lesser worries , the most recent of which was [his]2375-he experience with [the Lipscombs]227-the lipscombs , who , after a two months ' tenancy of [the West End Avenue house]2019-the west end avenue house , had decamped without paying [their]2389-their rent . [Clare]228-clare laughed contemptuously . " Yes -- [I]192-undine heard [he]2375-he 'd come to grief and been suspended from the Stock Exchange , and [I]192-undine see in the papers that [[his]2375-he wife]512-his wife 's retort has been to sue for a divorce . "[192-undine] [Ralph]199-ralph knew that , like all [[their]2389-their clan]2390-their clan , [[his]2375-he cousin]939-his cousin regarded a divorce - suit as a vulgar and unnecessary way of taking [the public]2392-the public into [one]629-one 's confidence . [His]2375-he mind flashed back to the family feast in [Washington Square]2-washington square in celebration of [his]2375-he engagement . [He]2375-he recalled [[his]2375-he grandfather]949-his grandfather 's chance allusion to [Mrs. Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb , and [Undine]192-undine 's answer , fluted out on [her]192-undine highest note : " Oh , [I]192-undine guess [she]192-undine 'll get a divorce pretty soon . [He]949-his grandfather 's been a disappointment to [her]192-undine . "[192-undine] [Ralph]199-ralph could still hear the horrified murmur with which [[his]2375-he mother]3752-his mother had rebuked [his]2375-he laugh . For [he]2375-he had laughed -- had thought [Undine]192-undine 's speech fresh and natural ! Now [he]2375-he felt the ironic rebound of [her]192-undine words . [Heaven]339-heaven knew [he]2375-he had been a disappointment to [her]192-undine ; and what was there in [her]192-undine own feeling , or in [her]192-undine inherited prejudices , to prevent [her]192-undine seeking the same redress as [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel ? [He]2375-he wondered if the same thought were in [[his]2375-he cousin]939-his cousin 's mind ... [They]2397-they began to talk of other things : books , pictures , plays ; and one by one the closed doors opened and light was let into dusty shuttered places . [Clare]228-clare 's mind was neither keen nor deep : [Ralph]199-ralph , in the past , had smiled at [her]192-undine rash ardours and vague intensities . But [she]192-undine had [his]2375-he own range of allusions , and a great gift of momentary understanding ; and [he]2375-he had so long beaten [his]2375-he thoughts out against a blank wall of incomprehension that [her]192-undine sympathy seemed full of insight . [She]192-undine began by a question about [his]2375-he writing , but the subject was distasteful to [him]2375-he , and [he]2375-he turned the talk to a new book in which [he]2375-he had been interested . [She]192-undine knew enough of it to slip in the right word here and there ; and thence [they]2397-they wandered on to kindred topics . Under the warmth of [her]192-undine attention [his]2375-he torpid ideas awoke again , and [his]2375-he eyes took their fill of pleasure as [she]192-undine leaned forward , [her]192-undine thin brown hands clasped on [her]192-undine knees and [her]192-undine eager face reflecting all [his]2375-he feelings . There was a moment when the two currents of sensation were merged in one , and [he]2375-he began to feel confusedly that [he]2375-he was young and [she]192-undine was kind , and that there was nothing [he]2375-he would like better than to go on sitting there , not much caring what [she]192-undine said or how [he]2375-he answered , if only [she]192-undine would let [him]2375-he look at [her]192-undine and give [him]2375-he one of [her]192-undine thin brown hands to hold . Then the corkscrew in the back of [his]2375-he head dug into [him]2375-he again with a deeper thrust , and [she]192-undine seemed suddenly to recede to a great distance and be divided from [him]2375-he by a fog of pain . The fog lifted after a minute , but it left [him]2375-he queerly remote from [her]192-undine , from [the cool room]2398-the cool room with its scents and shadows , and from all the objects which , a moment before , had so sharply impinged upon [his]2375-he senses . It was as though [he]2375-he looked at it all through a rain - blurred pane , against which [his]2375-he hand would strike if [he]2375-he held it out to [her]192-undine ... That impression passed also , and [he]2375-he found [himself]2375-he thinking how tired [he]2375-he was and how little anything mattered . [He]2375-he recalled the unfinished piece of work on [his]2375-he desk , and for a moment had the odd illusion that it was there before [him]2375-he ... [She]192-undine exclaimed : " But are [you]2375-he going ? "[2375-he] and [her]192-undine exclamation made [him]2375-he aware that [he]2375-he had left [his]2375-he seat and was standing in front of [her]192-undine ... [He]2375-he fancied there was some kind of appeal in [her]192-undine brown eyes ; but [she]192-undine was so dim and far off that [he]2375-he could n't be sure of what [she]192-undine wanted , and the next moment [he]2375-he found [himself]2375-he shaking hands with [her]192-undine , and heard [her]192-undine saying something kind and cold about its having been so nice to see [him]2375-he ... Half way up the stairs [little Paul]218-paul , shining and rosy from supper , lurked in ambush for [his]2375-he evening game . [Ralph]199-ralph was fond of stooping down to let [the boy]4296-the boy climb up [his]2375-he outstretched arms to [his]2375-he shoulders , but to - day , as [he]2375-he did so , [Paul]218-paul 's hug seemed to crush [him]2375-he in a vice , and the shout of welcome that accompanied it racked [his]2375-he ears like an explosion of steam - whistles . The queer distance between [himself]2375-he and the rest of [the world]620-the world was annihilated again : everything stared and glared and clutched [him]2375-he . [He]2375-he tried to turn away [his]2375-he face from [the child]1948-the child 's hot kisses ; and as [he]2375-he did so [he]2375-he caught sight of a mauve envelope among the hats and sticks on the hall table . Instantly [he]2375-he passed [Paul]218-paul over to [[his]2375-he nurse]2402-his nurse , stammered out a word about being tired , and sprang up the long flights to [[his]2375-he study]2403-his study . The pain in [his]2375-he head had stopped , but [his]2375-he hands trembled as [he]2375-he tore open the envelope . Within it was a second letter bearing a French stamp and addressed to [himself]2375-he . It looked like a business communication and had apparently been sent to [[Undine]192-undine 's hotel in [Paris]76-paris]2404-undine 's hotel in paris and forwarded to [him]2375-he by [her]192-undine hand . " Another bill ! "[2405-private detectives who undertook , in conditions of attested and inviolable discretion , to investigate " delicate " situations] [he]2375-he reflected grimly , as [he]2375-he threw it aside and felt in the outer envelope for [her]192-undine letter . There was nothing there , and after a first sharp pang of disappointment [he]2375-he picked up the enclosure and opened it . Inside was a lithographed circular , headed " Confidential "[2405-private detectives who undertook , in conditions of attested and inviolable discretion , to investigate " delicate " situations] and bearing the [Paris]76-paris address of a firm of [private detectives who undertook , in conditions of attested and inviolable discretion , to investigate " delicate "[2375-he] situations]2405-private detectives who undertook , in conditions of attested and inviolable discretion , to investigate " delicate " situations , look up doubtful antecedents , and furnish reliable evidence of misconduct -- all on the most reasonable terms . For a long time [Ralph]199-ralph sat and stared at this document ; then [he]2375-he began to laugh and tossed it into the scrap - basket . After that , with a groan , [he]2375-he dropped [his]2375-he head against the edge of [his]2375-he writing table . XXII When [he]2375-he woke , the first thing [he]2375-he remembered was the fact of having cried . [He]2375-he could not think how [he]2375-he had come to be such [a fool]4414-a fool . [He]2375-he hoped to heaven [no one]3844-no one had seen [him]2375-he . [He]2375-he supposed [he]2375-he must have been worrying about the unfinished piece of work at [the office]1866-the office : where was it , by the way , [he]2375-he wondered ? Why -- where [he]2375-he had left it the day before , of course ! What a ridiculous thing to worry about -- but it seemed to follow [him]2375-he about like a dog ... [He]2375-he said to [himself]2375-he that [he]2375-he must get up presently and go down to [the office]1866-the office . Presently -- when [he]2375-he could open [his]2375-he eyes . Just now there was a dead weight on them ; [he]2375-he tried one after another in vain . The effort set [him]2375-he weakly trembling , and [he]2375-he wanted to cry again . Nonsense ! [He]2375-he must get out of bed . [He]2375-he stretched [his]2375-he arms out , trying to reach something to pull [himself]2375-he up by ; but everything slipped away and evaded [him]2375-he . It was like trying to catch at bright short waves . Then suddenly [his]2375-he fingers clasped themselves about something firm and warm . A hand : a hand that gave back [his]2375-he pressure ! The relief was inexpressible . [He]2375-he lay still and let the hand hold [him]2375-he , while mentally [he]2375-he went through the motions of getting up and beginning to dress . So indistinct were the boundaries between thought and action that [he]2375-he really felt [himself]2375-he moving about [the room]441-the room , in a queer disembodied way , as one treads the air in sleep . Then [he]2375-he felt the bedclothes over [him]2375-he and the pillows under [his]2375-he head . " [I]993-some one MUST get up , "[993-some one] [he]2375-he said , and pulled at the hand . It pressed [him]2375-he down again : down into a dim deep pool of sleep . [He]2375-he lay there for a long time , in a silent blackness far below light and sound ; then [he]2375-he gradually floated to the surface with the buoyancy of a dead body . But [his]2375-he body had never been more alive . Jagged strokes of pain tore through it , hands dragged at it with nails that bit like teeth . [They]2411-they wound thongs about [him]2375-he , bound [him]2375-he , tied weights to [him]2375-he , tried to pull [him]2375-he down with them ; but still [he]2375-he floated , floated , danced on the fiery waves of pain , with barbed light pouring down on [him]2375-he from an arrowy sky . Charmed intervals of rest , blue sailings on [melodious seas]2412-melodious seas , alternated with the anguish . [He]2375-he became a leaf on the air , a feather on a current , a straw on the tide , the spray of the wave spinning itself to sunshine as the wave toppled over into gulfs of blue ... [He]2375-he woke on [a stony beach]2413-a stony beach , [his]2375-he legs and arms still lashed to [his]2375-he sides and the thongs cutting into [him]2375-he ; but the fierce sky was hidden , and hidden by [his]2375-he own languid lids . [He]2375-he felt the ecstasy of decreasing pain , and courage came to [him]2375-he to open [his]2375-he eyes and look about [him]2375-he ... [The beach]2414-the beach was [[his]2375-he own bed]2415-his own bed ; the tempered light lay on familiar things , and [some one]993-some one was moving about in a shadowy way between bed and window . [He]2375-he was thirsty and [some one]993-some one gave [him]2375-he a drink . [His]2375-he pillow burned , and [some one]993-some one turned the cool side out . [His]2375-he brain was clear enough now for [him]2375-he to understand that [he]2375-he was ill , and to want to talk about it ; but [his]2375-he tongue hung in [his]2375-he throat like a clapper in a bell . [He]2375-he must wait till the rope was pulled ... So time and life stole back on [him]2375-he , and [his]2375-he thoughts laboured weakly with dim fears . Slowly [he]2375-he cleared a way through them , adjusted [himself]2375-he to [his]2375-he strange state , and found out that [he]2375-he was in [[his]2375-he own room]1726-his own room , in [[[his]2375-he grandfather]949-his grandfather 's house]2421-his grandfather 's house , that alternating with the white - capped faces about [him]2375-he were those of [[his]2375-he mother]3752-his mother and [sister]2215-sister , and that in a few days -- if [he]2375-he took [his]2375-he beef - tea and did n't fret -- [Paul]218-paul would be brought up from [Long Island]122-long island , whither , on account of the great heat , [he]2375-he had been carried off by [Clare Van Degen]228-clare . [No one]3844-no one named [Undine]192-undine to [him]2375-he , and [he]2375-he did not speak of [her]192-undine . But one day , as [he]2375-he lay in bed in the summer twilight , [he]2375-he had a vision of a moment , a long way behind [him]2375-he -- at the beginning of [his]2375-he illness , it must have been -- when [he]2375-he had called out for [her]192-undine in [his]2375-he anguish , and [some one]993-some one had said : " [She]192-undine 's coming : [she]192-undine 'll be here next week . "[203-laura] Could it be that next week was not yet here ? [He]2375-he supposed that illness robbed one of all sense of time , and [he]2375-he lay still , as if in ambush , watching [his]2375-he scattered memories come out one by one and join themselves together . If [he]2375-he watched long enough [he]2375-he was sure [he]2375-he should recognize one that fitted into [his]2375-he picture of the day when [he]2375-he had asked for [Undine]192-undine . And at length a face came out of the twilight : a freckled face , benevolently bent over [him]2375-he under a starched cap . [He]2375-he had not seen the face for a long time , but suddenly it took shape and fitted itself into the picture ... [Laura Fairford]203-laura sat near by , a book on [her]203-laura knee . At the sound of [his]2375-he voice [she]203-laura looked up . " What was the name of [the first nurse]4665-the first nurse ? "[2375-he] " [The first--]4666-the first-- ? "[2375-he] " The one that went away . "[203-laura] " Oh -- [Miss Hicks]340-miss hicks , [you]2375-he mean ? "[2375-he] " How long is it since [she]192-undine went ? "[2375-he] " It must be three weeks . [She]192-undine had another case . "[2375-he] [He]2375-he thought this over carefully ; then [he]2375-he spoke again . " Call [Undine]192-undine . "[2375-he] [She]203-laura made no answer , and [he]2375-he repeated irritably : " Why do n't [you]203-laura call [her]192-undine ? [I]204-mrs. fairford want to speak to [her]192-undine . "[204-mrs. fairford] [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford laid down [her]204-mrs. fairford book and came to [him]2375-he . " [She]192-undine 's not [here]3758-here -- just now . "[2375-he] [He]2375-he dealt with this also , laboriously . " [You]204-mrs. fairford mean [she]192-undine 's out -- [she]192-undine 's not in [the house]623-the house ? "[204-mrs. fairford] " [I]2375-he mean [she]192-undine has n't come yet . "[2375-he] As [she]204-mrs. fairford spoke [Ralph]199-ralph felt a sudden strength and hardness in [his]2375-he brain and body . Everything in [him]2375-he became as clear as noon . " But it was before [Miss Hicks]340-miss hicks left that [you]204-mrs. fairford told [me]191-mr. spragg [you]204-mrs. fairford 'd sent for [her]192-undine , and that [she]192-undine 'd be here the following week . And [you]204-mrs. fairford say [Miss Hicks]340-miss hicks has been gone three weeks . "[191-mr. spragg] This was what [he]2375-he had worked out in [his]2375-he head , and what [he]2375-he meant to say to [[his]2375-he sister]3743-his sister ; but something seemed to snap shut in [his]2375-he throat , and [he]2375-he closed [his]2375-he eyes without speaking . Even when [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg came to see [him]2375-he [he]2375-he said nothing . [They]2427-they talked about [his]2375-he illness , about the hot weather , about the rumours that [Harmon B. Driscoll]201-driscoll was again threatened with indictment ; and then [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg pulled [himself]191-mr. spragg out of [his]191-mr. spragg chair and said : " [I]199-ralph presume [you]199-ralph 'll call round at [the office]1866-the office before [you]199-ralph leave [the city]4670-the city . "[199-ralph] " Oh , yes : as soon as [I]212-moffatt 'm up , "[212-moffatt] [Ralph]199-ralph answered . [They]2427-they understood [each other]3877-each other . [Clare]228-clare had urged [him]2375-he to come down to [Long Island]122-long island and complete [his]2375-he convalescence there , but [he]2375-he preferred to stay in [Washington Square]2-washington square till [he]2375-he should be strong enough for the journey to [the Adirondacks]98-the adirondacks , [whither Laura]203-laura had already preceded [him]2375-he with [Paul]218-paul . [He]2375-he did not want to see [any one]659-any one but [[his]2375-he mother]3752-his mother and [grandfather]963-grandfather till [his]2375-he legs could carry [him]2375-he to [[Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's office]2432-mr. spragg 's office . It was an oppressive day in mid - August , with a yellow mist of heat in the sky , when at last [he]2375-he entered [the big office - building]2433-the big office - building . Swirls of dust lay on [the mosaic floor]2434-the mosaic floor , and a stale smell of decayed fruit and salt air and steaming asphalt filled [the place]491-the place like a fog . As [he]2375-he shot up in [the elevator]1296-the elevator [some one]993-some one slapped [him]2375-he on the back , and turning [he]2375-he saw [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt at [his]2375-he side , smooth and rubicund under a new straw hat . "[191-mr. spragg] [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg sat alone in [[his]191-mr. spragg murky inner office]2439-his murky inner office , the fly - blown engraving of [Daniel Webster]325-daniel webster above [his]191-mr. spragg head and the congested scrap - basket beneath [his]191-mr. spragg feet . [He]191-mr. spragg looked fagged and sallow , like the day . [Ralph]199-ralph sat down on the other side of the desk . " Why , let [me]199-ralph see : has n't [Dakota]126-dakota been [a state]4674-a state a year or two now ? "[199-ralph] " Oh , [God--]342-god-- "[191-mr. spragg] [Ralph]199-ralph cried , pushing [his]191-mr. spragg chair back violently and striding across [the narrow room]2441-the narrow room . [He]191-mr. spragg had given up the quest for the tooth - pick , and [his]191-mr. spragg drawn - in lips were no more than a narrow depression in [his]191-mr. spragg beard . [He]191-mr. spragg stood before [Ralph]199-ralph , absently shaking the loose change in [his]191-mr. spragg trouser - pockets . " [She]3743-his sister 's gone , [you]191-mr. spragg mean ? Left [me]191-mr. spragg ? With [another man]1237-another man ? "[191-mr. spragg] [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg drew [himself]191-mr. spragg up with a kind of slouching majesty . " [[My]191-mr. spragg daughter]3805-my daughter is not that style . [I]191-mr. spragg understand [Undine]192-undine thinks there have been mistakes on both sides . [She]192-undine considers the tie was formed too hastily . [I]191-mr. spragg believe desertion is the usual plea in such cases . "[191-mr. spragg] [Ralph]199-ralph stared about [him]191-mr. spragg , hardly listening . [He]191-mr. spragg did not resent [[his]191-mr. spragg father - in - law]1041-his father - in - law 's tone . In a dim way [he]191-mr. spragg guessed that [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg was suffering hardly less than [himself]191-mr. spragg . But nothing was clear to [him]191-mr. spragg save the monstrous fact suddenly upheaved in [his]191-mr. spragg path . [[His]191-mr. spragg wife]512-his wife had left [him]191-mr. spragg , and the plan for [her]512-his wife evasion had been made and executed while [he]191-mr. spragg lay helpless : [she]512-his wife had seized the opportunity of [his]191-mr. spragg illness to keep [him]191-mr. spragg in ignorance of [her]512-his wife design . " [She]192-undine 'll know it -- [you]199-ralph may count on that ! "[191-mr. spragg] [Ralph]199-ralph had begun to laugh again . Suddenly [he]191-mr. spragg heard [his]191-mr. spragg own laugh and it pulled [him]191-mr. spragg up . What was [he]191-mr. spragg laughing about ? What was [he]191-mr. spragg talking about ? The thing was to act -- to hold [his]191-mr. spragg tongue and act . There was no use uttering windy threats to [this broken - spirited old man]2450-this broken - spirited old man . A fury of action burned in [Ralph]199-ralph , pouring light into [his]191-mr. spragg mind and strength into [his]191-mr. spragg muscles . [He]191-mr. spragg caught up [his]191-mr. spragg hat and turned to the door .
