Nothing [you]199-ralph can do will change it . Time and again , [I]3752-his mother 've found that a good thing to remember . "[3752-his mother] XXIII In [the Adirondacks]98-the adirondacks [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph sat day after day on [the balcony of [[his]2454-his little house]2455-his little house above [the lake]2456-the lake]2453-the balcony of his little house above the lake , staring at the great white cloud - reflections in [the water]2457-the water and at the dark line of trees that closed them in . Now and then [he]2454-his got into [the canoe]2458-the canoe and paddled [himself]2454-his through [a winding chain of ponds]2459-a winding chain of ponds to [some lonely clearing in [the forest]2461-the forest]2460-some lonely clearing in the forest ; and there [he]2454-his lay on [his]2454-his back in the pine - needles and watched the great clouds form and dissolve themselves above [his]2454-his head . All [his]2454-his past life seemed to be symbolized by the building - up and breaking - down of those fluctuating shapes , which incalculable wind - currents perpetually shifted and remodelled or swept from the zenith like a pinch of dust . [[His]2454-his sister]3743-his sister told [him]2454-his that [he]2454-his looked well -- better than [he]2454-his had in years ; and there were moments when [his]2454-his listlessness , [his]2454-his stony insensibility to the small pricks and frictions of daily life , might have passed for the serenity of recovered health . There was [no one with whom [he]2454-his could speak of [Undine]192-undine]2463-no one with whom he could speak of undine . [[His]2454-his family]504-his family had thrown over the whole subject a pall of silence which even [Laura Fairford]203-laura shrank from raising . As for [[his]2454-his mother]3752-his mother , [Ralph]199-ralph had seen at once that the idea of talking over the situation was positively frightening to [her]3752-his mother . There was no provision for such emergencies in the moral order of [Washington Square]2-washington square . The affair was a " scandal , "[2475-their] and it was not in the Dagonet tradition to acknowledge the existence of scandals . [Ralph]199-ralph recalled a dim memory of [his]2454-his childhood , the tale of [a misguided friend of [[his]2454-his mother]3752-his mother 's who had left [[her]3752-his mother husband]488-her husband for [a more congenial companion]2469-a more congenial companion , and who , years later , returning ill and friendless to [New York]8-new york , had appealed for sympathy to [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph . [The latter]573-the latter had not refused to give it ; but [she]3752-his mother had put on [her]3752-his mother black cashmere and two veils when [she]3752-his mother went to see [[her]3752-his mother unhappy friend]2471-her unhappy friend , and had never mentioned these errands of mercy to [[her]3752-his mother husband]488-her husband]2466-a misguided friend of his mother 's who had left her husband for a more congenial companion , and who , years later , returning ill and friendless to new york , had appealed for sympathy to mrs. marvell . the latter had not refused to give it ; but she had put on her black cashmere and two veils when she went to see her unhappy friend , and had never mentioned these errands of mercy to her husband . [Ralph]199-ralph suspected that the constraint shown by [[his]2454-his mother]3752-his mother and [sister]2215-sister was partly due to [their]2475-their having but a dim and confused view of what had happened . In [their]2475-their vocabulary the word " divorce "[2475-their] was wrapped in such a dark veil of innuendo as [no ladylike hand]2476-no ladylike hand would care to lift . [They]2475-their had not reached the point of differentiating divorces , but classed them indistinctively as disgraceful incidents , in which [the woman]1564-the woman was always to blame , but [the man]1579-the man , though [[her]1564-the woman innocent victim]2479-her innocent victim , was yet inevitably contaminated . The time involved in the " proceedings "[256-mr. dagonet] was viewed as a penitential season during which it behoved [the family of [the persons concerned]2481-the persons concerned]2480-the family of the persons concerned to behave as if [they]2480-the family of the persons concerned were dead ; yet any open allusion to the reason for adopting such an attitude would have been regarded as the height of indelicacy . [Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet 's notion of the case was almost as remote from reality . All [he]256-mr. dagonet asked was that [[his]256-mr. dagonet grandson]2342-his grandson should " thrash "[256-mr. dagonet] [somebody]4109-somebody , and [he]256-mr. dagonet could not be made to understand that the modern drama of divorce is sometimes cast without a Lovelace . " [You]4686-you might as well tell [me]256-mr. dagonet there was nobody but [Adam]344-adam in [the garden]2118-the garden when [Eve]345-eve picked the apple . [You]4686-you say [[your]4686-you wife]4211-your wife was discontented ? [No woman]4689-no woman ever knows [she]4689-no woman 's discontented till [some man]4355-some man tells [her]4689-no woman so . [[My]256-mr. dagonet God]4691-my god ! [I]256-mr. dagonet 've seen smash - ups before now ; but [I]256-mr. dagonet never yet saw a marriage dissolved like a business partnership . Divorce without [a lover]4692-a lover ? Why , it's -- it 's as unnatural as getting drunk on lemonade . "[256-mr. dagonet] After this first explosion [Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet also became silent ; and [Ralph]199-ralph perceived that what annoyed [him]256-mr. dagonet most was the fact of the " scandal 's "[204-mrs. fairford] not being one in any gentlemanly sense of the word . It was like some nasty business mess , about which [Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet could n't pretend to have an opinion , since such things did n't happen to [men of [his]256-mr. dagonet kind]2484-men of his kind . That such a thing should have happened to [[his]256-mr. dagonet only grandson]2485-his only grandson was probably the bitterest experience of [his]256-mr. dagonet pleasantly uneventful life ; and it added a touch of irony to [Ralph]199-ralph 's unhappiness to know how little , in the whole affair , [he]256-mr. dagonet was cutting the figure [Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet expected [him]256-mr. dagonet to cut . At first [he]256-mr. dagonet had chafed under the taciturnity surrounding [him]256-mr. dagonet : had passionately longed to cry out [his]256-mr. dagonet humiliation , [his]256-mr. dagonet rebellion , [his]256-mr. dagonet despair . Then [he]256-mr. dagonet began to feel the tonic effect of silence ; and the next stage was reached when it became clear to [him]256-mr. dagonet that there was nothing to say . There were thoughts and thoughts : they bubbled up perpetually from the black springs of [his]256-mr. dagonet hidden misery , [they]2486-they stole on [him]256-mr. dagonet in the darkness of night , they blotted out the light of day ; but when it came to putting them into words and applying them to the external facts of the case , they seemed totally unrelated to it . One more white and sun - touched glory had gone from [his]256-mr. dagonet sky ; but there seemed no way of connecting that with such practical issues as [his]256-mr. dagonet being called on to decide whether [Paul]218-paul was to be put in knickerbockers or trousers , and whether [he]256-mr. dagonet should go back to [Washington Square]2-washington square for the winter or hire [a small house for [himself]256-mr. dagonet]2487-a small house for himself and [[his]256-mr. dagonet son]1973-his son . The latter question was ultimately decided by [his]256-mr. dagonet remaining under [[his]256-mr. dagonet grandfather]949-his grandfather 's roof . [November]346-november found [him]256-mr. dagonet back in [the office]1866-the office again , in fairly good health , with an outer skin of indifference slowly forming over [his]256-mr. dagonet lacerated soul . There had been a hard minute to live through when [he]256-mr. dagonet came back to [[his]256-mr. dagonet old brown room in [Washington Square]2-washington square]2238-his old brown room in washington square . The walls and tables were covered with photographs of [Undine]192-undine : effigies of all shapes and sizes , expressing every possible sentiment dear to the photographic tradition . [Ralph]199-ralph had gathered them all up when [he]256-mr. dagonet had moved from [West End Avenue]11-west end avenue after [Undine]192-undine 's departure for [Europe]29-europe , and [they]2492-they throned over [his]256-mr. dagonet other possessions as [her]192-undine image had throned over [his]256-mr. dagonet future the night [he]256-mr. dagonet had sat in [that very room]2493-that very room and dreamed of soaring up with [her]192-undine into the blue ... It was impossible to go on living with [her]192-undine photographs about [him]256-mr. dagonet ; and one evening , going up to [[his]256-mr. dagonet room]1748-his room after dinner , [he]256-mr. dagonet began to unhang them from the walls , and to gather them up from book - shelves and mantel - piece and tables . Then [he]256-mr. dagonet looked about for some place in which to hide them . There were drawers under [his]256-mr. dagonet book - cases ; but they were full of old discarded things , and even if [he]256-mr. dagonet emptied the drawers , the photographs , in their heavy frames , were almost all too large to fit into them . [He]256-mr. dagonet turned next to the top shelf of [his]256-mr. dagonet cupboard ; but here [the nurse]4300-the nurse had stored [Paul]218-paul 's old toys , [his]256-mr. dagonet sand - pails , shovels and croquet - box . [Every corner]2496-every corner was packed with the vain impedimenta of living , and the mere thought of clearing a space in the chaos was too great an effort . [He]256-mr. dagonet began to replace the pictures one by one ; and the last was still in [his]256-mr. dagonet hand when [he]256-mr. dagonet heard [[his]256-mr. dagonet sister]3743-his sister 's voice outside . [He]256-mr. dagonet hurriedly put the portrait back in its usual place on [his]256-mr. dagonet writing - table , and [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford , who had been dining in [Washington Square]2-washington square , and had come up to bid [him]256-mr. dagonet good night , flung [her]204-mrs. fairford arms about [him]256-mr. dagonet in a quick embrace and went down to [[her]204-mrs. fairford carriage]2498-her carriage . The next afternoon , when [he]256-mr. dagonet came [home]548-home from [the office]1866-the office , [he]256-mr. dagonet did not at first see any change in [[his]256-mr. dagonet room]1748-his room ; but when [he]256-mr. dagonet had lit [his]256-mr. dagonet pipe and thrown [himself]256-mr. dagonet into [his]256-mr. dagonet arm - chair [he]256-mr. dagonet noticed that the photograph of [[his]256-mr. dagonet wife]512-his wife 's picture by [Popple]197-popple no longer faced [him]256-mr. dagonet from the mantel - piece . [He]256-mr. dagonet turned to [his]256-mr. dagonet writing - table , but [her]512-his wife image had vanished from there too ; then [his]256-mr. dagonet eye , making the circuit of the walls , perceived that they also had been stripped . Not a single photograph of [Undine]192-undine was left ; yet so adroitly had the work of elimination been done , so ingeniously the remaining objects readjusted , that the change attracted no attention . [Ralph]199-ralph was angry , sore , ashamed . [He]256-mr. dagonet felt as if [Laura]203-laura , whose hand [he]256-mr. dagonet instantly detected , had taken a cruel pleasure in [her]203-laura work , and for an instant [he]256-mr. dagonet hated [her]203-laura for it . Then a sense of relief stole over [him]256-mr. dagonet . [He]256-mr. dagonet was glad [he]256-mr. dagonet could look about [him]256-mr. dagonet without meeting [Undine]192-undine 's eyes , and [he]256-mr. dagonet understood that what had been done to [[his]256-mr. dagonet room]1748-his room [he]256-mr. dagonet must do to [his]256-mr. dagonet memory and [his]256-mr. dagonet imagination : [he]256-mr. dagonet must so readjust [his]256-mr. dagonet mind that , whichever way [he]256-mr. dagonet turned [his]256-mr. dagonet thoughts , [her]203-laura face should no longer confront [him]256-mr. dagonet . But that was a task that [Laura]203-laura could not perform for [him]256-mr. dagonet , a task to be accomplished only by the hard continuous tension of [his]256-mr. dagonet will . With the setting in of the mood of silence all desire to fight [[his]256-mr. dagonet wife]512-his wife 's suit died out . The idea of touching publicly on anything that had passed between [himself]256-mr. dagonet and [Undine]192-undine had become unthinkable . Insensibly [he]256-mr. dagonet had been subdued to the point of view about [him]256-mr. dagonet , and the idea of calling on the law to repair [his]256-mr. dagonet shattered happiness struck [him]256-mr. dagonet as even more grotesque than it was degrading . Nevertheless , some contradictory impulse of [his]256-mr. dagonet divided spirit made [him]256-mr. dagonet resent , on the part of [[his]256-mr. dagonet mother]3752-his mother and [sister]2215-sister , a too - ready acceptance of [his]256-mr. dagonet attitude . There were moments when [their]2507-their tacit assumption that [[his]256-mr. dagonet wife]512-his wife was banished and forgotten irritated [him]256-mr. dagonet like the hushed tread of sympathizers about the bed of [an invalid who will not admit that [he]256-mr. dagonet suffers]2509-an invalid who will not admit that he suffers . [His]256-mr. dagonet irritation was aggravated by the discovery that [Mrs. Marvell]192-undine and [Laura]203-laura had already begun to treat [Paul]218-paul as if [he]256-mr. dagonet were [an orphan]2510-an orphan . One day , coming unnoticed into [the nursery]1723-the nursery , [Ralph]199-ralph heard [the boy]4296-the boy ask when [[his]4296-the boy mother]3752-his mother was coming back ; and [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford , who was with [him]4296-the boy , answered : " [She]3752-his mother 's not coming back , [dearest]4053-dearest ; and [you]4296-the boy 're not to speak of [her]3752-his mother to [father]3817-father . "[203-laura] [Ralph]199-ralph , when [the boy]4296-the boy was out of hearing , rebuked [[his]4296-the boy sister]3743-his sister for [her]3743-his sister answer . " [I]199-ralph do n't want [you]3743-his sister to talk of [[his]4296-the boy mother]3752-his mother as if [she]3752-his mother were dead . [I]199-ralph do n't want [you]3743-his sister to forbid [Paul]218-paul to speak of [her]3752-his mother . "[199-ralph] [Laura]203-laura , though usually so yielding , defended [herself]203-laura . " What 's the use of encouraging [him]4296-the boy to speak of [her]3752-his mother when [he]4296-the boy 's never to see [her]3752-his mother ? The sooner [he]4296-the boy forgets [her]3752-his mother the better . "[199-ralph] [Ralph]199-ralph pondered . " Later -- if [she]3752-his mother asks to see [him]4296-the boy -- [I]204-mrs. fairford sha n't refuse . "[204-mrs. fairford] [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford pressed [her]204-mrs. fairford lips together to check the answer : " [She]3752-his mother never will ! "[2516-his] [Ralph]199-ralph heard it , nevertheless , and let it pass . Nothing gave [him]2516-his so profound a sense of estrangement from [his]2516-his former life as the conviction that [[his]2516-his sister]3743-his sister was probably right . [He]2516-his did not really believe that [Undine]192-undine would ever ask to see [[her]192-undine boy]1665-her boy ; but if [she]192-undine did [he]2516-his was determined not to refuse [her]192-undine request . Time wore on , the Christmas holidays came and went , and the winter continued to grind out the weary measure of its days . Toward the end of January [Ralph]199-ralph received a registered letter , addressed to [him]2516-his at [[his]2516-his office]737-his office , and bearing in the corner of the envelope the names of [a firm of [Sioux Falls]128-sioux falls [attorneys]129-attorneys]2520-a firm of sioux falls attorneys . [He]2516-his instantly divined that it contained the legal notification of [[his]2516-his wife]512-his wife 's application for divorce , and as [he]2516-his wrote [his]2516-his name in [the postman]2522-the postman 's book [he]2516-his smiled grimly at the thought that the stroke of [his]2516-his pen was doubtless signing [her]512-his wife release . [He]2516-his opened the letter , found it to be what [he]2516-his had expected , and locked it away in [his]2516-his desk without mentioning the matter to [any one]659-any one . [He]2516-his supposed that with the putting away of this document [he]2516-his was thrusting the whole subject out of sight ; but not more than a fortnight later , as [he]2516-his sat in [the Subway]130-the subway on [his]2516-his way down [- town]2524-- town , [his]2516-his eye was caught by [his]2516-his own name on the first page of the heavily head - lined paper which [the unshaved occupant of the next seat]2525-the unshaved occupant of the next seat held between grimy fists . The blood rushed to [Ralph]199-ralph 's forehead as [he]2516-his looked over [the man]1579-the man 's arm and read : " Society Leader Gets Decree , "[2516-his] and beneath it the subordinate clause : " Says [Husband]1427-husband Too Absorbed In Business To Make [Home]548-home Happy . "[512-his wife] For weeks afterward , wherever [he]2516-his went , [he]2516-his felt that blush upon [his]2516-his forehead . For the first time in [his]2516-his life the coarse fingering of public curiosity had touched the secret places of [his]2516-his soul , and nothing that had gone before seemed as humiliating as this trivial comment on [his]2516-his tragedy . The paragraph continued on its way through the press , and whenever [he]2516-his took up a newspaper [he]2516-his seemed to come upon it , slightly modified , variously developed , but always reverting with a kind of unctuous irony to [his]2516-his financial preoccupations and [[his]2516-his wife]512-his wife 's consequent loneliness . The phrase was even taken up by [the paragraph writer]2528-the paragraph writer , called forth excited letters from [similarly situated victims]2529-similarly situated victims , was commented on in humorous editorials and served as a text for pulpit denunciations of the growing craze for wealth ; and finally , at [[his]2516-his dentist]2530-his dentist 's , [Ralph]199-ralph came across it in a Family Weekly , as one of the " Heart problems "[512-his wife] propounded to [subscribers]2531-subscribers , with a Gramophone , a Straight - front Corset and a Vanity - box among the prizes offered for its solution . XXIV " If [you]192-undine 'd only had the sense to come straight to [me]512-his wife , [Undine Spragg]192-undine ! There is n't a tip [I]512-his wife could n't have given [you]192-undine -- not one ! "[512-his wife] This speech , in which a faintly contemptuous compassion for [[her]512-his wife friend]608-her friend 's case was blent with the frankest pride in [her]512-his wife own , probably represented the nearest approach to " tact "[330-mrs. rolliver] that [Mrs. James J. Rolliver]330-mrs. rolliver had yet acquired . [Undine]192-undine was impartial enough to note in it a distinct advance on the youthful methods of [Indiana Frusk]216-indiana frusk ; yet it required a good deal of self - control to take the words to [herself]192-undine with a smile , while they seemed to be laying a visible scarlet welt across the pale face [she]192-undine kept valiantly turned to [[her]192-undine friend]608-her friend . The fact that [she]192-undine must permit [herself]192-undine to be pitied by [Indiana Frusk]216-indiana frusk gave [her]192-undine the uttermost measure of the depth to which [her]192-undine fortunes had fallen . This abasement was inflicted on [her]192-undine in [the staring gold apartment of [the Hotel Nouveau Luxe]2535-the hotel nouveau luxe in which [the Rollivers]347-the rollivers had established [themselves]347-the rollivers on [their]2536-their recent arrival in [Paris]76-paris]2534-the staring gold apartment of the hotel nouveau luxe in which the rollivers had established themselves on their recent arrival in paris . [The vast drawing - room]2537-the vast drawing - room , adorned only by two high - shouldered gilt baskets of orchids drooping on their wires , reminded [Undine]192-undine of [the " Looey suite "[330-mrs. rolliver] in which the opening scenes of [her]192-undine own history had been enacted]2538-the " looey suite " in which the opening scenes of her own history had been enacted ; and the resemblance and the difference were emphasized by the fact that the image of [her]192-undine past self was not inaccurately repeated in the triumphant presence of [Indiana Rolliver]348-indiana . " There is n't a tip [I]348-indiana could n't have given [you]192-undine -- not one ! "[348-indiana] [Mrs. Rolliver]330-mrs. rolliver reproachfully repeated ; and all [Undine]192-undine 's superiorities and discriminations seemed to shrivel up in the crude blaze of the other 's solid achievement . There was little comfort in noting , for [one]629-one 's private delectation , that [Indiana]348-indiana spoke of [[her]348-indiana husband]488-her husband as " [Mr. Rolliver]349-mr. rolliver , "[330-mrs. rolliver] that [she]348-indiana twanged a piercing R , that one of [her]348-indiana shoulders was still higher than the other , and that [her]348-indiana striking dress was totally unsuited to the hour , the place and the occasion . [She]348-indiana still did and was all that [Undine]192-undine had so sedulously learned not to be and to do ; but to dwell on these obstacles to [her]192-undine success was but to be more deeply impressed by the fact that [she]192-undine had nevertheless succeeded . Not much more than a year had elapsed since [Undine Marvell]192-undine , sitting in [the drawing - room of [another Parisian hotel]2542-another parisian hotel]2541-the drawing - room of another parisian hotel , had heard the immense orchestral murmur of [Paris]76-paris rise through the open windows like the ascending movement of [her]192-undine own hopes . The immense murmur still sounded on , deafening and implacable as some elemental force ; and the discord in [her]192-undine fate no more disturbed it than the motor wheels rolling by under the windows were disturbed by the particles of dust that they ground to finer powder as [they]2543-they passed . [Many of [[her]192-undine old friends]2558-her old friends]2557-many of her old friends had already returned to [Paris]76-paris : [the Harvey Shallums]298-the shallums , [May Beringer]337-may beringer , [Dicky Bowles]308-dicky bowles and other westward - bound nomads lingering on for a glimpse of the autumn theatres and fashions before hurrying back to inaugurate the [New York]8-new york season . [I]192-undine 'd forgotten that [I]192-undine 'd asked [the Jim Driscolls]210-the driscolls , and it might be uncomfortable -- for [YOU]4733-you .... "[192-undine] In [another world]2564-another world [she]2565-her was still welcome , at first perhaps even more so than before : [the world]620-the world , namely , to which [she]2565-her had proposed to present [Indiana Rolliver]348-indiana . [Roviano]351-the marquis roviano , [Madame Adelschein]296-madame adelschein , and [a few of the freer spirits of [[her]2565-her old St. Moritz band]73-st. moritz , reappearing in [Paris]76-paris with the close of the watering - place season]2567-a few of the freer spirits of her old st. moritz band , reappearing in paris with the close of the watering - place season , had quickly discovered [her]2565-her and shown a keen interest in [her]2565-her liberation . It appeared in some mysterious way to make [her]2565-her more available for [their]2568-their purpose , and [she]2565-her found that , in the character of [the last American divorcee]2569-the last american divorcee , [she]2565-her was even regarded as eligible to [the small and intimate inner circle of [[their]2568-their loosely - knit association]2571-their loosely - knit association]2570-the small and intimate inner circle of their loosely - knit association . At first [she]2565-her could not make out what had entitled [her]2565-her to this privilege , and increasing enlightenment produced a revolt of the Apex puritanism which , despite some odd accommodations and compliances , still carried its head so high in [her]2565-her . [Undine]192-undine had been perfectly sincere in telling [Indiana Rolliver]348-indiana that [she]2565-her was not " [an Immoral woman]4700-an immoral woman . "[2565-her] The pleasures for which [her]2565-her sex took such risks had never attracted [her]2565-her , and [she]2565-her did not even crave the excitement of having it thought that [they]2572-they did . [She]2565-her wanted , passionately and persistently , two things which [she]2565-her believed should subsist together in any well - ordered life : amusement and respectability ; and despite [her]2565-her surface - sophistication [her]2565-her notion of amusement was hardly less innocent than when [she]2565-her had hung on [the plumber]554-the plumber 's fence with [Indiana Frusk]216-indiana frusk . It gave [her]2565-her , therefore , no satisfaction to find [herself]2565-her included among [[Madame Adelschein]296-madame adelschein 's intimates]2574-madame adelschein 's intimates . It embarrassed [her]2565-her to feel that [she]2565-her was expected to be " queer "[2565-her] and " different , "[192-undine] to respond to pass - words and talk in innuendo , to associate with the equivocal and the subterranean and affect to despise the ingenuous daylight joys which really satisfied [her]2565-her soul . But the business shrewdness which was never quite dormant in [her]2565-her suggested that this was not the moment for such scruples . [She]2565-her must make the best of what [she]2565-her could get and wait [her]2565-her chance of getting something better ; and meanwhile the most practical use to which [she]2565-her could put [[her]2565-her shady friends]2575-her shady friends was to flash [their]2575-her shady friends authentic nobility in the dazzled eyes of [Mrs. Rolliver]330-mrs. rolliver . With this object in view [she]2565-her made haste , in [a fashionable tea - room of [the rue de Rivoli]2577-the rue de rivoli]2576-a fashionable tea - room of the rue de rivoli , to group about [[Indiana]216-indiana frusk the most titled members of [the band]1768-the band]2578-indiana the most titled members of the band ; and the felicity of the occasion would have been unmarred had [she]2565-her not suddenly caught sight of [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond sitting on the other side of [the room]441-the room . [She]2565-her had not seen [Chelles]382-raymond since [her]2565-her return to [Paris]76-paris . It had seemed preferable to leave [their]2581-their meeting to chance and the present chance might have served as well as another but for the fact that among [[his]382-raymond companions]2582-his companions were [two or three of [the most eminent ladies of [the proud quarter beyond the Seine]2585-the proud quarter beyond the seine]2584-the most eminent ladies of the proud quarter beyond the seine]2583-two or three of the most eminent ladies of the proud quarter beyond the seine . It was what [Undine]192-undine , in moments of discouragement , characterized as " [her]192-undine luck "[192-undine] that one of these should be the hated [Miss Wincher of Potash Springs]244-miss wincher , who had now become [the Marquise de Trezac]332-the marquise de trezac . [Undine]192-undine knew that [Chelles]382-raymond and [[his]382-raymond compatriots]2586-his compatriots , however scandalized at [[her]2565-her European companions]2587-her european companions , would be completely indifferent to [Mrs. Rolliver]330-mrs. rolliver 's appearance ; but one gesture of [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac 's eye - glass would wave [Indiana]216-indiana frusk to [her]216-indiana frusk place and thus brand [the whole party]2588-the whole party as " wrong . "[216-indiana frusk] All this passed through [Undine]192-undine 's mind in the very moment of [her]192-undine noting the change of expression with which [Chelles]382-raymond had signalled [his]382-raymond recognition . If [their]2589-their encounter could have occurred in happier conditions it might have had far - reaching results . As it was , the crowded state of [the tea - room]2590-the tea - room , and the distance between [their]2589-their tables , sufficiently excused [his]382-raymond restricting [his]382-raymond greeting to an eager bow ; and [Undine]192-undine went [home]548-home heavy - hearted from this first attempt to reconstruct [her]192-undine past . [Her]192-undine spirits were not lightened by the developments of the next few days . [She]192-undine kept [herself]192-undine well in the foreground of [Indiana]216-indiana frusk 's life , and cultivated toward the rarely - visible [Rolliver]330-mrs. rolliver a manner in which impersonal admiration for [the statesman]2592-the statesman was tempered with the politest indifference to [the man]1579-the man . [Indiana]216-indiana frusk seemed to do justice to [her]192-undine efforts and to be reassured by the result ; but still there came no hint of a reward . For a time [Undine]192-undine restrained the question on [her]192-undine lips ; but one afternoon , when [she]192-undine had inducted [Indiana]216-indiana frusk into the deepest mysteries of Parisian complexion - making , the importance of the service and the confidential mood it engendered seemed to warrant a discreet allusion to [their]2589-their bargain . [Indiana]216-indiana frusk leaned back among [her]192-undine cushions with an embarrassed laugh . " [Undine]192-undine made no attempt to deny the charge or to defend [herself]192-undine . "[198-mr. marvell] [It]2604-it was [[[your]0-i husband]4485-your husband 's sister]2606-your husband 's sister -- what did [you]0-i say [her]2606-your husband 's sister name was ? [You]192-undine see , [you]0-i were [his]198-mr. marvell ideal . " XXV [Undine Marvell]192-undine , for the next few months , tasted all the accumulated bitterness of failure . After January [the drifting hordes of [[her]192-undine compatriots]2171-her compatriots]4743-the drifting hordes of her compatriots had scattered to [the four quarters of [the globe]4746-the globe]4745-the four quarters of the globe , leaving [Paris]76-paris to resume , under [its]76-paris low grey sky , [its]76-paris compacter winter personality . Noting , from [her]192-undine more and more deserted corner , each least sign of the social revival , [Undine]192-undine felt [herself]192-undine as stranded and baffled as after the ineffectual summers of [her]192-undine girlhood . [She]192-undine was not without possible alternatives ; but the sense of what [she]192-undine had lost took the savour from all that was left . [She]192-undine might have attached [herself]192-undine to [some migratory group winged for [Italy]72-italy or [Egypt]134-egypt]4747-some migratory group winged for italy or egypt ; but the prospect of travel did not in itself appeal to [her]192-undine , and [she]192-undine was doubtful of its social benefit . [She]192-undine lacked the adventurous curiosity which seeks its occasion in the unknown ; and though [she]192-undine could work doggedly for a given object the obstacles to be overcome had to be as distinct as the prize . [Her]192-undine one desire was to get back an equivalent of the precise value [she]192-undine had lost in ceasing to be [[Ralph Marvell]199-ralph 's wife]4748-ralph marvell 's wife . [Her]192-undine new visiting - card , bearing [her]192-undine Christian name in place of [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's , was like the coin of a debased currency testifying to [her]192-undine diminished trading capacity . [Her]192-undine restricted means , [her]192-undine vacant days , all the minor irritations of [her]192-undine life , were as nothing compared to this sense of a lost advantage . Even in the narrowed field of a Parisian winter [she]192-undine might have made [herself]192-undine a place in [some more or less extra - social world]4750-some more or less extra - social world ; but [her]192-undine experiments in this line gave [her]192-undine no pleasure proportioned to the possible derogation . [She]192-undine feared to be associated with "[2612-the wrong people] [the wrong people]2612-the wrong people , " and scented a shade of disrespect in every amicable advance . The more pressing attentions of [one or two men [she]192-undine had formerly known]4751-one or two men she had formerly known filled [her]192-undine with a glow of outraged pride , and for the first time in [her]192-undine life [she]192-undine felt that even solitude might be preferable to certain kinds of society . Since ill health was the most plausible pretext for seclusion , it was almost a relief to find that [she]192-undine was really growing "[198-mr. marvell] nervous " and sleeping badly . [The doctor [she]192-undine summoned]4752-the doctor she summoned advised [her]192-undine trying [a small quiet place on [the Riviera]135-the riviera]4753-a small quiet place on the riviera , not too near [the sea]4754-the sea ; and thither in the early days of December , [she]192-undine transported [herself]192-undine with [[her]192-undine maid]2227-her maid and an omnibus - load of luggage . [The place]491-the place disconcerted [her]192-undine by being really small and quiet , and for a few days [she]192-undine struggled against the desire for flight . [She]192-undine had never before known [a world as colourless and negative]4757-a world as colourless and negative as that of [the large white hotel where [everybody]3748-everybody went to bed at nine]4758-the large white hotel where everybody went to bed at nine , and donkey - rides over [stony hills]4760-stony hills were the only alternative to slow drives along [dusty roads]4761-dusty roads . [Many of [the dwellers in [this temple of repose]4764-this temple of repose]4763-the dwellers in this temple of repose]4762-many of the dwellers in this temple of repose found even these exercises too stimulating , and preferred to sit for hours under the palms in [the garden]2118-the garden , playing Patience , embroidering , or reading odd volumes of Tauchnitz . [Undine]192-undine , driven by despair to an inspection of [the hotel]819-the hotel book - shelves , discovered that scarcely any work [they]4763-the dwellers in this temple of repose contained was complete ; but this did not seem to trouble [the readers]4767-the readers , who continued to feed [their]4767-the readers leisure with mutilated fiction , from which [they]4767-the readers occasionally raised [their]4767-the readers eyes to glance mistrustfully at the new arrival sweeping [the garden]2118-the garden gravel with [her]192-undine frivolous draperies . [The inmates of [the hotel]819-the hotel]4769-the inmates of the hotel were of different nationalities , but [their]4769-the inmates of the hotel racial differences were levelled by the stamp of a common mediocrity . All differences of tongue , of custom , of physiognomy , disappeared in this deep community of insignificance , which was like some secret bond , with the manifold signs and pass - words of [its]819-the hotel ignorances and its imperceptions . It was not the heterogeneous mediocrity of [the American summer hotel]4771-the american summer hotel where the lack of any standard is the nearest approach to a tie , but an organized codified dulness , in conscious possession of [its]819-the hotel rights , and strong in the voluntary ignorance of any others . It took [Undine]192-undine a long time to accustom [herself]192-undine to such an atmosphere , and meanwhile [she]192-undine fretted , fumed and flaunted , or abandoned [herself]192-undine to long periods of fruitless brooding . Sometimes a flame of anger shot up in [her]192-undine , dismally illuminating the path [she]192-undine had travelled and the blank wall to which [it]4772-it led . At other moments past and present were enveloped in a dull fog of rancour which distorted and faded even the image [she]192-undine presented to [her]192-undine morning mirror . There were days when every young face [she]192-undine saw left in [her]192-undine a taste of poison . But when [she]192-undine compared [herself]192-undine with the specimens of [her]192-undine sex who plied [their]4769-the inmates of the hotel languid industries under the palms , or looked away as [she]192-undine passed [them]4769-the inmates of the hotel in [hall]4773-hall or [staircase]4774-staircase , [her]192-undine spirits rose , and [she]192-undine rang for [[her]192-undine maid]2227-her maid and dressed [herself]192-undine in [her]192-undine newest and vividest . These were unprofitable triumphs , however . [She]192-undine never made one of [her]192-undine attacks on the organized disapproval of [the community]4092-the community without feeling [she]192-undine had lost ground by it ; and the next day [she]192-undine would lie in bed and send down capricious orders for food , which [[her]192-undine maid]2227-her maid would presently remove untouched , with instructions to transmit [her]192-undine complaints to [the landlord]4778-the landlord . Sometimes the events of the past year , ceaselessly revolving through [her]192-undine brain , became no longer a subject for criticism or justification but simply a series of pictures monotonously unrolled . Hour by hour , in such moods , [she]192-undine re - lived the incidents of [her]192-undine flight with [Peter Van Degen]246-van degen : the part of [her]192-undine career that , since it had proved a failure , seemed least like [herself]192-undine and most difficult to justify . [She]192-undine had gone away with [him]246-van degen , and had lived with [him]246-van degen for two months : [she]192-undine , [Undine Marvell]192-undine , to whom respectability was the breath of life , to whom such follies had always been unintelligible and therefore inexcusable.--She had done this incredible thing , and [she]192-undine had done it from a motive that seemed , at the time , as clear , as logical , as free from the distorting mists of sentimentality , as any of [[her]192-undine father]614-her father 's financial enterprises . It had been a bold move , but it had been as carefully calculated as the happiest Wall Street "[198-mr. marvell] stroke . " [She]192-undine had gone away with [Peter]246-van degen because , after the decisive scene in which [she]192-undine had put [her]192-undine power to the test , to yield to [him]246-van degen seemed the surest means of victory . Even to [her]192-undine practical intelligence it was clear that an immediate dash to [Dakota]126-dakota might look too calculated ; and [she]192-undine had preserved [her]192-undine self - respect by telling [herself]192-undine that [she]192-undine was really [[his]246-van degen wife]512-his wife , and in no way to blame if the law delayed to ratify the bond . [She]192-undine was still persuaded of the justness of [her]192-undine reasoning ; but [she]192-undine now saw that it had left certain risks out of account . [Her]192-undine life with [Van Degen]246-van degen had taught [her]192-undine many things . [The two]899-the two had wandered from place to place , spending a great deal of money , always more and more money ; for the first time in [her]192-undine life [she]192-undine had been able to buy everything [she]192-undine wanted . For a while this had kept [her]192-undine amused and busy ; but presently [she]192-undine began to perceive that [[her]192-undine companion]887-her companion 's view of [their]899-the two relation was not the same as [hers]192-undine . [She]192-undine saw that [he]246-van degen had always meant it to be an unavowed tie , screened by [Mrs. Shallum]293-mrs. shallum 's companionship and [Clare]228-clare 's careless tolerance ; and that on those terms [he]246-van degen would have been ready to shed on [their]899-the two adventure the brightest blaze of notoriety . But since [Undine]192-undine had insisted on being carried off like [a sentimental school - girl]4783-a sentimental school - girl [he]246-van degen meant to shroud the affair in mystery , and was as zealous in concealing [their]899-the two relation as [she]192-undine was bent on proclaiming it . In the "[3774-mother] powerful " novels which [Popple]197-popple was fond of lending [her]192-undine [she]192-undine had met with increasing frequency [the type of heroine who scorns to love clandestinely , and proclaims the sanctity of passion and the moral duty of obeying its call]4784-the type of heroine who scorns to love clandestinely , and proclaims the sanctity of passion and the moral duty of obeying its call . [Undine]192-undine had been struck by these arguments as justifying and even ennobling [her]192-undine course , and had let [Peter]246-van degen understand that [she]192-undine had been actuated by the highest motives in openly associating [her]192-undine life with [his]246-van degen ; but [he]246-van degen had opposed a placid insensibility to these allusions , and had persisted in treating [her]192-undine as though [their]899-the two journey were the kind of escapade that [a man of [the world]620-the world]4785-a man of the world is bound to hide . [She]192-undine had expected [him]246-van degen to take [her]192-undine to [all the showy places where [[couples]2185-couples like [themselves]2185-couples]4789-couples like themselves are relieved from a too sustained contemplation of nature by the distractions of [the restaurant]716-the restaurant and the gaming - table]4787-all the showy places where couples like themselves are relieved from a too sustained contemplation of nature by the distractions of the restaurant and the gaming - table ; but [he]246-van degen had carried [her]192-undine from [one obscure corner of [Europe]29-europe]4791-one obscure corner of europe to another , shunning [fashionable hotels]4792-fashionable hotels and [crowded watering - places]4793-crowded watering - places , and displaying an ingenuity in the discovery of the unvisited and the out - of - season that gave [their]899-the two journey an odd resemblance to [her]192-undine melancholy wedding - tour . [She]192-undine had never for a moment ceased to remember that [the Dakota divorce - court]4794-the dakota divorce - court was the objective point of this later honeymoon , and [her]192-undine allusions to the fact were as frequent as prudence permitted . [Peter]246-van degen seemed in no way disturbed by them . [He]246-van degen responded with expressions of increasing tenderness , or the purchase of another piece of jewelry ; and though [Undine]192-undine could not remember [his]246-van degen ever voluntarily bringing the subject of [their]899-the two marriage [he]246-van degen did not shrink from [her]192-undine recurring mention of it . [He]246-van degen seemed merely too steeped in present well - being to think of the future , and [she]192-undine ascribed this to the fact that [his]246-van degen faculty of enjoyment could not project itself beyond the moment . [Her]192-undine business was to make each of [their]899-the two days so agreeable that when the last came [he]246-van degen should be conscious of a void to be bridged over as rapidly as possible and when [she]192-undine thought this point had been reached [she]192-undine packed [her]192-undine trunks and started for [Dakota]126-dakota . The next picture to follow was that of the dull months in [the western divorce - town]4795-the western divorce - town , where , to escape loneliness and avoid comment , [she]192-undine had cast in [her]192-undine lot with [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel , who had lately arrived [there]603-there on the same errand . [Undine]192-undine , at the outset , had been sorry for [the friend whose new venture seemed likely to result so much less brilliantly than [her]192-undine own]4797-the friend whose new venture seemed likely to result so much less brilliantly than her own ; but compassion had been replaced by irritation as [Mabel]200-mabel 's unpruned vulgarities , [her]192-undine enormous encroaching satisfaction with [herself]192-undine and [her]192-undine surroundings , began to pervade every corner of [[their]899-the two provisional household]4798-their provisional household . [Undine]192-undine , during the first months of [her]192-undine exile , had been sustained by the fullest confidence in [her]192-undine future . When [she]192-undine had parted from [Van Degen]246-van degen [she]192-undine had felt sure [he]246-van degen meant to marry [her]192-undine , and the fact that [Mrs. Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb was fortified by no similar hope made [her]192-undine easier to bear with . [Undine]192-undine was almost ashamed that [the unwooed Mabel]4799-the unwooed mabel should be [the witness of [her]192-undine own felicity]4800-the witness of her own felicity , and planned to send [her]4799-the unwooed mabel off on a trip to [Denver]136-denver when [Peter]246-van degen should announce [his]246-van degen arrival ; but the weeks passed , and [Peter]246-van degen did not come . [Mabel]200-mabel , on the whole , behaved well in this contingency . [Undine]192-undine , in [her]192-undine first exultation , had confided all [her]192-undine hopes and plans to [[her]192-undine friend]608-her friend , but [Mabel]200-mabel took no undue advantage of the confidence . [She]200-mabel was even tactful in [her]200-mabel loud fond clumsy way , with a tact that insistently boomed and buzzed about [its victim]4802-its victim 's head . But one day [she]192-undine mentioned that [she]192-undine had asked to dinner [a gentleman from [Little Rock]137-little rock who had come to [Dakota]126-dakota with the same object as [themselves]4803-a gentleman from little rock who had come to dakota with the same object as themselves , and whose acquaintance she had made through her lawyer , and whose acquaintance [she]192-undine had made through [[her]192-undine lawyer]4804-her lawyer]4803-a gentleman from little rock who had come to dakota with the same object as themselves , and whose acquaintance she had made through her lawyer . [The gentleman from [Little Rock]137-little rock]4805-the gentleman from little rock came to dine , and within a week [Undine]192-undine understood that [Mabel]200-mabel 's future was assured . If [Van Degen]246-van degen had been at hand [Undine]192-undine would have smiled with [him]246-van degen at poor [Mabel]200-mabel 's infatuation and [[her]192-undine suitor]4806-her suitor 's crudeness . But [Van Degen]246-van degen was not there . [He]246-van degen made no sign , [he]246-van degen sent no excuse ; [he]246-van degen simply continued to absent [himself]246-van degen ; and it was [Undine]192-undine who , in due course , had to make way for [[Mrs. Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb 's caller]4807-mrs. lipscomb 's caller , and sit [upstairs]4364-upstairs with a novel while [the drawing - room below]4809-the drawing - room below was given up to the enacting of an actual love - story . Even then , even to the end , [Undine]192-undine had to admit that [Mabel]200-mabel had behaved "[3774-mother] beautifully . " But it is comparatively easy to behave beautifully when one is getting what [one]629-one wants , and when [some one else , who has not always been altogether kind]4811-some one else , who has not always been altogether kind , is not . The net result of [Mrs. Lipscomb]221-mrs. lipscomb 's magnanimity was that when , on the day of parting , [she]221-mrs. lipscomb drew [Undine]192-undine to [her]221-mrs. lipscomb bosom with the hand on which [her]221-mrs. lipscomb new engagement - ring blazed , [Undine]192-undine hated [her]221-mrs. lipscomb as [she]192-undine hated everything else connected with [her]192-undine vain exile in [the wilderness]4812-the wilderness . XXVI The next phase in the unrolling vision was the episode of [her]192-undine return to [New York]8-new york . [She]192-undine had gone to [the Malibran]120-the malibran , to [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents -- for it was a moment in [her]192-undine career when [she]192-undine clung passionately to the conformities , and when the fact of being able to say : "[3774-mother] [I]0-i 'm here with [[my]0-i father]2613-my father and [mother]3774-mother " was worth paying for even in the discomfort of that grim abode . Nevertheless , it was another thorn in [her]192-undine pride that [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents could not -- for the meanest of material reasons -- transfer [themselves]551-her parents at [her]192-undine coming to [one of [the big Fifth Avenue hotels]4816-the big fifth avenue hotels]4815-one of the big fifth avenue hotels . When [she]192-undine had suggested it [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had briefly replied that , owing to the heavy expenses of [her]192-undine divorce suit , [he]191-mr. spragg could n't for the moment afford anything better ; and this announcement cast a deeper gloom over the future . It was not an occasion for being "[2615-her] nervous , " however ; [she]192-undine had learned too many hard facts in the last few months to think of having recourse to [her]192-undine youthful methods . And something told [her]192-undine that if [she]192-undine made the attempt it would be useless . [[Her]192-undine father]614-her father and [mother]3774-mother seemed much older , seemed tired and defeated , like [herself]192-undine . [Parents]742-parents and [daughter]480-daughter bore [their]551-her parents common failure in a common silence , broken only by [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's occasional tentative allusions to [[her]194-mrs. spragg grandson]4821-her grandson . But [her]192-undine anecdotes of [Paul]218-paul left a deeper silence behind [them]551-her parents . [Undine]192-undine did not want to talk of [[her]192-undine boy]1665-her boy . [She]192-undine could forget [him]1665-her boy when , as [she]192-undine put it , things were "[2615-her] going [her]2615-her way , " but in moments of discouragement the thought of [him]1665-her boy was an added bitterness , subtly different from [her]192-undine other bitter thoughts , and harder to quiet . It had not occurred to [her]192-undine to try to gain possession of [the child]1948-the child . [She]192-undine was vaguely aware that [the courts]4824-the courts had given [her]192-undine [his]1665-her boy custody ; but [she]192-undine had never seriously thought of asserting this claim . [[Her]192-undine parents]551-her parents ' diminished means and [her]192-undine own uncertain future made [her]192-undine regard the care of [Paul]218-paul as an additional burden , and [she]192-undine quieted [her]192-undine scruples by thinking of [him]1665-her boy as "[2615-her] better off " with [[Ralph]199-ralph 's family]4826-ralph 's family , and of [herself]192-undine as rather touchingly disinterested in putting [his]1665-her boy welfare before [her]192-undine own . [Poor Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg was pining for [him]1665-her boy , but [Undine]192-undine rejected [her]192-undine artless suggestion that [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny should be sent to "[2615-her] bring [him]2616-him round . " "[2617-them] [I]0-i would n't ask [them]2617-them a favour for [the world]620-the world -- [they're]2617-them just waiting for a chance to be hateful to [me]0-i , " [she]192-undine scornfully declared ; but it pained [her]192-undine that [[her]192-undine boy]1665-her boy , should be so near , yet inaccessible , and for the first time [she]192-undine was visited by unwonted questionings as to [her]192-undine share in the misfortunes that had befallen [her]192-undine . [She]192-undine had voluntarily stepped out of [her]192-undine social frame , and [the only person on whom]4828-the only person on whom [she]192-undine could with any satisfaction have laid the blame was [the person to whom [her]192-undine mind now turned with a belated tenderness]4829-the person to whom her mind now turned with a belated tenderness . It was thus , in fact , that [she]192-undine thought of [Ralph]199-ralph . [His]1665-her boy pride , [his]1665-her boy reserve , all the secret expressions of [his]1665-her boy devotion , the tones of [his]1665-her boy voice , [his]1665-her boy quiet manner , even [his]1665-her boy disconcerting irony : these seemed , in contrast to what [she]192-undine had since known , the qualities essential to [her]192-undine happiness . [She]192-undine could console [herself]192-undine only by regarding it as part of [her]192-undine sad lot that poverty and the relentless animosity of [[his]1665-her boy family]504-his family , should have put an end to so perfect a union : [she]192-undine gradually began to look on [herself]192-undine and [Ralph]199-ralph as [the victims of dark machinations]4831-the victims of dark machinations , and when [she]192-undine mentioned [him]1665-her boy [she]192-undine spoke forgivingly , and implied that "[560-people] everything might have been different " if "[2615-her] [people]560-people " had not "[560-people] come between " [them]560-people . [She]192-undine had arrived in [New York]8-new york in midseason , and the dread of seeing familiar faces kept [her]192-undine shut up in [[her]192-undine room]461-her room at [the Malibran]120-the malibran , reading novels and brooding over possibilities of escape . [She]192-undine tried to avoid the daily papers , but they formed the staple diet of [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents , and now and then [she]192-undine could not help taking one up and turning to the "[560-people] Society Column . " [Its]4834-its perusal produced the impression that the season must be the gayest [New York]8-new york had ever known . [The Harmon B. Driscolls]355-the driscolls , [young Jim]330-mrs. rolliver and [[his]1665-her boy wife]512-his wife , [the Thurber Van Degens]209-van degens , [the Chauncey Ellings]211-the chauncey ellings , and [all the other Fifth Avenue potentates]4836-all the other fifth avenue potentates , seemed to have [their]4836-all the other fifth avenue potentates doors perpetually open to a stream of feasters among whom the familiar presences of [Grace Beringer]356-grace beringer , [Bertha Shallum]297-bertha shallum , [Dicky Bowles]308-dicky bowles and [Claud Walsingham Popple]197-popple came and went with the irritating sameness of [the figures in a stage - procession]4837-the figures in a stage - procession . Among [them]4837-the figures in a stage - procession also [Peter Van Degen]246-van degen presently appeared . [He]246-van degen had been on a tour around [the world]620-the world , and [Undine]192-undine could not look at a newspaper without seeing some allusion to [his]246-van degen progress . After [his]246-van degen return [she]192-undine noticed that [his]246-van degen name was usually coupled with [[his]246-van degen wife]512-his wife 's : [he]246-van degen and [Clare]228-clare seemed to be celebrating [his]246-van degen home - coming in a series of festivities , and [Undine]192-undine guessed that [he]246-van degen had reasons for wishing to keep before [the world]620-the world the evidences of [his]246-van degen conjugal accord . [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's clippings supplied [her]192-undine with such items as [her]192-undine own reading missed ; and one day [the masseuse]460-the masseuse appeared with a long article from the leading journal of [Little Rock]137-little rock , describing the brilliant nuptials of [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel -- now [Mrs. Homer Branney]357-mrs. homer branney -- and [her]200-mabel departure for "[2620-you] the Coast " in [[the bridegroom]4842-the bridegroom 's private car]4843-the bridegroom 's private car . This put the last touch to [Undine]192-undine 's irritation , and the next morning [she]192-undine got up earlier than usual , put on [her]192-undine most effective dress , went for a quick walk around [the Park]576-the park , and told [[her]192-undine father]614-her father when [she]192-undine came in that [she]192-undine wanted [him]614-her father to take [her]192-undine to the opera that evening . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg stared and frowned . "[2620-you] [You]2620-you mean [you]2620-you want [me]0-i to go round and hire a box for [you]2620-you ? " "[2620-you] Oh , no . " [Undine]192-undine coloured at the infelicitous allusion : besides , [she]192-undine knew now that [the smart people who were "[0-i] musical "]4846-the smart people who were " musical " went in stalls . "[0-i] [I]0-i only want two good seats . [I]0-i do n't see why [I]0-i should stay shut up . [I]0-i want [you]2621-you to go with [me]0-i , " [she]192-undine added . [[Her]192-undine father]614-her father received the latter part of the request without comment : [he]614-her father seemed to have gone beyond surprise . But [he]614-her father appeared that evening at dinner in a creased and loosely fitting dress - suit which [he]614-her father had probably not put on since the last time [he]614-her father had dined with [[his]614-her father son - in - law]1364-his son - in - law , and [he]614-her father and [Undine]192-undine drove off together , leaving [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg to gaze after [them]4849-them with the pale stare of [Hecuba]358-hecuba . [[Their]4849-them stalls]1143-their stalls were in the middle of [the house]623-the house , and around [them]4849-them swept the great curve of boxes at which [Undine]192-undine had so often looked up in the remote Stentorian days . Then all had been one indistinguishable glitter , now the scene was full of familiar details : [the house]623-the house was thronged with [people [she]192-undine knew]4853-people she knew , and every box seemed to contain a parcel of [her]192-undine past . At first [she]192-undine had shrunk from recognition ; but gradually , as [she]192-undine perceived that [no one]3844-no one noticed [her]192-undine , that [she]192-undine was merely part of [the invisible crowd out of range of the exploring opera glasses]4855-the invisible crowd out of range of the exploring opera glasses , [she]192-undine felt a defiant desire to make [herself]192-undine seen . When the performance was over [[her]192-undine father]614-her father wanted to leave [the house]623-the house by the door at which [they]2622-they had entered , but [she]192-undine guided [him]614-her father toward [[the stockholders]4858-the stockholders ' entrance]4859-the stockholders ' entrance , and pressed [her]192-undine way among [the furred and jewelled ladies waiting for [their]2622-they motors]4860-the furred and jewelled ladies waiting for their motors . "[2622-they] Oh , it 's the wrong door -- never mind , [we]2622-they 'll walk to the corner and get [a cab]4287-a cab , " [she]192-undine exclaimed , speaking loudly enough to be overheard . [Two or three heads]4861-two or three heads turned , and [she]192-undine met [Dicky Bowles]308-dicky bowles 's glance , and returned [his]614-her father laughing bow . [The woman talking to [him]614-her father]4862-the woman talking to him looked around , coloured slightly , and made a barely perceptible motion of [her]4862-the woman talking to him head . Just beyond [her]192-undine , [Mrs. Chauncey Elling]359-mrs. chauncey elling , plumed and purple , stared , parted [her]359-mrs. chauncey elling lips , and turned to say something important to [young Jim Driscoll]306-young jim driscoll , who looked up involuntarily and then squared [his]614-her father shoulders and gazed fixedly at a distant point , as [people]560-people do at a funeral . Behind [them]2622-they [Undine]192-undine caught sight of [Clare Van Degen]228-clare ; [she]2624-her stood alone , and [her]2624-her face was pale and listless . "[0-i] Shall [I]0-i go up and speak to [her]2624-her ? " [Undine]192-undine wondered . Some intuition told [her]192-undine that , alone of [all the women present]4864-all the women present , [Clare]228-clare might have greeted [her]192-undine kindly ; but [she]192-undine hung back , and [Mrs. Harmon Driscoll]201-driscoll surged by on [Popple]197-popple 's arm . [Popple]197-popple crimsoned , coughed , and signalled despotically to [[Mrs. Driscoll]201-driscoll 's footman]4865-mrs. driscoll 's footman . Over [his]614-her father shoulder [Undine]192-undine received a bow from [Charles Bowen]314-bowen , and behind [Bowen]314-bowen [she]192-undine saw [two or three other men [she]192-undine knew]4866-two or three other men she knew , and read in [their]4866-two or three other men she knew faces surprise , curiosity , and the wish to show [their]4866-two or three other men she knew pleasure at seeing [her]192-undine . But [she]192-undine grasped [[her]192-undine father]614-her father 's arm and drew [him]614-her father out among [the entangled motors and vociferating policemen]4868-the entangled motors and vociferating policemen . Neither [she]192-undine nor [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg spoke a word on the way [home]548-home ; but when [they]4870-they reached [the Malibran]120-the malibran [[her]192-undine father]614-her father followed [her]192-undine up to [[her]192-undine room]461-her room . [She]192-undine had dropped [her]192-undine cloak and stood before the wardrobe mirror studying [her]192-undine reflection when [he]614-her father came up behind [her]192-undine and [she]192-undine saw that [he]614-her father was looking at it too . "[0-i] Where did that necklace come from ? " [Undine]192-undine 's neck grew pink under the shining circlet . It was the first time since [her]192-undine return to [New York]8-new york that [she]192-undine had put on a low dress and thus uncovered the string of pearls [she]192-undine always wore . [She]192-undine made no answer , and [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg continued : "[199-ralph] Did [[your]2625-you husband]4485-your husband give them to [you]2625-you ? " "[199-ralph] [RALPH]199-ralph ! " [She]192-undine could not restrain a laugh . "[199-ralph] Who did , then ? " [Undine]192-undine remained silent . [She]192-undine really had not thought about the pearls , except in so far as [she]192-undine consciously enjoyed the pleasure of possessing them ; and [[her]192-undine father]614-her father , habitually so unobservant , had seemed [the last person]4874-the last person likely to raise the awkward question of [their]2627-'em origin . "[0-i] Why-- " [she]192-undine began , without knowing what [she]192-undine meant to say . "[2625-you] [I]0-i guess [you]2625-you better send ['em]2627-'em back to [the party [they]2627-'em belong to]2628-the party they belong to , " [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg continued , in a voice [she]192-undine did not know . "[2625-you] [They]2627-'em belong to [me]0-i ! " [she]192-undine flamed up . [He]191-mr. spragg looked at [her]192-undine as if [she]192-undine had grown suddenly small and insignificant . "[2625-you] [You]2625-you better send ['em]2627-'em back to [Peter Van Degen]246-van degen the first thing to - morrow morning , " [he]191-mr. spragg said as [he]191-mr. spragg went out of [the room]441-the room . As far as [Undine]192-undine could remember , it was the first time in [her]192-undine life that [he]191-mr. spragg had ever ordered [her]192-undine to do anything ; and when the door closed on [him]191-mr. spragg [she]192-undine had the distinct sense that the question had closed with it , and that [she]192-undine would have to obey . [She]192-undine took the pearls off and threw them from [her]192-undine angrily . The humiliation [[her]192-undine father]614-her father had inflicted on [her]192-undine was merged with the humiliation to which [she]192-undine had subjected [herself]192-undine in going to the opera , and [she]192-undine had never before hated [her]192-undine life as [she]192-undine hated it then . All night [she]192-undine lay sleepless , wondering miserably what to do ; and out of [her]192-undine hatred of [her]192-undine life , and [her]192-undine hatred of [Peter Van Degen]246-van degen , there gradually grew a loathing of [Van Degen]246-van degen 's pearls . How could [she]192-undine have kept them ; how have continued to wear them about [her]192-undine neck ! Only [her]192-undine absorption in other cares could have kept [her]192-undine from feeling the humiliation of carrying about with [her]192-undine the price of [her]192-undine shame . [Her]192-undine novel - reading had filled [her]192-undine mind with the vocabulary of outraged virtue , and with pathetic allusions to [woman]1795-woman 's frailty , and while [she]192-undine pitied [herself]192-undine [she]192-undine thought [[her]192-undine father]614-her father heroic . [She]192-undine was proud to think that [she]192-undine had [such a man to defend [her]192-undine]4879-such a man to defend her , and rejoiced that it was in [her]192-undine power to express [her]192-undine scorn of [Van Degen]246-van degen by sending back [his]246-van degen jewels . But [her]192-undine righteous ardour gradually cooled , and [she]192-undine was left once more to face the dreary problem of the future . [Her]192-undine evening at the opera had shown [her]192-undine the impossibility of remaining in [New York]8-new york . [She]192-undine had neither the skill nor the power to fight the forces of indifference leagued against [her]192-undine : [she]192-undine must get away at once , and try to make a fresh start . But , as usual , the lack of money hampered [her]192-undine . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg could no longer afford to make [her]192-undine the allowance [she]192-undine had intermittently received from [him]191-mr. spragg during the first years of [her]192-undine marriage , and since [she]192-undine was now without [child]4044-child or household [she]192-undine could hardly make it a grievance that [he]191-mr. spragg had reduced [her]192-undine income . But what [he]191-mr. spragg allowed [her]192-undine , even with the addition of [her]192-undine alimony , was absurdly insufficient . Not that [she]192-undine looked far ahead ; [she]192-undine had always felt [herself]192-undine predestined to ease and luxury , and the possibility of a future adapted to [her]192-undine present budget did not occur to [her]192-undine . But [she]192-undine desperately wanted enough money to carry [her]192-undine without anxiety through the coming year . When [her]192-undine breakfast tray was brought in [she]192-undine sent it away untouched and continued to lie in [[her]192-undine darkened room]4881-her darkened room . [She]192-undine knew that when [she]192-undine got up [she]192-undine must send back the pearls ; but there was no longer any satisfaction in the thought , and [she]192-undine lay listlessly wondering how [she]192-undine could best transmit them to [Van Degen]246-van degen . As [she]192-undine lay there [she]192-undine heard [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's voice in the passage . Hitherto [she]192-undine had avoided [the masseuse]460-the masseuse , as [she]192-undine did [every one else associated with [her]192-undine past]4883-every one else associated with her past . [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny had behaved with extreme discretion , refraining from all direct allusions to [Undine]192-undine 's misadventure ; but [her]192-undine silence was obviously the criticism of a superior mind . Once again [Undine]192-undine had disregarded [her]192-undine injunction to "[2625-you] go slow , " with results that justified the warning . [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's very reserve , however , now marked [her]192-undine as [a safe adviser]4884-a safe adviser ; and [Undine]192-undine sprang up and called [her]192-undine in . "[192-undine] [My]0-i sakes . [Undine]192-undine ! [You]192-undine look 's if [you]192-undine 'd been setting up all night with a remains ! " [the masseuse]460-the masseuse exclaimed in [her]460-the masseuse round rich tones . [Undine]192-undine , without answering , caught up the pearls and thrust them into [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's hands . "[192-undine] [Good land]2629-good land alive ! " [The masseuse]460-the masseuse dropped into a chair and let the twist slip through [her]460-the masseuse fat flexible fingers . "[192-undine] Well , [you]192-undine got a fortune right round [your]192-undine neck whenever [you]192-undine wear them , [Undine Spragg]192-undine . " [Undine]192-undine murmured something indistinguishable . "[2630-'em] [I]0-i want [you]192-undine to take them-- " [she]192-undine began . "[2630-'em] Take ['em]2630-'em ? Where to ? " "[0-i] Why , to-- " [She]192-undine was checked by the wondering simplicity of [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's stare . [The masseuse]460-the masseuse must know where the pearls had come from , yet it had evidently not occurred to [her]192-undine that [Mrs. Marvell]192-undine was about to ask [her]192-undine to return them to [[their]2630-'em donor]4888-their donor . In the light of [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's unclouded gaze the whole episode took on a different aspect , and [Undine]192-undine began to be vaguely astonished at [her]192-undine immediate submission to [[her]192-undine father]614-her father 's will . The pearls were [hers]192-undine , after all ! "[2630-'em] To be re - strung ? " [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny placidly suggested . "[192-undine] Why , [you]192-undine 'd oughter to have it done right here before [your]192-undine eyes , with pearls that are worth what these are . " As [Undine]192-undine listened , a new thought shaped itself . [She]192-undine could not continue to wear the pearls : the idea had become intolerable . But for the first time [she]192-undine saw what they might be converted into , and what [they]2631-they might rescue [her]192-undine from ; and suddenly [she]192-undine brought out : "[0-i] Do [you]192-undine suppose [I]0-i could get anything for [them]2631-they ? " "[192-undine] Get anything ? Why , what-- " "[0-i] Anything like what they 're worth , [I]0-i mean . [They]2631-they cost a lot of money : they came from [the biggest place in [Paris]76-paris]2632-the biggest place in paris . " Under [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's simplifying eye it was comparatively easy to make these explanations . "[192-undine] [I]0-i want [you]192-undine to try and sell them for [me]0-i -- [I]0-i want [you]192-undine to do the best [you]192-undine can with [them]2631-they . [I]0-i ca n't do it [myself]0-i -- but [you]192-undine must swear [you]192-undine 'll never tell [a soul]2633-a soul , " [she]193-mrs. heeny pressed on breathlessly . "[192-undine] Why , [[you]192-undine poor child]2634-you poor child -- it ai n't the first time , " said [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny , coiling the pearls in [her]193-mrs. heeny big palm . "[192-undine] It 's a pity too : [they]2631-they 're such beauties . But [you]192-undine 'll get [others]807-others , " [she]193-mrs. heeny added , as the necklace vanished into [her]193-mrs. heeny bag . A few days later there appeared from the same receptacle a bundle of banknotes considerable enough to quiet [Undine]192-undine 's last scruples . [She]193-mrs. heeny no longer understood why [she]193-mrs. heeny had hesitated . Why should [she]193-mrs. heeny have thought it necessary to give back the pearls to [Van Degen]246-van degen ? [His]246-van degen obligation to [her]193-mrs. heeny represented far more than the relatively small sum [she]193-mrs. heeny had been able to realize on the necklace . [She]193-mrs. heeny hid the money in [her]193-mrs. heeny dress , and when [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny had gone on to [[Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's room]4890-mrs. spragg 's room [she]193-mrs. heeny drew the packet out , and counting the bills over , murmured to [herself]193-mrs. heeny : "[192-undine] Now [I]0-i can get away ! " [Her]193-mrs. heeny one thought was to return to [Europe]29-europe ; but [she]193-mrs. heeny did not want to go alone . The vision of [her]193-mrs. heeny solitary figure adrift in [the spring mob of [trans - Atlantic pleasure - seekers]4892-trans - atlantic pleasure - seekers]4891-the spring mob of trans - atlantic pleasure - seekers depressed and mortified [her]193-mrs. heeny . [She]193-mrs. heeny would be sure to run across [acquaintances]1453-acquaintances , and [they]1453-acquaintances would infer that [she]193-mrs. heeny was in quest of a new opportunity , a fresh start , and would suspect [her]193-mrs. heeny of trying to use [them]1453-acquaintances for the purpose . The thought was repugnant to [her]193-mrs. heeny newly awakened pride , and [she]193-mrs. heeny decided that if [she]193-mrs. heeny went to [Europe]29-europe [[her]193-mrs. heeny father]614-her father and [mother]3774-mother must go with [her]193-mrs. heeny . The project was a bold one , and when [she]193-mrs. heeny broached it [she]193-mrs. heeny had to run the whole gamut of [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's irony . [He]191-mr. spragg wanted to know what [she]193-mrs. heeny expected to do with [him]191-mr. spragg when [she]193-mrs. heeny got [him]191-mr. spragg [there]603-there ; whether [she]193-mrs. heeny meant to introduce [him]191-mr. spragg to "[192-undine] all those old Kings , " how [she]193-mrs. heeny thought [he]191-mr. spragg and [[her]193-mrs. heeny mother]426-her mother would look in court dress , and how [she]193-mrs. heeny supposed [he]191-mr. spragg was going to get on without [his]191-mr. spragg New York paper .
