[Neither Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg nor [[his]191-mr. spragg wife]512-his wife had ever before been out of [[their]4899-their country]4904-their country ; and [Undine]192-undine had not understood , till [they]551-her parents stood beside [her]193-mrs. heeny tongue - tied and helpless on [the dock at [Cherbourg]139-cherbourg]4905-the dock at cherbourg , the task [she]193-mrs. heeny had undertaken in uprooting [them]551-her parents . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had never been physically active , but on [foreign shores]4906-foreign shores [he]191-mr. spragg was seized by a strange restlessness , and a helpless dependence on [[his]191-mr. spragg daughter]500-his daughter . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's long habit of apathy was overcome by [her]194-mrs. spragg dread of being left alone when [[her]194-mrs. spragg husband]488-her husband and [Undine]192-undine went out , and [she]194-mrs. spragg delayed and impeded [their]551-her parents expeditions by insisting on accompanying [them]551-her parents ; so that , much as [Undine]192-undine disliked sightseeing , there seemed no alternative between "[2636-you] going round " with [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents and shutting [herself]192-undine up with [them]551-her parents in [the crowded hotels to which [she]192-undine successively transported [them]551-her parents]4910-the crowded hotels to which she successively transported them . [The hotels]4140-the hotels were [the only European institutions that really interested [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg]4912-the only european institutions that really interested mr. spragg . [He]191-mr. spragg considered [them]4140-the hotels manifestly inferior to [those at [home]548-home]4913-those at home ; but [he]191-mr. spragg was haunted by a statistical curiosity as to [their]4140-the hotels size , [their]4140-the hotels number , [their]4140-the hotels cost and [their]4140-the hotels capacity for housing and feeding [the incalculable hordes of [[his]191-mr. spragg countrymen]4916-his countrymen]4915-the incalculable hordes of his countrymen . [He]191-mr. spragg went through [galleries]1548-galleries , [churches]4918-churches and [museums]1547-museums in a stolid silence like [[his]191-mr. spragg daughter]500-his daughter 's ; but in [the hotels]4140-the hotels [he]191-mr. spragg never ceased to enquire and investigate , questioning every one who could speak English , comparing bills , collecting prospectuses and computing the cost of construction and the probable return on the investment . [He]191-mr. spragg regarded the non - existence of the cold - storage system as one more proof of European inferiority , and no longer wondered , in the absence of the room - to - room telephone , that [foreigners]4728-foreigners had n't yet mastered the first principles of time - saving . After a few weeks it became evident to [both parents]4923-both parents and [daughter]480-daughter that [their]4923-both parents unnatural association could not continue much longer . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's shrinking from everything new and unfamiliar had developed into a kind of settled terror , and [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had begun to be depressed by the incredible number of [the hotels]4140-the hotels and [their]4140-the hotels simply incalculable housing capacity . "[2636-you] It ai n't that [they]2637-they 're any great shakes in [themselves]2637-they , any one of 'em ; but there 's such a darned lot of 'em : they 're as thick as mosquitoes , every place [you]2638-you go . " And [he]191-mr. spragg began to reckon up , on slips of paper , on the backs of bills and the margins of old newspapers , the number of [travellers who could be simultaneously lodged]4926-travellers who could be simultaneously lodged , bathed and boarded on [the continent of [Europe]29-europe]4927-the continent of europe . "[240-undie] [Five hundred bedrooms]2639-five hundred bedrooms -- [three hundred bathrooms]2640-three hundred bathrooms -- no ; [three hundred and fifty bathrooms]2641-three hundred and fifty bathrooms , that one has : that makes , supposing two - thirds of 'em double up -- do [you]2638-you s'pose as many as that do , [Undie]240-undie ? [That porter at [Lucerne]140-lucerne]2642-that porter at lucerne told [me]0-i [the Germans]361-the germans slept three in [a room]2643-a room -- well , call it [eight hundred people]2644-eight hundred people ; and three meals a day per head ; no , four meals , with that afternoon tea [they]361-the germans take ; and the last place [we]2645-we were at--'way up on [that mountain]2646-that mountain there -- why , there were [seventy - five hotels in [that one spot]2648-that one spot alone]2647-seventy - five hotels in that one spot alone , and all jam full -- well , it beats [me]0-i to know where all [the people]875-the people come from ... " [He]0-i had gone on in this fashion for what seemed to [[his]0-i daughter]500-his daughter an endless length of days ; and then suddenly [he]0-i had roused [himself]0-i to say : "[0-i] See here , [Undie]240-undie , [I]0-i got to go back and make the money to pay for all this . " There had been no question on the part of [any of [the three of [Undine]192-undine 's]4930-the three of undine 's]4929-any of the three of undine 's returning with [them]4930-the three of undine 's ; and after [she]192-undine had conveyed [them]4930-the three of undine 's to [[their]4930-the three of undine 's steamer]4931-their steamer , and seen [their]4930-the three of undine 's vaguely relieved faces merged in the handkerchief - waving throng along the taffrail , [she]192-undine had returned alone to [Paris]76-paris and made [her]192-undine unsuccessful attempt to enlist the aid of [Indiana Rolliver]348-indiana . XXVII [She]192-undine was still brooding over this last failure when one afternoon , as [she]192-undine loitered on [the hotel terrace]4932-the hotel terrace , [she]192-undine was approached by [a young woman whom [she]192-undine had seen sitting near the wheeled chair of an old lady wearing a crumpled black bonnet under a funny fringed parasol with a jointed handle]4933-a young woman whom she had seen sitting near the wheeled chair of an old lady wearing a crumpled black bonnet under a funny fringed parasol with a jointed handle . [The young woman , who was small , slight and brown]4934-the young woman , who was small , slight and brown , was dressed with a disregard of the fashion which contrasted oddly with the mauve powder on [her]4934-the young woman , who was small , slight and brown face and the traces of artificial colour in [her]4934-the young woman , who was small , slight and brown dark untidy hair . [She]4934-the young woman , who was small , slight and brown looked as if [she]4934-the young woman , who was small , slight and brown might have several different personalities , and as if [the one of the moment]4935-the one of the moment had been hanging up a long time in [her]4934-the young woman , who was small , slight and brown wardrobe and been hurriedly taken down as probably good enough for the present occasion . On [Undine]192-undine 's assenting , the smile grew more alert and [the lady]593-the lady continued : "[362-sacha adelschein] [I]0-i think [you]2650-you know [[my]0-i friend]4726-my friend [Sacha Adelschein]362-sacha adelschein ? " No question could have been less welcome to [Undine]192-undine . If there was one point on which [she]192-undine was doggedly and puritanically resolved , it was that no extremes of social adversity should ever again draw [her]192-undine into the group of people among whom [Madame Adelschein]296-madame adelschein too conspicuously figured . " The murmur of negation died on [Undine]192-undine 's lips . [She]192-undine found [herself]192-undine grappling with a new social riddle , and such surprises were always stimulating . [No one]3844-no one figured more largely in the [Parisian]90-parisian chronicle than [the Princess Estradina]363-the princess estradina , and no name more impressively headed the list at every marriage , funeral and philanthropic entertainment of [the Faubourg Saint Germain]364-faubourg than that of [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother , [the Duchesse de Dordogne]365-the duchesse de dordogne , who must be no other than [the old woman sitting in the Bath - chair with the crumpled bonnet and the ridiculous sunshade]4944-the old woman sitting in the bath - chair with the crumpled bonnet and the ridiculous sunshade . But it was not the appearance of [the two ladies]913-the two ladies that surprised [Undine]192-undine . [She]192-undine knew that social gold does not always glitter , and that [the lady [she]192-undine had heard spoken of as [Lili Estradina]366-lili]4946-the lady she had heard spoken of as lili estradina was notoriously careless of the conventions ; but that [she]192-undine should boast of [her]192-undine intimacy with [Madame Adelschein]296-madame adelschein , and use it as a pretext for naming [herself]192-undine , overthrew [all [Undine]192-undine 's hierarchies]4947-all undine 's hierarchies . "[0-i] Yes -- it 's hideously dull here , and [I]0-i 'm dying of it . Do come over and speak to [[my]0-i mother]4182-my mother . " How had it happened , whither would it lead , how long could it last ? The questions raced through [Undine]192-undine 's brain as [she]192-undine sat listening to [[her]192-undine new friends]4953-her new friends -- [they]4953-her new friends seemed already too friendly to be called acquaintances!--replying to [their]4953-her new friends enquiries , and trying to think far enough ahead to guess what [they]4953-her new friends would expect [her]192-undine to say , and what tone it would be well to take . [She]192-undine was used to such feats of mental agility , and it was instinctive with [her]192-undine to become , for the moment , [the person [she]192-undine thought [[her]192-undine interlocutors]4955-her interlocutors]4954-the person she thought her interlocutors expected [her]192-undine to be ; but [she]192-undine had never had quite so new a part to play at such short notice . [She]192-undine took [her]192-undine cue , however , from the fact that [the Princess Estradina]363-the princess estradina , in [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother 's presence , made no farther allusion to [[her]192-undine dear friend]4957-her dear friend [Sacha]362-sacha adelschein , and seemed somehow , though [she]192-undine continued to chat on in the same easy strain , to look differently and throw out different implications . All these shades of demeanour were immediately perceptible to [Undine]192-undine , who tried to adapt [herself]192-undine to [them]4958-them by combining in [her]192-undine manner a mixture of Apex dash and [New York]8-new york dignity ; and the result was so successful that when [she]192-undine rose to go [the Princess]4948-the princess , with a hand on [her]192-undine arm , said almost wistfully : "[0-i] [You]2660-you 're staying on too ? Then do take pity on [us]2661-we ! [We]2661-we might go on some trips together ; and in the evenings [we]2661-we could make a bridge . " A new life began for [Undine]192-undine . [The Princess]4948-the princess , chained [[her]4948-the princess mother]426-her mother 's side , and frankly restive under [her]4948-the princess filial duty , clung to [her]4948-the princess new acquaintance with a persistence too flattering to be analyzed . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]4259-my dear , [I]0-i was on the brink of suicide when [I]0-i saw [your]4259-my dear name in [the visitors]2663-the visitors ' list , " [she]192-undine explained ; and [Undine]192-undine felt like answering that [she]192-undine had nearly reached the same pass when [the Princess]4948-the princess 's thin little hand had been held out to [her]192-undine . For the moment [she]192-undine was dizzy with the effect of that random gesture . Here [she]192-undine was , at the lowest ebb of [her]192-undine fortunes , miraculously rehabilitated , reinstated , and restored to the old victorious sense of [her]192-undine youth and [her]192-undine power ! [Her]192-undine sole graces , [her]192-undine unaided personality , had worked the miracle ; how should [she]192-undine not trust in them hereafter ? Aside from [her]192-undine feeling of concrete attainment . [Undine]192-undine was deeply interested in [[her]192-undine new friends]4953-her new friends . [The Princess]4948-the princess and [[her]4948-the princess mother]426-her mother , in [their]4953-her new friends different ways , were different from [any one else [she]192-undine had known]4966-any one else she had known . [The Princess , who might have been of any age between twenty and forty]4967-the princess , who might have been of any age between twenty and forty , had a small triangular face with caressing impudent eyes , a smile like a silent whistle and the gait of [[a baker]4968-a baker 's boy balancing [his]4969-a baker 's boy balancing his basket basket]4969-a baker 's boy balancing his basket . [She]4967-the princess , who might have been of any age between twenty and forty wore either baggy shabby clothes like [a man]932-a man 's , or rich draperies that looked as if they had been rained on ; and [she]4967-the princess , who might have been of any age between twenty and forty seemed equally at ease in either style of dress , and carelessly unconscious of both . [She]4967-the princess , who might have been of any age between twenty and forty was extremely familiar and unblushingly inquisitive , but [she]4967-the princess , who might have been of any age between twenty and forty never gave [Undine]192-undine the time to ask [her]4967-the princess , who might have been of any age between twenty and forty any questions or the opportunity to venture on any freedom with [her]4967-the princess , who might have been of any age between twenty and forty . [She]192-undine playfully accused [[her]192-undine beautiful new friend]4971-her beautiful new friend of being cachottiere , and at the sight of [Undine]192-undine 's blush cried out : "[2664-you] Ah , [[you]2664-you funny [Americans]352-americans]2665-you funny americans ! Why do [you]2664-you all behave as if love were a secret infirmity ? " [The old Duchess]4972-the old duchess was even more impressive , because [she]4972-the old duchess fitted better into [Undine]192-undine 's preconceived picture of [the Faubourg Saint Germain]364-faubourg , and was more like [the people with whom [she]192-undine pictured [the former Nettie Wincher]333-nettie wincher as living in privileged intimacy]4973-the people with whom she pictured the former nettie wincher as living in privileged intimacy . [The Duchess]4974-the duchess was , indeed , more amiable and accessible than [Undine]192-undine 's conception of [a Duchess]4949-a duchess , and displayed a curiosity as great as [[her]192-undine daughter]443-her daughter 's , and much more puerile , concerning [[her]192-undine new friend]4977-her new friend 's history and habits . But through [her]192-undine mild prattle , and in spite of [her]192-undine limited perceptions . [Undine]192-undine felt in [her]192-undine the same clear impenetrable barrier that [she]192-undine ran against occasionally in [the Princess]4948-the princess ; and [she]192-undine was beginning to understand that this barrier represented a number of things about which [she]192-undine [herself]192-undine had yet to learn . [She]192-undine would not have known this a few years earlier , nor would [she]192-undine have seen in [the Duchess]4974-the duchess anything but the ruin of [an ugly woman]4980-an ugly woman , dressed in clothes that [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg would n't have touched . [The Duchess]4974-the duchess certainly looked like [a ruin]4982-a ruin ; but [Undine]192-undine now saw that [she]4974-the duchess looked like [the ruin of [a castle]4984-a castle]4983-the ruin of a castle . [The Princess]4948-the princess , who was unofficially separated from [[her]4948-the princess husband]488-her husband , had with [her]4948-the princess [[her]4948-the princess two little girls]4987-her two little girls . [She]4948-the princess seemed extremely attached to both -- though avowing for [the younger]4988-the younger a preference [she]4948-the princess frankly ascribed to the interesting accident of [its]4988-the younger parentage -- and [she]4948-the princess could not understand that [Undine]192-undine , as to whose domestic difficulties [she]192-undine minutely informed [herself]192-undine , should have consented to leave [[her]192-undine child]483-her child to [strangers]4990-strangers . "[629-one] For , to [one 's child]2666-one 's child [every one but one]2667-every one but one 's self is [a stranger]1430-a stranger ; and whatever [your]2669-your egarements-- " [she]4948-the princess began , breaking off with a stare when [Undine]192-undine interrupted [her]4948-the princess to explain that [the courts]4824-the courts had ascribed all the wrongs in the case to [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband . "[629-one] But then -- but then-- " murmured [the Princess]4948-the princess , turning away from the subject as if checked by too deep an abyss of difference . The incident had embarrassed [Undine]192-undine , and though [she]192-undine tried to justify [herself]192-undine by allusions to [[her]192-undine boy]1665-her boy 's dependence on [[[his]1665-her boy father]1946-his father 's family]4996-his father 's family , and to the duty of not standing in [his]488-her husband way , [she]192-undine saw that [she]192-undine made no impression . "[629-one] Whatever [one]629-one 's errors , [one 's child]2666-one 's child belongs to [one]629-one , " [[her]192-undine hearer]4997-her hearer continued to repeat ; and [Undine]192-undine , who was frequently scandalized by [the Princess]4948-the princess 's conversation , now found [herself]192-undine in the odd position of having to set a watch upon [her]192-undine own in order not to scandalize [the Princess]4948-the princess . Each day , nevertheless , strengthened [her]192-undine hold on [[her]192-undine new friends]4953-her new friends . After [her]192-undine first flush of triumph [she]192-undine began indeed to suspect that [she]192-undine had been a slight disappointment to [the Princess]4948-the princess , had not completely justified the hopes raised by the doubtful honour of being one of [[Sacha Adelschein]362-sacha adelschein 's intimates]5002-sacha adelschein 's intimates . [Undine]192-undine guessed that [the Princess]4948-the princess had expected to find [her]192-undine more amusing , "[629-one] queerer , " more startling in speech and conduct . Though by instinct [she]192-undine was none of these things , [she]192-undine was eager to go as far as was expected ; but [she]192-undine felt that [her]192-undine audacities were on lines too normal to be interesting , and that [the Princess]4948-the princess thought [her]192-undine rather school - girlish and old - fashioned . Still , [they]4953-her new friends had in common [their]4953-her new friends youth , [their]4953-her new friends boredom , [their]4953-her new friends high spirits and [their]4953-her new friends hunger for amusement ; and [Undine]192-undine was making the most of these ties when one day , coming back from a trip to [Monte - Carlo]141-monte - carlo with [the Princess]4948-the princess , [she]192-undine was brought up short by the sight of [a lady]1146-a lady -- evidently [a new arrival]5007-a new arrival -- who was seated in an attitude of respectful intimacy beside [the old Duchess]4972-the old duchess 's chair . [Undine]192-undine , advancing unheard over the fine gravel of [the garden path]5009-the garden path , recognized at a glance [the Marquise de Trezac]332-the marquise de trezac 's drooping nose and disdainful back , and at the same moment heard [her]2673-her say : "[488-her husband] --And [[her]2673-her husband]488-her husband ? " "[2673-her] [[Her]2673-her husband]488-her husband ? But [she]2673-her 's [an American]2676-an american -- [she]2673-her 's divorced , " [the Duchess]4974-the duchess replied , as if [she]4974-the duchess were merely stating the same fact in two different ways ; and [Undine]192-undine stopped short with a pang of apprehension . [The Princess]4948-the princess came up behind [her]192-undine . "[2678-that old bore of a trezac] Who 's [the solemn person with Mamma]2677-the solemn person with mamma ? Ah , [that old bore of a Trezac]2678-that old bore of a trezac ! " [She]4948-the princess dropped [her]4948-the princess long eye - glass with a laugh . "[2680-you] Well , [she]2673-her 'll be useful -- [she'll]2673-her stick to [Mamma]367-mamma like a leech and [we]2679-we shall get away oftener . Come , let 's go and be charming to [her]2673-her . " [She]192-undine approached [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac effusively , and after an interchange of exclamations [Undine]192-undine heard [her]353-madame de trezac say "[0-i] [You]2680-you know [[my]0-i friend]4726-my friend [Mrs. Marvell]192-undine ? No ? How odd ! Where do [you]2680-you manage to hide [yourself]2680-you , [chere Madame]2682-chere madame ? [Undine]192-undine , here 's [a compatriot who has n't the pleasure--]2683-a compatriot who has n't the pleasure-- " "[2686-the old hypocrite] [I]0-i 'm such [a hermit]2684-a hermit , [dear Mrs. Marvell]192-undine -- [the Princess]4948-the princess shows [me]0-i what [I]0-i miss , " [the Marquise de Trezac]332-the marquise de trezac murmured , rising to give [her]332-the marquise de trezac hand to [Undine]192-undine , and speaking in a voice so different from that of [the supercilious Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher that only [her]332-the marquise de trezac facial angle and the droop of [her]332-the marquise de trezac nose linked [her]332-the marquise de trezac to the hated vision of [Potash Springs]38-potash springs . [Undine]192-undine felt [herself]192-undine dancing on a flood - tide of security . For the first time the memory of [Potash Springs]38-potash springs became a thing to smile at , and with [the Princess]4948-the princess 's arm through [hers]192-undine [she]192-undine shone back triumphantly on [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac , who seemed to have grown suddenly obsequious and insignificant , as though the waving of [the Princess]4948-the princess 's wand had stripped [her]332-the marquise de trezac of all [her]332-the marquise de trezac false advantages . But [upstairs]4364-upstairs , in [[her]192-undine own room]5015-her own room . [Undine]192-undine 's courage fell . [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac had been civil , effusive even , because for the moment [she]353-madame de trezac had been taken off [her]353-madame de trezac guard by finding [Mrs. Marvell]192-undine on terms of intimacy with [the Princess Estradina]363-the princess estradina and [[her]4948-the princess mother]426-her mother . But the force of facts would reassert itself . Far from continuing to see [Undine]192-undine through [[her]192-undine French friends]5017-her french friends ' eyes [she]192-undine would probably invite [them]2687-them to view [[her]192-undine compatriot]5018-her compatriot through the searching lens of [her]192-undine own ampler information . "[2686-the old hypocrite] [The old hypocrite]2686-the old hypocrite -- she'll tell [them]2687-them everything , " [Undine]192-undine murmured , wincing at the recollection of [[the dentist]5019-the dentist 's assistant]5020-the dentist 's assistant from [Deposit]40-deposit , and staring miserably at [her]192-undine reflection in the dressing - table mirror . Of what use were youth and grace and good looks , if one drop of poison distilled from the envy of [a narrow - minded woman]5021-a narrow - minded woman was enough to paralyze [them]2687-them ? Of course [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac knew and remembered , and , secure in [her]353-madame de trezac own impregnable position , would never rest till [she]353-madame de trezac had driven out [the intruder]5022-the intruder . XXVIII "[2688-you] What do [you]2688-you say to Nice to - morrow , dearest ? " [the Princess]4948-the princess suggested a few evenings later as [she]4948-the princess followed [Undine]192-undine [upstairs]4364-upstairs after a languid evening at [bridge]5025-bridge with [the Duchess]4974-the duchess and [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac . Half - way down [the passage]538-the passage [she]4948-the princess stopped to open a door and , putting [her]4948-the princess finger to [her]4948-the princess lip , signed to [Undine]192-undine to enter . In the taper - lit dimness stood two small white beds , [each surmounted by a crucifix and a palm branch]5028-each surmounted by a crucifix and a palm branch , and each containing [a small brown sleeping child with a mop of hair and a curiously finished little face]5029-a small brown sleeping child with a mop of hair and a curiously finished little face . As [the Princess]4948-the princess stood gazing on [their]5031-their innocent slumbers [she]4948-the princess seemed for a moment like [a third little girl scarcely bigger and browner than the others]5032-a third little girl scarcely bigger and browner than the others ; and the smile with which [she]4948-the princess watched [them]5031-their was as clear as [theirs]5031-their . "[2688-you] Ah , si seulement je pouvais choisir leurs amants ! " [she]4948-the princess sighed as [she]4948-the princess turned away . "[2688-you] --Nice to - morrow , " [she]4948-the princess repeated , as [she]4948-the princess and [Undine]192-undine walked on to [[their]2689-we rooms]834-their rooms with linked arms . "[2698-she] [We]2689-we may as well make hay while [the Trezac]353-madame de trezac shines . [She]353-madame de trezac bores [Mamma]367-mamma frightfully , but [Mamma]367-mamma wo n't admit it because [they]2690-they belong to the same oeuvres . Shall it be [the eleven train]2691-the eleven train , [dear]3838-dear ? [We]2689-we can lunch at [the Royal]2693-the royal and look in [the shops]2694-the shops -- [we]2689-we may meet [somebody]4109-somebody amusing . Anyhow , it 's better than staying [here]3758-here ! " [Undine]192-undine was sure the trip to [Nice]142-nice would be delightful . [Their]2689-we previous expeditions had shown [her]192-undine [the Princess]4948-the princess 's faculty for organizing such adventures . At [Monte - Carlo]141-monte - carlo , a few days before , [they]2689-we had run across [two or three amusing but unassorted people]5035-two or three amusing but unassorted people , and [the Princess]4948-the princess , having fused [them]5035-two or three amusing but unassorted people in a jolly lunch , had followed it up by a bout at baccarat , and , finally hunting down [an eminent composer who had just arrived to rehearse a new production]5037-an eminent composer who had just arrived to rehearse a new production , had insisted on [his]5037-an eminent composer who had just arrived to rehearse a new production asking [the party]2119-the party to tea , and treating [them]2119-the party to fragments of [his]5037-an eminent composer who had just arrived to rehearse a new production opera . A few days earlier , [Undine]192-undine 's hope of renewing such pleasures would have been clouded by the dread of leaving [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac alone with [the Duchess]4974-the duchess . But [she]192-undine had no longer any fear of [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac . [She]192-undine had discovered that [[her]192-undine old rival of [Potash Springs]38-potash springs]5040-her old rival of potash springs was in actual dread of [her]192-undine disfavour , and nervously anxious to conciliate [her]192-undine , and the discovery gave [her]192-undine such a sense of the heights [she]192-undine had scaled , and the security of [her]192-undine footing , that all [her]192-undine troubled past began to seem like the result of some providential "[2698-she] design , " and vague impulses of piety stirred in [her]192-undine as [she]192-undine and [the Princess]4948-the princess whirled toward [Nice]142-nice through the blue and gold glitter of the morning . [They]5042-they wandered about [the lively streets]5043-the lively streets , [they]5042-they gazed into [the beguiling shops]5044-the beguiling shops , [the Princess]4948-the princess tried on hats and [Undine]192-undine bought them , and [they]5042-they lunched at [the Royal]2693-the royal on all sorts of succulent dishes prepared under [the head - waiter]5047-the head - waiter 's special supervision . But as [they]5042-they were savouring [their]5042-they "[0-i] double " coffee and liqueurs , and [Undine]192-undine was wondering what [[her]192-undine companion]887-her companion would devise for the afternoon , [the Princess]4948-the princess clapped [her]4948-the princess hands together and cried out : "[2697-you] Dearest , [I]0-i 'd forgotten ! [I]0-i must desert [you]2697-you . " [She]4948-the princess explained that [she]4948-the princess 'd promised [the Duchess]4974-the duchess to look up a friend who was ill -- [a poor wretch who 'd been sent to [Cimiez]143-cimiez for [her]5051-a poor wretch who 'd been sent to cimiez for her lungs lungs]5051-a poor wretch who 'd been sent to cimiez for her lungs -- and that [she]192-undine must rush off at once , and would be back as soon as possible -- well , if not in an hour , then in two at latest . [She]192-undine was full of compunction , but [she]192-undine knew [Undine]192-undine would forgive [her]192-undine , and find something amusing to fill up the time : [she]192-undine advised [her]192-undine to go back and buy the black hat with [the osprey]5052-the osprey , and try on the crepe de Chine [they]5053-they 'd thought so smart : for [any one as good - looking as [herself]192-undine [the woman]1564-the woman]5054-any one as good - looking as herself the woman would probably alter it for nothing ; and [they]5053-they could meet again at [the Palace Tea - Rooms]5056-the palace tea - rooms at four . [She]192-undine whirled away in a cloud of explanations , and [Undine]192-undine , left alone , sat down on [the Promenade des Anglais]5057-the promenade des anglais . [She]192-undine did not believe a word [the Princess]4948-the princess had said . [She]192-undine had seen in a flash why [she]192-undine was being left , and why the plan had not been divulged to [her]192-undine before - hand ; and [she]192-undine quivered with resentment and humiliation . "[2698-she] That 's what [she]2698-she 's wanted [me]0-i for ... that 's why [she]2698-she made up to [me]0-i . [She]2698-she 's trying it to - day , and after this it 'll happen regularly ... she'll drag [me]0-i over [here]3758-here every day or two ... at least [she]2698-she thinks [she]2698-she will ! " A sincere disgust was [Undine]192-undine 's uppermost sensation . [She]192-undine was as much ashamed as [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg might have been at finding [herself]192-undine used to screen a clandestine adventure . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll let [her]2698-she see ... [I]0-i 'll make [her]2698-she understand , " [she]192-undine repeated angrily ; and for a moment [she]192-undine was half - disposed to drive to [the station]4592-the station and take [the first train]5060-the first train back . But the sense of [her]192-undine precarious situation withheld [her]192-undine ; and presently , with bitterness in [her]192-undine heart , [she]192-undine got up and began to stroll toward [the shops]2694-the shops . To show that [she]192-undine was not [a dupe]5062-a dupe , [she]192-undine arrived at [the designated meeting - place]5063-the designated meeting - place nearly an hour later than the time appointed ; but when [she]192-undine entered [the Tea - Rooms]5064-the tea - rooms [the Princess]4948-the princess was nowhere to be seen . [The rooms]5066-the rooms were crowded , and [Undine]192-undine was guided toward [a small inner apartment where [isolated couples]5068-isolated couples were absorbing refreshments in an atmosphere of intimacy that made it seem incongruous to be alone]5067-a small inner apartment where isolated couples were absorbing refreshments in an atmosphere of intimacy that made it seem incongruous to be alone . [She]192-undine glanced about for a face [she]192-undine knew , but none was visible , and [she]192-undine was just giving up the search when [she]192-undine beheld [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt shouldering [his]212-moffatt way through [the crowd]3861-the crowd . The sight was so surprising that [she]192-undine sat gazing with unconscious fixity at the round black head and glossy reddish face which kept appearing and disappearing through the intervening jungle of aigrettes . It was long since [she]192-undine had either heard of [Moffatt]212-moffatt or thought about [him]212-moffatt , and now , in [her]192-undine loneliness and exasperation , [she]192-undine took comfort in the sight of [his]212-moffatt confident capable face , and felt a longing to hear [his]212-moffatt voice and unbosom [her]192-undine woes to [him]212-moffatt . [She]192-undine had half risen to attract [his]212-moffatt attention when [she]192-undine saw [him]212-moffatt turn back and make way for [a companion , who was cautiously steering [her]5070-a companion , who was cautiously steering her huge feathered hat between the tea - tables huge feathered hat between the tea - tables]5070-a companion , who was cautiously steering her huge feathered hat between the tea - tables . [The woman]1564-the woman was of the vulgarest type ; everything about [her]1564-the woman was cheap and gaudy . But [Moffatt]212-moffatt was obviously elated : [he]212-moffatt stood aside with a flourish to usher [her]192-undine in , and as [he]212-moffatt followed [he]212-moffatt shot out a pink shirt - cuff with jewelled links , and gave [his]212-moffatt moustache a gallant twist . [Undine]192-undine felt an unreasoning irritation : [she]192-undine was vexed with [him]212-moffatt both for not being alone and for being so vulgarly accompanied . As [the couple]5072-the couple seated [themselves]5072-the couple [she]192-undine caught [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's glance and saw [him]212-moffatt redden to the edge of [his]212-moffatt white forehead ; but [he]212-moffatt elaborately avoided [her]192-undine eye -- [he]212-moffatt evidently wanted [her]192-undine to see [him]212-moffatt do it -- and proceeded to minister to [[his]212-moffatt companion]912-his companion 's wants with an air of experienced gallantry . The incident , trifling as it was , filled up the measure of [Undine]192-undine 's bitterness . [She]192-undine thought [Moffatt]212-moffatt pitiably ridiculous , and [she]192-undine hated [him]212-moffatt for showing [himself]212-moffatt in such a light at that particular moment . [Her]192-undine mind turned back to [her]192-undine own grievance , and [she]192-undine was just saying to [herself]192-undine that nothing on [earth]4638-earth should prevent [her]192-undine letting [the Princess]4948-the princess know what [she]192-undine thought of [her]192-undine , when [the lady in question]5076-the lady in question at last appeared . [She]192-undine came hurriedly forward and behind [her]192-undine [Undine]192-undine perceived the figure of [a slight quietly dressed man]5077-a slight quietly dressed man , as to whom [her]192-undine immediate impression was that [he]212-moffatt made [every one else in [the room]441-the room]5078-every one else in the room look as common as [Moffatt]212-moffatt . An instant later the colour had flown to [her]192-undine face and [her]192-undine hand was in [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond , while [the Princess]4948-the princess , murmuring : "[2700-you] [Cimiez]143-cimiez 's such a long way off ; but [you]2700-you WILL forgive [me]0-i ? " looked into [her]192-undine eyes with a smile that added : "[2700-you] See how [I]0-i pay for what [I]0-i get ! " [Her]4948-the princess first glance showed [Undine]192-undine how glad [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond was to see [her]192-undine . Since [their]5081-their last meeting [his]382-raymond admiration for [her]192-undine seemed not only to have increased but to have acquired a different character . [Undine]192-undine , at an earlier stage in [her]192-undine career , might not have known exactly what the difference signified ; but it was as clear to [her]192-undine now as if [the Princess]4948-the princess had said -- what [her]4948-the princess beaming eyes seemed , in fact , to convey--"I'm[2700-you] only too glad to do [[my]0-i cousin]2652-my cousin the same kind of turn [you]2700-you 're doing [me]0-i . " But [Undine]192-undine 's increased experience , if it had made [her]192-undine more vigilant , had also given [her]192-undine a clearer measure of [her]192-undine power . [She]192-undine saw at once that [Chelles]382-raymond , in seeking to meet [her]192-undine again , was not in quest of a mere passing adventure . [He]382-raymond was evidently deeply drawn to [her]192-undine , and [her]192-undine present situation , if it made it natural to regard [her]192-undine as more accessible , had not altered the nature of [his]382-raymond feeling . [She]192-undine saw and weighed all this in the first five minutes during which , over tea and muffins , [the Princess]4948-the princess descanted on [her]192-undine luck in happening to run across [[her]192-undine cousin]1178-her cousin , and [Chelles]382-raymond , [his]382-raymond enchanted eyes on [Undine]192-undine , expressed [his]382-raymond sense of [his]382-raymond good fortune . [He]382-raymond was staying , it appeared , with [friends]5085-friends at [Beaulieu]144-beaulieu , and had run over to [Nice]142-nice that afternoon by the merest chance : [he]382-raymond added that , having just learned of [[his]382-raymond aunt]5086-his aunt 's presence in [the neighbourhood]5087-the neighbourhood , [he]382-raymond had already planned to present [his]382-raymond homage to [her]5086-his aunt . "[2700-you] Oh , do n't come to [us]2702-us -- [we're]2702-us too dull ! " [the Princess]4948-the princess exclaimed . "[2703-you] Let [us]2702-us run over occasionally and call on [you]2703-you : [we]2702-us 're dying for a pretext , are n't [we]2702-us ? " [she]4948-the princess added , smiling at [Undine]192-undine . [The latter]573-the latter smiled back vaguely , and looked across [the room]441-the room . [Moffatt]212-moffatt , looking flushed and foolish , was just pushing back [his]212-moffatt chair . To carry off [his]212-moffatt embarrassment [he]212-moffatt put an additional touch of importance ; and as [he]212-moffatt swaggered out behind [[his]212-moffatt companion]912-his companion , [Undine]192-undine said to [herself]192-undine , with a shiver : "[2704-their] If [he]2703-you 'd been alone [they]2704-their would have found [me]0-i taking tea with [him]2703-you . " [Undine]192-undine , during the ensuing weeks , returned several times to [Nice]142-nice with [the Princess]4948-the princess ; but , to [the latter]573-the latter 's surprise , [she]192-undine absolutely refused to have [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond included in [their]2704-their luncheon - parties , or even apprised in advance of [their]2704-their expeditions . [The Princess]4948-the princess , always impatient of unnecessary dissimulation , had not attempted to keep up the feint of the interesting invalid at [Cimiez]143-cimiez . [She]4948-the princess confessed to [Undine]192-undine that [she]4948-the princess was drawn to Nice by the presence there of [the person without whom , for the moment]5095-the person without whom , for the moment , [she]4948-the princess found life intolerable , and whom [she]4948-the princess could not well receive under the same roof with [[her]4948-the princess little girls]5096-her little girls and [[her]4948-the princess mother]426-her mother . [She]4948-the princess appealed to [Undine]192-undine 's sisterly heart to feel for [her]192-undine in [her]192-undine difficulty , and implied that -- as [her]4948-the princess conduct had already proved -- [she]4948-the princess would always be ready to render [[her]4948-the princess friend]608-her friend a like service . It was at this point that [Undine]192-undine checked [her]4948-the princess by a decided word . "[0-i] [I]0-i understand [your]2705-you position , and [I]0-i 'm very sorry for [you]2705-you , of course , " [she]192-undine began ( [the Princess]4948-the princess stared at the "[2705-you] sorry " ) . "[3969-your cousin] [Your]2705-you secret 's perfectly safe with [me]0-i , and [I]0-i 'll do anything [I]0-i can for [you]2705-you ... but if [I]0-i go to [Nice]142-nice with [you]2705-you again [you]2705-you must promise not to ask [[your]2705-you cousin]3969-your cousin to meet [us]2707-us . " [The Princess]4948-the princess 's face expressed the most genuine astonishment . "[3969-your cousin] Oh , [[my]0-i dear]4259-my dear , do forgive [me]0-i if [I]0-i 've been stupid ! [He]3969-your cousin admires [you]2705-you so tremendously ; and [I]0-i thought-- " "[2705-you] [You]2705-you 'll do as [I]0-i ask , please -- won't [you]2705-you ? " [Undine]192-undine went on , ignoring the interruption and looking straight at [her]192-undine under level brows ; and [the Princess]4948-the princess , with a shrug , merely murmured : "[2705-you] What a pity ! [I]0-i fancied [you]2705-you liked [him]3969-your cousin . " XXIX The early spring found [Undine]192-undine once more in [Paris]76-paris . [She]192-undine had every reason to be satisfied with the result of the course [she]192-undine had pursued since [she]192-undine had pronounced [her]192-undine ultimatum on the subject of [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond . [She]192-undine had continued to remain on the best of terms with [the Princess]4948-the princess , to rise in the estimation of [the old Duchess]4972-the old duchess , and to measure the rapidity of [her]192-undine ascent in the upward gaze of [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac ; and [she]192-undine had given [Chelles]382-raymond to understand that , if [he]382-raymond wished to renew [their]5104-their acquaintance , [he]382-raymond must do so in the shelter of [[his]382-raymond venerable aunt]5105-his venerable aunt 's protection . To [the Princess]4948-the princess [she]192-undine was careful to make [her]192-undine attitude equally clear . "[0-i] [I]0-i like [[your]2709-your cousin]3969-your cousin very much -- [he]3969-your cousin 's delightful , and if [I]0-i 'm in [Paris]76-paris this spring [I]0-i hope [I]0-i shall see a great deal of [him]3969-your cousin . But [I]0-i know how easy it is for [a woman in [my]0-i position]2711-a woman in my position to get talked about -- and [I]0-i have [[my]0-i little boy]2712-my little boy to consider . " Nevertheless , whenever [Chelles]382-raymond came over from [Beaulieu]144-beaulieu to spend a day with [[his]382-raymond aunt]5086-his aunt and [cousin]5108-cousin -- an excursion [he]382-raymond not infrequently repeated -- [Undine]192-undine was at no pains to conceal [her]192-undine pleasure . Nor was there anything calculated in [her]192-undine attitude . [Chelles]382-raymond seemed to [her]192-undine more charming than ever , and the warmth of [his]382-raymond wooing was in flattering contrast to the cool reserve of [his]382-raymond manners . At last [she]192-undine felt [herself]192-undine alive and young again , and it became a joy to look in [her]192-undine glass and to try on [her]192-undine new hats and dresses ... The only menace ahead was the usual one of the want of money . While [she]192-undine had travelled with [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents [she]192-undine had been at relatively small expense , and since [their]551-her parents return to [America]77-america [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had sent [her]192-undine allowance regularly ; yet almost all the money [she]192-undine had received for the pearls was already gone , and [she]192-undine knew [her]192-undine [Paris]76-paris season would be far more expensive than the quiet weeks on [the Riviera]135-the riviera . Meanwhile the sense of reviving popularity , and the charm of [Chelles]382-raymond ' devotion , had almost effaced the ugly memories of failure , and refurbished that image of [herself]192-undine in other minds which was [her]192-undine only notion of self - seeing . Under the guidance of [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac [she]192-undine had found [a prettily furnished apartment in [a not too inaccessible quarter]5111-a not too inaccessible quarter]5110-a prettily furnished apartment in a not too inaccessible quarter , and in [[its]5110-a prettily furnished apartment in a not too inaccessible quarter light bright drawing - room]5112-its light bright drawing - room [she]192-undine sat one June afternoon listening , with all the forbearance of which [she]192-undine was capable , to the counsels of [[her]192-undine newly - acquired guide]5113-her newly - acquired guide . "[0-i] Everything but marriage-- " [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac was repeating , [her]353-madame de trezac long head slightly tilted , [her]353-madame de trezac features wearing the rapt look of [an adept reciting a hallowed formula]5114-an adept reciting a hallowed formula . [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond had not been mentioned by [either of [the ladies]459-the ladies]5115-either of the ladies , and [the former Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher was merely imparting to [[her]244-miss wincher young friend]5117-her young friend one of the fundamental dogmas of [her]244-miss wincher social creed ; but [Undine]192-undine was conscious that the air between [them]5118-them vibrated with an unspoken name . [She]192-undine made no immediate answer , but [her]192-undine glance , passing by [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac 's dull countenance , sought [her]192-undine own reflection in the mirror behind [[her]192-undine visitor]427-her visitor 's chair . A beam of spring sunlight touched the living masses of [her]192-undine hair and made the face beneath as radiant as [a girl]3760-a girl 's . [Undine]192-undine smiled faintly at the promise [her]192-undine own eyes gave [her]192-undine , and then turned them back to [[her]192-undine friend]608-her friend . "[0-i] What can [such women]2713-such women know about anything ? " [she]192-undine thought compassionately . "[0-i] There 's everything against it , " [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac continued in a tone of patient exposition . [She]353-madame de trezac seemed to be doing [her]353-madame de trezac best to make the matter clear . "[2722-they] In the first place , between [people in society]2714-people in society a religious marriage is necessary ; and , since [the Church]2715-the church does n't recognize divorce , that 's obviously out of the question . In [France]104-france , [a man of position who goes through the form of civil marriage with [a divorced woman]1021-a divorced woman]2716-a man of position who goes through the form of civil marriage with a divorced woman is simply ruining [himself]2716-a man of position who goes through the form of civil marriage with a divorced woman and [her]1021-a divorced woman . [They]2718-they might much better -- from [her]1021-a divorced woman point of view as well as [his]2716-a man of position who goes through the form of civil marriage with a divorced woman -- be ' [friends]5085-friends , ' as it 's called over here : such arrangements are understood and allowed for . But when [a Frenchman]2720-a frenchman marries [he]2720-a frenchman wants to marry as [[his]2720-a frenchman people]4440-his people always have . [He]2720-a frenchman knows there are traditions [he]2720-a frenchman ca n't fight against -- and in [his]2720-a frenchman heart [he]2720-a frenchman 's glad there are . " "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i know : [they]2722-they 've so much religious feeling . [I]0-i admire that in [them]2722-they : [their]2722-they religion 's so beautiful . " [Undine]192-undine looked thoughtfully at [[her]192-undine visitor]427-her visitor . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose even money -- a great deal of money -- wouldn't make the least bit of difference ? " "[0-i] None whatever , except to make matters worse , " [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac decisively rejoined . [She]353-madame de trezac returned [Undine]192-undine 's look with something of [Miss Wincher]244-miss wincher 's contemptuous authority . "[2723-we] But , " [she]353-madame de trezac added , softening to a smile , "[2723-we] between [ourselves]2723-we -- [I]0-i can say it , since [we]2723-we 're [neither of [us]2723-we children]2724-neither of us children -- [a woman with tact , who 's not in a position to remarry]2725-a woman with tact , who 's not in a position to remarry , will find society extremely indulgent ... provided , of course , [she]2725-a woman with tact , who 's not in a position to remarry keeps up appearances ... " [Undine]192-undine turned to [her]353-madame de trezac with the frown of a startled [Diana]369-diana . "[2723-we] [We]2723-we do n't look at things that way out at [Apex]192-undine , " [she]192-undine said coldly ; and the blood rose in [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac 's sallow cheek . "[0-i] Oh , [[my]0-i dear]4259-my dear , it 's so refreshing to hear [you]4259-my dear talk like that ! Personally , of course , [I]0-i 've never quite got used to the French view-- " "[370-granny] [I]0-i hope [no American woman]2727-no american woman ever does , " said [Undine]192-undine . [She]192-undine had been in [Paris]76-paris for about two months when this conversation took place , and in spite of [her]192-undine reviving self - confidence [she]192-undine was beginning to recognize the strength of [the forces opposed to [her]192-undine]5123-the forces opposed to her . It had taken a long time to convince [her]192-undine that even money could not prevail against [them]5123-the forces opposed to her ; and , in the intervals of expressing [her]192-undine admiration for the Catholic creed , [she]192-undine now had violent reactions of militant Protestantism , during which [she]192-undine talked of the tyranny of [Rome]71-rome and recalled school stories of [immoral Popes]5124-immoral popes and persecuting [Jesuits]5125-jesuits . Meanwhile [her]192-undine demeanour to [Chelles]382-raymond was that of [the incorruptible but fearless American woman , who can not even conceive of love outside of marriage , but is ready to give [her]192-undine devoted friendship to [the man on whom , in happier circumstances]5127-the man on whom , in happier circumstances , [she]192-undine might have bestowed [her]192-undine hand]5126-the incorruptible but fearless american woman , who can not even conceive of love outside of marriage , but is ready to give her devoted friendship to the man on whom , in happier circumstances , she might have bestowed her hand . This attitude was provocative of many scenes , during which [[her]192-undine suitor]4806-her suitor 's unfailing powers of expression -- [his]382-raymond gift of looking and saying all the desperate and devoted things [a pretty woman]1804-a pretty woman likes to think [she]1804-a pretty woman inspires -- gave [Undine]192-undine the thrilling sense of breathing the very air of French fiction . But [she]192-undine was aware that too prolonged tension of these cords usually ends in [their]5130-their snapping , and that [Chelles]382-raymond ' patience was probably in inverse ratio to [his]382-raymond ardour . When [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac had left [her]192-undine these thoughts remained in [her]192-undine mind . [She]192-undine understood exactly what [each of [[her]192-undine new friends]4953-her new friends]5131-each of her new friends wanted of [her]192-undine . [The Princess]4948-the princess , who was fond of [[her]4948-the princess cousin]1178-her cousin , and had the French sense of family solidarity , would have liked to see [Chelles]382-raymond happy in what seemed to [her]4948-the princess the only imaginable way . [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac would have liked to do what [she]353-madame de trezac could to second [the Princess]4948-the princess 's efforts in this or any other line ; and even [the old Duchess]4972-the old duchess -- though piously desirous of seeing [[her]4972-the old duchess favourite nephew]5137-her favourite nephew married -- would have thought it not only natural but inevitable that , while awaiting that happy event , [he]382-raymond should try to induce [an amiable young woman]5138-an amiable young woman to mitigate the drawbacks of celibacy . Meanwhile , [they]4953-her new friends might one and all weary of [her]192-undine if [Chelles]382-raymond did ; and a persistent rejection of [his]382-raymond suit would probably imperil [her]192-undine scarcely - gained footing among [[his]382-raymond friends]5139-his friends . All this was clear to [her]192-undine , yet it did not shake [her]192-undine resolve . [She]192-undine was determined to give up [Chelles]382-raymond unless [he]382-raymond was willing to marry [her]192-undine ; and the thought of [her]192-undine renunciation moved [her]192-undine to a kind of wistful melancholy . In this mood [her]192-undine mind reverted to a letter [she]192-undine had just received from [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg wrote more fully than usual , and the unwonted flow of [her]194-mrs. spragg pen had been occasioned by an event for which [she]194-mrs. spragg had long yearned . For months [she]194-mrs. spragg had pined for a sight of [[her]194-mrs. spragg grandson]4821-her grandson , had tried to screw up [her]194-mrs. spragg courage to write and ask permission to visit [him]4821-her grandson , and , finally breaking through [her]194-mrs. spragg sedentary habits , had begun to haunt [the neighbourhood of [Washington Square]2-washington square]5142-the neighbourhood of washington square , with the result that one afternoon [she]194-mrs. spragg had had the luck to meet [the little boy coming out of [the house]623-the house with [[his]4821-her grandson nurse]2402-his nurse]5143-the little boy coming out of the house with his nurse . [She]194-mrs. spragg had spoken to [him]4821-her grandson , and [he]4821-her grandson had remembered [her]194-mrs. spragg and called [her]194-mrs. spragg "[370-granny] [Granny]370-granny " ; and the next day [she]194-mrs. spragg had received a note from [Mrs. Fairford]204-mrs. fairford saying that [Ralph]199-ralph would be glad to send [Paul]218-paul to see [her]194-mrs. spragg . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg enlarged on the delights of the visit and the growing beauty and cleverness of [[her]194-mrs. spragg grandson]4821-her grandson . [She]194-mrs. spragg described to [Undine]192-undine exactly how [Paul]218-paul was dressed , how [he]4821-her grandson looked and what [he]4821-her grandson said , and told [her]192-undine how [he]4821-her grandson had examined everything in [the room]441-the room , and , finally coming upon [[his]4821-her grandson mother]3752-his mother 's photograph , had asked who [the lady]593-the lady was ; and , on being told , had wanted to know if [she]593-the lady was a very long way off , and when [Granny]370-granny thought [she]593-the lady would come back . As [Undine]192-undine re - read [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother 's pages , [she]192-undine felt an unusual tightness in [her]192-undine throat and two tears rose to [her]192-undine eyes . It was dreadful that [[her]426-her mother little boy]5151-her little boy should be growing up far away from [her]426-her mother , perhaps dressed in clothes [she]426-her mother would have hated ; and wicked and unnatural that when [he]5151-her little boy saw [her]426-her mother picture [he]5151-her little boy should have to be told who [she]426-her mother was . "[370-granny] If [I]0-i could only meet [some good man who would give [me]0-i [a home]2729-a home and be a father to [him]2728-some good man who would give me a home and be a father to him]2728-some good man who would give me a home and be a father to him , " [she]192-undine thought -- and the tears overflowed and ran down . Even as they fell , the door was thrown open to admit [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond , and the consciousness of the moisture still glistening on [her]192-undine cheeks perhaps strengthened [her]192-undine resolve to resist [him]5151-her little boy , and thus made [her]192-undine more imperiously to be desired . Certain it is that on that day [[her]192-undine suitor]4806-her suitor first alluded to a possibility which [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac had prudently refrained from suggesting , there fell upon [Undine]192-undine 's attentive ears the magic phrase "[370-granny] annulment of marriage . " [Her]192-undine alert intelligence immediately set to work in this new direction ; but almost at the same moment [she]192-undine became aware of a subtle change of tone in [the Princess]4948-the princess and [[her]4948-the princess mother]426-her mother , a change reflected in the corresponding decline of [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac 's cordiality . [Undine]192-undine , since [her]192-undine arrival in [Paris]76-paris , had necessarily been less in [[the Princess]4948-the princess 's company]5156-the princess 's company , but when [they]5157-they met [she]192-undine had found [her]192-undine as friendly as ever . It was manifestly not a failing of [the Princess]4948-the princess 's to forget past favours , and though increasingly absorbed by the demands of [town]3770-town life [she]192-undine treated [[her]192-undine new friend]4977-her new friend with the same affectionate frankness , and [Undine]192-undine was given frequent opportunities to enlarge [her]192-undine Parisian acquaintance , not only in [[the Princess]4948-the princess 's intimate circle]5162-the princess 's intimate circle but in [the majestic drawing - rooms of [the Hotel de Dordogne]5164-the hotel de dordogne]5163-the majestic drawing - rooms of the hotel de dordogne . Now , however , there was a perceptible decline in these signs of hospitality , and [Undine]192-undine , on calling one day on [the Duchess]4974-the duchess , noticed that [her]192-undine appearance sent a visible flutter of discomfort through the circle about [[her]192-undine hostess]431-her hostess 's chair . [Two or three of [the ladies present]5168-the ladies present]5167-two or three of the ladies present looked away from [the new - comer]5169-the new - comer and at [each other]3877-each other , and [several of [them]5168-the ladies present]5171-several of them seemed spontaneously to encircle without approaching [her]192-undine , while [another -- grey - haired , elderly and slightly frightened -- with an "[2730-you] Adieu]5172-another -- grey - haired , elderly and slightly frightened -- with an " adieu , ma bonne tante " to [the Duchess]4974-the duchess , was hastily aided in [her]5172-another -- grey - haired , elderly and slightly frightened -- with an " adieu retreat down the long line of [old gilded rooms]5174-old gilded rooms . The incident was too mute and rapid to have been noticeable had it not been followed by [the Duchess]4974-the duchess 's resuming [her]4974-the duchess conversation with [the ladies nearest [her]4974-the duchess]5176-the ladies nearest her as though [Undine]192-undine had just gone out of [the room]441-the room instead of entering [it]441-the room . The sense of having been thus rendered invisible filled [Undine]192-undine with a vehement desire to make [herself]192-undine seen , and an equally strong sense that all attempts to do so would be vain ; and when , a few minutes later , [she]192-undine issued from the portals of [the Hotel de Dordogne]5164-the hotel de dordogne it was with the fixed resolve not to enter [them]5179-them again till [she]192-undine had had an explanation with [the Princess]4948-the princess . [She]192-undine was spared the trouble of seeking one by the arrival , early the next morning , of [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac , who , entering almost with the breakfast tray , mysteriously asked to be allowed to communicate something of importance . "[4948-the princess] [You]2730-you 'll understand , [I]0-i know , [the Princess]4948-the princess 's not coming herself-- " [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac began , sitting up very straight on the edge of the arm - chair over which [Undine]192-undine 's lace dressing - gown hung . "[4948-the princess] If there 's anything [she]4948-the princess wants to say to [me]0-i , [I]0-i do n't , " [Undine]192-undine answered , leaning back among [her]192-undine rosy pillows , and reflecting compassionately that the face opposite [her]192-undine was just the colour of the caf au lait [she]192-undine was pouring out . "[629-one] There are things that are ... that might seem too pointed ... if one said them [one]629-one 's self , " [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac continued . " [Undine]192-undine raised [herself]192-undine on [her]192-undine elbow . "[366-lili] What did [Lili]366-lili tell [you]0-i to tell [me]0-i ? " "[382-raymond] Well -- not while [the Marquise de Chelles]371-the marquise de chelles is in [Paris]76-paris . That kind of family feeling is something [you]0-i naturally don't-- " [Undine]192-undine had a sudden glimpse of hidden intricacies . "[2745-they] That was [[Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond ' mother]2743-raymond de chelles ' mother [I]0-i saw [there]603-there yesterday ? The one [they]2745-they hurried out when [I]0-i came in ? " "[2743-raymond de chelles ' mother] It seems [she]2743-raymond de chelles ' mother was very much upset . [She]2743-raymond de chelles ' mother somehow heard [your]0-i name . "[2743-raymond de chelles ' mother] Is n't it better to be frank ? Because [[her]2743-raymond de chelles ' mother son]1095-her son wants to marry [me]0-i ? " "[2745-they] Of course [they]2745-they know that 's impossible . " [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac smiled compassionately . "[2745-they] But [they]2745-they 're afraid of [your]0-i spoiling [his]1095-her son other chances . " [Undine]192-undine paused a moment before answering , "[2748-my dear child] It wo n't be impossible when [my]0-i marriage is annulled , " [she]192-undine said . The effect of this statement was less electrifying than [she]192-undine had hoped . [[Her]192-undine visitor]427-her visitor simply broke into a laugh . "[382-raymond] [[My]0-i dear child]2748-my dear child ! [Your]0-i marriage annulled ? Who can have put such a mad idea into [your]0-i head ? " [Undine]192-undine 's gaze followed the pattern [she]192-undine was tracing with a lustrous nail on [her]192-undine embroidered bedspread . "[382-raymond] [Raymond]382-raymond [himself]382-raymond , " [she]192-undine let fall . This time there was no mistaking the effect [she]192-undine produced . [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac , with a murmured "[2749-they] Oh , " sat gazing before [her]192-undine as if [she]353-madame de trezac had lost the thread of [her]353-madame de trezac argument ; and it was only after a considerable interval that [she]353-madame de trezac recovered it sufficiently to exclaim : "[2749-they] [They]2749-they 'll never hear of it -- absolutely never ! " "[2749-they] But [they]2749-they ca n't prevent it , can [they]2749-they ? " "[0-i] [They]2749-they can prevent its being of any use to [you]0-i . " "[0-i] [I]0-i see , " [Undine]192-undine pensively assented . [She]192-undine knew the tone [she]192-undine had taken was virtually a declaration of war ; but [she]192-undine was in a mood when the act of defiance , apart from its strategic value , was a satisfaction in itself . Moreover , if [she]192-undine could not gain [her]192-undine end without a fight it was better that the battle should be engaged while [Raymond]382-raymond 's ardour was at its height . To provoke immediate hostilities [she]192-undine sent for [him]382-raymond the same afternoon , and related , quietly and without comment , the incident of [her]192-undine visit to [the Duchess]4974-the duchess , and the mission with which [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac had been charged . In the circumstances , [she]192-undine went on to explain , it was manifestly impossible that [she]192-undine should continue to receive [his]382-raymond visits ; and [she]192-undine met [his]382-raymond wrathful comments on [[his]382-raymond relatives]5183-his relatives by the gently but firmly expressed resolve not to be the cause of any disagreement between [himself]382-raymond and [[his]382-raymond family]504-his family . XXX A few days after [her]192-undine decisive conversation with [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond , [Undine]192-undine , emerging from the doors of [the Nouveau Luxe]2072-the nouveau luxe , where [she]192-undine had been to call on [the newly - arrived Mrs. Homer Branney]357-mrs. homer branney , once more found [herself]192-undine face to face with [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt . This time there was no mistaking [his]2750-he eagerness to be recognized . [He]2750-he stopped short as [they]5186-they met , and [she]192-undine read such pleasure in [his]2750-he eyes that [she]192-undine too stopped , holding out [her]192-undine hand . "[2750-he] [I]0-i 'm glad [you]2750-he 're going to speak to [me]0-i , " [she]192-undine said , and [Moffatt]212-moffatt reddened at the allusion . "[2750-he] Well , [I]0-i very nearly did n't . [I]0-i did n't know [you]2750-he . [You]2750-he look about as old as [you]2750-he did when [I]0-i first landed at [Apex]192-undine -- remember ? " [He]2750-he turned back and began to walk at [her]192-undine side in the direction of [the Champs Elysees]145-the champs elysees . "[2750-he] Say -- this is all right ! " [he]2750-he exclaimed ; and [she]192-undine saw that [his]2750-he glance had left [her]192-undine and was ranging across [the wide silvery square ahead of [them]5188-them]5187-the wide silvery square ahead of them to the congregated domes and spires beyond [the river]5189-the river . " [He]2750-he seemed to be breathing in deeply the impression of fountains , sculpture , [leafy ' avenues]5191-leafy ' avenues and long - drawn architectural distances fading into the afternoon haze . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i 've been to [that old church over there]2751-that old church over there ? Making the trip just for [my]0-i private satisfaction -- there wo n't be any money in it , [I]0-i 'm afraid . " Leaden disappointment descended on [Undine]192-undine . But another look at [his]212-moffatt face denied [her]192-undine this solace ; and [his]212-moffatt evident indifference was the last blow to [her]192-undine pride . "[0-i] Why , [I]0-i should n't wonder -- one of these days . [Millionaires]2772-millionaires always collect something ; but [I]0-i 've got to collect [my]0-i millions first .
