"[192-undine] [You]192-undine 've never had [a child]549-a child , " [she]192-undine replied . XXXI Nearly two years had passed since [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph , waking from [his]212-moffatt long sleep in the hot summer light of [Washington Square]2-washington square , had found that the face of life was changed for [him]212-moffatt . In the interval [he]212-moffatt had gradually adapted [himself]212-moffatt to the new order of things ; but the months of adaptation had been a time of such darkness and confusion that , from the vantage - ground of [his]212-moffatt recovered lucidity , [he]212-moffatt could not yet distinguish the stages by which [he]212-moffatt had worked [his]212-moffatt way out ; and even now [his]212-moffatt footing was not secure . [His]212-moffatt first effort had been to readjust [his]212-moffatt values -- to take an inventory of them , and reclassify them , so that one at least might be made to appear as important as those [he]212-moffatt had lost ; otherwise there could be no reason why [he]212-moffatt should go on living . [He]212-moffatt applied [himself]212-moffatt doggedly to this attempt ; but whenever [he]212-moffatt thought [he]212-moffatt had found a reason that [his]212-moffatt mind could rest in , it gave way under [him]212-moffatt , and the old struggle for a foothold began again . [His]212-moffatt two objects in life were [[his]212-moffatt boy]1702-his boy and [his]212-moffatt book . [The boy]4296-the boy was incomparably the stronger argument , yet the less serviceable in filling the void . [Ralph]199-ralph felt [[his]212-moffatt son]1973-his son all the while , and all through [his]212-moffatt other feelings ; but [he]212-moffatt could not think about [him]1973-his son actively and continuously , could not forever exercise [his]212-moffatt eager empty dissatisfied mind on the relatively simple problem of clothing , educating and amusing [a little boy of six]5209-a little boy of six . Yet [Paul]218-paul 's existence was the all - sufficient reason for [his]212-moffatt own ; and [he]212-moffatt turned again , with a kind of cold fervour , to [his]212-moffatt abandoned literary dream . Material needs obliged [him]212-moffatt to go on with [his]212-moffatt regular business ; but , the day 's work over , [he]212-moffatt was possessed of a leisure as bare and as blank as [an unfurnished house]5210-an unfurnished house , yet that was at least [his]212-moffatt own to furnish as [he]212-moffatt pleased . Meanwhile [he]212-moffatt was beginning to show a presentable face to [the world]620-the world , and to be once more treated like [a man in whose case [no one]3844-no one is particularly interested]5212-a man in whose case no one is particularly interested . [[His]212-moffatt men [friends]5085-friends]5214-his men friends ceased to say : "[252-hallo] [Hallo]252-hallo , [old chap]2774-old chap , [I]0-i never saw [you]2774-old chap looking fitter ! " and [elderly ladies]5216-elderly ladies no longer told [him]212-moffatt [they]5216-elderly ladies were sure [he]212-moffatt kept too much to [himself]212-moffatt , and urged [him]212-moffatt to drop in any afternoon for a quiet talk . [People]560-people left [him]212-moffatt to [his]212-moffatt sorrow as [a man]932-a man is left to an incurable habit , an unfortunate tie : [they]560-people ignored it , or looked over its head if [they]560-people happened to catch a glimpse of it at [his]212-moffatt elbow . These glimpses were given to [them]560-people more and more rarely . The smothered springs of life were bubbling up in [Ralph]199-ralph , and there were days when [he]212-moffatt was glad to wake and see the sun in [his]212-moffatt window , and when [he]212-moffatt began to plan [his]212-moffatt book , and to fancy that the planning really interested [him]212-moffatt . [He]212-moffatt could even maintain the delusion for several days -- for intervals each time appreciably longer -- before it shrivelled up again in a scorching blast of disenchantment . The worst of it was that [he]212-moffatt could never tell when these hot gusts of anguish would overtake [him]212-moffatt . They came sometimes just when [he]212-moffatt felt most secure , when [he]212-moffatt was saying to [himself]212-moffatt : "[2775-you] After all , things are really worth while-- " sometimes even when [he]212-moffatt was sitting with [Clare Van Degen]228-clare , listening to [her]228-clare voice , watching [her]228-clare hands , and turning over in [his]212-moffatt mind the opening chapters of [his]212-moffatt book . "[2775-you] [You]2775-you ought to write " ; [they]560-people had one and all said it to [him]212-moffatt from the first ; and [he]212-moffatt fancied [he]212-moffatt might have begun sooner if [he]212-moffatt had not been urged on by [their]560-people watchful fondness . [Everybody]3748-everybody wanted [him]212-moffatt to write -- [everybody]3748-everybody had decided that [he]212-moffatt ought to , that [he]212-moffatt would , that [he]212-moffatt must be persuaded to ; and the incessant imperceptible pressure of encouragement -- the assumption of those about [him]212-moffatt that because it would be good for [him]212-moffatt to write [he]212-moffatt must naturally be able to -- acted on [his]212-moffatt restive nerves as a stronger deterrent than disapproval . Even [Clare]228-clare had fallen into the same mistake ; and one day , as [he]212-moffatt sat talking with [her]228-clare on [the verandah of [Laura Fairford]203-laura 's house]5221-the verandah of laura fairford 's house on [the Sound]5222-the sound -- where [they]560-people now most frequently met -- [Ralph]199-ralph had half - impatiently rejoined : "[0-i] Oh , if [you]2776-you think it 's literature [I]0-i need-- ! " Instantly [he]212-moffatt had seen [her]228-clare face change , and the speaking hands tremble on [her]228-clare knee . But [she]228-clare achieved the feat of not answering [him]212-moffatt , or turning [her]228-clare steady eyes from the dancing mid - summer water at [the foot of [Laura]203-laura 's lawn]5223-the foot of laura 's lawn . [Ralph]199-ralph leaned a little nearer , and for an instant [his]212-moffatt hand imagined the flutter of hers . But instead of clasping it [he]212-moffatt drew back , and rising from [his]212-moffatt chair wandered away to the other end of [the verandah]5224-the verandah ... No , [he]212-moffatt did n't feel as [Clare]228-clare felt . If [he]212-moffatt loved [her]228-clare -- as [he]212-moffatt sometimes thought [he]212-moffatt did -- it was not in the same way . [He]212-moffatt had a great tenderness for [her]228-clare , [he]212-moffatt was more nearly happy with [her]228-clare than with [any one else]2380-any one else ; [he]212-moffatt liked to sit and talk with [her]228-clare , and watch [her]228-clare face and [her]228-clare hands , and [he]212-moffatt wished there were some way -- some different way -- of letting [her]228-clare know it ; but [he]212-moffatt could not conceive that tenderness and desire could ever again be one for [him]212-moffatt : such a notion as that seemed part of the monstrous sentimental muddle on which [his]212-moffatt life had gone aground . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall write -- of course [I]0-i shall write some day , " [he]0-i said , turning back to [his]0-i seat . "[2777-you] [I]0-i 've had a novel in the back of [my]0-i head for years ; and now 's the time to pull it out . " [He]0-i hardly knew what [he]0-i was saying ; but before the end of the sentence [he]0-i saw that [Clare]228-clare had understood what [he]0-i meant to convey , and henceforth [he]0-i felt committed to letting [her]228-clare talk to [him]0-i as much as [she]228-clare pleased about [his]0-i book . [He]0-i [himself]0-i , in consequence , took to thinking about it more consecutively ; and just as [[his]0-i friends]5139-his friends ceased to urge [him]0-i to write , [he]0-i sat down in earnest to begin . The vision that had come to [him]0-i had no likeness to any of [his]0-i earlier imaginings . Two or three subjects had haunted [him]0-i , pleading for expression , during the first years of [his]0-i marriage ; but these now seemed either too lyrical or too tragic . [He]0-i no longer saw life on the heroic scale : [he]0-i wanted to do something in which [men]730-men should look no bigger than the insects [they]730-men were . [He]0-i contrived in the course of time to reduce one of [[his]0-i old subjects]5228-his old subjects to these dimensions , and after nights of brooding [he]0-i made a dash at it , and wrote an opening chapter that struck [him]0-i as not too bad . In the exhilaration of this first attempt [he]0-i spent some pleasant evenings revising and polishing [his]0-i work ; and gradually a feeling of authority and importance developed in [him]0-i . In the morning , when [he]0-i woke , instead of [his]0-i habitual sense of lassitude , [he]0-i felt an eagerness to be up and doing , and a conviction that [his]0-i individual task was a necessary part of [the world]620-the world 's machinery . [He]0-i kept [his]0-i secret with [the beginner]5230-the beginner 's deadly fear of losing [his]0-i hold on [his]0-i half - real creations if [he]0-i let in any outer light on them ; but [he]0-i went about with a more assured step , shrank less from meeting [[his]0-i friends]5139-his friends , and even began to dine out again , and to laugh at some of the jokes [he]0-i heard . [Laura Fairford]203-laura , to get [Paul]218-paul away from [town]3770-town , had gone early to [the country]424-the country ; and [Ralph]199-ralph , who went down to [her]203-laura every Saturday , usually found [Clare Van Degen]228-clare [there]603-there . Since [his]0-i divorce [he]0-i had never entered [[[his]0-i cousin]939-his cousin 's pinnacled palace]5236-his cousin 's pinnacled palace ; and [Clare]228-clare had never asked [him]0-i why [he]0-i stayed away . This mutual silence had been [their]5237-they sole allusion to [Van Degen]228-clare 's share in the catastrophe , though [Ralph]199-ralph had spoken frankly of its other aspects . [They]5237-they talked , however , most often of impersonal subjects -- books , pictures , plays , or whatever the world that interested [them]5237-they was doing -- and [she]228-clare showed no desire to draw [him]0-i back to [his]0-i own affairs . [She]228-clare was again staying late in [town]3770-town -- to have a pretext , as [he]0-i guessed , for coming down on Sundays to [the Fairfords'--and]5239-the fairfords'--and [they]5237-they often made the trip together in [[her]228-clare motor]698-her motor ; but [he]0-i had not yet spoken to [her]228-clare of having begun [his]0-i book . One May evening , however , as [they]5237-they sat alone in [the verandah]5224-the verandah , [he]0-i suddenly told [her]228-clare that [he]0-i was writing . As [he]0-i spoke [his]0-i heart beat like [a boy]980-a boy 's ; but once the words were out they gave [him]0-i a feeling of self - confidence , and [he]0-i began to sketch [his]0-i plan , and then to go into its details . [Clare]228-clare listened devoutly , [her]228-clare eyes burning on [him]0-i through the dusk like the stars deepening above [the garden]2118-the garden ; and when [she]228-clare got up to go in [he]0-i followed [her]228-clare with a new sense of reassurance . The dinner that evening was unusually pleasant . [Charles Bowen]314-bowen , just back from [his]314-bowen usual spring travels , had come straight down to [[his]314-bowen friends]5139-his friends from [the steamer]4717-the steamer ; and the fund of impressions [he]314-bowen brought with [him]314-bowen gave [Ralph]199-ralph a desire to be up and wandering . And why not -- when the book was done ? [He]0-i smiled across the table at [Clare]228-clare . "[314-bowen] Next summer [you]2777-you 'll have to charter [a yacht]2778-a yacht , and take [us]2779-us all off to [the Aegean]149-the aegean . [We]2779-us ca n't have [Charles]314-bowen condescending to [us]2779-us about [the out - of - the - way places [he]314-bowen 's been seeing]2780-the out - of - the - way places he 's been seeing . " Was it really [he]0-i who was speaking , and [[his]0-i cousin]939-his cousin who was sending [him]0-i back [her]939-his cousin dusky smile ? Well -- why not , again ? The seasons renewed themselves , and [he]0-i too was putting out a new growth . "[314-bowen] [My]0-i book -- [my]0-i book -- [my]0-i book , " kept repeating itself under all [his]0-i thoughts , as [Undine]192-undine 's name had once perpetually murmured there . That night as [he]0-i went up to [bed]5247-bed [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i that [he]0-i was actually ceasing to think about [[his]0-i wife]512-his wife ... As [he]0-i passed [Laura]203-laura 's door [she]203-laura called [him]0-i in , and put [her]203-laura arms about [him]0-i . "[0-i] [You]0-i look so well , [dear]3838-dear ! " "[0-i] But why should n't [I]0-i ? " [he]0-i answered gaily , as if ridiculing the fancy that [he]0-i had ever looked otherwise . [Paul]218-paul was sleeping behind the next door , and the sense of [the boy]4296-the boy 's nearness gave [him]0-i a warmer glow . [[His]0-i little world]5250-his little world was rounding itself out again , and once more [he]0-i felt safe and at peace in its circle . [[His]0-i sister]3743-his sister looked as if [she]3743-his sister had something more to say ; but [she]3743-his sister merely kissed [him]0-i good night , and [he]0-i went up whistling to [[his]0-i room]1748-his room . The next morning [he]0-i was to take a walk with [Clare]228-clare , and while [he]0-i lounged about [the drawing - room]439-the drawing - room , waiting for [her]228-clare to come down , [a servant]2208-a servant came in with the Sunday papers . [Ralph]199-ralph picked one up , and was absently unfolding it when [his]0-i eye fell on [his]0-i own name : a sight [he]0-i had been spared since the last echoes of [his]0-i divorce had subsided . [His]0-i impulse was to fling the paper down , to hurl it as far from [him]0-i as [he]0-i could ; but a grim fascination tightened [his]0-i hold and drew [his]0-i eyes back to the hated head - line . CASE There it was before [him]0-i in all its long - drawn horror -- an "[5258-the count "] interview"--an "[0-i] interview " of [Undine]192-undine 's about [her]5255-mrs . coming marriage ! " [Ralph]199-ralph shrugged . "[2788-she] There may be other inducements . But [she]2788-she wo n't be able to manage it . " [He]0-i heard [himself]0-i speaking quite collectedly . Had [Undine]192-undine at last lost [her]192-undine power of wounding [him]0-i ? [Clare]228-clare came in , dressed for [their]5263-their walk , and under [Laura]203-laura 's anxious eyes [he]2789-he picked up the newspaper and held it out with a careless : "[2788-she] Look at this ! " came from [him]2789-he involuntarily ; and [she]939-his cousin startled [him]2789-he by bursting into tears . [He]2789-he bent over and kissed [her]939-his cousin on the cheek . XXXII [Ralph]199-ralph , as the days passed , felt that [Clare]228-clare was right : if [Undine]192-undine married again [he]2789-he would possess [himself]2789-he more completely , be more definitely rid of [his]2789-he past . And [he]2789-he did not doubt that [she]192-undine would gain [her]192-undine end : [he]2789-he knew [her]192-undine violent desires and [her]192-undine cold tenacity . If [she]192-undine had failed to capture [Van Degen]228-clare it was probably because [she]192-undine lacked experience of [that particular type of man]5269-that particular type of man , of [his]2789-he huge immediate wants and feeble vacillating purposes ; most of all , because [she]192-undine had not yet measured the strength of the social considerations that restrained [him]2789-he . It was a mistake [she]192-undine was not likely to repeat , and [her]192-undine failure had probably been a useful preliminary to success . It was a long time since [Ralph]199-ralph had allowed [himself]199-ralph to think of [her]192-undine , and as [he]2789-he did so the overwhelming fact of [her]192-undine beauty became present to [him]2789-he again , no longer as an element of [his]2789-he being but as a power dispassionately estimated . [He]2789-he said to [himself]2789-he : "[0-i] [Any man who can feel at all]2791-any man who can feel at all will feel it as [I]0-i did " ; and the conviction grew in [him]2789-he that [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond , of whom [he]2789-he had formed an idea through [Bowen]314-bowen 's talk , was not the man to give [her]192-undine up , even if [she]192-undine failed to obtain the release [his]2789-he religion exacted . Meanwhile [Ralph]199-ralph was gradually beginning to feel [himself]199-ralph freer and lighter . [Undine]192-undine 's act , by cutting the last link between [them]5270-them , seemed to have given [him]2789-he back to [himself]199-ralph ; and the mere fact that [he]2789-he could consider [his]2789-he case in all its bearings , impartially and ironically , showed [him]2789-he the distance [he]2789-he had travelled , the extent to which [he]2789-he had renewed [himself]2789-he . [He]2789-he had been moved , too , by [Clare]228-clare 's cry of joy at [his]2789-he release . Though the nature of [his]2789-he feeling for [her]192-undine had not changed [he]2789-he was aware of a new quality in [their]5270-them friendship . When [he]2789-he went back to [his]2789-he book again [his]2789-he sense of power had lost its asperity , and the spectacle of life seemed less like a witless dangling of limp dolls . [He]2789-he was well on in [his]2789-he second chapter now . This lightness of mood was still on [him]2789-he when , returning one afternoon to [Washington Square]2-washington square , full of projects for a long evening 's work , [he]2789-he found [[his]2789-he mother]3752-his mother awaiting [him]2789-he with a strange face . [He]2789-he followed [her]3752-his mother into [the drawing - room]439-the drawing - room , and [she]3752-his mother explained that there had been a telephone message [she]3752-his mother did n't understand -- something perfectly crazy about [Paul]218-paul -- of course it was all a mistake ... [Ralph]199-ralph 's first thought was of an accident , and [his]2789-he heart contracted . "[203-laura] Did [Laura]203-laura telephone ? " "[2794-hers] No , no ; not [Laura]203-laura . [I]0-i was to be sure to have [his]2792-him things packed ... but of course it 's a misunderstanding ... " [She]3752-his mother gave an uncertain laugh , and looked up at [Ralph]199-ralph as though entreating [him]2789-he to return the reassurance [she]3752-his mother had given [him]2789-he . "[199-ralph] Of course , of course , " [he]2789-he echoed . [He]2789-he made [[his]2789-he mother]3752-his mother repeat [her]3752-his mother statement ; but the unforeseen always flurried [her]3752-his mother , and [she]3752-his mother was confused and inaccurate . [She]3752-his mother did n't actually know who had telephoned : the voice had n't sounded like [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's ... [A woman]933-a woman 's voice ; yes -- oh , not [a lady]1146-a lady 's ! And there was certainly something about [a steamer]5276-a steamer ... but [he]2789-he knew how the telephone bewildered [her]3752-his mother ... and [she]3752-his mother was sure [she]3752-his mother was getting a little deaf . As [he]2789-he reached the front door a letter clinked in the box , and [he]2789-he saw [his]2789-he name on an ordinary looking business envelope . [Mrs. Marvell]218-paul had followed [him]2789-he into [the hall]565-the hall , and [her]218-paul cry broke the silence . "[2794-hers] [Ralph]199-ralph -- [Ralph]199-ralph -- is it anything [she]2794-hers 's done ? " "[2794-hers] Nothing -- it 's nothing . " [He]2789-he stared at [her]218-paul . "[2794-hers] What 's the day of the week ? " "[2794-hers] Wednesday . Why , what-- ? " [She]218-paul suddenly seemed to understand . "[2794-hers] [She]2794-hers 's not going to take [him]2795-him away from [us]2796-us ? " [Ralph]199-ralph dropped into a chair , crumpling the letter in [his]2789-he hand . [He]2789-he had been in a dream , poor fool that [he]2789-he was -- a dream about [[his]2789-he child]5280-his child ! [He]2789-he sat gazing at the type - written phrases that spun themselves out before [him]2789-he . "[472-a mother] [[My]0-i client]2797-my client 's circumstances now happily permitting ... at last in a position to offer [[her]2797-my client son]1095-her son a [home]548-home ... long separation ... " The sole custody ! But that meant that [Paul]218-paul was [hers]2794-hers , [hers]2794-hers only , [hers]2794-hers for always : that [[his]5280-his child father]1946-his father had no more claim on [him]5280-his child than [any casual stranger in [the street]705-the street]5282-any casual stranger in the street ! And [he]2789-he , [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph , [a sane man]5284-a sane man , young , able - bodied , in full possession of [his]2789-he wits , had assisted at the perpetration of this abominable wrong , had passively forfeited [his]2789-he right to the flesh of [his]2789-he body , the blood of [his]2789-he being ! But it could n't be -- of course it could n't be . The preposterousness of it proved that it was n't true . There was a mistake somewhere ; a mistake [[his]2789-he own lawyer]5285-his own lawyer would instantly rectify . If a hammer had n't been drumming in [his]2789-he head [he]2789-he could have recalled the terms of the decree -- but for the moment all the details of the agonizing episode were lost in a blur of uncertainty . To escape [[his]2789-he mother]3752-his mother 's silent anguish of interrogation [he]2789-he stood up and said : "[191-mr. spragg] [I]0-i 'll see [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg -- of course it 's a mistake . " But as [he]2789-he spoke [he]2789-he retravelled the hateful months during the divorce proceedings , remembering [his]2789-he incomprehensible lassitude , [his]2789-he acquiescence in [[his]2789-he family]504-his family 's determination to ignore the whole episode , and [his]2789-he gradual lapse into the same state of apathy . [He]2789-he recalled all the old family catchwords , the full and elaborate vocabulary of evasion : "[191-mr. spragg] delicacy , " "[191-mr. spragg] pride , " "[191-mr. spragg] personal dignity , " "[191-mr. spragg] preferring not to know about such things " ; [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph 's : "[0-i] All [I]0-i ask is that [you]0-i wo n't mention the subject to [[your]0-i grandfather]2802-your grandfather , " [Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet 's : "[0-i] Spare [[your]0-i mother]3779-your mother , [Ralph]199-ralph , whatever happens , " and even [Laura]203-laura 's terrified : "[2804-his] Of course , for [Paul]218-paul 's sake , there must be no scandal . " For [Paul]218-paul 's sake ! And it was because , for [Paul]218-paul 's sake , there must be no scandal , that [he]2802-your grandfather , [[Paul]218-paul 's father]5288-paul 's father , had tamely abstained from defending [his]2802-your grandfather rights and contesting [[his]2802-your grandfather wife]512-his wife 's charges , and had thus handed [the child]1948-the child over to [her]512-his wife keeping ! As [[his]2802-your grandfather cab]5291-his cab whirled [him]2802-your grandfather up [Fifth Avenue]4-fifth avenue , [Ralph]199-ralph 's whole body throbbed with rage against the influences that had reduced [him]2802-your grandfather to such weakness . Then , gradually , [he]2802-your grandfather saw that the weakness was innate in [him]2802-your grandfather . [He]2802-your grandfather had been eloquent enough , in [his]2802-your grandfather free youth , against the conventions of [[his]2802-your grandfather class]5292-his class ; yet when the moment came to show [his]2802-your grandfather contempt for [them]5293-them [they]5293-them had mysteriously mastered [him]2802-your grandfather , deflecting [his]2802-your grandfather course like some hidden hereditary failing . As [he]2802-your grandfather looked back it seemed as though even [his]2802-your grandfather great disaster had been conventionalized and sentimentalized by this inherited attitude : that the thoughts [he]2802-your grandfather had thought about it were only those of generations of [Dagonets]270-the dagonets , and that there had been nothing real and [his]2802-your grandfather own in [his]2802-your grandfather life but the foolish passion [he]2802-your grandfather had been trying so hard to think out of existence . Halfway to [the Malibran]120-the malibran [he]2802-your grandfather changed [his]2802-your grandfather direction , and drove to [the house of [the lawyer [he]2802-your grandfather had consulted at the time of [his]2802-your grandfather divorce]5295-the lawyer he had consulted at the time of his divorce]5294-the house of the lawyer he had consulted at the time of his divorce . [The lawyer]5296-the lawyer had not yet come up [town]3770-town , and [Ralph]199-ralph had a half hour of bitter meditation before the sound of a latch - key brought [him]2802-your grandfather to [his]2802-your grandfather feet . The visit did not last long . [[His]2802-your grandfather host]5298-his host , after an affable greeting , listened without surprise to what [he]2802-your grandfather had to say , and when [he]2802-your grandfather had ended reminded [him]5298-his host with somewhat ironic precision that , at the time of the divorce , [he]2802-your grandfather had asked for neither advice nor information -- had simply declared that [he]2802-your grandfather wanted to "[2805-you] turn [his]2804-his back on the whole business " ( [Ralph]199-ralph recognized the phrase as one of [[his]2802-your grandfather grandfather]949-his grandfather 's ) , and , on hearing that in that case [he]2802-your grandfather had only to abstain from action , and was in no need of legal services , had gone away without farther enquiries . "[2805-you] [You]2805-you led [me]0-i to infer [you]2805-you had [your]2805-you reasons-- " [the slighted counsellor]5300-the slighted counsellor concluded ; and , in reply to [Ralph]199-ralph 's breathless question , [he]0-i subjoined , "[430-the mother] Why , [you]2805-you see , the case is closed , and [I]0-i do n't exactly know on what ground [you]2805-you can re - open it -- unless , of course , [you]2805-you can bring evidence showing that the irregularity of [the mother]430-the mother 's life is such ... " "[430-the mother] [She]430-the mother 's going to marry again , " [Ralph]199-ralph threw in . "[2805-you] Indeed ? Well , that in itself can hardly be described as irregular . In fact , in certain circumstances it might be construed as an advantage to [the child]1948-the child . " "[0-i] Then [I]0-i 'm powerless ? " "[2805-you] Why -- unless there 's an ulterior motive -- through which pressure might be brought to bear . " "[2805-you] [You]2805-you mean that the first thing to do is to find out what [she]430-the mother 's up to ? " "[2805-you] Precisely . At most , [you]2805-you could probably arrange to see [[your]2805-you boy]2808-your boy at stated intervals . " To see [[his]0-i boy]1702-his boy at stated intervals ! [Ralph]199-ralph wondered how [a sane man]5284-a sane man could sit there , looking responsible and efficient , and talk such rubbish ... As [he]0-i got up to go [the lawyer]5296-the lawyer detained [him]0-i to add : "[4182-my mother] Of course there 's no immediate cause for alarm . It will take time to enforce the provision of the Dakota decree in [New York]8-new york , and till it 's done [[your]2805-you son]2809-your son ca n't be taken from [you]2805-you . But there 's sure to be a lot of nasty talk in the papers ; and [you]2805-you 're bound to lose in the end . " [Ralph]199-ralph thanked [him]0-i and left . [He]0-i sped northward to [the Malibran]120-the malibran , where [he]0-i learned that [Mr.]5304-mr. and [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg were at dinner . [He]0-i sent [his]0-i name down to [the subterranean restaurant]5305-the subterranean restaurant , and [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg presently appeared between the limp portieres of [the "[4182-my mother] Adam " writing - room]5306-the " adam " writing - room . [He]191-mr. spragg had grown older and heavier , as if illness instead of health had put more flesh on [his]191-mr. spragg bones , and there were greyish tints in the hollows of [his]191-mr. spragg face . "[218-paul] What 's this about [Paul]218-paul ? " [Ralph]199-ralph exclaimed . "[4182-my mother] [[My]0-i mother]4182-my mother 's had a message [we]2811-we ca n't make out . " [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg sat down , with the effect of immersing [his]191-mr. spragg spinal column in the depths of the arm - chair [he]191-mr. spragg selected . "[4182-my mother] From [my]0-i -- from [Undine 's lawyers]2812-undine 's lawyers ? Yes . " [Ralph]199-ralph held it out . "[4182-my mother] It 's queer reading . "[194-mrs. spragg] But the first communication [I]0-i received was from [you]0-i -- at least from [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg . " [Ralph]199-ralph burst out , springing from [his]0-i seat . "[0-i] [You]0-i do n't for a moment imagine , do [you]0-i -- any of [you]0-i -- that [I]0-i 'm going to deliver up [[my]0-i son]4359-my son like a bale of goods in answer to any instructions in [God]259-god 's world?--Oh , yes , [I]0-i know -- [I]0-i let [him]4359-my son go -- [I]0-i abandoned [my]0-i right to [him]4359-my son ... but [I]0-i did n't know what [I]0-i was doing ... [I]0-i was sick with grief and misery . [[My]0-i people]4401-my people were awfully broken up over the whole business , and [I]0-i wanted to spare [them]4401-my people . " [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg received this passionate appeal in a silence that implied not so much disdain or indifference , as the total inability to deal verbally with emotional crises . XXXIII The upshot of [Ralph]199-ralph 's visit was that [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg , after considerable deliberation , agreed , pending farther negotiations between [the opposing lawyers]5307-the opposing lawyers , to undertake that no attempt should be made to remove [Paul]218-paul from [[his]4359-my son father]1946-his father 's custody . Nevertheless , [he]0-i seemed to think it quite natural that [Undine]192-undine , on the point of making a marriage which would put it in [her]192-undine power to give [[her]192-undine child]483-her child [a suitable home]5310-a suitable home , should assert [her]192-undine claim on [him]4359-my son . It was more disconcerting to [Ralph]199-ralph to learn that [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg , for once departing from [her]194-mrs. spragg attitude of passive impartiality , had eagerly abetted [[her]194-mrs. spragg daughter]443-her daughter 's move ; [he]0-i had somehow felt that [Undine]192-undine 's desertion of [the child]1948-the child had established a kind of mute understanding between [himself]0-i and [[his]0-i mother - in - law]5313-his mother - in - law . "[194-mrs. spragg] [I]0-i thought [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg would know there 's no earthly use trying to take [Paul]218-paul from [me]0-i , " [he]0-i said with a desperate awkwardness of entreaty , and [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg startled [him]0-i by replying : "[2823-his grandma] [I]0-i presume [[his]2822-his grandma]2823-his grandma thinks [he]2822-his 'll belong to [her]2823-his grandma more if [we]2824-we keep [him]2822-his in [the family]2345-the family . " [Ralph]199-ralph , abruptly awakened from [his]0-i dream of recovered peace , found [himself]199-ralph confronted on every side by . indifference or hostility : it was as though the June fields in which [[his]0-i boy]1702-his boy was playing had suddenly opened to engulph [him]0-i . [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph 's fears and tremors were almost harder to bear than [the Spraggs]207-the spraggs ' antagonism ; and for the next few days [Ralph]199-ralph wandered about miserably , dreading some fresh communication from [[Undine]192-undine 's lawyers]2812-undine 's lawyers , yet racked by the strain of hearing nothing more from [them]2812-undine 's lawyers . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had agreed to cable [[his]191-mr. spragg daughter]500-his daughter asking [her]500-his daughter to await a letter before enforcing [her]500-his daughter demands ; but on the fourth day after [Ralph]199-ralph 's visit to [the Malibran]120-the malibran a telephone message summoned [him]0-i to [[his]0-i father]1946-his father - in - [law 's office]5318-law 's office . Half an hour later [their]5319-their talk was over and [he]0-i stood once more on [the landing outside [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's door]5320-the landing outside mr. spragg 's door . [Undine]192-undine 's answer had come and [Paul]218-paul 's fate was sealed . [[His]0-i mother]3752-his mother refused to give [him]0-i up , refused to await the arrival of [[her]3752-his mother lawyer]4804-her lawyer 's letter , and reiterated , in more peremptory language , [her]3752-his mother demand that [the child]1948-the child should be sent immediately to [Paris]76-paris in [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's care . [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg , in face of [Ralph]199-ralph 's entreaties , remained pacific but remote . It was evident that , though [he]191-mr. spragg had no wish to quarrel with [Ralph]199-ralph , [he]191-mr. spragg saw no reason for resisting [Undine]192-undine . "[2826-she] [I]0-i guess [she]2826-she 's got the law on [her]2826-she side , " [he]0-i said ; and in response to [Ralph]199-ralph 's passionate remonstrances [he]0-i added fatalistically : "[0-i] [I]0-i presume [you]0-i 'll have to leave the matter to [[my]0-i daughter]3805-my daughter . " [Ralph]199-ralph had gone to [the office]1866-the office resolved to control [his]0-i temper and keep on the watch for any shred of information [he]0-i might glean ; but it soon became clear that [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg knew as little as [himself]191-mr. spragg of [Undine]192-undine 's projects , or of the stage [her]192-undine plans had reached . All [she]192-undine had apparently vouchsafed [[her]192-undine parent]5325-her parent was the statement that [she]192-undine intended to re - marry , and the command to send [Paul]218-paul over ; and [Ralph]199-ralph reflected that [his]0-i own betrothal to [her]192-undine had probably been announced to [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg in the same curt fashion . The thought brought back an overwhelming sense of the past . One by one the details of that incredible moment revived , and [he]0-i felt in [his]0-i veins the glow of rapture with which [he]0-i had first approached the dingy threshold [he]0-i was now leaving . There came back to [him]0-i with peculiar vividness the memory of [his]0-i rushing up to [[Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's office]2432-mr. spragg 's office to consult [him]191-mr. spragg about a necklace for [Undine]192-undine . [Ralph]199-ralph recalled the incident because [his]0-i eager appeal for advice had been received by [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg with the very phrase [he]0-i had just used : "[3805-my daughter] [I]0-i presume [you]0-i 'll have to leave the matter to [[my]0-i daughter]3805-my daughter . " [Ralph]199-ralph saw [him]212-moffatt slouching in [his]212-moffatt chair , swung sideways from the untidy desk , [his]212-moffatt legs stretched out , [his]212-moffatt hands in [his]212-moffatt pockets , [his]212-moffatt jaws engaged on the phantom tooth - pick ; and , in a corner of [the office]1866-the office , the figure of [a middle - sized red - faced young man who seemed to have been interrupted in the act of saying something disagreeable]5328-a middle - sized red - faced young man who seemed to have been interrupted in the act of saying something disagreeable . "[0-i] Why , it must have been then that [I]0-i first saw [Moffatt]212-moffatt , " [Ralph]199-ralph reflected ; and the thought suggested the memory of other , subsequent meetings in [the same building]5329-the same building , and of frequent ascents to [[Moffatt]212-moffatt 's office]1897-moffatt 's office during the ardent weeks of [their]5331-their mysterious and remunerative "[2829-he] deal . " [Ralph]199-ralph wondered if [[Moffatt]212-moffatt 's office]1897-moffatt 's office were still in [the Ararat]94-ararat ; and on the way out [he]0-i paused before the black tablet affixed to the wall of [the vestibule]1896-the vestibule and sought and found the name in its familiar place . The next moment [he]0-i was again absorbed in [his]0-i own cares . Now that [he]0-i had learned the imminence of [Paul]218-paul 's danger , and the futility of pleading for delay , a thousand fantastic projects were contending in [his]0-i head . To get [the boy]4296-the boy away -- that seemed the first thing to do : to put [him]4296-the boy out of reach , and then invoke the law , get the case re - opened , and carry the fight from court to court till [his]4296-the boy rights should be recognized . It would cost a lot of money -- well , the money would have to be found . The first step was to secure [the boy]4296-the boy 's temporary safety ; after that , the question of ways and means would have to be considered ... Had there ever been a time , [Ralph]199-ralph wondered , when that question had n't been at the root of all the others ? [He]0-i had promised to let [Clare Van Degen]228-clare know the result of [his]0-i visit , and half an hour later [he]0-i was in [[her]228-clare drawing - room]5198-her drawing - room . It was the first time [he]0-i had entered [it]5198-her drawing - room since [his]0-i divorce ; but [Van Degen]228-clare was tarpon - fishing in [California]30-california -- and besides , [he]0-i had to see [Clare]228-clare . [His]0-i one relief was in talking to [her]228-clare , in feverishly turning over with [her]228-clare every possibility of delay and obstruction ; and [he]0-i marvelled at the intelligence and energy [she]228-clare brought to the discussion of these questions . It was as if [she]228-clare had never before felt strongly enough about anything to put [her]228-clare heart or [her]228-clare brains into it ; but now everything in [her]228-clare was at work for [him]0-i . [She]228-clare listened intently to what [he]0-i told [her]228-clare ; then [she]228-clare said : "[2829-he] [You]2829-he tell [me]0-i it will cost a great deal ; but why take it to [the courts]4824-the courts at all ? " [Her]192-undine eyes followed [him]2829-he intently as [he]2829-he turned away to the window and stood staring down at the sultry prospect of [Fifth Avenue]4-fifth avenue . "[0-i] As [you]0-i say , when [Paul]218-paul 's safe there wo n't be another bother left ! " XXXIV The means of raising the requisite amount of money became , during the next few weeks , the anxious theme of all [Ralph]199-ralph 's thoughts . [[His]0-i lawyers]5340-his lawyers ' enquiries soon brought the confirmation of [Clare]228-clare 's surmise , and it became clear that -- for reasons swathed in all the ingenuities of legal verbiage -- [Undine]192-undine might , in return for a substantial consideration , be prevailed on to admit that it was for [[her]228-clare son]1095-her son 's advantage to remain with [[his]1095-her son father]1946-his father . The day this admission was communicated to [Ralph]199-ralph [his]0-i first impulse was to carry the news to [[his]0-i cousin]939-his cousin . [His]0-i mood was one of pure exaltation ; [he]0-i seemed to be hugging [[his]0-i boy]1702-his boy to [him]0-i as [he]0-i walked . [Paul]218-paul and [he]0-i were to belong to [each other]3877-each other forever : no mysterious threat of separation could ever menace [them]3877-each other again ! [He]0-i had the blissful sense of relief that [the child]1948-the child [himself]0-i might have had on waking out of a frightened dream and finding the jolly daylight in [[his]0-i room]1748-his room . [Clare]228-clare at once renewed [her]228-clare entreaty to be allowed to aid in ransoming [[her]228-clare little cousin]5348-her little cousin , but [Ralph]199-ralph tried to put [her]228-clare off by explaining that [he]0-i meant to "[0-i] look about . " "[199-ralph] Look where ? In [the Dagonet coffers]2844-the dagonet coffers ? Oh , [Ralph]199-ralph , what 's the use of pretending ? Tell [me]0-i what [you]199-ralph 've got to give [her]2845-her . " It was amazing how [[his]0-i cousin]939-his cousin suddenly dominated [him]0-i . But as yet [he]0-i could n't go into the details of the bargain . That the reckoning between [himself]0-i and [Undine]192-undine should be settled in dollars and cents seemed the last bitterest satire on [his]0-i dreams : [he]0-i felt [himself]0-i miserably diminished by the smallness of what had filled [[his]0-i world]5350-his world . Nevertheless , the looking about had to be done ; and a day came when [he]0-i found [himself]0-i once more at the door of [[Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt 's office]5351-elmer moffatt 's office . [His]0-i thoughts had been drawn back to [Moffatt]212-moffatt by the insistence with which [the latter]573-the latter 's name had lately been put forward by the press in connection with a revival of the Ararat investigation . [Moffatt]212-moffatt , it appeared , had been regarded as one of [the most valuable witnesses for the State]5353-the most valuable witnesses for the state ; [his]212-moffatt return from [Europe]29-europe had been anxiously awaited , [his]212-moffatt unreadiness to testify caustically criticized ; then at last [he]212-moffatt had arrived , had gone on to [Washington]36-washington -- and had apparently had nothing to tell . [Ralph]199-ralph was too deep in [his]0-i own troubles to waste any wonder over this anticlimax ; but the frequent appearance of [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's name in the morning papers acted as an unconscious suggestion . Besides , to whom else could [he]0-i look for help ? The sum [[his]0-i wife]512-his wife demanded could be acquired only by "[199-ralph] a quick turn , " and the fact that [Ralph]199-ralph had once rendered the same kind of service to [Moffatt]212-moffatt made it natural to appeal to [him]0-i now . The market , moreover , happened to be booming , and it seemed not unlikely that [so experienced a speculator]5355-so experienced a speculator might have a "[199-ralph] good thing " up [his]5355-so experienced a speculator sleeve . [[Moffatt]212-moffatt 's office]1897-moffatt 's office had been transformed since [Ralph]199-ralph 's last visit . Paint , varnish and brass railings gave an air of opulence to [the outer precincts]5357-the outer precincts , and [the inner room]5358-the inner room , with [its]5358-the inner room mahogany bookcases containing morocco - bound "[199-ralph] sets " and [its]5358-the inner room wide blue leather arm - chairs , lacked only a palm or two to resemble [the lounge of [a fashionable hotel]5360-a fashionable hotel]5359-the lounge of a fashionable hotel . [Moffatt]212-moffatt [himself]212-moffatt , as [he]212-moffatt came forward , gave [Ralph]199-ralph the impression of having been done over by the same hand : [he]0-i was smoother , broader , more supremely tailored , and [[his]0-i whole person]5361-his whole person exhaled the faintest whiff of an expensive scent . [He]212-moffatt installed [[his]212-moffatt visitor]1247-his visitor in one of the blue arm - chairs , and sitting opposite , an elbow on [his]0-i impressive "[2846-you] [Washington]36-washington " desk , listened attentively while [Ralph]199-ralph made [his]0-i request . "[2846-you] [You]2846-you want to be put onto something good in a damned hurry ? " [Moffatt]212-moffatt twisted [his]212-moffatt moustache between two plump square - tipped fingers with a little black growth on their lower joints . "[199-ralph] [I]0-i do n't suppose , " [he]212-moffatt remarked , "[2847-a sane man between here and san francisco] there 's [a sane man between here and [San Francisco]152-san francisco]2847-a sane man between here and san francisco who is n't consumed by that yearning . " Having permitted [himself]212-moffatt this pleasantry [he]212-moffatt passed on to business . "[2848-other fellows] Yes -- it 's a first - rate time to buy : no doubt of that . But [you]2846-you say [you]2846-you want to make a quick turn - over ? Heard of a soft thing that wo n't wait , [I]0-i presume ? That 's apt to be the way with soft things -- all kinds of 'em . There 's always [other fellows]2848-other fellows after [them]2849-them . " [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's smile was playful . "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i 'd go considerably out of [my]0-i way to do [you]2846-you a good turn , because [you]2846-you did [me]0-i one when [I]0-i needed it mighty bad . ' In youth [you]2846-you sheltered [me]0-i . ' Yes , [sir]4084-sir , that 's the kind [I]0-i am . " [He]212-moffatt stood up , sauntered to the other side of [the room]441-the room , and took a small object from the top of the bookcase . "[0-i] Fond of these pink crystals ? " [He]212-moffatt held the oriental toy against the light . "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i ai n't [a judge]2851-a judge -- but now and then [I]0-i like to pick up a pretty thing . " [Ralph]199-ralph noticed that [his]2846-you eyes caressed it . "[2846-you] Well -- now let 's talk . [You]2846-you say [you]2846-you 've got to have the funds for [your]2846-you -- [your]2846-you investment within three weeks . That 's quick work . And [you]2846-you want a hundred thousand . Can [you]2846-you put up fifty ? " [Ralph]199-ralph had been prepared for the question , but when it came [he]212-moffatt felt a moment 's tremor . [He]212-moffatt knew [he]212-moffatt could count on half the amount from [[his]212-moffatt grandfather]949-his grandfather ; could possibly ask [Fairford]203-laura for a small additional loan -- but what of the rest ? Well , there was [Clare]228-clare . [He]212-moffatt had always known there would be no other way . And after all , the money was [Clare's]373-clare's -- it was [Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet money . At least [she]203-laura said it was . All the misery of [his]212-moffatt predicament was distilled into the short silence that preceded [his]212-moffatt answer : "[0-i] Yes -- [I]0-i think so . " "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i guess [I]0-i can double it for [you]2846-you . " [Moffatt]212-moffatt spoke with an air of Olympian modesty . "[2852-the other girls] Anyhow , [I]0-i 'll try . Only do n't tell [the other girls]2852-the other girls ! " [He]212-moffatt proceeded to develop [his]212-moffatt plan to ears which [Ralph]199-ralph tried to make alert and attentive , but in which perpetually , through the intricate concert of facts and figures , there broke the shout of [a small boy]5365-a small boy racing across [a suburban lawn]5366-a suburban lawn . [I]0-i do n't want to let [you]2846-you in for anything [you]2846-you ai n't quite sure about . " "[0-i] Oh , if [you]2846-you 're sure-- " [Ralph]199-ralph was already calculating the time it would take to dash up to [Clare Van Degen]228-clare 's on [his]212-moffatt way to catch [the train]4147-the train for [the Fairfords]217-the fairfords ' . " [Moffatt]212-moffatt continued . " [[Clare]228-clare 's inner sitting - room]5369-clare 's inner sitting - room was empty ; but [the servant]4299-the servant , presently returning , led [Ralph]199-ralph into [the gilded and tapestried wilderness]5371-the gilded and tapestried wilderness where [she]4299-the servant occasionally chose to receive [[her]4299-the servant visitors]5372-her visitors . "[0-i] Anyhow , [he]2857-he seems to be sure it 's a safe thing . " [She]2859-you was close beside [him]0-i , [her]2859-you hand on the heavy tapestry curtaining the door ; and [her]2859-you glance shot past [him]0-i to [[her]2859-you husband]488-her husband 's portrait . [Ralph]199-ralph caught the look , and a flood of old tendernesses and hates welled up in [him]0-i . [He]0-i drew [her]2859-you under the portrait and kissed [her]2859-you vehemently . XXXV Within forty - eight hours [Ralph]199-ralph 's money was in [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's hands , and the interval of suspense had begun . The transaction over , [he]0-i felt the deceptive buoyancy that follows on periods of painful indecision . It seemed to [him]0-i that now at last life had freed [him]0-i from all trammelling delusions , leaving [him]0-i only the best thing in its gift -- [[his]0-i boy]1702-his boy . The things [he]0-i meant [Paul]218-paul to do and to be filled [his]0-i fancy with happy pictures . [The child]1948-the child was growing more and more interesting -- throwing out countless tendrils of feeling and perception that delighted [Ralph]199-ralph but preoccupied [the watchful Laura]5384-the watchful laura . "[374-ralph--] [He]2862-him 's going to be exactly like [you]2863-you , [Ralph--]374-ralph-- " [she]5384-the watchful laura paused and then risked it : "[0-i] For [his]2862-him own sake , [I]0-i wish there were just a drop or two of Spragg in [him]2862-him . " [Ralph]199-ralph laughed , understanding [her]5384-the watchful laura . "[2867-his] Oh , [the plodding citizen [I]0-i 've become]2864-the plodding citizen i 've become will keep [him]2862-him from taking after [the lyric idiot who begot [him]2862-him]2865-the lyric idiot who begot him . [Paul]218-paul and [I]0-i , between [us]2866-they , are going to turn out something first - rate . " [His]0-i book too was spreading and throwing out tendrils , and [he]0-i worked at it in the white heat of energy which [his]0-i factitious exhilaration produced . For a few weeks everything [he]0-i did and said seemed as easy and unconditioned as the actions in a dream . [Clare Van Degen]228-clare , in the light of this mood , became again [the comrade of [his]0-i boyhood]5385-the comrade of his boyhood . [He]0-i did not see [her]228-clare often , for [she]228-clare had gone down to [the country]424-the country with [[her]228-clare children]5387-her children , but [they]2866-they communicated daily by letter or telephone , and now and then [she]228-clare came over to [the Fairfords]217-the fairfords ' for a night . There [they]2866-they renewed the long rambles of [their]2866-they youth , and once more [the summer fields]5388-the summer fields and [woods]5389-woods seemed full of magic presences . [Clare]228-clare was no more intelligent , [she]228-clare followed [him]0-i no farther in [[his]0-i flights]5390-his flights ; but some of the qualities that had become most precious to [him]0-i were as native to [her]228-clare as its perfume to a flower . So , through the long June afternoons , [they]2866-they ranged together over many themes ; and if [her]228-clare answers sometimes missed the mark it did not matter , because [her]228-clare silences never did . [Meanwhile Ralph]199-ralph , from various sources , continued to pick up a good deal of more or less contradictory information about [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt . It seemed to be generally understood that [Moffatt]212-moffatt had come back from [Europe]29-europe with the intention of testifying in the Ararat investigation , and that [[his]212-moffatt former patron]5391-his former patron , [the great Harmon B. Driscoll]201-driscoll , had managed to silence [him]212-moffatt ; and it was implied that the price of this silence , which was set at a considerable figure , had been turned to account in a series of speculations likely to lift [Moffatt]212-moffatt to permanent eminence among [the rulers of [Wall Street]47-wall street]5392-the rulers of wall street . The stories as to [his]2867-his latest achievement , and the theories as to [the man]1579-the man [himself]2867-his , varied with the visual angle of [each reporter]5394-each reporter : and whenever any attempt was made to focus [his]2867-his hard sharp personality [some guardian divinity]5395-some guardian divinity seemed to throw a veil of mystery over [him]2867-his . [[His]2867-his detractors]5396-his detractors , however , were the first to own that there was "[2867-his] something about [him]2867-his " ; it was felt that [he]2867-his had passed beyond the meteoric stage , and the business world was unanimous in recognizing that [he]2867-his had "[2867-his] come to stay . " A dawning sense of [his]2867-his stability was even beginning to make itself felt in [Fifth Avenue]4-fifth avenue . It was said that [he]2867-his had bought [a house in [Seventy - second Street]12-seventy - second street]5397-a house in seventy - second street , then that [he]2867-his meant to build near [the Park]576-the park ; [one or two people]5399-one or two people ( always "[1579-the man] taken by [a friend "]5400-a friend " ) had been to [[his]2867-his flat in [the Pactolus]153-the pactolus]5401-his flat in the pactolus , to see [his]2867-his Chinese porcelains and Persian rugs ; now and then [he]2867-his had [a few important men]5402-a few important men to dine at [a Fifth Avenue restaurant]5403-a fifth avenue restaurant ; [his]2867-his name began to appear in philanthropic reports and on municipal committees ( there were even rumours of its having been put up at [a well - known club]5404-a well - known club ) ; and [the rector of [a wealthy parish]5406-a wealthy parish , who was raising funds for [a chantry]5407-a chantry]5405-the rector of a wealthy parish , who was raising funds for a chantry , was known to have met [him]2867-his at dinner and to have stated afterward that "[1579-the man] [the man]1579-the man was not wholly [a materialist]2869-a materialist . " All these converging proofs of [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's solidity strengthened [Ralph]199-ralph 's faith in [his]2867-his venture . [He]2867-his remembered with what astuteness and authority [Moffatt]212-moffatt had conducted [their]5408-their real estate transaction -- how far off and unreal it all seemed!--and awaited events with the passive faith of [a sufferer]5409-a sufferer in the hands of [a skilful surgeon]5410-a skilful surgeon . The days moved on toward the end of June , and each morning [Ralph]199-ralph opened [his]2867-his newspaper with a keener thrill of expectation . Any day now [he]2867-his might read of the granting of the Apex charter : [Moffatt]212-moffatt had assured [him]2867-his it would "[1579-the man] go through " before the close of the month . But the announcement did not appear , and after what seemed to [Ralph]199-ralph a decent lapse of time [he]2867-his telephoned to ask for news . [Moffatt]212-moffatt was away , and when [he]212-moffatt came back a few days later [he]212-moffatt answered [Ralph]199-ralph 's enquiries evasively , with an edge of irritation in [his]212-moffatt voice . The same day [Ralph]199-ralph received a letter from [[his]2867-his lawyer]5411-his lawyer , who had been reminded by [[Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph 's representatives]5412-mrs. marvell 's representatives that the latest date agreed on for the execution of the financial agreement was the end of the following week . [Ralph]199-ralph , alarmed , betook [himself]199-ralph at once to [the Ararat]94-ararat , and [his]2867-his first glimpse of [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's round common face and [fastidiously dressed person]5413-fastidiously dressed person gave [him]2867-his an immediate sense of reassurance . [He]2867-his felt that under the circle of baldness on top of that carefully brushed head lay the solution of every monetary problem that could beset the soul of [man]728-man . [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's voice had recovered its usual cordial note , and the warmth of [his]212-moffatt welcome dispelled [Ralph]199-ralph 's last apprehension . "[2870-they] Why , yes , everything 's going along first - rate . [They]2870-they thought [they]2870-they 'd hung [us]2871-us up last week -- but [they]2870-they have n't . There may be another week 's delay ; but [we]2871-us ought to be opening a bottle of wine on it by [the Fourth]154-the fourth . " [An office - boy]5415-an office - boy came in with a name on a slip of paper , and [Moffatt]212-moffatt looked at [his]212-moffatt watch and held out a hearty hand . "[2870-they] Glad [you]2872-he came . Of course [I]0-i 'll keep [you]2872-he posted ... No , this way ... Look in again ... " and [he]212-moffatt steered [Ralph]199-ralph out by another door . [July]375-july came , and passed into its second week . [[Ralph]199-ralph 's lawyer]5416-ralph 's lawyer had obtained a postponement from the other side , but [[Undine]192-undine 's representatives]5417-undine 's representatives had given [him]5416-ralph 's lawyer to understand that the transaction must be closed before the first of August . [Ralph]199-ralph telephoned once or twice to [Moffatt]212-moffatt , receiving genially - worded assurances that everything was "[2870-they] going [their]2870-they way " ; but [he]2872-he felt a certain embarrassment in returning again to [the office]1866-the office , and let [himself]2872-he drift through the days in a state of hungry apprehension . Finally one afternoon [Henley Fairford]204-mrs. fairford , coming back from [town]3770-town ( which [Ralph]199-ralph had left in the morning to join [[his]2872-he boy]1702-his boy over Sunday ) , brought word that the Apex consolidation scheme had failed to get its charter . It was useless to attempt to reach [Moffatt]212-moffatt on Sunday , and [Ralph]199-ralph wore on as [he]2872-he could through the succeeding twenty - four hours . [Clare Van Degen]228-clare had come down to stay with [[her]228-clare youngest boy]5421-her youngest boy , and in the afternoon [she]228-clare and [Ralph]199-ralph took [the two children]5422-the two children for a sail . A light breeze brightened [the waters of [the Sound]155-the sound]5423-the waters of the sound , and [they]5422-the two children ran down [the shore]5424-the shore before [it]5424-the shore and then tacked out toward the sunset , coming back at last , under a failing breeze , as the summer sky passed from blue to a translucid green and then into the accumulating greys of twilight . As [they]5422-the two children left [the landing]1741-the landing and walked up behind [the children]3922-the children across [the darkening lawn]5427-the darkening lawn , a sense of security descended again on [Ralph]199-ralph . [He]2872-he could not believe that such a scene and such a mood could be the disguise of any impending evil , and all [his]2872-he doubts and anxieties fell away from [him]2872-he . The next morning , [he]2872-he and [Clare]228-clare travelled up to [town]3770-town together , and at [the station]4592-the station [he]2872-he put [her]228-clare in the motor which was to take [her]228-clare to [Long Island]122-long island , and hastened down to [[Moffatt]212-moffatt 's office]1897-moffatt 's office . When [he]2872-he arrived [he]2872-he was told that [Moffatt]212-moffatt was "[2870-they] engaged , " and [he]2872-he had to wait for nearly half an hour in [the outer office]1319-the outer office , where , to the steady click of the type - writer and the spasmodic buzzing of the telephone , [his]2872-he thoughts again began their restless circlings . Finally the inner door opened , and [he]2872-he found [himself]2872-he in [the sanctuary]5432-the sanctuary . [Moffatt]212-moffatt was seated behind [his]212-moffatt desk , examining another little crystal vase somewhat like the one [he]212-moffatt had shown [Ralph]199-ralph a few weeks earlier . As [[his]212-moffatt visitor]1247-his visitor entered , [he]212-moffatt held it up against the light , revealing on its dewy sides an incised design as frail as the shadow of grass - blades on water . "[2873-she] Ai n't [she]2873-she a peach ? " [He]212-moffatt put the toy down and reached across the desk to shake hands . "[2873-she] Well , well , " [he]212-moffatt went on , leaning back in [his]212-moffatt chair , and pushing out [his]212-moffatt lower lip in a half - comic pout , "[2876-the reformers] [they]2874-they 've got [us]2875-we in the neck this time and no mistake . Seen this morning 's Radiator ? [I]0-i do n't know how the thing leaked out -- but [the reformers]2876-the reformers somehow got a smell of the scheme , and whenever [they]2876-the reformers get swishing round something 's bound to get spilt . " [He]212-moffatt talked gaily , genially , in [his]212-moffatt roundest tones and with [his]212-moffatt easiest gestures ; never had [he]212-moffatt conveyed a completer sense of unhurried power ; but [Ralph]199-ralph noticed for the first time the crow's - feet about [his]212-moffatt eyes , and the sharpness of the contrast between the white of [his]212-moffatt forehead and the redness of the fold of neck above [his]212-moffatt collar . "[0-i] Do [you]0-i mean to say it 's not going through ? " "[2875-we] Not this time , anyhow . [We]2875-we 're high and dry . " Something seemed to snap in [Ralph]199-ralph 's head , and [he]0-i sat down in the nearest chair . "[2875-we] Has the common stock dropped a lot ? " "[0-i] Well , [you]0-i 've got to lean over to see it . " [Moffatt]212-moffatt pressed [his]212-moffatt finger - tips together and added thoughtfully : "[2875-we] But it 's THERE all right . [We]2875-we 're bound to get [our]2875-we charter in the end . " "[0-i] What do [you]0-i call the end ? " "[0-i] Oh , before the Day of Judgment , sure : next year , [I]0-i guess . " "[0-i] Next year ? " [Ralph]199-ralph flushed . "[0-i] What earthly good will that do [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't say it 's as pleasant as driving [[your]0-i best girl]2877-your best girl [home]548-home by moonlight . But that 's how it is . And the stuff 's safe enough any way -- [I've]0-i told [you]0-i that right along . " "[0-i] But [you]0-i 've told [me]0-i all along [I]0-i could count on a rise before [August]79-august . [You]0-i knew [I]0-i had to have the money now . " "[0-i] [I]0-i knew [you]0-i WANTED to have the money now ; and so did [I]0-i , and [several of [[my]0-i friends]4627-my friends]2879-several of my friends . [I]0-i put [you]0-i onto it because it was the only thing in sight likely to give [you]0-i the return [you]0-i wanted . " "[0-i] [You]0-i ought at least to have warned [me]0-i of the risk ! " "[0-i] Risk ? [I]0-i do n't call it much of a risk to lie back in [your]0-i chair and wait another few months for fifty thousand to drop into [your]0-i lap . [I]0-i tell [you]0-i the thing 's as safe as [a bank]4557-a bank . " "[0-i] How do [I]0-i know it is ? [You]0-i 've misled [me]0-i about it from the first . " [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's face grew dark red to the forehead : for the first time in [their]5434-their acquaintance [Ralph]199-ralph saw [him]212-moffatt on the verge of anger . "[0-i] Well , if [you]0-i get stuck so do [I.]0-i [I]0-i 'm in it a good deal deeper than [you]0-i . That 's about the best guarantee [I]0-i can give ; unless [you]0-i wo n't take [my]0-i word for that either . " To control [himself]212-moffatt [Moffatt]212-moffatt spoke with extreme deliberation , separating [his]212-moffatt syllables like a machine cutting something into even lengths . [Ralph]199-ralph listened through a cloud of confusion ; but [he]0-i saw the madness of offending [Moffatt]212-moffatt , and tried to take a more conciliatory tone . "[0-i] Of course [I]0-i take [your]0-i word for it . But [I]0-i can't -- [I]0-i simply ca n't afford to lose ... " "[0-i] [You]0-i ai n't going to lose : [I]0-i do n't believe [you]0-i 'll even have to put up any margin . It 's THERE safe enough , [I]0-i tell [you]0-i ... " "[0-i] Yes , yes ; [I]0-i understand . [I]0-i 'm sure [you]0-i would n't have advised [me--]2882-me-- " [Ralph]199-ralph 's tongue seemed swollen , and [he]0-i had difficulty in bringing out the words . "[0-i] Only , [you]0-i see -- [I]0-i ca n't wait ; it 's not possible ; and [I]0-i want to know if there is n't a way-- " [Moffatt]212-moffatt looked at [him]0-i with a sort of resigned compassion , as [a doctor]5435-a doctor looks at [a despairing mother who will not understand what [he]5435-a doctor has tried to imply without uttering the word [she]5436-a despairing mother who will not understand what he has tried to imply without uttering the word she dreads dreads]5436-a despairing mother who will not understand what he has tried to imply without uttering the word she dreads . [Ralph]199-ralph understood the look , but hurried on . "[0-i] [You]0-i 'll think [I]0-i 'm mad , or [an ass]2883-an ass , to talk like this ; but the fact is , [I]0-i must have the money . " [He]0-i waited and drew a hard breath . "[0-i] [I]0-i must have it : that 's all . Perhaps [I]0-i 'd better tell [you--]2884-you-- " [Moffatt]212-moffatt , who had risen , as if assuming that the interview was over , sat down again and turned an attentive look on [him]0-i . "[3972-my boy] Go ahead , " [he]212-moffatt said , more humanly than [he]212-moffatt had hitherto spoken . "[0-i] [[My]0-i boy]3972-my boy ... [you]0-i spoke of [him]3972-my boy the other day ... [I]0-i 'm awfully fond of [him--]3972-my boy " [Ralph]199-ralph broke off , deterred by the impossibility of confiding [his]0-i feeling for [Paul]218-paul to [this coarse - grained man with whom [he]0-i had n't a sentiment in common]5437-this coarse - grained man with whom he had n't a sentiment in common . [Moffatt]212-moffatt was still looking at [him]0-i . "[3972-my boy] [I]0-i should say [you]0-i would be ! [He]3972-my boy 's as smart a little chap as [I]0-i ever saw ; and [I]0-i guess [he]3972-my boy 's [the kind that gets better every day]2886-the kind that gets better every day . " [Ralph]199-ralph had collected [himself]199-ralph , and went on with sudden resolution : "[0-i] Well , [you]0-i see -- when [[my]0-i wife]4218-my wife and [I]0-i separated , [I]0-i never dreamed [she]4218-my wife 'd want [the boy]4296-the boy : the question never came up . If it had , of course -- but [she]4218-my wife 'd left [him]4296-the boy with [me]0-i when [she]4218-my wife went away two years before , and at the time of the divorce [I]0-i was [a fool]4414-a fool ... [I]0-i did n't take the proper steps ... " "[4218-my wife] [You]0-i mean [she]4218-my wife 's got sole custody ? " [Ralph]199-ralph made a sign of assent , and [Moffatt]212-moffatt pondered . "[4218-my wife] That 's bad -- bad . " "[0-i] And now [I]0-i understand [she]4218-my wife 's going to marry again -- and of course [I]0-i ca n't give up [[my]0-i son]4359-my son . " "[4218-my wife] [She]4218-my wife wants [you]0-i to , eh ? " [Ralph]199-ralph again assented . [Moffatt]212-moffatt swung [his]212-moffatt chair about and leaned back in it , stretching out [his]212-moffatt plump legs and contemplating the tips of [his]212-moffatt varnished boots . [He]212-moffatt hummed a low tune behind inscrutable lips . "[0-i] That 's what [you]0-i want the money for ? " [he]212-moffatt finally raised [his]212-moffatt head to ask . The word came out of the depths of [Ralph]199-ralph 's anguish : "[0-i] Yes . " "[0-i] And why [you]0-i want it in such a hurry . [I]0-i see . " [Moffatt]212-moffatt reverted to the study of [his]212-moffatt boots . "[0-i] It 's a lot of money . " "[4218-my wife] Yes . That 's the difficulty . And [I]0-i ... [she]4218-my wife ... " [Ralph]199-ralph 's tongue was again too thick for [his]0-i mouth . "[4218-my wife] [I]0-i 'm afraid [she]4218-my wife wo n't wait ... or take less ... " [Moffatt]212-moffatt , abandoning the boots , was scrutinizing [him]0-i through half - shut lids . "[4218-my wife] No , " [he]212-moffatt said slowly , "[2891-your] [I]0-i do n't believe Undine Spragg'll take a single cent less . " [Ralph]199-ralph felt [himself]199-ralph whiten . Was it insolence or ignorance that had prompted [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's speech ? Nothing in [his]0-i voice or face showed the sense of any shades of expression or of feeling : [he]212-moffatt seemed to apply to everything the measure of the same crude flippancy . But such considerations could not curb [Ralph]199-ralph now . [He]0-i said to [himself]0-i "[2891-your] Keep [your]2891-your temper -- keep [your]2891-your temper-- " and [his]0-i anger suddenly boiled over . "[2891-your] Look here , [Moffatt]212-moffatt , " [he]0-i said , getting to [his]0-i feet , "[659-any one] the fact that [I]0-i 've been divorced from [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph does n't authorize [any one]659-any one to take that tone to [me]0-i in speaking of [her]199-ralph . " [Moffatt]212-moffatt met the challenge with a calm stare under which there were dawning signs of surprise and interest . "[2893-this man] That so ? Well , if that 's the case [I]0-i presume [I]0-i ought to feel the same way : [I]0-i 've been divorced from [her]199-ralph [myself]0-i . " For an instant the words conveyed no meaning to [Ralph]199-ralph ; then they surged up into [his]0-i brain and flung [him]0-i forward with half - raised arm . But [he]0-i felt the grotesqueness of the gesture and [his]0-i arm dropped back to [his]0-i side . A series of unimportant and irrelevant things raced through [his]0-i mind ; then obscurity settled down on it . "[2893-this man] [THIS man]2893-this man ... [THIS man]2893-this man ... " was the one fiery point in [his]0-i darkened consciousness .... "[0-i] What on earth are [you]0-i talking about ? " [he]0-i brought out . "[0-i] Why , facts , " said [Moffatt]212-moffatt , in a cool half - humorous voice . "[0-i] [You]0-i did n't know ? [I]0-i understood from [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph [[your]0-i folks]4024-your folks had a prejudice against divorce , so [I]0-i suppose [she]199-ralph kept quiet about that early episode . The truth is , " [he]0-i continued amicably , "[0-i] [I]0-i would n't have alluded to it now if [you]0-i had n't taken rather a high tone with [me]0-i about [our]2896-our little venture ; but now it 's out [I]0-i guess [you]0-i may as well hear the whole story . It 's mighty wholesome for [a man]932-a man to have a round now and then with a few facts . Shall [I]0-i go on ? " [Ralph]199-ralph had stood listening without a sign , but as [Moffatt]212-moffatt ended [he]212-moffatt made a slight motion of acquiescence . [He]212-moffatt did not otherwise change [his]212-moffatt attitude , except to grasp with one hand the back of the chair that [Moffatt]212-moffatt pushed toward [him]212-moffatt . "[0-i] Rather stand ? ... " [Moffatt]212-moffatt [himself]212-moffatt dropped back into [his]212-moffatt seat and took the pose of easy narrative . "[2893-this man] Well , it was this way . [Undine Spragg]192-undine and [I]0-i were made one at [Opake]156-opake , [Nebraska]20-nebraska , just nine years ago last month . [My]0-i ! [She]192-undine was [a beauty]2898-a beauty then . Nothing much had happened to [her]192-undine before but being engaged for a year or two to a soft called [Millard Binch]272-millard binch ; the same [she]192-undine passed on to [Indiana Rolliver]348-indiana ; and -- well , [I]0-i guess [she]192-undine liked the change . [We]2899-we did n't have what [you]2900-you 'd called a society wedding : [no best man]2901-no best man or [bridesmaids]2902-bridesmaids or Voice that Breathed o'er [Eden]377-eden . Trouble was , [they]2903-they caught on too soon ; [we]2899-we only had a fortnight . Then [they]2903-they hauled [Undine]192-undine back to [Apex]192-undine , and -- well , [I]0-i had n't the cash or the pull to fight 'em . [Uncle Abner]380-uncle abner was [a pretty big man out there]2904-a pretty big man out there then ; and [he]380-uncle abner had [James J. Rolliver]330-mrs. rolliver behind [him]380-uncle abner . " [He]380-uncle abner still kept to [his]380-uncle abner half - humorous minor key , as though [he]380-uncle abner were in the first stages of an after - dinner speech ; but as [he]380-uncle abner went on [his]380-uncle abner bodily presence , which hitherto had seemed to [Ralph]199-ralph the mere average garment of vulgarity , began to loom , huge and portentous as [some monster released from a magician]5438-some monster released from a magician 's bottle . [His]380-uncle abner redness , [his]380-uncle abner glossiness , [his]380-uncle abner baldness , and the carefully brushed ring of hair encircling it ; the square line of [his]380-uncle abner shoulders , the too careful fit of [his]380-uncle abner clothes , the prominent lustre of [his]380-uncle abner scarf - pin , the growth of short black hair on [his]380-uncle abner manicured hands , even the tiny cracks and crows'-feet beginning to show in the hard close surface of [his]380-uncle abner complexion : all these solid witnesses to [his]380-uncle abner reality and [his]380-uncle abner proximity pressed on [Ralph]199-ralph with the mounting pang of physical nausea . "[2893-this man] [THIS man]2893-this man ... [THIS man]2893-this man ... " [he]0-i could n't get beyond the thought : whichever way [he]0-i turned [his]0-i haggard thought , there was [Moffatt]212-moffatt bodily blocking the perspective ... [Ralph]199-ralph 's eyes roamed toward the crystal toy that stood on the desk beside [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's hand . Faugh ! That such a hand should have touched it ! Suddenly [he]0-i heard [himself]0-i speaking . "[2909-they] Before [my]0-i marriage -- did [you]2893-this man know [they]2909-they had n't told [me]0-i ? " "[2893-this man] Why , [I]0-i understood as much ... " [Ralph]199-ralph pushed on : "[191-mr. spragg] [You]2893-this man knew it the day [I]0-i met [you]2893-this man in [[Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's office]2432-mr. spragg 's office ? " [Moffatt]212-moffatt considered a moment , as if the incident had escaped [him]212-moffatt . "[2913-he] Did [we]2911-we meet [there]603-there ? " [He]212-moffatt seemed benevolently ready for enlightenment . But [Ralph]199-ralph had been assailed by another memory ; [he]0-i recalled that [Moffatt]212-moffatt had dined one night in [[his]212-moffatt house]507-his house , that [he]212-moffatt and [the man who now faced [him]212-moffatt]5440-the man who now faced him had sat at the same table , [[their]2911-we wife]5441-their wife between [them]2911-we ... [He]0-i was seized with another dumb gust of fury ; but it died out and left [him]0-i face to face with the uselessness , the irrelevance of all the old attitudes of appropriation and defiance . [He]212-moffatt seemed to be stumbling about in [his]212-moffatt inherited prejudices like [a modern man in mediaeval armour]5442-a modern man in mediaeval armour ... [Moffatt]212-moffatt still sat at [his]212-moffatt desk , unmoved and apparently uncomprehending . "[2913-he] [He]2913-he does n't even know what [I]0-i 'm feeling , " flashed through [Ralph]199-ralph ; and the whole archaic structure of [his]0-i rites and sanctions tumbled down about [him]0-i . Through the noise of the crash [he]0-i heard [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's voice going on without perceptible change of tone : "[0-i] About that other matter now ... [you]2914-you ca n't feel any meaner about it than [I]0-i do , [I]0-i can tell [you]2914-you that ... but all [we]2915-we 've got to do is to sit tight ... " [Ralph]199-ralph turned from the voice , and found [himself]0-i outside on [the landing]1741-the landing , and then in [the street below]5444-the street below . XXXVI [He]0-i stood at the corner of [Wall Street]47-wall street , looking up and down [its]47-wall street hot summer perspective . [He]0-i noticed the swirls of dust in the cracks of [the pavement]757-the pavement , the rubbish in the gutters , the ceaseless stream of perspiring faces that poured by under tilted hats . [He]0-i found [himself]0-i , next , slipping northward between the glazed walls of [the Subway]736-the subway , [another languid crowd in the seats about [him]0-i]5447-another languid crowd in the seats about him and the nasal yelp of [the stations]5448-the stations ringing through [the car]5449-the car like some repeated ritual wail . The blindness within [him]0-i seemed to have intensified [his]0-i physical perceptions , [his]0-i sensitiveness to the heat , the noise , the smells of the dishevelled [midsummer city]5450-midsummer city ; but combined with the acuter perception of these offenses was a complete indifference to [them]5451-them , as though [he]0-i were [some vivisected animal deprived of the power of discrimination]5452-some vivisected animal deprived of the power of discrimination . Now [he]0-i had turned into [Waverly Place]157-waverly place , and was walking westward toward [Washington Square]2-washington square . At the corner [he]0-i pulled [himself]0-i up , saying half - aloud : "[0-i] [The office]1866-the office -- [I]0-i ought to be at [the office]1866-the office . " [He]0-i drew out [his]0-i watch and stared at it blankly . What the devil had [he]0-i taken it out for ? [He]0-i had to go through a laborious process of readjustment to find out what it had to say .... Twelve o'clock .... Should [he]0-i turn back to [the office]1866-the office ? It seemed easier to cross [the square]2034-the square , go up [the steps of [the old house]5456-the old house]5455-the steps of the old house and slip [his]0-i key into the door .... [The house]623-the house was empty . [[His]0-i mother]3752-his mother , a few days previously , had departed with [Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet for [their]5459-their usual two months on [the Maine coast]5460-the maine coast , where [Ralph]199-ralph was to join [them]5459-their with [[his]0-i boy]1702-his boy .... The blinds were all drawn down , and the freshness and silence of [the marble - paved hall]5462-the marble - paved hall laid soothing hands on [him]0-i .... [He]0-i said to [himself]0-i : "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll jump into [a cab]4287-a cab presently , and go and lunch at [the club--]2919-the club-- " [He]0-i laid down [his]0-i hat and stick and climbed the carpetless stairs to [[his]0-i room]1748-his room . When [he]0-i entered [it]1748-his room [he]0-i had the shock of feeling [himself]0-i in a strange place : it did not seem like anything [he]0-i had ever seen before . Then , one by one , all the old stale usual things in it confronted [him]0-i , and [he]0-i longed with a sick intensity to be in a place that was really strange . "[0-i] How on earth can [I]0-i go on living [here]3758-here ? " [he]0-i wondered . [A careless servant]5464-a careless servant had left the outer shutters open , and the sun was beating on the window - panes . [Ralph]199-ralph pushed open the windows , shut the shutters , and wandered toward [his]0-i arm - chair .
