[He]0-i saw [her]192-undine before [him]0-i , leaning against the tree - trunk in [her]192-undine white dress , limpid and inscrutable .... "[239-father] [We]2921-we were made one at [Opake]156-opake , [Nebraska]20-nebraska .... " Had [she]192-undine been thinking of it that afternoon at [Siena]66-siena , [he]0-i wondered ? Did [she]192-undine ever think of it at all ? ... It was [she]192-undine who had asked [Moffatt]212-moffatt to dine . [She]192-undine had said : "[0-i] [Father]239-father brought [him]2922-he [home]548-home one day at [Apex]192-undine .... [I]0-i do n't remember ever having seen [him]2922-he since"--and [the man [she]192-undine spoke of]5468-the man she spoke of had had [her]192-undine in [his]5468-the man she spoke of arms ... and perhaps it was really all [she]192-undine remembered ! [She]192-undine had lied to [him]2922-he -- lied to [him]2922-he from the first ... there had n't been a moment when [she]192-undine had n't lied to [him]2922-he , deliberately , ingeniously and inventively . As [he]2922-he thought of it , there came to [him]2922-he , for the first time in months , that overwhelming sense of [her]192-undine physical nearness which had once so haunted and tortured [him]2922-he . [Her]192-undine freshness , [her]192-undine fragrance , the luminous haze of [her]192-undine youth , filled [the room]441-the room with a mocking glory ; and [he]2922-he dropped [his]2922-he head on [his]2922-he hands to shut it out .... The vision was swept away by another wave of hurrying thoughts . [He]2922-he felt it was intensely important that [he]2922-he should keep the thread of every one of [them]5470-them , that [they]5470-them all represented things to be said or done , or guarded against ; and [his]2922-he mind , with the unwondering versatility and tireless haste of [the dreamer]5471-the dreamer 's brain , seemed to be pursuing [them]5470-them all simultaneously . Then they became as unreal and meaningless as the red specks dancing behind the lids against which [he]2922-he had pressed [his]2922-he fists clenched , and [he]2922-he had the feeling that if [he]2922-he opened [his]2922-he eyes they would vanish , and the familiar daylight look in on [him]2922-he .... A knock disturbed [him]2922-he . [[The old parlour]5472-the old parlour - maid who was always left in charge of [the house]623-the house]5473-the old parlour - maid who was always left in charge of the house had come up to ask if [he]2922-he was n't well , and if there was anything [she]5473-the old parlour - maid who was always left in charge of the house could do for [him]2922-he . [He]2922-he told [her]5473-the old parlour - maid who was always left in charge of the house no ... [he]2922-he was perfectly well ... or , rather , no , [he]2922-he was n't ... [he]2922-he supposed it must be the heat ; and [he]2922-he began to scold [her]5473-the old parlour - maid who was always left in charge of the house for having forgotten to close the shutters . "[199-ralph] [I]0-i 've always told [Mrs. Marvell]199-ralph [I]0-i could n't turn [my]0-i back for a second but what Eliza'd find a way to make trouble , " [the old woman]5477-the old woman continued , evidently glad of the chance to air a perennial grievance . [He]2922-he said to [himself]2922-he that perhaps [she]5477-the old woman was right ... that perhaps there was something [he]2922-he ought to do ... that [[his]2922-he mother]3752-his mother was old , and did n't always see things ; and for a while [his]2922-he mind revolved this problem with feverish intensity .... "[0-i] Then [you]0-i 'll come down , [sir]4084-sir ? " "[0-i] Yes . " The door closed , and [he]2922-he heard [her]5477-the old woman heavy heels along [the passage]538-the passage . "[0-i] But the money -- where 's the money to come from ? " The question sprang out from some denser fold of the fog in [his]2922-he brain . The money -- how on earth was [he]2922-he to pay it back ? [I]0-i ca n't ... it 's gone ... and even if it were n't .... " [He]2922-he dropped back in [his]2922-he chair and took [his]2922-he head between [his]2922-he hands . [He]2922-he had forgotten what [he]2922-he wanted the money for . [He]2922-he made a great effort to regain hold of the idea , but all the whirring , shuttling , flying had abruptly ceased in [his]2922-he brain , and [he]2922-he sat with [his]2922-he eyes shut , staring straight into darkness .... The clock struck , and [he]2922-he remembered that [he]2922-he had said [he]2922-he would go down to [the dining - room]5480-the dining - room . "[2926-they] If [I]0-i do n't [she]2925-she 'll come up-- " [He]2922-he raised [his]2922-he head and sat listening for the sound of [the old woman]5477-the old woman 's step : it seemed to [him]2922-he perfectly intolerable that [any one]659-any one should cross the threshold of [the room]441-the room again . "[2925-she] Why ca n't [they]2926-they leave [me]0-i alone ? " [he]2922-he groaned .... At length through the silence of [the empty house]5484-the empty house , [he]2922-he fancied [he]2922-he heard a door opening and closing far below ; and [he]2922-he said to [himself]2922-he : "[2925-she] [She]2925-she 's coming . " [He]2922-he got to [his]2922-he feet and went to the door . [He]2922-he did n't feel anything now except the insane dread of hearing [the woman]1564-the woman 's steps come nearer . [He]2922-he bolted the door and stood looking about [the room]441-the room . For a moment [he]2922-he was conscious of seeing it in every detail with a distinctness [he]2922-he had never before known ; then everything in [it]441-the room vanished but the single narrow panel of a drawer under one of the bookcases . [He]2922-he went up to the drawer , knelt down and slipped [his]2922-he hand into it . As [he]2922-he raised [himself]2922-he [he]2922-he listened again , and this time [he]2922-he distinctly heard [the old servant]5487-the old servant 's steps on the stairs . [He]2922-he passed [his]2922-he left hand over the side of [his]2922-he head , and down the curve of the skull behind the ear . [He]2922-he said to [himself]2922-he : "[218-paul] [[My]0-i wife]4218-my wife ... this will make it all right for [her]4218-my wife .... " and a last flash of irony twitched through [him]2922-he . Then [he]2922-he felt again , more deliberately , for the spot [he]2922-he wanted , and put the muzzle of [his]2922-he revolver against it . XXXVII In [a drawing - room]4272-a drawing - room hung with portraits of [high - nosed personages in perukes and orders]5489-high - nosed personages in perukes and orders , [a circle of [ladies and gentlemen]5491-ladies and gentlemen , looking not unlike every - day versions of [the official figures above [their]5491-ladies and gentlemen heads]5492-the official figures above their heads]5490-a circle of ladies and gentlemen , looking not unlike every - day versions of the official figures above their heads , sat examining with friendly interest [a little boy in mourning]5493-a little boy in mourning . [The boy]4296-the boy was slim , fair and shy , and [his]4296-the boy small black figure , islanded in the middle of the wide lustrous floor , looked curiously lonely and remote . This effect of remoteness seemed to strike [[his]4296-the boy mother]3752-his mother as something intentional , and almost naughty , for after having launched [him]4296-the boy from the door , and waited to judge of the impression [he]4296-the boy produced , [she]3752-his mother came forward and , giving [him]4296-the boy a slight push , said impatiently : "[2928-your new granny] [Paul]218-paul ! Why do n't [you]218-paul go and kiss [[your]218-paul new granny]2928-your new granny ? " [The boy]4296-the boy , without turning to [her]3752-his mother , or moving , sent [his]4296-the boy blue glance gravely about the circle . "[2928-your new granny] Does [she]2928-your new granny want [me]0-i to ? " [he]4296-the boy asked , in a tone of evident apprehension ; and on [[his]4296-the boy mother]3752-his mother 's answering : "[2928-your new granny] Of course , [you]2928-your new granny silly ! " [he]4296-the boy added earnestly : "[2928-your new granny] How many more do [you]2928-your new granny think there 'll be ? " [Undine]192-undine blushed to the ripples of [her]192-undine brilliant hair . "[2930-they] [I]0-i never knew [such a child]2929-such a child ! [They]2930-they 've turned [him]2929-such a child into [a perfect little savage]2931-a perfect little savage ! " [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond advanced from behind [[his]4296-the boy mother]3752-his mother 's chair . [Their]5499-their eyes met and [the boy]4296-the boy smiled . "[2774-old chap] Come along , [old chap]2774-old chap , " [Chelles]382-raymond continued in English , drawing [the little boy]1732-the little boy after [him]0-i . "[2935-madame] Do be nice , [darling]2934-darling ! Say , ' bonjour , [Madame]2935-madame , ' " [Undine]192-undine urged . An odd mingling of emotions stirred in [her]192-undine while [she]192-undine stood watching [Paul]218-paul make the round of [the family group]5503-the family group under [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's guidance . It was "[2774-old chap] lovely " to have [the child]1948-the child back , and to find [him]1948-the child , after [their]5506-their three years ' separation , grown into so endearing a figure : [her]192-undine first glimpse of [him]1948-the child when , in [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's arms , [he]1948-the child had emerged that morning from [the steamer train]5507-the steamer train , had shown what an acquisition [he]1948-the child would be . If [she]192-undine had had any lingering doubts on the point , the impression produced on [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband would have dispelled [them]5509-them . [Chelles]371-the marquise de chelles had been instantly charmed , and [Paul]218-paul , in a shy confused way , was already responding to [his]1948-the child advances . [The Count]4266-the count and [Countess Raymond]382-raymond had returned but a few weeks before from [their]5506-their protracted wedding journey , and were staying -- as [they]5506-their were apparently to do whenever [they]5506-their came to [Paris]76-paris -- with [the old Marquis]5511-the old marquis , [[Raymond]382-raymond 's father]5512-raymond 's father , who had amicably proposed that [little Paul Marvell]218-paul should also share the hospitality of [the Hotel [de Chelles]382-raymond]5513-the hotel de chelles . [Undine]192-undine , at first , was somewhat dismayed to find that [she]192-undine was expected to fit [the boy]4296-the boy and [[his]4296-the boy nurse]2402-his nurse into a corner of [[her]192-undine contracted entresol]5516-her contracted entresol . [Undine]192-undine had supposed that on [her]192-undine marriage [one of [the great suites of [the Hotel de Chelles]5513-the hotel de chelles]5524-the great suites of the hotel de chelles]5523-one of the great suites of the hotel de chelles would be emptied of [[its]5523-one of the great suites of the hotel de chelles tenants]5526-its tenants and put at [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's disposal ; but [she]192-undine had since learned that , even had such a plan occurred to [[her]192-undine parents - in - law]5528-her parents - in - law , considerations of economy would have hindered it . [The rest of [the fine old mouldering house]5537-the fine old mouldering house]5536-the rest of the fine old mouldering house -- the tall - windowed premier on [the garden]2118-the garden , and the whole of the floor above -- had been let for years to [old fashioned tenants who would have been more surprised than [[their]5539-old fashioned tenants who would have been more surprised than their landlord had he suddenly proposed to dispossess them landlord]5540-their landlord had [he]5540-their landlord suddenly proposed to dispossess [them]5539-old fashioned tenants who would have been more surprised than their landlord had he suddenly proposed to dispossess them]5539-old fashioned tenants who would have been more surprised than their landlord had he suddenly proposed to dispossess them . [Undine]192-undine , at first , had regarded these arrangements as merely provisional . [She]192-undine was persuaded that , under [her]192-undine influence , [Raymond]382-raymond would soon convert [[his]382-raymond parents]4611-his parents to more modern ideas , and meanwhile [she]192-undine was still in the flush of a completer well - being than [she]192-undine had ever known , and disposed , for the moment , to make light of any inconveniences connected with it . The three months since [her]192-undine marriage had been more nearly like what [she]192-undine had dreamed of than any of [her]192-undine previous experiments in happiness . At last [she]192-undine had what [she]192-undine wanted , and for the first time the glow of triumph was warmed by a deeper feeling . [[Her]192-undine husband]488-her husband was really charming ( it was odd how [he]488-her husband reminded [her]192-undine of [Ralph]199-ralph ! ) , and after [her]192-undine bitter two years of loneliness and humiliation it was delicious to find [herself]192-undine once more adored and protected . The very fact that [Raymond]382-raymond was more jealous of [her]192-undine than [Ralph]199-ralph had ever been -- or at any rate less reluctant to show it -- gave [her]192-undine a keener sense of recovered power . None of [the men who had been in love with [her]192-undine before]5543-the men who had been in love with her before had been so frankly possessive , or so eager for reciprocal assurances of constancy . [She]192-undine knew that [Ralph]199-ralph had suffered deeply from [her]192-undine intimacy with [Van Degen]228-clare , but [he]488-her husband had betrayed [his]488-her husband feeling only by a more studied detachment ; and [Van Degen]228-clare , from the first , had been contemptuously indifferent to what [she]192-undine did or felt when [she]192-undine was out of [his]488-her husband sight . As to [her]192-undine earlier experiences , [she]192-undine had frankly forgotten them : [her]192-undine sentimental memories went back no farther than the beginning of [her]192-undine New [York]17-york career . [Raymond]382-raymond seemed to attach more importance to love , in all its manifestations , than was usual or convenient in [a husband]5544-a husband ; and [she]192-undine gradually began to be aware that [her]192-undine domination over [him]382-raymond involved a corresponding loss of independence . Since [their]5545-their return to [Paris]76-paris [she]192-undine had found that [she]192-undine was expected to give a circumstantial report of every hour [she]192-undine spent away from [him]382-raymond . [She]192-undine had nothing to hide , and no designs against [his]382-raymond peace of mind except those connected with [her]192-undine frequent and costly sessions at [the dress - makers]4048-the dress - makers ' ; but [she]192-undine had never before been called upon to account to [any one]659-any one for the use of [her]192-undine time , and after the first amused surprise at [Raymond]382-raymond 's always wanting to know where [she]192-undine had been and whom [she]192-undine had seen [she]192-undine began to be oppressed by so exacting a devotion . [[Her]192-undine parents]551-her parents , from [her]192-undine tenderest youth , had tacitly recognized [her]192-undine inalienable right to "[2774-old chap] go round , " and [Ralph]199-ralph -- though from motives which [she]192-undine divined to be different -- had shown the same respect for [her]192-undine freedom . It was therefore disconcerting to find that [Raymond]382-raymond expected [her]192-undine to choose [[her]192-undine friends]1672-her friends , and even [[her]192-undine acquaintances]1452-her acquaintances , in conformity not only with [his]382-raymond personal tastes but with a definite and complicated code of family prejudices and traditions ; and [she]192-undine was especially surprised to discover that [he]382-raymond viewed with disapproval [her]192-undine intimacy with [the Princess Estradina]363-the princess estradina . "[2955-her] [[My]0-i cousin]2652-my cousin 's extremely amusing , of course , but utterly mad and very mal entoure . [A woman]933-a woman 's classed -- or rather unclassed -- by being known as one of [[Lili]366-lili 's set]2954-lili 's set . " Agreeable as it was to [Undine]192-undine that an appeal to [her]192-undine discretion should be based on the ground of [her]192-undine youth and good - looks , [she]192-undine was dismayed to find [herself]192-undine cut off from the very circle [she]192-undine had meant [them]5551-their to establish [her]192-undine in . Before [she]192-undine had become [[Raymond]382-raymond 's wife]5552-raymond 's wife there had been a moment of sharp tension in [her]192-undine relations with [the Princess Estradina]363-the princess estradina and [the old Duchess]4972-the old duchess . [They]5551-their had done [their]5551-their best to prevent [her]192-undine marrying [[their]5551-their cousin]5554-their cousin , and had gone so far as openly to accuse [her]192-undine of being the cause of a breach between [themselves]5551-their and [[his]382-raymond parents]4611-his parents . But [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph 's death had brought about a sudden change in [her]192-undine situation . [She]192-undine was now no longer [a divorced woman]1021-a divorced woman struggling to obtain ecclesiastical sanction for [her]192-undine remarriage , but [a widow whose conspicuous beauty and independent situation made [her]192-undine the object of lawful aspirations]5557-a widow whose conspicuous beauty and independent situation made her the object of lawful aspirations . "[382-raymond] A good match ? If [she]2955-her is n't , [I]0-i should like to know what [the Chelles]382-raymond call one ! " [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac went about indefatigably proclaiming . " [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac had lately discovered that the proper attitude for [the American married abroad]5566-the american married abroad was that of a militant patriotism ; and [she]353-madame de trezac flaunted [Undine]192-undine Marvell in the face of [the Faubourg]364-faubourg like a particularly showy specimen of [her]353-madame de trezac national banner . [She]192-undine kept [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny in [Paris]76-paris for a fortnight , and between [her]192-undine more pressing occupations it amused [her]192-undine to listen to [the masseuse]460-the masseuse 's New [York]17-york gossip and [her]192-undine comments on the social organization of [the old world]5578-the old world . It was [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's first visit to [Europe]29-europe , and [she]193-mrs. heeny confessed to [Undine]192-undine that [she]193-mrs. heeny had always wanted to "[2977-they] see something of the aristocracy"--using the phrase as [a naturalist]5579-a naturalist might , with no hint of personal pretensions . [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's democratic ease was combined with the strictest professional discretion , and it would never have occurred to [her]193-mrs. heeny to regard [herself]193-mrs. heeny , or to wish [others]807-others to regard [her]193-mrs. heeny , as anything but [a manipulator of muscles]5581-a manipulator of muscles ; but in that character [she]193-mrs. heeny felt [herself]193-mrs. heeny entitled to admission to the highest circles . "[2977-they] [They]2977-they certainly do things with style over here -- but it 's kinder one - horse after [New York]8-new york , ai n't it ? " And [she]193-mrs. heeny poured into [Undine]192-undine 's half - envious ear a list of the entertainments which had illuminated the last weeks of the [New York]8-new york winter . "[2984-his] [I]0-i suppose [you]2978-you 'll begin to give parties as soon as ever [you]2978-you get into [a house of [your]2978-you own]2980-a house of your own . And [he]2984-his 's dead in love , [I]0-i can see that ; reminds [me]0-i of the way-- " but [she]192-undine broke off suddenly , as if something in [Undine]192-undine 's look had silenced [her]192-undine . Even to [herself]192-undine . [Undine]192-undine did not like to call up the image of [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph ; and any mention of [his]2984-his name gave [her]192-undine a vague sense of distress . [His]2984-his death had released [her]192-undine , had given [her]192-undine what [she]192-undine wanted ; yet [she]192-undine could honestly say to [herself]192-undine that [she]192-undine had not wanted [him]2984-his to die -- at least not to die like that .... [People]560-people said at the time that it was the hot weather -- [[his]2984-his own family]2291-his own family had said so : [he]2984-his had never quite got over [his]2984-his attack of pneumonia , and the sudden rise of temperature -- one of the fierce "[2984-his] heat - waves " that devastate [New York]8-new york in summer -- had probably affected [his]2984-his brain : [the doctors]1810-the doctors said such cases were not uncommon .... [She]192-undine had worn black for a few weeks -- not quite mourning , but something decently regretful ( [the dress - makers]4048-the dress - makers were beginning to provide a special garb for such cases ) ; and even since [her]192-undine remarriage , and the lapse of a year , [she]192-undine continued to wish that [she]192-undine could have got what [she]192-undine wanted without having had to pay that particular price for it . This feeling was intensified by an incident -- in itself far from unwelcome -- which had occurred about three months after [Ralph]199-ralph 's death . [[Her]192-undine lawyers]5586-her lawyers had written to say that the sum of a hundred thousand dollars had been paid over to [[Marvell]199-ralph 's estate]5587-marvell 's estate by [the Apex Consolidation Company]5588-the apex consolidation company ; and as [Marvell]199-ralph had left a will bequeathing everything [he]2984-his possessed to [[his]2984-his son]1973-his son , this unexpected windfall handsomely increased [Paul]218-paul 's patrimony . [Undine]192-undine had never relinquished [her]192-undine claim on [[her]192-undine child]483-her child ; [she]192-undine had merely , by the advice of [[her]192-undine lawyers]5586-her lawyers , waived the assertion of [her]192-undine right for a few months after [Marvell]218-paul 's death , with the express stipulation that [her]192-undine doing so was only a temporary concession to the feelings of [[[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's family]5593-her husband 's family ; and [she]192-undine had held out against all attempts to induce [her]192-undine to surrender [Paul]218-paul permanently . Before [her]192-undine marriage [she]192-undine had somewhat conspicuously adopted [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's creed , and [the Dagonets]270-the dagonets , picturing [Paul]218-paul as the prey of [the Jesuits]5595-the jesuits , had made the mistake of appealing to [the courts]4824-the courts for [his]488-her husband custody . This had confirmed [Undine]192-undine 's resistance , and [her]192-undine determination to keep [the child]1948-the child . The case had been decided in [her]192-undine favour , and [she]192-undine had thereupon demanded , and obtained , an allowance of five thousand dollars , to be devoted to the bringing up and education of [[her]192-undine son]1095-her son . This sum , added to what [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg had agreed to give [her]192-undine , made up an income which had appreciably bettered [her]192-undine position , and justified [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac 's discreet allusions to [her]192-undine wealth . Nevertheless , it was one of the facts about which [she]192-undine least liked to think when any chance allusion evoked [Ralph]199-ralph 's image . The money was [hers]192-undine , of course ; [she]192-undine had a right to it , and [she]192-undine was an ardent believer in "[2984-his] rights . " But [she]192-undine wished [she]192-undine could have got it in some other way -- [she]192-undine hated the thought of it as one more instance of the perverseness with which things [she]192-undine was entitled to always came to [her]192-undine as if they had been stolen . The approach of summer , and the culmination of the [Paris]76-paris season , swept aside such thoughts . [The Countess Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond , contrasting [her]192-undine situation with that of [Mrs. Undine Marvell]192-undine , and the fulness and animation of [her]192-undine new life with the vacant dissatisfied days which had followed on [her]192-undine return from [Dakota]126-dakota , forgot the smallness of [[her]192-undine apartment]5599-her apartment , the inconvenient proximity of [Paul]218-paul and [[his]5600-his nurse]2402-his nurse , the interminable round of visits with [[her]192-undine mother - in - law]5602-her mother - in - law , and the long dinners in the solemn hotels of [all the family]5603-all the family connection . [The world]620-the world was radiant , the lights were lit , the music playing ; [she]192-undine was still young , and better - looking than ever , with [[a Countess]578-a countess 's coronet]5606-a countess 's coronet , [a famous chateau]5607-a famous chateau and [a handsome and popular husband who adored [her]192-undine]5608-a handsome and popular husband who adored her . And then suddenly the lights went out and the music stopped when one day [Raymond]382-raymond , putting [his]0-i arm about [her]192-undine , said in [his]0-i tenderest tones : "[4259-my dear] And now , [[my]0-i dear]4259-my dear , [the world]620-the world 's had [you]4259-my dear long enough and it 's [my]0-i turn . What do [you]4259-my dear say to going down to [Saint Desert]162-saint desert ? " XXXVIII In a window of [the long gallery of [the chateau de [Saint Desert]162-saint desert [the new Marquise de Chelles]371-the marquise de chelles]5610-the chateau de saint desert the new marquise de chelles]5609-the long gallery of the chateau de saint desert the new marquise de chelles stood looking down [the poplar avenue]5611-the poplar avenue into the November rain . It had been raining heavily and persistently for a longer time than [she]192-undine could remember . Day after day [the hills beyond [the park]576-the park]5612-the hills beyond the park had been curtained by motionless clouds , the gutters of the long steep roofs had gurgled with a perpetual overflow , the opaque surface of [the moat]5614-the moat been peppered by a continuous pelting of big drops . The water lay in glassy stretches under the trees and along the sodden edges of [the garden - paths]5615-the garden - paths , it rose in a white mist from [the fields beyond]5616-the fields beyond , it exuded in a chill moisture from the brick flooring of [the passages]5617-the passages and from the walls of [the rooms on the lower floor]5618-the rooms on the lower floor . Everything in [the great empty house]5619-the great empty house smelt of dampness : the stuffing of the chairs , the threadbare folds of the faded curtains , the splendid tapestries , that were fading too , on the walls of [the room in which [Undine]192-undine stood]5620-the room in which undine stood , and the wide bands of crape which [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband had insisted on [her]192-undine keeping on [her]192-undine black dresses till the last hour of [her]192-undine mourning for [the old Marquis]5511-the old marquis . The summer had been more than usually inclement , and since [her]192-undine first coming to [the country]424-the country [Undine]192-undine had lived through many periods of rainy weather ; but none which had gone before had so completely epitomized , so summed up in one vast monotonous blur , the image of [her]192-undine long months at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert . When , the year before , [she]192-undine had reluctantly suffered [herself]192-undine to be torn from the joys of [Paris]76-paris , [she]192-undine had been sustained by the belief that [her]192-undine exile would not be of long duration . Once [Paris]76-paris was out of sight , [she]192-undine had even found a certain lazy charm in the long warm days at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert . [[Her]192-undine parents - in - law]5528-her parents - in - law had remained in [town]3770-town , and [she]192-undine enjoyed being alone with [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband , exploring and appraising the treasures of [the great half abandoned house]5627-the great half abandoned house , and watching [[her]192-undine boy]1665-her boy scamper over [the June meadows]5629-the june meadows or trot about [the gardens]5630-the gardens on [the poney [[his]1665-her boy stepfather]5632-his stepfather had given [him]1665-her boy]5631-the poney his stepfather had given him . [Paul]218-paul , after [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's departure , had grown fretful and restive , and [Undine]192-undine had found it more and more difficult to fit [his]488-her husband small exacting personality into [[her]192-undine cramped rooms]5633-her cramped rooms and crowded life . [He]488-her husband irritated [her]192-undine by pining for [[his]488-her husband Aunt]5086-his aunt [Laura]203-laura , [[his]488-her husband Marvell granny]5635-his marvell granny , and [old Mr. Dagonet]256-mr. dagonet 's funny stories about gods and fairies ; and [his]488-her husband wistful allusions to [his]488-her husband games with [[Clare]228-clare 's children]5636-clare 's children sounded like a lesson [he]488-her husband might have been drilled in to make [her]192-undine feel how little [he]488-her husband belonged to [her]192-undine . But once released from [Paris]76-paris , and blessed with rabbits , a poney and the freedom of [the fields]5637-the fields , [he]488-her husband became again all that [a charming child]5638-a charming child should be , and for a time it amused [her]192-undine to share in [his]488-her husband romps and rambles . [Raymond]382-raymond seemed enchanted at the picture [they]5639-they made , and the quiet weeks of fresh air and outdoor activity gave [her]192-undine back a bloom that reflected itself in [her]192-undine tranquillized mood . [She]192-undine was the more resigned to this interlude because [she]192-undine was so sure of its not lasting . Before [they]5639-they left [Paris]76-paris [a doctor]5435-a doctor had been found to say that [Paul]218-paul -- who was certainly looking pale and pulled - down -- was in urgent need of sea air , and [Undine]192-undine had nearly convinced [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband of the expediency of hiring [a chalet at [Deauville]163-deauville]5642-a chalet at deauville for July and August , when this plan , and with it every other prospect of escape , was dashed by the sudden death of [the old Marquis]5511-the old marquis . [Undine]192-undine , at first , had supposed that the resulting change could not be other than favourable . [She]192-undine had been on too formal terms with [[her]192-undine father - in - law]5644-her father - in - law -- [a remote and ceremonious old gentleman to whom [her]192-undine own personality was evidently an insoluble enigma -- to feel more than the merest conventional pang at [his]488-her husband death]5645-a remote and ceremonious old gentleman to whom her own personality was evidently an insoluble enigma -- to feel more than the merest conventional pang at his death ; and it was certainly "[4259-my dear] more fun " to be [a marchioness]5646-a marchioness than [a countess]578-a countess , and to know that [[one]629-one 's husband]5649-one 's husband was [the head of [the house]623-the house]5650-the head of the house . Besides , now [they]5652-they would have [the chateau]5653-the chateau to [themselves]5652-they -- or at least [the old Marquise]5654-the old marquise , when [she]5654-the old marquise came , would be [there]603-there as [a guest]5656-a guest and not [a ruler]5657-a ruler -- and visions of smart house - parties and big shoots lit up the first weeks of [Undine]192-undine 's enforced seclusion . Then , by degrees , the inexorable conditions of French mourning closed in on [her]192-undine . Immediately after the long - drawn funeral observances [the bereaved family]5658-the bereaved family -- [mother]3774-mother , [daughters]5660-daughters , [sons]5661-sons and [sons - in - law]5662-sons - in - law -- came down to seclude [themselves]5658-the bereaved family at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert ; and [Undine]192-undine , through the slow hot crape - smelling months , lived encircled by shrouded images of woe in which the only live points were the eyes constantly fixed on [her]192-undine least movements . The hope of escaping to [the seaside]5663-the seaside with [Paul]218-paul vanished in the pained stare with which [[her]192-undine mother - in - law]5602-her mother - in - law received the suggestion . [Undine]192-undine learned the next day that it had cost [the old Marquise]371-the marquise de chelles a sleepless night , and might have had more distressing results had it not been explained as a harmless instance of transatlantic oddness . [Raymond]382-raymond entreated [[his]382-raymond wife]512-his wife to atone for [her]512-his wife involuntary legeret by submitting with a good grace to the usages of [[her]512-his wife adopted country]5666-her adopted country ; and [he]382-raymond seemed to regard the remaining months of the summer as hardly long enough for this act of expiation . As [Undine]192-undine looked back on [them]5667-them , they appeared to have been composed of an interminable succession of identical days , in which attendance at early mass ( in [the coroneted gallery [she]192-undine had once so glowingly depicted to [Van Degen]228-clare]5668-the coroneted gallery she had once so glowingly depicted to van degen ) was followed by a great deal of conversational sitting about , a great deal of excellent eating , an occasional drive to [the nearest town]5669-the nearest town behind a pair of heavy draft horses , and long evenings in [a lamp - heated drawing - room]5670-a lamp - heated drawing - room with all the windows shut , and the stout cure making an asthmatic fourth at the [Marquise]371-the marquise de chelles 's card - table . Still , even these conditions were not permanent , and the discipline of the last years had trained [Undine]192-undine to wait and dissemble . The summer over , it was decided -- after a protracted family conclave -- that the state of [the old Marquise]371-the marquise de chelles 's health made it advisable for [her]192-undine to spend the winter with [the married daughter who lived near [Pau]164-pau]5671-the married daughter who lived near pau . [The other members of [the family]2345-the family]5672-the other members of the family returned to [[their]5672-the other members of the family respective estates]5674-their respective estates , and [Undine]192-undine once more found [herself]192-undine alone with [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband . But [she]192-undine knew by this time that there was to be no thought of [Paris]76-paris that winter , or even the next spring . Worse still , [she]192-undine was presently to discover that [Raymond]382-raymond 's accession of rank brought with it no financial advantages . Having but the vaguest notion of French testamentary law , [she]192-undine was dismayed to learn that the compulsory division of property made it impossible for [a father]470-a father to benefit [[his]470-a father eldest son]5677-his eldest son at the expense of [the others]652-the others . [Raymond]382-raymond was therefore little richer than before , and with the debts of honour of [a troublesome younger brother]5679-a troublesome younger brother to settle , and [Saint Desert]162-saint desert to keep up , [his]382-raymond available income was actually reduced . [He]382-raymond held out , indeed , the hope of eventual improvement , since [the old Marquis]5511-the old marquis had managed [[his]5511-the old marquis estates]5681-his estates with a lofty contempt for modern methods , and the application of new principles of agriculture and forestry were certain to yield profitable results . But for a year or two , at any rate , this very change of treatment would necessitate [the owner]5682-the owner 's continual supervision , and would not in the meanwhile produce any increase of income . To faire valoir [the family acres]5683-the family acres had always , it appeared , been [Raymond]382-raymond 's deepest - seated purpose , and all [his]382-raymond frivolities dropped from [him]382-raymond with the prospect of putting [his]382-raymond hand to the plough . [He]382-raymond was not , indeed , inhuman enough to condemn [[his]382-raymond wife]512-his wife to perpetual exile . [He]382-raymond meant , [he]382-raymond assured [her]512-his wife , that [she]512-his wife should have [her]512-his wife annual spring visit to [Paris]76-paris -- but [he]382-raymond stared in dismay at [her]512-his wife suggestion that [they]5685-they should take possession of [the coveted premier of [the Hotel de Chelles]5513-the hotel de chelles]5686-the coveted premier of the hotel de chelles . [He]382-raymond was gallant enough to express the wish that it were in [his]382-raymond power to house [her]512-his wife on such a scale ; but [he]382-raymond could not conceal [his]382-raymond surprise that [she]512-his wife had ever seriously expected it . [She]512-his wife was beginning to see that [he]382-raymond felt [her]512-his wife constitutional inability to understand anything about money as the deepest difference between [them]5685-they . It was a proficiency [no one]3844-no one had ever expected [her]512-his wife to acquire , and the lack of which [she]512-his wife had even been encouraged to regard as a grace and to use as a pretext . During the interval between [her]512-his wife divorce and [her]512-his wife remarriage [she]512-his wife had learned what things cost , but not how to do without them ; and money still seemed to [her]512-his wife like some mysterious and uncertain stream which occasionally vanished underground but was sure to bubble up again at one 's feet . Now , however , [she]512-his wife found [herself]512-his wife in a world where it represented not the means of individual gratification but the substance binding together whole groups of interests , and where the uses to which it might be put in twenty years were considered before the reasons for spending it on the spot . At first [she]512-his wife was sure [she]512-his wife could laugh [Raymond]382-raymond out of [his]382-raymond prudence or coax [him]382-raymond round to [her]512-his wife point of view . [She]512-his wife did not understand how [a man so romantically in love]5689-a man so romantically in love could be so unpersuadable on certain points . Hitherto [she]512-his wife had had to contend with personal moods , now [she]512-his wife was arguing against a policy ; and [she]512-his wife was gradually to learn that it was as natural to [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond to adore [her]512-his wife and resist [her]512-his wife as it had been to [Ralph Marvell]199-ralph to adore [her]512-his wife and let [her]512-his wife have [her]512-his wife way . At first , indeed , [he]382-raymond appealed to [her]512-his wife good sense , using arguments evidently drawn from accumulations of hereditary experience . But [his]382-raymond economic plea was as unintelligible to [her]512-his wife as the silly problems about pen - knives and apples in the "[4259-my dear] Mental Arithmetic " of [her]512-his wife infancy ; and when [he]382-raymond struck a tenderer note and spoke of the duty of providing for [the son [he]382-raymond hoped for]5690-the son he hoped for , [she]512-his wife put [her]512-his wife arms about [him]382-raymond to whisper : "[4259-my dear] But then [I]0-i ought n't to be worried ... " After that , [she]512-his wife noticed , though [he]382-raymond was as charming as ever , [he]382-raymond behaved as if the case were closed . [He]382-raymond had apparently decided that [his]382-raymond arguments were unintelligible to [her]512-his wife , and under all [his]382-raymond ardour [she]512-his wife felt the difference made by the discovery . It did not make [him]382-raymond less kind , but it evidently made [her]512-his wife less important ; and [she]512-his wife had the half - frightened sense that the day [she]512-his wife ceased to please [him]382-raymond [she]512-his wife would cease to exist for [him]382-raymond . That day was a long way off , of course , but the chill of it had brushed [her]512-his wife face ; and [she]512-his wife was no longer heedless of such signs . [She]512-his wife resolved to cultivate all the arts of patience and compliance , and habit might have helped them to take root if [they]5691-they had not been nipped by a new cataclysm . It was barely a week ago that [[her]512-his wife husband]488-her husband had been called to [Paris]76-paris to straighten out a fresh tangle in the affairs of [the troublesome brother whose difficulties were apparently a part of the family tradition]5693-the troublesome brother whose difficulties were apparently a part of the family tradition . [Raymond]382-raymond 's letters had been hurried , [his]382-raymond telegrams brief and contradictory , and now , as [Undine]192-undine stood watching for the brougham that was to bring [him]382-raymond from [the station]4592-the station , [she]512-his wife had the sense that with [his]382-raymond arrival all [her]512-his wife vague fears would be confirmed . There would be more money to pay out , of course -- since the funds that could not be found for [her]512-his wife just needs were apparently always forthcoming to settle [Hubert]384-hubert 's scandalous prodigalities -- and that meant a longer perspective of solitude at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert , and a fresh pretext for postponing the hospitalities that were to follow on [their]5695-their period of mourning . The brougham -- [a vehicle]5696-a vehicle as massive and lumbering as [the pair that drew]5697-the pair that drew [it]5696-a vehicle -- presently rolled into [the court]5698-the court , and [Raymond]382-raymond 's sable figure ( [she]512-his wife had never before seen [a man travel in such black clothes]5699-a man travel in such black clothes ) sprang up the steps to the door . Whenever [Undine]192-undine saw [him]382-raymond after an absence [she]512-his wife had a curious sense of [his]382-raymond coming back from unknown distances and not belonging to [her]512-his wife or to any state of things [she]512-his wife understood . Then habit reasserted itself , and [she]512-his wife began to think of [him]382-raymond again with a querulous familiarity . But [she]512-his wife had learned to hide [her]512-his wife feelings , and as [he]382-raymond came in [she]512-his wife put up [her]512-his wife face for a kiss . "[2993-you] Yes -- everything 's settled-- " [his]382-raymond embrace expressed the satisfaction of [the man]1579-the man returning from an accomplished task to the joys of [his]382-raymond fireside . "[2993-you] Settled ? " [Her]512-his wife face kindled . "[0-i] Without [your]2993-you having to pay ? " [He]382-raymond looked at [her]512-his wife with a shrug . "[2993-you] Of course [I]0-i 've had to pay . Did [you]2993-you suppose [[Hubert]384-hubert 's creditors]2994-hubert 's creditors would be put off with vanilla eclairs ? " "[2993-you] Oh , if THAT 'S what [you]2993-you mean -- if [Hubert]384-hubert has only to wire [you]2993-you at any time to be sure of [his]2995-his affairs being settled-- ! " [She]512-his wife saw [his]382-raymond lips narrow and a line come out between [his]382-raymond eyes . "[2993-you] Would n't it be a happy thought to tell [them]2994-hubert 's creditors to bring tea ? " [he]382-raymond suggested . "[0-i] In [the library]2996-the library , then . [It]2997-it 's so cold here -- and the tapestries smell so of rain . " [He]382-raymond paused a moment to scrutinize the long walls , on which the fabulous blues and pinks of the great Boucher series looked as livid as withered roses . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose they ought to be taken down and aired , " [he]382-raymond said . [She]512-his wife thought : "[0-i] In THIS air -- much good it would do [them]2994-hubert 's creditors ! " But [she]512-his wife had already repented [her]512-his wife outbreak about [Hubert]384-hubert , and [she]512-his wife followed [[her]512-his wife husband]488-her husband into [the library]2996-the library with the resolve not to let [him]382-raymond see [her]512-his wife annoyance . Compared with the long grey gallery [the library]2996-the library , with [its]2996-the library brown walls of books , looked warm and [home]548-home - like , and [Raymond]382-raymond seemed to feel the influence of the softer atmosphere . [He]0-i turned to [[his]0-i wife]512-his wife and put [his]0-i arm about [her]2998-her . "[0-i] [I]0-i know it 's been a trial to [you]2998-her , dearest ; but this is the last time [I]0-i shall have to pull [the poor boy]4402-the poor boy out . " In spite of [herself]512-his wife [she]512-his wife laughed incredulously : [Hubert]384-hubert 's "[2676-an american] last times " were a household word . But when tea had been brought , and [they]5706-they were alone over the fire , [Raymond]382-raymond unfolded the amazing sequel . [Hubert]384-hubert had found [an heiress]5707-an heiress , [Hubert]384-hubert was to be married , and henceforth the business of paying [his]4402-the poor boy debts ( which might be counted on to recur as inevitably as the changes of the seasons ) would devolve on [[his]0-i American bride]5708-his american bride -- [the charming Miss [Looty Arlington]385-looty arlington , whom [Raymond]382-raymond had remained over in [Paris]76-paris to meet]5709-the charming miss looty arlington , whom raymond had remained over in paris to meet . "[2676-an american] [An American]2676-an american ? [He]4402-the poor boy 's marrying [an American]2676-an american ? " [Undine]192-undine wavered between wrath and satisfaction . [She]192-undine felt a flash of resentment at [any other intruder]5710-any other intruder 's venturing upon [her]192-undine territory--("Looty[165-arlington] [Arlington]165-arlington ? Who is [she]165-arlington ? What a name!")--but it was quickly superseded by the relief of knowing that henceforth , as [Raymond]382-raymond said , [Hubert]384-hubert 's debts would be [some one else]5711-some one else 's business . Then a third consideration prevailed . "[3005-a general] But if [he]4402-the poor boy 's engaged to [a rich girl]3002-a rich girl , why on earth do [WE]3003-we have to pull [him]4402-the poor boy out ? " [[Her]192-undine husband]488-her husband explained that no other course was possible . Though [General Arlington]386-general arlington was immensely wealthy , ( "[3005-a general] [[her]165-arlington father]614-her father 's [a general]3005-a general -- [a General Manager]3006-a general manager , whatever that may be , " ) [he]614-her father had exacted what [he]614-her father called "[3005-a general] a clean slate " from [[his]614-her father future son - in - law]5713-his future son - in - law , and [[Hubert]384-hubert 's creditors]2994-hubert 's creditors ( [the boy]4296-the boy was such a donkey ! ) had in [their]2994-hubert 's creditors possession certain papers that made it possible for [them]2994-hubert 's creditors to press for immediate payment . "[3011-another brilliant foreign alliance] [[Your]3007-your compatriots]4566-your compatriots ' views on such matters are so rigid -- and it 's all to [their]4566-your compatriots credit -- that the marriage would have fallen through at once if the least hint of [Hubert]384-hubert 's mess had got out -- and then [we]3009-we should have had [him]3010-him on [our]3009-we hands for life . " Yes -- from that point of view it was doubtless best to pay up ; but [Undine]192-undine obscurely wished that [their]4566-your compatriots doing so had not incidentally helped an unknown compatriot to what the American papers were no doubt already announcing as "[3011-another brilliant foreign alliance] [another brilliant foreign alliance]3011-another brilliant foreign alliance . " "[3014-she] Where on earth did [[your]3007-your brother]3012-your brother pick up [anybody respectable]3013-anybody respectable ? [La petite n'est vraiment pas trop mal]3023-la petite n'est vraiment pas trop mal . " "[3014-she] [I]0-i daresay not ! [We]3024-we 're all good - looking . But [she]3014-she must be horribly common . " [Raymond]382-raymond seemed sincerely unable to formulate a judgment . "[4259-my dear] [[My]0-i dear]4259-my dear , [you]4259-my dear have [your]4259-my dear own customs ... " "[4259-my dear] Oh , [I]0-i know [we]3024-we 're all alike to [you]4259-my dear ! " It was one of [her]4259-my dear grievances that [he]0-i never attempted to discriminate between [Americans]352-americans . "[387-miss arlington] [You]4259-my dear see no difference between [me]0-i and [a girl one]3026-a girl one gets engaged to at [a skating rink]3016-a skating rink ! " [He]0-i evaded the challenge by rejoining : "[0-i] [Miss Arlington]387-miss arlington 's burning to know [you]4259-my dear . " [She]192-undine brightened at the prospect of repayment . Yes , [they]3024-we would ask [the girl]449-the girl down ...
