"[0-i] But then after a while [we]3024-we shall be a good deal better off -- especially , as [you]0-i say , with no more of [Hubert]384-hubert 's debts to worry [us]3024-we . " And leaning back far enough to give [her]192-undine upward smile , [she]192-undine renewed [her]192-undine plea for [the premier]5718-the premier in [the Hotel de Chelles]166-the hotel de chelles : "[0-i] Because , really , [you]0-i know , as the head of [the house]623-the house [you]0-i ought to-- " "[0-i] Ah , [[my]0-i dear]4259-my dear , as [the head of [the house]623-the house]5650-the head of the house [I]0-i 've so many obligations ; and one of them is not to miss a good stroke of business when it comes [my]0-i way . " [Her]192-undine hands slipped from [his]0-i shoulders and [she]192-undine drew back . "[0-i] What do [you]0-i mean by a good stroke of business ? " Why , an incredible piece of luck -- it 's what kept [me]0-i on so long in [Paris]76-paris . [[Miss Arlington]387-miss arlington 's father]5719-miss arlington 's father was looking for [an apartment for [the young couple]1663-the young couple]5720-an apartment for the young couple , and [I]0-i 've let [him]0-i [the premier]5718-the premier for twelve years on the understanding that [he]0-i puts electric light and heating into [the whole hotel]5723-the whole hotel . It 's a wonderful chance , for of course [we]3035-we all benefit by it as much as [Hubert]384-hubert . "[0-i] " A wonderful chance ... benefit by it as much as [Hubert]384-hubert ! "[3034-she] [He]0-i seemed to be speaking a strange language in which familiar - sounding syllables meant something totally unknown . Did [he]0-i really think [she]3034-she was going to coop [herself]3034-she up again in [[their]3035-we cramped quarters]3036-their cramped quarters while [Hubert]384-hubert and [[his]0-i skating - rink bride]3037-his skating - rink bride luxuriated overhead in [the coveted premier]3038-the coveted premier ? All the resentments that had been accumulating in [her]3034-she during the long baffled months since [her]3034-she marriage broke into speech . " It 's extraordinary of [you]0-i to do such a thing without consulting [me]3034-she ! "[3034-she] " Without consulting [you]0-i ? But , [[my]3034-she dear child]2748-my dear child , [you]0-i 've always professed the most complete indifference to business matters -- [you've]0-i frequently begged [me]3034-she not to bore [you]0-i with [them]5725-them . [You]0-i may be sure [I]3034-she 've acted on the best advice ; and [[my]3034-she mother]4182-my mother , whose head is as good as [a man]932-a man 's , thinks [I]3034-she 've made a remarkably good arrangement . "[3034-she] " [I]382-raymond daresay -- but [I]382-raymond 'm not always thinking about money , as [you]3034-she are . "[382-raymond] As [she]3034-she spoke [she]3034-she had an ominous sense of impending peril ; but [she]3034-she was too angry to avoid even the risks [she]3034-she saw . To [her]3034-she surprise [Raymond]382-raymond put [his]382-raymond arm about [her]3034-she with a smile . " There are many reasons why [I]192-undine have to think about money . One is that [YOU]3034-she do n't ; and another is that [I]192-undine must look out for the future of [[our]5728-our son]5729-our son . "[192-undine] [Undine]192-undine flushed to the forehead . [She]192-undine had grown accustomed to such allusions and the thought of having [a child]549-a child no longer filled [her]192-undine with the resentful terror [she]192-undine had felt before [Paul]218-paul 's birth . [She]192-undine had been insensibly influenced by a different point of view , perhaps also by a difference in [her]192-undine own feeling ; and the vision of [herself]192-undine as [the mother of the future [Marquis de Chelles]388-marquis de chelles]3040-the mother of the future marquis de chelles was softened to happiness by the thought of giving [Raymond]382-raymond [a son]3041-a son . But all these lightly - rooted sentiments went down in the rush of [her]192-undine resentment , and [she]192-undine freed [herself]192-undine with a petulant movement . " Oh , [[my]192-undine dear]4259-my dear , [you]4259-my dear 'd better leave it to [[your]4259-my dear brother]3012-your brother to perpetuate the race . There 'll be more room for [nurseries]5732-nurseries in [[their]3012-your brother apartment]1553-their apartment ! "[192-undine] [She]192-undine waited a moment , quivering with the expectation of [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's answer ; then , as none came except the silent darkening of [his]488-her husband face , [she]192-undine walked to the door and turned round to fling back : " Of course [you]488-her husband can do what [you]488-her husband like with [[your]488-her husband own house]5734-your own house , and make any arrangements that suit [[your]488-her husband family]4403-your family , without consulting [me]382-raymond ; but [you]488-her husband need n't think [I]382-raymond 'm ever going back to live in that stuffy little hole , with [Hubert]384-hubert and [[his]488-her husband wife]512-his wife splurging round on top of [our]5737-our heads ! "[382-raymond] " Ah-- "[382-raymond] said [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond in a low voice . XXXIX [Undine]192-undine did not fulfil [her]192-undine threat . The month of [May]337-may beringer saw [her]192-undine back in [the rooms [she]192-undine had declared [she]192-undine would never set foot in]3043-the rooms she had declared she would never set foot in , and after [her]192-undine long sojourn among the echoing vistas of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert the exiguity of [[her]192-undine [Paris]76-paris quarters]3044-her paris quarters seemed like cosiness . In the interval many things had happened . [Hubert]384-hubert , permitted by [[his]382-raymond anxious relatives]3045-his anxious relatives to anticipate the term of [the family mourning]3046-the family mourning , had been showily and expensively united to [[his]382-raymond heiress]3047-his heiress ; [the Hotel de Chelles]5513-the hotel de chelles had been piped , heated and illuminated in accordance with [the bride]4198-the bride 's requirements ; and [the young couple , not content with these utilitarian changes]3050-the young couple , not content with these utilitarian changes had moved doors , opened windows , torn down partitions , and given over [the great trophied and pilastered dining - room]3051-the great trophied and pilastered dining - room to [a decorative painter with a new theory of the human anatomy]3052-a decorative painter with a new theory of the human anatomy . [Undine]192-undine had silently assisted at this spectacle , and at the sight of [the old Marquise]5654-the old marquise 's abject acquiescence ; [she]192-undine had seen [the Duchesse de Dordogne]365-the duchesse de dordogne and [the Princesse Estradina]3054-the princesse estradina go past [her]192-undine door to visit [[Hubert]384-hubert 's premier]3055-hubert 's premier and marvel at the American bath - tubs and [the Annamite bric - a - brac]3056-the annamite bric - a - brac ; and [she]192-undine had been present , with [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband , at the banquet at which [Hubert]384-hubert had revealed to the astonished [Faubourg]364-faubourg the prehistoric episodes depicted on [[his]488-her husband dining - room walls]3058-his dining - room walls . [She]192-undine had accepted all these necessities with the stoicism which the last months had developed in [her]192-undine ; for more and more , as the days passed , [she]192-undine felt [herself]192-undine in the grasp of circumstances stronger than any effort [she]192-undine could oppose to [them]3059-them . The very absence of external pressure , of any tactless assertion of authority on [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's part , intensified the sense of [her]192-undine helplessness . [He]488-her husband simply left it to [her]192-undine to infer that , important as [she]192-undine might be to [him]488-her husband in certain ways , there were others in which [she]192-undine did not weigh a feather . [Their]3061-their outward relations had not changed since [her]192-undine outburst on the subject of [Hubert]384-hubert 's marriage . That incident had left [her]192-undine half - ashamed , half - frightened at [her]192-undine behaviour , and [she]192-undine had tried to atone for it by the indirect arts that were [her]192-undine nearest approach to acknowledging [herself]192-undine in the wrong . [Raymond]382-raymond met [her]192-undine advances with a good grace , and [they]3061-their lived through the rest of the winter on terms of apparent understanding . When the spring approached it was [he]382-raymond who suggested that , since [[his]382-raymond mother]3752-his mother had consented to [Hubert]384-hubert 's marrying before the year of mourning was over , there was really no reason why [they]3061-their should not go up to [Paris]76-paris as usual ; and [she]192-undine was surprised at the readiness with which [he]382-raymond prepared to accompany [her]192-undine . A year earlier [she]192-undine would have regarded this as another proof of [her]192-undine power ; but [she]192-undine now drew [her]192-undine inferences less quickly . [Raymond]382-raymond was as " lovely "[192-undine] to [her]192-undine as ever ; but more than once , during [their]3061-their months in [the country]424-the country , [she]192-undine had had a startled sense of not giving [him]382-raymond all [he]382-raymond expected of [her]192-undine . [She]192-undine had admired [him]382-raymond , before [their]3061-their marriage , as a model of social distinction ; during the honeymoon [he]382-raymond had been the most ardent of [lovers]3064-lovers ; and with [their]3061-their settling down at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert [she]192-undine had prepared to resign [herself]192-undine to the society of [a country gentleman absorbed in sport and agriculture]3065-a country gentleman absorbed in sport and agriculture . But [Raymond]382-raymond , to [her]192-undine surprise , had again developed a disturbing resemblance to [[his]382-raymond predecessor]3066-his predecessor . During the long winter afternoons , after [he]382-raymond had gone over [his]382-raymond accounts with [the bailiff]3067-the bailiff , or written [his]382-raymond business letters , [he]382-raymond took to dabbling with a paint - box , or picking out new scores at the piano ; after dinner , when [they]3061-their went to [the library]2996-the library , [he]382-raymond seemed to expect to read aloud to [her]192-undine from the reviews and papers [he]382-raymond was always receiving ; and when [he]382-raymond had discovered [her]192-undine inability to fix [her]192-undine attention [he]382-raymond fell into the way of absorbing [himself]382-raymond in one of the old brown books with which [the room]441-the room was lined . At first [he]382-raymond tried -- as [Ralph]199-ralph had done -- to tell [her]192-undine about what [he]382-raymond was reading or what was happening in [the world]620-the world ; but [her]192-undine sense of inadequacy made [her]192-undine slip away to other subjects , and little by little [their]3061-their talk died down to monosyllables . Was it possible that , in spite of [his]382-raymond books , the evenings seemed as long to [Raymond]382-raymond as to [her]192-undine , and that [he]382-raymond had suggested going back to [Paris]76-paris because [he]382-raymond was bored at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert ? Bored as [she]192-undine was [herself]192-undine , [she]192-undine resented [his]382-raymond not finding [her]192-undine company all - sufficient , and was mortified by the discovery that there were regions of [his]382-raymond life [she]192-undine could not enter . But once back in [Paris]76-paris [she]192-undine had less time for introspection , and [Raymond]382-raymond less for books . [They]3061-their resumed [their]3061-their dispersed and busy life , and in spite of [Hubert]384-hubert 's ostentatious vicinity , of the perpetual lack of money , and of [Paul]218-paul 's innocent encroachments on [her]192-undine freedom , [Undine]192-undine , once more in [her]192-undine element , ceased to brood upon [her]192-undine grievances . [She]192-undine enjoyed going about with [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband , whose presence at [her]192-undine side was distinctly ornamental . [He]382-raymond seemed to have grown suddenly younger and more animated , and when [she]192-undine saw [other women]4230-other women looking at [him]382-raymond [she]192-undine remembered how distinguished [he]382-raymond was . It amused [her]192-undine to have [him]382-raymond in [[her]192-undine train]3073-her train , and driving about with [him]382-raymond to dinners and dances , waiting for [him]382-raymond on [flower - decked landings]3074-flower - decked landings , or pushing at [his]382-raymond side through [blazing theatre - lobbies]3075-blazing theatre - lobbies , answered to [her]192-undine inmost ideal of domestic intimacy . [He]382-raymond seemed disposed to allow [her]192-undine more liberty than before , and it was only now and then that [he]382-raymond let drop a brief reminder of the conditions on which it was accorded . [She]192-undine was to keep [certain people]3076-certain people at a distance , [she]192-undine was not to cheapen [herself]192-undine by being seen at [vulgar restaurants]3077-vulgar restaurants and [tea - rooms]3078-tea - rooms , [she]192-undine was to join with [him]382-raymond in fulfilling certain family obligations ( going to a good many dull dinners among the number ) ; but in other respects [she]192-undine was free to fill [her]192-undine days as [she]192-undine pleased . " Not that it leaves [me]192-undine much time , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine admitted to [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac ; " what with going to see [[his]382-raymond mother]3752-his mother every day , and never missing one of [[his]382-raymond sisters]5739-his sisters ' jours , and showing [myself]353-madame de trezac at [the Hotel de Dordogne]5164-the hotel de dordogne whenever [the Duchess]4974-the duchess gives a pay - up party to [the stuffy people]5742-the stuffy people [Lili Estradina]366-lili wo n't be bothered with , there are days when [I]353-madame de trezac never lay eyes on [Paul]218-paul , and barely have time to be waved and manicured ; but , apart from that , [Raymond]382-raymond 's really much nicer and less fussy than [he]382-raymond was . "[353-madame de trezac] [Undine]192-undine , as [she]192-undine grew older , had developed [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother 's craving for [a confidante]3080-a confidante , and [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac had succeeded in that capacity to [Mabel Lipscomb]200-mabel and [Bertha Shallum]297-bertha shallum . " Less fussy ? "[353-madame de trezac] [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac 's long nose lengthened thoughtfully . " H'm -- are [you]192-undine sure that 's a good sign ? "[192-undine] [Undine]192-undine stared and laughed . " Oh , [[my]353-madame de trezac dear]4259-my dear , [you]192-undine 're so quaint ! Why , [nobody]4003-nobody 's jealous any more . "[353-madame de trezac] " No ; that 's the worst of it . "[353-madame de trezac] [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac pondered . " It 's a thousand pities [you]192-undine have n't got [a son]3041-a son . "[192-undine] " Yes ; [I]353-madame de trezac wish [we]5746-we had . "[353-madame de trezac] [Undine]192-undine stood up , impatient to end the conversation . Since [she]192-undine had learned that [her]192-undine continued childlessness was regarded by every one about [her]192-undine as not only unfortunate but somehow vaguely derogatory to [her]192-undine , [she]192-undine had genuinely begun to regret it ; and any allusion to the subject disturbed [her]192-undine . " Especially , "[353-madame de trezac] [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac continued , " as [Hubert]384-hubert 's wife-- "[192-undine] " Oh , if THAT 'S all [they]5746-we want , it 's a pity [Raymond]382-raymond did n't marry [[Hubert]384-hubert 's wife]5747-hubert 's wife , "[192-undine] [Undine]192-undine flung back ; and on the stairs [she]192-undine murmured to [herself]192-undine : " [Nettie]333-nettie wincher has been talking to [[my]192-undine mother - in - law]5748-my mother - in - law . "[192-undine] But this explanation did not quiet [her]192-undine , and that evening , as [she]192-undine and [Raymond]382-raymond drove back together from a party , [she]192-undine felt a sudden impulse to speak . Sitting close to [him]382-raymond in the darkness of [the carriage]1356-the carriage , it ought to have been easy for [her]192-undine to find the needed word ; but the barrier of [his]382-raymond indifference hung between [them]3082-them , and [street]3083-street after [street]3083-street slipped by , and the spangled blackness of [the river]5189-the river unrolled itself beneath [their]3082-them wheels , before [she]192-undine leaned over to touch [his]382-raymond hand . " What is it , [[my]382-raymond dear]4259-my dear ? "[382-raymond] [She]192-undine had not yet found the word , and already [his]382-raymond tone told [her]192-undine [she]192-undine was too late . A year ago , if [she]192-undine had slipped [her]192-undine hand in [his]382-raymond , [she]192-undine would not have had that answer . " [[Your]382-raymond mother]3779-your mother blames [me]382-raymond for [our]3082-them not having [a child]549-a child . [Everybody]3748-everybody thinks it 's [my]382-raymond fault . "[382-raymond] [He]382-raymond paused before answering , and [she]192-undine sat watching [his]382-raymond shadowy profile against the passing lamps . " [[My]382-raymond mother]4182-my mother 's ideas are old - fashioned ; and [I]382-raymond do n't know that it 's [anybody]3822-anybody 's business but [yours]382-raymond and [mine]382-raymond . "[382-raymond] " Yes , but-- "[382-raymond] " Here [we]3088-we are . "[382-raymond] The brougham was turning under the archway of [the hotel]819-the hotel , and the light of [Hubert]384-hubert 's tall windows fell across [the dusky court]3087-the dusky court . [Raymond]382-raymond helped [her]192-undine out , and [they]3088-we mounted to [their]3088-we door by the stairs which [Hubert]384-hubert had recarpeted in velvet , with a marble nymph lurking in the azaleas on the landing . In the antechamber [Raymond]382-raymond paused to take [her]192-undine cloak from [her]192-undine shoulders , and [his]382-raymond eyes rested on [her]192-undine with a faint smile of approval . " [You]192-undine never looked better ; [your]192-undine dress is extremely becoming . Good - night , [[my]199-ralph dear]4259-my dear , "[199-ralph] [he]382-raymond said , kissing [her]192-undine hand as [he]382-raymond turned away . [Undine]192-undine kept this incident to [herself]192-undine : [her]192-undine wounded pride made [her]192-undine shrink from confessing it even to [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac . [She]192-undine was sure [Raymond]382-raymond would " come back "[192-undine] ; [Ralph]199-ralph always had , to the last . During [their]3089-their remaining weeks in [Paris]76-paris [she]192-undine reassured [herself]192-undine with the thought that once [they]3089-their were back at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert [she]192-undine would easily regain [her]192-undine lost hold ; and when [Raymond]382-raymond suggested [their]3089-their leaving [Paris]76-paris [she]192-undine acquiesced without a protest . But at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert [she]192-undine seemed no nearer to [him]382-raymond than in [Paris]76-paris . [He]382-raymond continued to treat [her]192-undine with unvarying amiability , but [he]382-raymond seemed wholly absorbed in the management of [the estate]1961-the estate , in [his]382-raymond books , [his]382-raymond sketching and [his]382-raymond music . [He]382-raymond had begun to interest [himself]382-raymond in politics and had been urged to stand for [[his]382-raymond department]3091-his department . This necessitated frequent displacements : trips to [Beaune]167-beaune or [Dijon]168-dijon and occasional absences in [Paris]76-paris . [Undine]192-undine , when [he]382-raymond was away , was not left alone , for [the dowager Marquise]3092-the dowager marquise had established [herself]3092-the dowager marquise at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert for the summer , and relays of [brothers]3093-brothers and [sisters - in - law]3094-sisters - in - law , [aunts]3095-aunts , [cousins]667-cousins and [ecclesiastical friends]3097-ecclesiastical friends and connections succeeded each other under [its]3098-its capacious roof . Only [Hubert]384-hubert and [[his]382-raymond wife]512-his wife were absent . [They]3100-they had taken [a villa at [Deauville]163-deauville]3101-a villa at deauville , and in the morning papers [Undine]192-undine followed the chronicle of [Hubert]384-hubert 's polo scores and of [the Countess Hubert]384-hubert 's racing toilets . The days crawled on with a benumbing sameness . [The old Marquise]5654-the old marquise and [the other ladies of the party]3103-the other ladies of the party sat on [the terrace]2120-the terrace with [their]3100-they needle - work , [the cure]3105-the cure or [one of [the visiting uncles]3107-the visiting uncles]3106-one of the visiting uncles read aloud the Journal des Debats and prognosticated dark things of [the Republic]3108-the republic , [Paul]218-paul scoured [the park]576-the park and despoiled [the kitchen - garden]3110-the kitchen - garden with [the other children of [the family]2345-the family]3111-the other children of the family , [the inhabitants of [the adjacent chateaux]3114-the adjacent chateaux]3113-the inhabitants of the adjacent chateaux drove over to call , and occasionally [the ponderous pair]3115-the ponderous pair were harnessed to a landau as lumbering as the brougham , and [the ladies of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert]3116-the ladies of saint desert measured the dusty kilometres between [themselves]3116-the ladies of saint desert and [[their]3116-the ladies of saint desert neighbours]3117-their neighbours . It was the first time that [Undine]192-undine had seriously paused to consider the conditions of [her]192-undine new life , and as the days passed [she]192-undine began to understand that so [they]3115-the ponderous pair would continue to succeed [each other]3877-each other till the end . [Every one about [her]192-undine]3119-every one about her took it for granted that as long as [she]192-undine lived [she]192-undine would spend ten months of every year at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert and the remaining two in [Paris]76-paris . Of course , if health required it , [she]192-undine might go to [les eaux]3120-les eaux with [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband ; but [the old Marquise]5654-the old marquise was very doubtful as to the benefit of a course of waters , and [[her]192-undine uncle]3123-her uncle [the Duke]3124-the duke and [[her]192-undine cousin]1178-her cousin [the Canon]3126-the canon shared [her]192-undine view . In the case of [young married women]3127-young married women , especially , the unwholesome excitement of the modern watering - place was more than likely to do away with the possible benefit of the treatment . As to travel -- had not [Raymond]382-raymond and [[his]382-raymond wife]512-his wife been to [Egypt]134-egypt and [Asia Minor]169-asia minor on [their]3129-they wedding - journey ? Such reckless enterprise was unheard of in the annals of [the house]623-the house ! Had [they]3129-they not spent days and days in the saddle , and slept in [tents]3131-tents among [the Arabs]389-the arabs ? ( Who could tell , indeed , whether these imprudences were not the cause of the disappointment which it had pleased heaven to inflict on [the young couple]1663-the young couple ? ) [No one in the family]3133-no one in the family had ever taken so long a wedding - journey . [One bride]3134-one bride had gone to [England]16-england ( even that was considered extreme ) , and another -- [the artistic daughter]3135-the artistic daughter -- had spent a week in [Venice]114-venice ; which certainly showed that [they]1663-the young couple were not behind the times , and had no old - fashioned prejudices . Since wedding - journeys were the fashion , [they]3129-they had taken [them]3136-them ; but who had ever heard of travelling afterward ? What could be the possible object of leaving [[one]629-one 's family]3138-one 's family , [one]629-one 's habits , [[one]629-one 's [friends]5085-friends]3141-one 's friends ? It was natural that [the Americans]3143-the americans , who had [no homes]3144-no homes , who were born and died in [hotels]506-hotels , should have contracted nomadic habits : but [the new Marquise de Chelles]371-the marquise de chelles was no longer [an American]2676-an american , and [she]3147-her had [Saint Desert]162-saint desert and [the Hotel de Chelles]5513-the hotel de chelles to live in , as [generations of ladies of [her]3147-her name]3149-generations of ladies of her name had done before [her]3147-her . Thus [Undine]192-undine beheld [her]192-undine future laid out for [her]192-undine , not directly and in blunt words , but obliquely and affably , in the allusions , the assumptions , the insinuations of [the amiable women among whom [her]192-undine days were spent]3150-the amiable women among whom her days were spent . [Their]3151-their interminable conversations were carried on to the click of knitting - needles and the rise and fall of industrious fingers above embroidery - frames ; and as [Undine]192-undine sat staring at the lustrous nails of [her]192-undine idle hands [she]192-undine felt that [her]192-undine inability to occupy them was regarded as one of the chief causes of [her]192-undine restlessness . [The innumerable rooms of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert]3152-the innumerable rooms of saint desert were furnished with the embroidered hangings and tapestry chairs produced by [generations of diligent chatelaines]3153-generations of diligent chatelaines , and the untiring needles of [the old Marquise]5654-the old marquise , [[her]3147-her daughters]3155-her daughters and [dependents]3156-dependents were still steadily increasing the provision . It struck [Undine]192-undine as curious that [they]3151-their should be willing to go on making chair - coverings and bed - curtains for [a house that did n't really belong to [them]3151-their]3157-a house that did n't really belong to them , and that [she]192-undine had a right to pull about and rearrange as [she]192-undine chose ; but then that was only a part of [their]3151-their whole incomprehensible way of regarding [themselves]3151-their ( in spite of [their]3151-their acute personal and parochial absorptions ) as [minor members of a powerful and indivisible whole]3158-minor members of a powerful and indivisible whole , the huge voracious fetish [they]3151-their called [The Family]2345-the family . Notwithstanding [their]3151-their very definite theories as to what [Americans]352-americans were and were not , [they]3151-their were evidently bewildered at finding no corresponding sense of solidarity in [Undine]192-undine ; and [little Paul]218-paul 's rootlessness , [his]3160-his lack of all local and linear ties , made [them]3151-their ( for all the charm [he]3160-his exercised ) regard [him]3160-his with something of the shyness of [pious Christians]3161-pious christians toward [an elfin child]3162-an elfin child . But though [mother]3774-mother and [child]4044-child gave [them]3151-their a sense of insuperable strangeness , it plainly never occurred to [them]3151-their that [both]3165-both would not be gradually subdued to the customs of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert . Dynasties had fallen , institutions changed , manners and morals , alas , deplorably declined ; but as far back as memory went , [the ladies of the line of Chelles]3166-the ladies of the line of chelles had always sat at [their]3166-the ladies of the line of chelles needle - work on [the terrace of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert]3167-the terrace of saint desert , while [the men of [the house]623-the house]3168-the men of the house lamented the corruption of [the government]3170-the government and [the cure]3105-the cure ascribed the unhappy state of [the country]424-the country to the decline of religious feeling and the rise in the cost of living . It was inevitable that , in the course of time , [the new Marquise]3173-the new marquise should come to understand the fundamental necessity of these things being as [they]3151-their were ; and meanwhile the forbearance of [[[her]3173-the new marquise husband]488-her husband 's family]5593-her husband 's family exercised itself , with the smiling discretion of [[their]5593-her husband 's family race]3176-their race , through the long succession of uneventful days . Once , in September , this routine was broken in upon by the unannounced descent of a flock of motors bearing [the Princess Estradina]363-the princess estradina and a chosen band from [one watering - place]3177-one watering - place to another . [Raymond]382-raymond was away at the time , but family loyalty constrained [the old Marquise]5654-the old marquise to welcome [[her]5654-the old marquise kinswoman]3179-her kinswoman and [[the latter]573-the latter 's friends]3181-the latter 's friends ; and [Undine]192-undine once more found [herself]192-undine immersed in the world from which [her]192-undine marriage had removed [her]192-undine . [The Princess]4948-the princess , at first , seemed totally to have forgotten [their]3183-their former intimacy , and [Undine]192-undine was made to feel that in a life so variously agitated the episode could hardly have left a trace . But the night before [her]192-undine departure [the incalculable Lili]3184-the incalculable lili , with one of [her]192-undine sudden changes of humour , drew [[her]192-undine former friend]3185-her former friend into [[her]192-undine bedroom]1181-her bedroom and plunged into an exchange of confidences . [She]192-undine naturally unfolded [her]192-undine own history first , and it was so packed with incident that the courtyard clock had struck two before [she]192-undine turned [her]192-undine attention to [Undine]192-undine . " [[My]192-undine dear]4259-my dear , [you]192-undine 're handsomer than ever ; only perhaps a shade too stout . Domestic bliss , [I]192-undine suppose ? Take care ! [You]192-undine need an emotion , a drama ... [You]192-undine Americans are really extraordinary . [You]192-undine appear to live on change and excitement ; and then suddenly [a man]932-a man comes along and claps a ring on [your]192-undine finger , and [you]192-undine never look through it to see what 's going on outside . Are n't [you]192-undine ever the least bit bored ? Why do [I]192-undine never see anything of [you]192-undine any more ? [I]192-undine suppose it 's the fault of [[my]192-undine venerable aunt]5758-my venerable aunt -- [she]5758-my venerable aunt 's never forgiven [me]192-undine for having a better time than [[her]5758-my venerable aunt daughters]3155-her daughters . How can [I]192-undine help it if [I]192-undine do n't look like [the cure]3105-the cure 's umbrella ? [I]192-undine daresay [she]5758-my venerable aunt owes [you]192-undine the same grudge . But why do [you]192-undine let [her]5758-my venerable aunt coop [you]192-undine up here ? It 's a thousand pities [you]192-undine have n't had [a child]549-a child . [They]5762-they 'd all treat [you]192-undine differently if [you]192-undine had . "[192-undine] It was the same perpetually reiterated condolence ; and [Undine]192-undine flushed with anger as [she]192-undine listened . Why indeed had [she]192-undine let [herself]192-undine be cooped up ? [She]192-undine could not have answered [the Princess]4948-the princess 's question : [she]192-undine merely felt the impossibility of breaking through the mysterious web of traditions , conventions , prohibitions that enclosed [her]192-undine in [their]3188-their impenetrable net - work . But [her]192-undine vanity suggested the obvious pretext , and [she]192-undine murmured with a laugh : " [I]4948-the princess did n't know [Raymond]382-raymond was going to be so jealous-- "[4948-the princess] [The Princess]4948-the princess stared . " Is it [Raymond]382-raymond who keeps [you]192-undine shut up here ? And what about [his]382-raymond trips to [Dijon]168-dijon ? And what do [you]192-undine suppose [he]382-raymond does with [himself]382-raymond when [he]382-raymond runs up to [Paris]76-paris ? Politics ? "[4948-the princess] [She]4948-the princess shrugged ironically . " Politics do n't occupy [a man]932-a man after midnight . [Raymond]382-raymond jealous of [you]192-undine ? Ah , [merci]5764-merci ! [[My]192-undine dear]4259-my dear , it 's what [I]192-undine always say when [people]560-people talk to [me]192-undine about fast [Americans]352-americans : [you]352-americans 're [the only innocent women left in [the world]620-the world]5767-the only innocent women left in the world ... "[192-undine] XL After [the Princess Estradina]363-the princess estradina 's departure , the days at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert succeeded each other indistinguishably ; and more and more , as [they]3190-they passed , [Undine]192-undine felt [herself]192-undine drawn into the slow strong current already fed by so many tributary lives . Some spell [she]192-undine could not have named seemed to emanate from [the old house]5456-the old house which had so long been [the custodian of an unbroken tradition]3192-the custodian of an unbroken tradition : things had happened [there]603-there in the same way for so many generations that to try to alter them seemed as vain as to contend with the elements . Winter came and went , and once more the calendar marked the first days of spring ; but though the horse - chestnuts of [the Champs Elysees]145-the champs elysees were budding snow still lingered in [the grass drives of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert]3194-the grass drives of saint desert and along the ridges of [the hills beyond [the park]576-the park]5612-the hills beyond the park . Sometimes , as [Undine]192-undine looked out of the windows of [the Boucher gallery]3197-the boucher gallery , [she]192-undine felt as if [her]192-undine eyes had never rested on any other scene . Even [her]192-undine occasional brief trips to [Paris]76-paris left no lasting trace : the life of [the vivid streets]3198-the vivid streets faded to a shadow as soon as the black and white horizon of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert closed in on [her]192-undine again . Though the afternoons were still cold [she]192-undine had lately taken to sitting in [the gallery]771-the gallery . The smiling scenes on [its]771-the gallery walls and the tall screens which broke [its]771-the gallery length made it more habitable than [the drawing - rooms beyond]3200-the drawing - rooms beyond ; but [her]192-undine chief reason for preferring it was the satisfaction [she]192-undine found in having fires lit in both the monumental chimneys that faced each other down [its]771-the gallery long perspective . This satisfaction had its source in [the old Marquise]5654-the old marquise 's disapproval . Never before in the history of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert had the consumption of firewood exceeded a certain carefully - calculated measure ; but since [Undine]192-undine had been in authority this allowance had been doubled . If [any one]659-any one had told [her]192-undine , a year earlier , that one of the chief distractions of [her]192-undine new life would be to invent ways of annoying [[her]192-undine mother - in - law]5602-her mother - in - law , [she]192-undine would have laughed at the idea of wasting [her]192-undine time on such trifles . But [she]192-undine found [herself]192-undine with a great deal of time to waste , and with a fierce desire to spend it in upsetting the immemorial customs of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert . [[Her]192-undine husband]488-her husband had mastered [her]192-undine in essentials , but [she]192-undine had discovered innumerable small ways of irritating and hurting [him]488-her husband , and one -- and not the least effectual -- was to do anything that went counter to [[his]488-her husband mother]3752-his mother 's prejudices . It was not that [he]488-her husband always shared [her]192-undine views , or was [a particularly subservient son]3206-a particularly subservient son ; but it seemed to be one of [his]488-her husband fundamental principles that [a man]932-a man should respect [[his]932-a man mother]3752-his mother 's wishes , and see to it that [[his]932-a man household]3209-his household respected them . [All Frenchmen of [his]488-her husband class]3210-all frenchmen of his class appeared to share this view , and to regard it as beyond discussion : it was based on something so much more Immutable than personal feeling that [one]629-one might even hate [[one]629-one 's mother]3213-one 's mother and yet insist that [her]192-undine ideas as to the consumption of fire - wood should be regarded . [The old Marquise]371-the marquise de chelles , during the cold weather , always sat in [[her]192-undine bedroom]1181-her bedroom ; and there , between the tapestried four - poster and the fireplace , [the family]2345-the family grouped itself around the ground - glass of [her]192-undine single carcel lamp . In the evening , if there were [visitors]3216-visitors , a fire was lit in [the library]2996-the library ; otherwise [the family]2345-the family again sat about the [Marquise]371-the marquise de chelles 's lamp till [the footman]3219-the footman came in at ten with tisane and biscuits [de Reims]390-de reims ; after which [every one bade the dowager]3220-every one bade the dowager good night and scattered down [the corridors]3221-the corridors to chill distances marked by tapers floating in cups of oil . Since [Undine]192-undine 's coming [the library]2996-the library fire had never been allowed to go out ; and of late , after experimenting with [the two drawing - rooms]3223-the two drawing - rooms and [the so - called " study "[192-undine] where [Raymond]382-raymond kept [his]382-raymond guns]3224-the so - called " study " where raymond kept his guns and saw [the bailiff]3067-the bailiff , [she]192-undine had selected [the gallery]771-the gallery as the most suitable place for the new and unfamiliar ceremony of afternoon tea . Afternoon refreshments had never before been served at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert except when company was expected ; when they had invariably consisted in a decanter of sweet port and a plate of small dry cakes -- the kind that kept . That the complicated rites of the tea - urn , with its offering - up of perishable delicacies , should be enacted for the sole enjoyment of [the family]2345-the family , was a thing so unheard of that for a while [Undine]192-undine found sufficient amusement in elaborating the ceremonial , and in making the ancestral plate groan under more varied viands ; and when this palled [she]192-undine devised the plan of performing the office in [the gallery]771-the gallery and lighting sacrificial fires in both chimneys . [She]192-undine had said to [Raymond]382-raymond , at first : " It 's ridiculous that [[your]382-raymond mother]3779-your mother should sit in [[her]3779-your mother bedroom]1181-her bedroom all day . [She]3779-your mother says [she]3779-your mother does it to save fires ; but if [we]5771-we have a fire [downstairs]3746-downstairs why ca n't [she]3779-your mother let [hers]3779-your mother go out , and come down ? [I]5654-the old marquise do n't see why [I]5654-the old marquise should spend [my]5654-the old marquise life in [[[your]5654-the old marquise mother]3779-your mother 's bedroom]5774-your mother 's bedroom . "[5654-the old marquise] [Raymond]382-raymond made no answer , and [the Marquise]3229-the marquise did , in fact , let [her]3229-the marquise fire go out . But [she]3229-the marquise did not come down -- [she]3229-the marquise simply continued to sit [upstairs]4364-upstairs without a fire . At first this also amused [Undine]192-undine ; then the tacit criticism implied began to irritate [her]192-undine . [She]192-undine hoped [Raymond]382-raymond would speak of [[his]382-raymond mother]3752-his mother 's attitude : [she]192-undine had [her]192-undine answer ready if [he]382-raymond did ! But [he]382-raymond made no comment , [he]382-raymond took no notice ; [her]192-undine impulses of retaliation spent themselves against the blank surface of [his]382-raymond indifference . [He]382-raymond was as amiable , as considerate as ever ; as ready , within reason , to accede to [her]192-undine wishes and gratify [her]192-undine whims . Once or twice , when [she]192-undine suggested running up to [Paris]76-paris to take [Paul]218-paul to [the dentist]5019-the dentist , or to look for [a servant]2208-a servant , [he]382-raymond agreed to the necessity and went up with [her]192-undine . But instead of going to [an hotel]3234-an hotel [they]3235-their went to [[their]3235-their apartment]1553-their apartment , where carpets were up and curtains down , and [a care - taker]3237-a care - taker prepared primitive food at uncertain hours ; and [Undine]192-undine 's first glimpse of [Hubert]384-hubert 's illuminated windows deepened [her]192-undine rancour and [her]192-undine sense of helplessness . As [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac had predicted , [Raymond]382-raymond 's vigilance gradually relaxed , and during [their]3235-their excursions to [the capital]3238-the capital [Undine]192-undine came and went as [she]192-undine pleased . But [her]192-undine visits were too short to permit of [her]192-undine falling in with the social pace , and when [she]192-undine showed [herself]192-undine among [[her]192-undine friends]1672-her friends [she]192-undine felt countrified and out - of - place , as if even [her]192-undine clothes had come from [Saint Desert]162-saint desert . Nevertheless [her]192-undine dresses were more than ever [her]192-undine chief preoccupation : in [Paris]76-paris [she]192-undine spent hours at [the dressmaker]3240-the dressmaker 's , and in [the country]424-the country the arrival of a box of new gowns was the chief event of the vacant days . But there was more bitterness than joy in the unpacking , and the dresses hung in [her]192-undine wardrobe like so many unfulfilled promises of pleasure , reminding [her]192-undine of the days at the Stentorian when [she]192-undine had reviewed other finery with the same cheated eyes . In spite of this , [she]192-undine multiplied [her]192-undine orders , writing up to [the dress - makers]4048-the dress - makers for patterns , and to [the milliners]3243-the milliners for boxes of hats which [she]192-undine tried on , and kept for days , without being able to make a choice . Now and then [she]192-undine even sent [[her]192-undine maid]2227-her maid up to [Paris]76-paris to bring back great assortments of veils , gloves , flowers and laces ; and after periods of painful indecision [she]192-undine ended by keeping the greater number , lest those [she]192-undine sent back should turn out to be the ones that were worn in [Paris]76-paris . [She]192-undine knew [she]192-undine was spending too much money , and [she]192-undine had lost [her]192-undine youthful faith in providential solutions ; but [she]192-undine had always had the habit of going out to buy something when [she]192-undine was bored , and never had [she]192-undine been in greater need of such solace . The dulness of [her]192-undine life seemed to have passed into [her]192-undine blood : [her]192-undine complexion was less animated , [her]192-undine hair less shining . The change in [her]192-undine looks alarmed [her]192-undine , and [she]192-undine scanned the fashion - papers for new scents and powders , and experimented in facial bandaging , electric massage and other processes of renovation . Odd atavisms woke in [her]192-undine , and [she]192-undine began to pore over patent medicine advertisements , to send stamped envelopes to [beauty doctors]3245-beauty doctors and [professors of physical development]3246-professors of physical development , and to brood on the advantage of consulting [faith - healers]3247-faith - healers , [mind - readers]3248-mind - readers and [[their]3248-mind - readers kindred adepts]3249-their kindred adepts . [She]192-undine even wrote to [[her]192-undine mother]426-her mother for the receipts of some of [[her]192-undine grandfather]3251-her grandfather 's forgotten nostrums , and modified [her]192-undine daily life , and [her]192-undine hours of sleeping , eating and exercise , in accordance with each new experiment . [Her]192-undine constitutional restlessness lapsed into an apathy like [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's , and the least demand on [her]192-undine activity irritated [her]192-undine . But [she]192-undine was beset by endless annoyances : bickerings with [discontented maids]3252-discontented maids , the difficulty of finding [a tutor]3253-a tutor for [Paul]218-paul , and the problem of keeping [him]3251-her grandfather amused and occupied without having [him]3251-her grandfather too much on [her]192-undine hands . A great liking had sprung up between [Raymond]382-raymond and [the little boy]1732-the little boy , and during the summer [Paul]218-paul was perpetually at [[his]1732-the little boy step - father]3255-his step - father 's side in [the stables]3256-the stables and [the park]576-the park . But with the coming of winter [Raymond]382-raymond was oftener away , and [Paul]218-paul developed a persistent cold that kept [him]3251-her grandfather frequently [indoors]3258-indoors . The confinement made [him]3251-her grandfather fretful and exacting , and [the old Marquise]5654-the old marquise ascribed the change in [his]3251-her grandfather behaviour to the deplorable influence of [[his]3251-her grandfather tutor]3260-his tutor , [a " laic "[192-undine] recommended by one of [[Raymond]382-raymond 's old professors]3262-raymond 's old professors]3261-a " laic " recommended by one of raymond 's old professors . [Raymond]382-raymond [himself]382-raymond would have preferred an abb : it was in the tradition of [the house]623-the house , and though [Paul]218-paul was not of [the house]623-the house it seemed fitting that [he]3251-her grandfather should conform to [its]623-the house ways . Moreover , when [the married sisters]3265-the married sisters came to stay [they]3265-the married sisters objected to having [[their]3265-the married sisters children]3266-their children exposed to [the tutor]3267-the tutor 's influence , and even implied that [Paul]218-paul 's society might be contaminating . But [Undine]192-undine , though [she]192-undine had so readily embraced [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's faith , stubbornly resisted the suggestion that [she]192-undine should hand over [[her]192-undine son]1095-her son to [the Church]2715-the church . [The tutor]3267-the tutor therefore remained ; but the friction caused by [his]3267-the tutor presence was so irritating to [Undine]192-undine that [she]192-undine began to consider the alternative of sending [Paul]218-paul to [school]801-school . [He]3267-the tutor was still small and tender for the experiment ; but [she]192-undine persuaded [herself]192-undine that what [he]3267-the tutor needed was " hardening , "[382-raymond] and having heard of [a school where [fashionable infancy]3274-fashionable infancy was subjected to this process]3273-a school where fashionable infancy was subjected to this process , [she]192-undine entered into correspondence with [the master]3275-the master . [His]3267-the tutor first letter convinced [her]192-undine that [[his]3267-the tutor establishment]3276-his establishment was just the place for [Paul]218-paul ; but the second contained the price - list , and after comparing it with [the tutor]3267-the tutor 's keep and salary [she]192-undine wrote to say that [she]192-undine feared [[her]192-undine little boy]5151-her little boy was too young to be sent away from [home]548-home . [[Her]192-undine husband]488-her husband , for some time past , had ceased to make any comment on [her]192-undine expenditure . [She]192-undine knew [he]488-her husband thought [her]192-undine too extravagant , and felt sure [he]488-her husband was minutely aware of what [she]192-undine spent ; for [Saint Desert]162-saint desert projected on economic details a light as different as might be from the haze that veiled [them]3281-them in [West End Avenue]11-west end avenue . [She]192-undine therefore concluded that [Raymond]382-raymond 's silence was intentional , and ascribed it to [his]382-raymond having shortcomings of [his]382-raymond own to conceal . [The Princess Estradina]363-the princess estradina 's pleasantry had reached its mark . [Undine]192-undine did not believe that [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband was seriously in love with [another woman]4706-another woman -- [she]192-undine could not conceive that [any one]659-any one could tire of [her]192-undine of whom [she]192-undine had not first tired -- but [she]192-undine was humiliated by [his]382-raymond indifference , and it was easier to ascribe it to the arts of [a rival]3285-a rival than to any deficiency in [herself]192-undine . It exasperated [her]192-undine to think that [he]382-raymond might have consolations for the outward monotony of [his]382-raymond life , and [she]192-undine resolved that when [they]3286-they returned to [Paris]76-paris [he]382-raymond should see that [she]192-undine was not without similar opportunities . [March]147-march , meanwhile , was verging on April , and still [he]382-raymond did not speak of leaving . [Undine]192-undine had learned that [he]382-raymond expected to have such decisions left to [him]382-raymond , and [she]192-undine hid [her]192-undine impatience lest [her]192-undine showing it should incline [him]382-raymond to delay . But one day , as [she]192-undine sat at tea in [the gallery]771-the gallery , [he]382-raymond came in in [his]382-raymond riding - clothes and said : " [I]382-raymond 've been over to [the other side of [the mountain]5776-the mountain]5775-the other side of the mountain . The February rains have weakened [the dam of [the Alette]171-the alette]5777-the dam of the alette , and [the vineyards]5778-the vineyards will be in danger if [we]5779-we do n't rebuild at once . "[382-raymond] [She]192-undine suppressed a yawn , thinking , as [she]192-undine did so , how dull [he]382-raymond always looked when [he]382-raymond talked of agriculture . It made [him]382-raymond seem years older , and [she]192-undine reflected with a shiver that listening to [him]382-raymond probably gave [her]192-undine the same look . [He]382-raymond went on , as [she]192-undine handed [him]382-raymond [his]382-raymond tea : " [I]192-undine 'm sorry it should happen just now . [I]192-undine 'm afraid [I]192-undine shall have to ask [you]382-raymond to give up [your]382-raymond spring in [Paris]76-paris . "[192-undine] " Oh , no -- no ! "[192-undine] [she]192-undine broke out . A throng of half - subdued grievances choked in [her]192-undine : [she]192-undine wanted to burst into sobs like [a child]549-a child . " [I]382-raymond know it 's a disappointment . But [our]5780-our expenses have been unusually heavy this year . "[382-raymond] " It seems to [me]382-raymond they always are . [I]382-raymond do n't see why [we]5780-our should give up [Paris]76-paris because [you]382-raymond 've got to make repairs to [a dam]5781-a dam . Is n't [Hubert]384-hubert ever going to pay back that money ? "[382-raymond] [He]382-raymond looked at [her]192-undine with a mild surprise . " But surely [you]192-undine understood at the time that it wo n't be possible till [[his]382-raymond wife]512-his wife inherits ? "[192-undine] " Till [General Arlington]386-general arlington dies , [you]192-undine mean ? [He]382-raymond does n't look much older than [you]192-undine ! "[192-undine] " [You]192-undine may remember that [I]192-undine showed [you]192-undine [Hubert]384-hubert 's note . [He]382-raymond has paid the interest quite regularly . "[192-undine] " That 's kind of [him]382-raymond ! "[192-undine] [She]192-undine stood up , flaming with rebellion . " [You]382-raymond can do as [you]382-raymond please ; but [I]192-undine mean to go to [Paris]76-paris . "[192-undine] " [[My]3289-i mother]4182-my mother is not going . [I]3289-i did n't intend to open [[our]5784-our apartment]5785-our apartment . "[3289-i] " [I]3289-i understand . But [I]3289-i shall open it -- that 's all ! "[3289-i] [He]3289-i had risen too , and [she]192-undine saw [his]3289-i face whiten . " [I]192-undine prefer that [you]382-raymond should n't go without [me]192-undine . XLI The incident left [Undine]192-undine with the baffled feeling of not being able to count on any of [her]192-undine old weapons of aggression . In all [her]192-undine struggles for authority [her]192-undine sense of the rightfulness of [her]192-undine cause had been measured by [her]192-undine power of making [people]560-people do as [she]192-undine pleased . [Raymond]382-raymond 's firmness shook [her]192-undine faith in [her]192-undine own claims , and a blind desire to wound and destroy replaced [her]192-undine usual business - like intentness on gaining [her]192-undine end . But [her]192-undine ironies were as ineffectual as [her]192-undine arguments , and [his]382-raymond imperviousness was the more exasperating because [she]192-undine divined that some of the things [she]192-undine said would have hurt [him]382-raymond if [any one else]2380-any one else had said them : it was the fact of [their]3297-their coming from [her]192-undine that made [them]3297-their innocuous . Even when , at the close of [their]3298-we talk , [she]192-undine had burst out : " If [you]382-raymond grudge [me]382-raymond everything [I]382-raymond care about [we]3298-we 'd better separate , "[382-raymond] [he]382-raymond had merely answered with a shrug : " It 's one of the things [we]3298-we do n't do-- "[3314-the visitor] and the answer had been like the slamming of an iron door in [her]192-undine face . An interval of silent brooding had resulted in a reaction of rebellion . [She]192-undine dared not carry out [her]192-undine threat of joining [[her]192-undine compatriots]2171-her compatriots at [the Nouveau Luxe]102-the nouveau luxe : [she]192-undine had too clear a memory of the results of [her]192-undine former revolt . But neither could [she]192-undine submit to [her]192-undine present fate without attempting to make [Raymond]382-raymond understand [his]382-raymond selfish folly . [She]192-undine had failed to prove it by argument , but [she]192-undine had an inherited faith in the value of practical demonstration . If [he]382-raymond could be made to see how easily [he]382-raymond could give [her]192-undine what [she]192-undine wanted perhaps [he]382-raymond might come round to [her]192-undine view . With this idea in mind , [she]192-undine had gone up to [Paris]76-paris for twenty - four hours , on the pretext of finding [a new nurse]3300-a new nurse for [Paul]218-paul ; and the steps then taken had enabled [her]192-undine , on the first occasion , to set [her]192-undine plan in motion . The occasion was furnished by [Raymond]382-raymond 's next trip to [Beaune]167-beaune . [He]382-raymond went off early one morning , leaving word that [he]382-raymond should not be back till night ; and on the afternoon of the same day [she]192-undine stood at [her]192-undine usual post in [the gallery]771-the gallery , scanning the long perspective of [the poplar avenue]5611-the poplar avenue . [She]192-undine had not stood [there]603-there long before a black speck at the end of [the avenue]1736-the avenue expanded into a motor that was presently throbbing at the entrance . [I]3340-his saw [you]629-one were in a tight place that time [I]3340-his ran across [you]629-one in [Paris]76-paris -- and [I]3340-his had n't any grudge against [you]629-one . Fact is , [I]3340-his 've never had the time to nurse [old scores]5823-old scores , and if [you]629-one neglect 'em [they]5823-old scores die off like gold - fish . "[3340-his] [He]3340-his was still composedly regarding [her]629-one . " It 's funny to think of [your]629-one having settled down to this kind of life ; [I]629-one hope [you]629-one 've got what [you]629-one wanted . This is [a great place [you]629-one live in]5824-a great place you live in . "[629-one] " Yes ; but [I]3340-his see a little too much of it . [We]5825-we live [here]3758-here most of the year . "[3340-his] [She]629-one had meant to give [him]3340-his the illusion of success , but some underlying community of instinct drew the confession from [her]629-one lips . " That so ? Why on earth do n't [you]3340-his cut it and come up to [Paris]76-paris ? "[3340-his] " Oh , [Raymond]382-raymond 's absorbed in [the estates]5827-the estates -- and [we]5825-we have n't got the money . [This place]5788-this place eats it all up . "[3340-his] " Well , that sounds aristocratic ; but ai n't it rather out of date ? When the swells are hard - up nowadays [they]5829-they generally chip off an heirloom . "[3340-his] [He]3340-his wheeled round again to the tapestries . " There are a good many [Paris]76-paris seasons hanging right here on this wall . "[629-one] " Yes -- [I]629-one know . "[629-one] [She]629-one tried to check [herself]629-one , to summon up a glittering equivocation ; but [his]3340-his face , [his]3340-his voice , the very words [he]3340-his used , were like so many hammer - strokes demolishing the unrealities that imprisoned [her]629-one . " Of course it 's frightfully lonely down here , "[3340-his] [she]629-one began ; and through the opening made by the admission the whole flood of [her]629-one grievances poured forth . [She]629-one tried to let [him]3340-his see that [she]629-one had not sacrificed [herself]629-one for nothing ; [she]629-one touched on the superiorities of [her]629-one situation , [she]629-one gilded the circumstances of which [she]629-one called [herself]629-one [the victim]4356-the victim , and let titles , offices and attributes shed their utmost lustre on [her]629-one tale ; but what [she]629-one had to boast of seemed small and tinkling compared with the evidences of [his]3340-his power . " Well , it 's a downright shame [you]629-one do n't go round more , "[330-mrs. rolliver] [he]3340-his kept saying ; and [she]629-one felt ashamed of [her]629-one tame acceptance of [her]629-one fate . When [she]629-one had told [her]629-one story [she]629-one asked for [his]3340-his ; and for the first time [she]629-one listened to it with interest . [He]3340-his had what [he]3340-his wanted at last . The Apex Consolidation scheme , after a long interval of suspense , had obtained its charter and shot out huge ramifications . [Rolliver]330-mrs. rolliver had " stood in "[201-driscoll] with [him]3340-his at the critical moment , and between [them]3343-them [they]3343-them had " chucked out "[629-one] [old Harmon B. Driscoll]201-driscoll bag and baggage , and got [the whole town]3344-the whole town in [their]3343-them control . Absorbed in [his]3340-his theme , and forgetting [her]629-one inability to follow [him]3340-his , [Moffatt]212-moffatt launched out on an epic recital of plot and counterplot , and [she]629-one hung , a new [Desdemona]396-desdemona , on [his]3340-his conflict with the new anthropophagi . It was of no consequence that the details and the technicalities escaped [her]629-one : [she]629-one knew their meaningless syllables stood for success , and what that meant was as clear as day to [her]629-one . [Every Wall Street]3345-every wall street term had its equivalent in the language of [Fifth Avenue]4-fifth avenue , and while [he]3340-his talked of building up railways [she]629-one was building up [palaces]3346-palaces , and picturing all the multiple lives [he]3340-his would lead in [them]3346-palaces . To have things had always seemed to [her]629-one the first essential of existence , and as [she]629-one listened to [him]3340-his the vision of the things [he]3340-his could have unrolled itself before [her]629-one like the long triumph of [an Asiatic conqueror]3347-an asiatic conqueror . " And what are [you]3340-his going to do next ? "[629-one] [she]629-one asked , almost breathlessly , when [he]3340-his had ended . " Oh , there 's always a lot to do next . Business never goes to sleep . "[629-one] " Yes ; but [I]3340-his mean besides business . "[3340-his] " Why -- everything [I]3340-his can , [I]3340-his guess . "[3340-his] [He]3340-his leaned back in [his]3340-his chair with an air of placid power , as if [he]3340-his were so sure of getting what [he]3340-his wanted that there was no longer any use in hurrying , huge as [his]3340-his vistas had become . [She]629-one continued to question [him]3340-his , and [he]3340-his began to talk of [his]3340-his growing passion for pictures and furniture , and of [his]3340-his desire to form a collection which should be a great representative assemblage of unmatched specimens . As [he]3340-his spoke [she]629-one saw [his]3340-his expression change , and [his]3340-his eyes grow younger , almost boyish , with a concentrated look in them that reminded [her]629-one of long - forgotten things . " [I]3340-his mean to have the best , [you]629-one know ; not just to get ahead of [the other fellows]4078-the other fellows , but because [I]3340-his know it when [I]3340-his see it . "[382-raymond] XLII [Undine]192-undine had gained [her]192-undine point , and [the entresol of [the Hotel de Chelles]5513-the hotel de chelles]3348-the entresol of the hotel de chelles reopened [its]3348-the entresol of the hotel de chelles doors for the season . But [she]192-undine had to take [her]192-undine share of the felicitations which the whole far - reaching circle of [friends]5085-friends and relations distributed to [every member of [[Hubert]384-hubert 's family]3356-hubert 's family]3355-every member of hubert 's family on the approach of the happy event . Nor was this the hardest of [her]192-undine trials . [Raymond]382-raymond had done what [she]192-undine asked -- [he]382-raymond had stood out against [[his]382-raymond mother]3752-his mother 's protests , set aside considerations of prudence , and consented to go up to [Paris]76-paris for two months ; but [he]382-raymond had done so on the understanding that during [their]3353-their stay [they]3353-their should exercise the most unremitting economy . As dinner - giving put the heaviest strain on [their]3353-their budget , all hospitality was suspended ; and when [Undine]192-undine attempted to invite [a few friends]3358-a few friends informally [she]192-undine was warned that [she]192-undine could not do so without causing the gravest offense to the many others genealogically entitled to the same attention . [Raymond]382-raymond 's insistence on this rule was simply part of an elaborate and inveterate system of " relations "[192-undine] ( the whole of French social life seemed to depend on the exact interpretation of that word ) , and [Undine]192-undine felt the uselessness of struggling against such mysterious inhibitions . [He]382-raymond reminded [her]192-undine , however , that [their]3353-their inability to receive would give [them]3353-their all the more opportunity for going out , and [he]382-raymond showed [himself]382-raymond more socially disposed than in the past . But [his]382-raymond concession did not result as [she]192-undine had hoped . [They]3353-their were asked out as much as ever , but [they]3353-their were asked to big dinners , to impersonal crushes , to the kind of entertainment it is a slight to be omitted from but no compliment to be included in . Nothing could have been more galling to [Undine]192-undine , and [she]192-undine frankly bewailed the fact to [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac . " Of course it 's what was sure to come of being mewed up for months and months in [the country]424-the country . [We]3353-their 're out of everything , and [the people who are having a good time]5832-the people who are having a good time are simply too busy to remember [us]3353-their . [We]3353-their 're only asked to the things that are made up from visiting - lists . "[353-madame de trezac] [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac listened sympathetically , but did not suppress a candid answer . "[192-undine] " The wrong set ? Why , [I]353-madame de trezac 'm in [[HIS]382-raymond set]5836-his set -- the one that thinks itself too good for all the others . " [You]353-madame de trezac mean that [I'M]353-madame de trezac [the bore]5837-the bore , then ? "[192-undine] " Well , [you]4259-my dear do n't work hard enough -- [you]4259-my dear do n't keep up . [I]192-undine have n't always , either ; but then [I]192-undine have to put up with the big dinners . "[192-undine] [Undine]192-undine winced under the criticism ; but [she]192-undine had never lacked insight into the cause of [her]192-undine own failures , and [she]192-undine had already had premonitions of what [Madame de Trezac]353-madame de trezac so bluntly phrased . When [Raymond]382-raymond ceased to be interested in [her]192-undine conversation [she]192-undine had concluded it was the way of [husbands]4208-husbands ; but since then it had been slowly dawning on [her]192-undine that [she]192-undine produced the same effect on [others]807-others . [Her]192-undine entrances were always triumphs ; but they had no sequel . As soon as [people]560-people began to talk [they]560-people ceased to see [her]192-undine . Any sense of insufficiency exasperated [her]192-undine , and [she]192-undine had vague thoughts of cultivating [herself]192-undine , and went so far as to spend a morning in [the Louvre]174-the louvre and go to one or two lectures by [a fashionable philosopher]3362-a fashionable philosopher . But though [she]192-undine returned from these expeditions charged with opinions , [their]560-people expression did not excite the interest [she]192-undine had hoped . [Her]192-undine views , if abundant , were confused , and the more [she]192-undine said the more nebulous they seemed to grow . [She]192-undine was disconcerted , moreover , by finding that [everybody]3748-everybody appeared to know about the things [she]192-undine thought [she]192-undine had discovered , and [her]192-undine comments clearly produced more bewilderment than interest . Remembering the attention [she]192-undine had attracted on [her]192-undine first appearance in [Raymond]382-raymond 's world [she]192-undine concluded that [she]192-undine had " gone off "[192-undine] or grown dowdy , and instead of wasting more time in [museums]1547-museums and [lecture - halls]3365-lecture - halls [she]192-undine prolonged [her]192-undine hours at [the dress - maker]1659-the dress - maker 's and gave up the rest of the day to the scientific cultivation of [her]192-undine beauty . "[3367-one of her tradesmen] Meanwhile financial cares became more pressing . A dunning letter from [one of [[her]192-undine tradesmen]1671-her tradesmen]3367-one of her tradesmen fell into [Raymond]382-raymond 's hands , and the talk it led to ended in [his]3367-one of her tradesmen making it clear to [her]192-undine that [she]192-undine must settle [her]192-undine personal debts without [his]3367-one of her tradesmen aid . All the " scenes "[382-raymond] about money which had disturbed [her]192-undine past had ended in some mysterious solution of [her]192-undine difficulty . Disagreeable as they were , [she]192-undine had always , vulgarly speaking , found [they]3369-they paid ; but now it was [she]192-undine who was expected to pay . [Raymond]382-raymond took [his]382-raymond stand without ill - temper or apology : [he]382-raymond simply argued from inveterate precedent . But it was impossible for [Undine]192-undine to understand [a social organization which did not regard the indulging of woman]3370-a social organization which did not regard the indulging of woman as its first purpose , or to believe that [any one taking another view was not moved by avarice or malice]3371-any one taking another view was not moved by avarice or malice ; and the discussion ended in mutual acrimony . " Why should n't [I]488-her husband ? Something had to be done . [We]5845-we ca n't go on as [we]5845-we are . "[192-undine] [He]3377-you stopped again , [his]3377-you white face and drawn nostrils giving [him]3377-you so much the look of [an extremely distinguished actor]3378-an extremely distinguished actor in a fine part that , in spite of the vehemence of [his]3377-you emotion , [his]3377-you silence might have been the deliberate pause for a replique . "[3377-you] " Ah-- ! " How dare [you]3377-you speak to [me]382-raymond like that ? [Nobody]4003-nobody 's ever dared to before .
