XLIII [She]192-undine watched [him]382-raymond go in a kind of stupour , knowing that when [they]3379-they next met [he]382-raymond would be as courteous and self - possessed as if nothing had happened , but that everything would nevertheless go on in the same way -- in [HIS]382-raymond way -- and that there was no more hope of shaking [his]382-raymond resolve or altering [his]382-raymond point of view than there would have been of transporting the deep - rooted masonry of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert by means of the wheeled supports on which [Apex architecture]192-undine performed its easy transits . One of [her]192-undine childish rages possessed [her]192-undine , sweeping away every feeling save the primitive impulse to hurt and destroy ; but search as [she]192-undine would [she]192-undine could not find a crack in the strong armour of [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband 's habits and prejudices . For a long time [she]192-undine continued to sit where [he]488-her husband had left [her]192-undine , staring at the portraits on the walls as though [they]3379-they had joined hands to imprison [her]192-undine . Hitherto [she]192-undine had almost always felt [herself]192-undine a match for circumstances , but now [the very dead]3383-the very dead were leagued to defeat [her]192-undine : people [she]192-undine had never seen and whose names [she]192-undine could n't even remember seemed to be plotting and contriving against [her]192-undine under [the escutcheoned grave - stones of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert]3384-the escutcheoned grave - stones of saint desert . [Her]192-undine eyes turned to the old warm - toned furniture beneath the pictures , and to [her]192-undine own idle image in the mirror above the mantelpiece . Even in [that one small room]3385-that one small room there were enough things of price to buy a release from [her]192-undine most pressing cares ; and [the great house , in which [the room was a mere cell]3387-the room was a mere cell]3386-the great house , in which the room was a mere cell , and [the other greater house in [Burgundy]105-burgundy]3388-the other greater house in burgundy , held treasures to deplete even such a purse as [[Moffatt]212-moffatt 's]3389-moffatt 's . [She]192-undine liked to see such things about [her]192-undine -- without any real sense of their meaning [she]192-undine felt them to be the appropriate setting of [a pretty woman]1804-a pretty woman , to embody something of the rareness and distinction [she]192-undine had always considered [she]192-undine possessed ; and [she]192-undine reflected that if [she]192-undine had still been [[Moffatt]212-moffatt 's wife]3391-moffatt 's wife [he]212-moffatt would have given [her]192-undine just such a setting , and the power to live in it as became [her]192-undine . The thought sent [her]192-undine memory flying back to things [she]192-undine had turned it from for years . For the first time since [their]3392-their far - off weeks together [she]192-undine let [herself]192-undine relive the brief adventure . [She]192-undine had been drawn to [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt from the first -- from the day when [Ben Frusk]397-ben frusk , [[Indiana]348-indiana 's brother]3393-indiana 's brother , had brought [him]212-moffatt to a church picnic at [[Mulvey]398-mulvey 's Grove]3394-mulvey 's grove , and [he]212-moffatt had taken instant possession of [Undine]192-undine , sitting in the big " stage "[212-moffatt] beside [her]192-undine on the " ride "[212-moffatt] to [the grove]3395-the grove , supplanting [Millard Binch]272-millard binch ( to whom [she]192-undine was still , though intermittently and incompletely , engaged ) , swinging [her]192-undine between the trees , rowing [her]192-undine on [the lake]2456-the lake , catching and kissing [her]192-undine in " forfeits , "[212-moffatt] awarding [her]192-undine the first prize in the Beauty Show [he]212-moffatt hilariously organized and gallantly carried out , and finally ( [no one]3844-no one knew how ) contriving to borrow [a buggy and a fast colt]3398-a buggy and a fast colt from old [Mulvey]398-mulvey , and driving off with [her]192-undine at a two - forty gait while [Millard]272-millard binch and [the others]652-the others took [their]652-the others dust in the crawling stage . [No one in [Apex]192-undine]3400-no one in apex knew where [young Moffatt]212-moffatt had come from , and [he]212-moffatt offered no information on the subject . [He]212-moffatt simply appeared one day behind the counter in [[Luckaback]399-luckaback 's Dollar Shoe - store]176-luckaback 's dollar shoe - store , drifted thence to [the office of [Semple]400-semple and [Binch]272-millard binch]3401-the office of semple and binch , [the coal - merchants]3402-the coal - merchants , reappeared as [the stenographer of the Police Court]3403-the stenographer of the police court , and finally edged [his]212-moffatt way into [the power - house of [the Apex Water - Works]3405-the apex water - works]3404-the power - house of the apex water - works . [He]212-moffatt boarded with [old Mrs. Flynn]401-old mrs. flynn , down in [North Fifth Street]177-north fifth street , on the edge of [the red - light slum]3406-the red - light slum , [he]212-moffatt never went to [church]3407-church or attended lectures , or showed any desire to improve or refine [himself]212-moffatt ; but [he]212-moffatt managed to get [himself]212-moffatt invited to all the picnics and [lodge sociables]3408-lodge sociables , and at a supper of [the Phi Upsilon Society]3409-the phi upsilon society , to which [he]212-moffatt had contrived to affiliate [himself]212-moffatt , [he]212-moffatt made the best speech that had been heard [there]603-there since [young Jim Rolliver]330-mrs. rolliver 's first flights . [The brothers of [Undine]192-undine 's friends]3411-the brothers of undine 's friends all pronounced [him]212-moffatt " great , "[403-bartlett] though [he]212-moffatt had fits of uncouthness that made [the young women]3412-the young women slower in admitting [him]212-moffatt to favour . But at [the Mulvey 's Grove picnic]3413-the mulvey 's grove picnic [he]212-moffatt suddenly seemed to dominate [them]3411-the brothers of undine 's friends all , and [Undine]192-undine , as [she]192-undine drove away with [him]212-moffatt , tasted the public triumph which was necessary to [her]192-undine personal enjoyment . After that [he]212-moffatt became [a leading figure in the youthful world of [Apex]192-undine]3414-a leading figure in the youthful world of apex , and [no one]3844-no one was surprised when [the Sons of [Jonadab]402-jonadab]3416-the sons of jonadab , ( [the local Temperance Society]3417-the local temperance society ) invited [him]212-moffatt to deliver [their]3416-the sons of jonadab Fourth of July oration . The ceremony took place , as usual , in [the Baptist church]3418-the baptist church , and [Undine]192-undine , all in white , with a red rose in [her]192-undine breast , sat just beneath [the platform]3419-the platform , with [Indiana]348-indiana jealously glaring at [her]192-undine from a less privileged seat , and poor [Millard]272-millard binch 's long neck craning over the row of [prominent citizens behind [the orator]3421-the orator]3420-prominent citizens behind the orator . [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt had been magnificent , rolling out [his]212-moffatt alternating effects of humour and pathos , stirring [[his]212-moffatt audience]3422-his audience by moving references to the Blue and the Gray , convulsing them by a new version of [Washington]305-washington square and the Cherry Tree ( in which [the infant patriot]3423-the infant patriot was depicted as having cut down the tree to check the deleterious spread of cherry bounce ) , dazzling [them]3422-his audience by [his]212-moffatt erudite allusions and apt quotations ( [he]212-moffatt confessed to [Undine]192-undine that [he]212-moffatt had sat up half the night over [Bartlett]403-bartlett ) , and winding up with a peroration that drew tears from [the Grand Army pensioners in the front row and caused [[the minister]3425-the minister 's wife]3426-the minister 's wife]3424-the grand army pensioners in the front row and caused the minister 's wife to say that many a sermon from [that platform]3427-that platform had been less uplifting . An ice - cream supper always followed the " exercises , "[5862-the " sons] and as repairs were being made in [the church basement]3428-the church basement , which was the usual scene of the festivity , [the minister]3425-the minister had offered the use of [[his]3425-the minister house]507-his house . The long table ran through the doorway between [parlour]3431-parlour and [study]3432-study , and another was set in [the passage]538-the passage outside , with one end under the stairs . The stair - rail was wreathed in fire - weed and early golden - rod , and Temperance texts in smilax decked the walls . When the first course had been despatched [the young ladies]3434-the young ladies , gallantly seconded by [the younger of [the " Sons]5862-the " sons]5861-the younger of the " sons , "[3425-the minister] helped to ladle out and carry in the ice - cream , which stood in great pails on the larder floor , and to replenish the jugs of lemonade and coffee . [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt was indefatigable in performing these services , and when [[the minister]3425-the minister 's wife]3426-the minister 's wife pressed [him]212-moffatt to sit down and take a mouthful [himself]212-moffatt [he]212-moffatt modestly declined the place reserved for [him]212-moffatt among [the dignitaries of the evening]3437-the dignitaries of the evening , and withdrew with [a few chosen spirits]3438-a few chosen spirits to the dim table - end beneath the stairs . Explosions of hilarity came from this corner with increasing frequency , and now and then tumultuous rappings and howls of " Song ! Song ! "[3425-the minister] followed by adjurations to " Cough it up "[3425-the minister] and " Let [her]3426-the minister 's wife go , "[3425-the minister] drowned the conversational efforts at the other table . At length the noise subsided , and [the group]3439-the group was ceasing to attract attention when , toward the end of the evening , the upper table , drooping under the lengthy elucubrations of [the minister]3425-the minister and [the President of [the Temperance Society]3442-the temperance society]3441-the president of the temperance society , called on [the orator of the day]3443-the orator of the day for a few remarks . There was an interval of scuffling and laughter beneath the stairs , and then [the minister]3425-the minister 's lifted hand enjoined silence and [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt got to [his]212-moffatt feet . " Step out where [the ladies]459-the ladies can hear [you]212-moffatt better , [Mr. Moffatt]212-moffatt ! "[212-moffatt] [the minister]3425-the minister called . [Moffatt]212-moffatt did so , steadying [himself]212-moffatt against the table and twisting [his]212-moffatt head about as if [his]212-moffatt collar had grown too tight . But if [his]212-moffatt bearing was vacillating [his]212-moffatt smile was unabashed , and there was no lack of confidence in the glance [he]212-moffatt threw at [Undine Spragg]192-undine as [he]212-moffatt began : " [Ladies]4255-ladies and [Gentlemen]3778-gentlemen , if there 's one thing [I]212-moffatt like better than another about getting drunk -- and [I]212-moffatt like most everything about it except the next morning -- it 's the opportunity [you]192-undine 've given [me]212-moffatt of doing it right here , in the presence of [this Society , which , as [I]212-moffatt gather from its literature]5866-this society , which , as i gather from its literature , knows more about the subject than [anybody else]5867-anybody else . [Ladies]4255-ladies and [Gentlemen"--he]404-gentlemen"--he[212-moffatt] straightened [himself]212-moffatt , and the table - cloth slid toward [him--"ever]192-undine since [you]192-undine honoured [me]3453-an irresponsible loafer with an invitation to address [you]192-undine from [the temperance platform]5869-the temperance platform [I]3453-an irresponsible loafer 've been assiduously studying that literature ; and [I]3453-an irresponsible loafer 've gathered from [your]192-undine own evidence -- what [I]3453-an irresponsible loafer 'd strongly suspected before -- that all [[your]192-undine converted drunkards]5870-your converted drunkards had a hell of a good time before [you]192-undine got at 'em , and that ... and that a good many of 'em have gone on having it since ... "[3453-an irresponsible loafer] At this point [he]212-moffatt broke off , swept [the audience]925-the audience with [his]212-moffatt confident smile , and then , collapsing , tried to sit down on a chair that did n't happen to be [there]603-there , and disappeared among [[his]212-moffatt agitated supporters]3448-his agitated supporters . There was a night - mare moment during which [Undine]192-undine , through the doorway , saw [Ben Frusk]397-ben frusk and [the others close about the fallen orator]3449-the others close about the fallen orator to the crash of crockery and tumbling chairs ; then [some one]993-some one jumped up and shut the parlour door , and [a long - necked Sunday school teacher , who had been nervously waiting [his]3451-a long - necked sunday school teacher , who had been nervously waiting his chance , and had almost given it up chance , and had almost given it up]3451-a long - necked sunday school teacher , who had been nervously waiting his chance , and had almost given it up , rose from [his]3451-a long - necked sunday school teacher , who had been nervously waiting his chance , and had almost given it up feet and recited High Tide at [Gettysburg]178-gettysburg amid hysterical applause . The scandal was considerable , but [Moffatt]212-moffatt , though [he]212-moffatt vanished from the social horizon , managed to keep [his]212-moffatt place in [the power - house]3452-the power - house till [he]212-moffatt went off for a week and turned up again without being able to give a satisfactory reason for [his]212-moffatt absence . After that [he]212-moffatt drifted from one job to another , now extolled for [his]212-moffatt " smartness "[192-undine] and business capacity , now dismissed in disgrace as [an irresponsible loafer]3453-an irresponsible loafer . [His]212-moffatt head was always full of immense nebulous schemes for the enlargement and development of [any business [he]212-moffatt happened to be employed in]3454-any business he happened to be employed in . Sometimes [his]212-moffatt suggestions interested [[his]212-moffatt employers]3455-his employers , but proved unpractical and inapplicable ; sometimes [he]212-moffatt wore out [their]3455-his employers patience or was thought to be [a dangerous dreamer]3456-a dangerous dreamer . Whenever [he]212-moffatt found there was no hope of [his]212-moffatt ideas being adopted [he]212-moffatt lost interest in [his]212-moffatt work , came late and left early , or disappeared for two or three days at a time without troubling [himself]212-moffatt to account for [his]212-moffatt absences . At last even [those who had been cynical enough to smile over [his]212-moffatt disgrace at the temperance supper]3457-those who had been cynical enough to smile over his disgrace at the temperance supper began to speak of [him]212-moffatt as a hopeless failure , and [he]212-moffatt lost the support of [the feminine community]3458-the feminine community when one Sunday morning , just as [the Baptist and Methodist churches]3459-the baptist and methodist churches were releasing [[their]3459-the baptist and methodist churches congregations]3460-their congregations , [he]212-moffatt walked up [Eubaw Avenue]179-eubaw avenue with [a young woman]3461-a young woman less known to [those sacred edifices]3462-those sacred edifices than to [the saloons of [North Fifth Street]177-north fifth street]3463-the saloons of north fifth street . [Undine]192-undine 's estimate of [people]560-people had always been based on [their]560-people apparent power of getting what [they]560-people wanted -- provided it came under the category of things [she]192-undine understood wanting . [Success]405-success was beauty and romance to [her]192-undine ; yet it was at the moment when [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt 's failure was most complete and flagrant that [she]192-undine suddenly felt the extent of [his]212-moffatt power . After the [Eubaw Avenue]179-eubaw avenue scandal [he]212-moffatt had been asked not to return to [[the surveyor]3465-the surveyor 's office]3466-the surveyor 's office to which [Ben Frusk]397-ben frusk had managed to get [him]212-moffatt admitted ; and on the day of [his]212-moffatt dismissal [he]212-moffatt met [Undine]192-undine in [Main Street]180-main street , at the shopping hour , and , sauntering up cheerfully , invited [her]192-undine to take a walk with [him]212-moffatt . [She]192-undine was about to refuse when [she]192-undine saw [[Millard Binch]272-millard binch 's mother]3467-millard binch 's mother looking at [her]192-undine disapprovingly from [the opposite street - corner]3468-the opposite street - corner . " Oh , well , [I]212-moffatt will-- "[212-moffatt] [she]192-undine said ; and [they]3469-they walked the length of [Main Street]180-main street and out to [the immature park in which [it]3471-it ended]3470-the immature park in which it ended . [She]192-undine was in a mood of aimless discontent and unrest , tired of [her]192-undine engagement to [Millard Binch]272-millard binch , disappointed with [Moffatt]212-moffatt , half - ashamed of being seen with [him]212-moffatt , and yet not sorry to have it known that [she]192-undine was independent enough to choose [[her]192-undine companions]662-her companions without regard to the Apex verdict . " Well , [I]192-undine suppose [you]192-undine know [I]192-undine 'm down and out , "[192-undine] [he]212-moffatt began ; and [she]192-undine responded virtuously : " [You]212-moffatt must have wanted to be , or [you]212-moffatt would n't have behaved the way [you]212-moffatt did last Sunday . "[212-moffatt] " Oh , shucks ! "[212-moffatt] [he]212-moffatt sneered . " What do [I]212-moffatt care , in [a one - horse place like this]5871-a one - horse place like this ? If it had n't been for [you]212-moffatt [I]212-moffatt 'd have got a move on long ago . "[212-moffatt] [She]192-undine did not remember afterward what else [he]212-moffatt said : [she]192-undine recalled only the expression of a great sweeping scorn of [Apex]192-undine , into which [her]192-undine own disdain of it was absorbed like a drop in [the sea]4754-the sea , and the affirmation of a soaring self - confidence that seemed to lift [her]192-undine on wings . All [her]192-undine own attempts to get what [she]192-undine wanted had come to nothing ; but [she]192-undine had always attributed [her]192-undine lack of success to the fact that [she]192-undine had had [no one]3844-no one to second [her]192-undine . It was strange that [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt , [a shiftless out - cast from even [the small world [she]192-undine despised]3476-the small world she despised]3475-a shiftless out - cast from even the small world she despised , should give [her]192-undine , in the very moment of [his]212-moffatt downfall , the sense of being able to succeed where [she]192-undine had failed . It was a feeling [she]192-undine never had in [his]212-moffatt absence , but that [his]212-moffatt nearness always instantly revived ; and [he]212-moffatt seemed nearer to [her]192-undine now than [he]212-moffatt had ever been . [They]3477-they wandered on to [the edge of [the vague park]3479-the vague park]3478-the edge of the vague park , and sat down on a bench behind the empty band - stand . " [I]212-moffatt went with [that girl]5872-that girl on purpose , and [you]192-undine know it , "[212-moffatt] [he]212-moffatt broke out abruptly . " It makes [me]192-undine too damned sick to see [Millard Binch]272-millard binch going round looking as if [he]212-moffatt 'd patented [you]192-undine . "[192-undine] " [You]212-moffatt 've got no right-- "[192-undine] [she]192-undine interrupted ; and suddenly [she]192-undine was in [his]212-moffatt arms , and feeling that [no one]3844-no one had ever kissed [her]192-undine before .... The week that followed was a big bright blur -- the wildest vividest moment of [her]192-undine life . And it was only eight days later that [they]3477-they were in [the train]4147-the train together , [Apex]192-undine and all [her]192-undine plans and promises behind [them]3477-they , and a bigger and brighter blur ahead , into which [they]3477-they were plunging as the " Limited "[348-indiana] plunged into the sunset .... [Undine]192-undine stood up , looking about [her]192-undine with vague eyes , as if [she]192-undine had come back from a long distance . [Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt was still in [Paris]76-paris -- [he]212-moffatt was in reach , within telephone - call . [She]192-undine stood hesitating a moment ; then [she]192-undine went into [[her]192-undine dressing - room]3482-her dressing - room , and turning over the pages of the telephone book , looked out the number of the Nouveau Luxe .... [XLIV Undine]192-undine had been right in supposing that [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband would expect [their]3477-they life to go on as before . There was no appreciable change in the situation save that [he]212-moffatt was more often absent - finding abundant reasons , agricultural and political , for frequent trips to [Saint Desert]162-saint desert -- and that , when in [Paris]76-paris , [he]212-moffatt no longer showed any curiosity concerning [her]192-undine occupations and engagements . [They]3477-they lived as much apart is if [[their]3477-they cramped domicile]3484-their cramped domicile had been [a palace]4263-a palace ; and when [Undine]192-undine -- as [she]192-undine now frequently did -- joined [the Shallums]298-the shallums or [Rollivers]347-the rollivers for a dinner at [the Nouveau Luxe]2072-the nouveau luxe , or a party at [a petit theatre]3487-a petit theatre , [she]192-undine was not put to the trouble of prevaricating . [Her]192-undine first impulse , after [her]192-undine scene with [Raymond]382-raymond , had been to ring up [Indiana Rolliver]348-indiana and invite [herself]192-undine to dine . It chanced that [Indiana]348-indiana ( who was now in full social progress , and had " run over "[3497-them] for a few weeks to get [her]348-indiana dresses for [Newport]97-newport ) had organized for the same evening a showy cosmopolitan banquet in which [she]192-undine was enchanted to include [the Marquise de Chelles]371-the marquise de chelles ; and [Undine]192-undine , as [she]192-undine had hoped , found [[Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt of [the party]2119-the party]3488-elmer moffatt of the party . When [she]192-undine drove up to [the Nouveau Luxe]2072-the nouveau luxe [she]192-undine had not fixed on any plan of action ; but once [she]192-undine had crossed its magic threshold [her]192-undine energies revived like plants in water . At last [she]192-undine was in [her]192-undine native air again , among associations [she]192-undine shared and conventions [she]192-undine understood ; and all [her]192-undine self - confidence returned as the familiar accents uttered the accustomed things . Save for an occasional perfunctory call , [she]192-undine had hitherto made no effort to see [[her]192-undine compatriots]2171-her compatriots , and [she]192-undine noticed that [Mrs. Jim Driscoll]306-young jim driscoll and [Bertha Shallum]297-bertha shallum received [her]192-undine with a touch of constraint ; but it vanished when [they]3492-they remarked the cordiality of [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's greeting . [Her]192-undine seat was at [his]212-moffatt side , and [her]192-undine old sense of triumph returned as [she]192-undine perceived the importance [his]212-moffatt notice conferred , not only in the eyes of [[her]192-undine own party]3493-her own party but of [the other diners]3494-the other diners . [Moffatt]212-moffatt was evidently a notable figure in all the worlds represented about the crowded tables , and [Undine]192-undine saw that [many people who seemed personally unacquainted with [him]212-moffatt]3495-many people who seemed personally unacquainted with him were recognizing and pointing [him]212-moffatt out . [She]192-undine was conscious of receiving a large share of the attention [he]212-moffatt attracted , and , bathed again in the bright air of publicity , [she]192-undine remembered the evening when [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond ' first admiring glance had given [her]192-undine the same sense of triumph . This inopportune memory did not trouble [her]192-undine : [she]192-undine was almost grateful to [Raymond]382-raymond for giving [her]192-undine the touch of superiority [[her]192-undine compatriots]2171-her compatriots clearly felt in [her]192-undine . It was not merely [her]192-undine title and [her]192-undine " situation , "[212-moffatt] but the experiences [she]192-undine had gained through [them]3497-them , that gave [her]192-undine this advantage over [the loud vague company]3498-the loud vague company . [She]192-undine had learned things [they]2171-her compatriots did not guess : shades of conduct , turns of speech , tricks of attitude -- and easy and free and enviable as [she]192-undine thought them , [she]192-undine would not for [the world]620-the world have been back among [them]2171-her compatriots at the cost of knowing no more than [they]2171-her compatriots . [Moffatt]212-moffatt made no allusion to [his]212-moffatt visit to [Saint Desert]162-saint desert ; but when [the party]2119-the party had re - grouped itself about coffee and liqueurs on [the terrace]2120-the terrace , [he]212-moffatt bent over to ask confidentially : " What about [my]192-undine tapestries ? "[192-undine] [She]192-undine replied in the same tone : " [You]212-moffatt ought n't to have let [Fleischhauer]393-mr. fleischhauer write that letter . [[My]212-moffatt husband]4486-my husband 's furious . "[212-moffatt] [He]212-moffatt seemed honestly surprised . " Why ? Did n't [I]192-undine offer [him]4486-my husband enough ? "[192-undine] " [He]4486-my husband 's furious that [any one]659-any one should offer anything . [I]3505-i thought when [he]4486-my husband found out what they were worth [he]4486-my husband might be tempted ; but [he]4486-my husband 'd rather see [me]3505-i starve than part with one of [[his]4486-my husband grand - father]5875-his grand - father 's snuff - boxes . "[3505-i] " Well , [he]4486-my husband knows now what the tapestries are worth . [I]212-moffatt offered more than [Fleischhauer]393-mr. fleischhauer advised . "[212-moffatt] " Yes ; but [you]212-moffatt were in too much of a hurry . "[3502-her] " [I]3502-her 've got to be ; [I]3502-her 'm going back next week . "[3502-her] [She]3502-her felt [her]3502-her eyes cloud with disappointment . " Oh , why do [you]212-moffatt ? [I]3505-i hoped [you]212-moffatt might stay on . "[3505-i] " Why not ? Why wo n't [you]212-moffatt come and see [me]192-undine ? [I]192-undine 've always wanted to be [friends]5085-friends . "[192-undine] [He]3505-i came the next day and found in [[her]3502-her drawing - room]5198-her drawing - room [two ladies whom [she]3502-her introduced as [[her]3502-her sisters - in - law]3508-her sisters - in - law]3507-two ladies whom she introduced as her sisters - in - law . [The ladies]459-the ladies lingered on for a long time , sipping [their]459-the ladies tea stiffly and exchanging low - voiced remarks while [Undine]192-undine talked with [Moffatt]212-moffatt ; and when [they]459-the ladies left , with small sidelong bows in [his]212-moffatt direction . [Undine]192-undine exclaimed : " Now [you]212-moffatt see how [they]459-the ladies all watch [me]212-moffatt ! "[212-moffatt] [She]192-undine began to go into the details of [her]192-undine married life , drawing on the experiences of the first months for instances that scarcely applied to [her]192-undine present liberated state . [She]192-undine could thus , without great exaggeration , picture [herself]192-undine as entrapped into a bondage hardly conceivable to [Moffatt]212-moffatt , and [she]192-undine saw [him]212-moffatt redden with excitement as [he]212-moffatt listened . " [I]192-undine call it darned low -- darned low-- "[192-undine] [he]212-moffatt broke in at intervals . " Of course [I]212-moffatt go round more now , "[212-moffatt] [she]192-undine concluded . " [I]192-undine mean to see [[my]192-undine friends]4627-my friends -- [I]192-undine do n't care what [he]212-moffatt says . "[192-undine] " What CAN [he]212-moffatt say ? "[212-moffatt] " Well , [I]192-undine guess [we]3510-they can still sit up and take nourishment . "[192-undine] [They]3510-they laughed and slipped back to talking of earlier things . [She]192-undine urged [him]212-moffatt to put off [his]212-moffatt sailing -- there were so many things [they]3510-they might do together : sight - seeing and excursions -- and [she]192-undine could perhaps show [him]212-moffatt some of the private collections [he]212-moffatt had n't seen , the ones it was hard to get admitted to . This instantly roused [his]212-moffatt attention , and after naming one or two collections [he]212-moffatt had already seen [she]192-undine hit on one [he]212-moffatt had found inaccessible and was particularly anxious to visit . " There 's an [Ingres]407-ingres [there]603-there that 's one of the things [I]192-undine came over to have a look at ; but [I]192-undine was told there was no use trying . "[192-undine] " Oh , [I]192-undine can easily manage it : [[the Duke]3124-the duke 's [Raymond]382-raymond 's uncle]5881-the duke 's raymond 's uncle . " But [he]212-moffatt 's down in [the country]424-the country this week , "[192-undine] [she]192-undine continued , " and [no one]3844-no one -- not even [the family]2345-the family -- is allowed to see the pictures when [he]212-moffatt 's away . "[192-undine] [She]192-undine ran it off glibly , though a year ago [she]192-undine had never heard of [the painter]663-the painter , and did not , even now , remember whether [he]663-the painter was [an Old Master]3513-an old master or one of the very new ones whose names [one had n't had time to learn]3514-one had n't had time to learn . [Moffatt]212-moffatt put off sailing , saw [the Duke 's Ingres]3515-the duke 's ingres under [her]192-undine guidance , and accompanied [her]192-undine to [various other private galleries inaccessible to [strangers]4990-strangers]3516-various other private galleries inaccessible to strangers . [She]192-undine had lived in almost total ignorance of such opportunities , but now that [she]192-undine could use them to advantage [she]192-undine showed a surprising quickness in picking up " tips , "[3229-the marquise] ferreting out rare things and getting a sight of hidden treasures . [She]192-undine even acquired as much of the jargon as [a pretty woman]1804-a pretty woman needs to produce the impression of being well - informed ; and [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's sailing was more than once postponed . [They]3519-they saw [each other]3877-each other almost daily , for [she]192-undine continued to come and go as [she]192-undine pleased , and [Raymond]382-raymond showed neither surprise nor disapproval . When [they]3519-they were asked to [family]3521-family dinners [she]192-undine usually excused [herself]192-undine at the last moment on the plea of a headache and , calling up [Indiana]348-indiana or [Bertha Shallum]297-bertha shallum , improvised a little party at [the Nouveau Luxe]2072-the nouveau luxe ; and on other occasions [she]192-undine accepted such invitations as [she]192-undine chose , without mentioning to [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband where [she]192-undine was going . In this world of lavish pleasures [she]192-undine lost what little prudence the discipline of [Saint Desert]162-saint desert had inculcated . [She]192-undine could never be with [people who had all the things [she]192-undine envied without being hypnotized into the belief that [she]192-undine had only to put [her]192-undine hand out to obtain them , and all the unassuaged rancours and hungers of [her]192-undine early days in [West End Avenue]11-west end avenue]3524-people who had all the things she envied without being hypnotized into the belief that she had only to put her hand out to obtain them , and all the unassuaged rancours and hungers of her early days in west end avenue came back with increased acuity . [She]192-undine knew [her]192-undine wants so much better now , and was so much more worthy of the things [she]192-undine wanted ! [She]192-undine had given up hoping that [[her]192-undine father]614-her father might make another hit in [Wall Street]47-wall street . [Mrs. Spragg]194-mrs. spragg 's letters gave the impression that the days of big strokes were over for [[her]194-mrs. spragg husband]488-her husband , that [he]488-her husband had gone down in the conflict with forces beyond [his]488-her husband measure . If [he]488-her husband had remained in [Apex]192-undine the tide of its new prosperity might have carried [him]488-her husband to wealth ; but [New York]8-new york 's huge waves of success had submerged instead of floating [him]488-her husband , and [Rolliver]348-indiana 's enmity was a hand perpetually stretched out to strike [him]488-her husband lower . At most , [Mr. Spragg]191-mr. spragg 's tenacity would keep [him]488-her husband at the level [he]488-her husband now held , and though [he]191-mr. spragg and [[his]191-mr. spragg wife]512-his wife had still further simplified [their]3528-their way of living [Undine]192-undine understood that [their]3528-their self - denial would not increase [her]192-undine opportunities . [She]192-undine felt no compunction in continuing to accept an undiminished allowance : it was the hereditary habit of [the parent animal]3529-the parent animal to despoil [himself]3529-the parent animal for [his]3529-the parent animal progeny . But this conviction did not seem incompatible with a sentimental pity for [[her]192-undine parents]551-her parents . Aside from all interested motives , [she]192-undine wished for [their]3528-their own sakes that [they]3528-their were better off . [Their]3528-their personal requirements were pathetically limited , but renewed prosperity would at least have procured [them]3528-their the happiness of giving [her]192-undine what [she]192-undine wanted . [Moffatt]212-moffatt lingered on ; but [he]212-moffatt began to speak more definitely of sailing , and [Undine]192-undine foresaw the day when , strong as [her]192-undine attraction was , stronger influences would snap it like a thread . [She]192-undine knew [she]192-undine interested and amused [him]212-moffatt , and that it flattered [his]212-moffatt vanity to be seen with [her]192-undine , and to hear that rumour coupled [their]3528-their names ; but [he]212-moffatt gave [her]192-undine , more than [any one [she]192-undine had ever known]3531-any one she had ever known , the sense of being detached from [his]212-moffatt life , in control of it , and able , without weakness or uncertainty , to choose which of its calls [he]212-moffatt should obey . If the call were that of business -- of any of the great perilous affairs [he]212-moffatt handled like a snake - charmer spinning the deadly reptiles about [his]212-moffatt head -- [she]192-undine knew [she]192-undine would drop from [his]212-moffatt life like a loosened leaf . These anxieties sharpened the intensity of [her]192-undine enjoyment , and made the contrast keener between [her]192-undine crowded sparkling hours and the vacant months at [Saint Desert]162-saint desert . Little as [she]192-undine understood of the qualities that made [Moffatt]212-moffatt what [he]212-moffatt was , the results were of the kind most palpable to [her]192-undine . [He]212-moffatt used life exactly as [she]192-undine would have used it in [[his]212-moffatt place]3532-his place . Some of [his]212-moffatt enjoyments were beyond [her]192-undine range , but even these appealed to [her]192-undine because of the money that was required to gratify [them]3533-them . When [she]192-undine took [him]212-moffatt to see some inaccessible picture , or went with [him]212-moffatt to inspect the treasures of [a famous dealer]3534-a famous dealer , [she]192-undine saw that the things [he]212-moffatt looked at moved [him]212-moffatt in a way [she]192-undine could not understand , and that the actual touching of rare textures -- bronze or marble , or velvets flushed with the bloom of age -- gave [him]212-moffatt sensations like those [her]192-undine own beauty had once roused in [him]212-moffatt . But the next moment [he]212-moffatt was laughing over some commonplace joke , or absorbed in a long cipher cable handed to [him]212-moffatt as [they]3535-they re - entered the Nouveau Luxe for tea , and [his]212-moffatt aesthetic emotions had been thrust back into their own compartment of the great steel strong - box of [his]212-moffatt mind . [Her]192-undine new life went on without comment or interference from [[her]192-undine husband]488-her husband , and [she]192-undine saw that [he]212-moffatt had accepted [their]3535-they altered relation , and intended merely to keep up an external semblance of harmony . To that semblance [she]192-undine knew [he]212-moffatt attached intense importance : it was an article of [his]212-moffatt complicated social creed that [a man of [[his]212-moffatt class]5292-his class should appear to live on good terms with [[his]212-moffatt wife]512-his wife]3537-a man of his class should appear to live on good terms with his wife . For different reasons it was scarcely less important to [Undine]192-undine : [she]192-undine had no wish to affront again the social reprobation that had so nearly wrecked [her]192-undine . But [she]192-undine could not keep up the life [she]192-undine was leading without more money , a great deal more money ; and the thought of contracting [her]192-undine expenditure was no longer tolerable . One afternoon , several weeks later , [she]192-undine came in to find [[a tradesman]3540-a tradesman 's representative]3541-a tradesman 's representative waiting with a bill . There was a noisy scene in [the anteroom]3542-the anteroom before [the man]1579-the man threateningly withdrew -- a scene witnessed by [the servants]3544-the servants , and overheard by [[her]192-undine mother - in - law]5602-her mother - in - law , whom [she]192-undine found seated in [the drawing - room]439-the drawing - room when [she]192-undine entered . [The old Marquise]5654-the old marquise 's visits to [[her]5654-the old marquise daughter - in - law]5502-her daughter - in - law were made at long intervals but with ritual regularity ; [she]5654-the old marquise called every other Friday at five , and [Undine]192-undine had forgotten that [she]192-undine was due that day . This did not make for greater cordiality between [them]3549-them , and the altercation in [the anteroom]3542-the anteroom had been too loud for concealment . [The Marquise]3229-the marquise was on [her]3229-the marquise feet when [[her]3229-the marquise daughter - in - law]5502-her daughter - in - law came in , and instantly said with lowered eyes : " It would perhaps be best for [me]3229-the marquise to go . "[3229-the marquise] " Oh , [I]3229-the marquise do n't care . [You]3229-the marquise 're welcome to tell [Raymond]382-raymond [you]3229-the marquise 've heard [me]3229-the marquise insulted because [I]3229-the marquise 'm too poor to pay [my]3229-the marquise bills -- [he]382-raymond knows it well enough already ! "[3229-the marquise] The words broke from [Undine]192-undine unguardedly , but once spoken they nourished [her]192-undine defiance . " [I]3229-the marquise 'm sure [[my]3229-the marquise son]4359-my son has frequently recommended greater prudence-- "[3229-the marquise] [the Marquise]3229-the marquise murmured . " Yes ! "[3229-the marquise] " [Raymond]382-raymond has told [me]3229-the marquise that there are certain things [you]3229-the marquise fail to understand -- [I]3229-the marquise have no wish whatever to discuss them . "[3229-the marquise] [The Marquise]3229-the marquise had gone toward the door ; with [her]3229-the marquise hand on it [she]3229-the marquise paused to add : " [I]212-moffatt shall say nothing whatever of what has happened . "[212-moffatt] [Her]3229-the marquise icy magnanimity added the last touch to [Undine]192-undine 's wrath . [They]3555-they knew [her]3229-the marquise extremity , one and all , and it did not move [them]3555-they . At most , [they]3555-they would join in concealing it like a blot on [their]3555-they honour . And the menace grew and mounted , and not a hand was stretched to help [her]3229-the marquise .... Hardly a half - hour earlier [Moffatt]212-moffatt , with whom [she]3229-the marquise had been visiting a " private view , "[212-moffatt] had sent [her]3229-the marquise home in [[his]212-moffatt motor]3556-his motor with the excuse that [he]212-moffatt must hurry back to [the Nouveau Luxe]2072-the nouveau luxe to meet [[his]212-moffatt stenographer]3558-his stenographer and sign a batch of letters for the [New York]8-new york mail . It was therefore probable that [he]212-moffatt was still at [home]548-home -- that [she]3229-the marquise should find [him]212-moffatt if [she]3229-the marquise hastened [there]603-there at once . An overwhelming desire to cry out [her]3229-the marquise wrath and wretchedness brought [her]3229-the marquise to [her]3229-the marquise feet and sent [her]3229-the marquise down to hail [a passing cab]3561-a passing cab . As it whirled [her]3229-the marquise through [the bright streets]3562-the bright streets powdered with amber sunlight [her]3229-the marquise brain throbbed with confused intentions . [She]3229-the marquise did not think of [Moffatt]212-moffatt as a power [she]3229-the marquise could use , but simply as [some one who knew [her]3229-the marquise and understood [her]3229-the marquise grievance]3563-some one who knew her and understood her grievance . At [the hotel]819-the hotel [she]3229-the marquise asked [his]212-moffatt number and was carried up in [the lift]3566-the lift . On [the landing]1741-the landing [she]3229-the marquise paused a moment , disconcerted -- it had occurred to [her]3229-the marquise that [he]212-moffatt might not be alone . But [she]3229-the marquise walked on quickly , found the number and knocked .... " [Hullo]408-hullo ! "[3229-the marquise] [he]212-moffatt exclaimed , surprised ; and as [he]212-moffatt stood aside to let [her]3229-the marquise enter [she]3229-the marquise saw [him]212-moffatt draw out [his]212-moffatt watch and glance at it surreptitiously . [He]212-moffatt was expecting [someone]3569-someone , or [he]212-moffatt had an engagement elsewhere -- something claimed [him]212-moffatt from which [she]3229-the marquise was excluded . [She]3229-the marquise knew now what [she]3229-the marquise had come for -- to keep [him]212-moffatt from [every one else]1469-every one else , to keep [him]212-moffatt for [herself]3229-the marquise alone . " Do n't send [me]192-undine away ! "[192-undine] [she]3229-the marquise said , and laid [her]3229-the marquise hand on [his]212-moffatt beseechingly . XLV [She]3229-the marquise advanced into [the room]441-the room and slowly looked about [her]3229-the marquise . The big vulgar writing - table wreathed in bronze was heaped with letters and papers . Among them stood a lapis bowl in a Renaissance mounting of enamel and a vase of Phenician glass that was like a bit of rainbow caught in cobwebs . On a table against the window a little Greek marble lifted its pure lines . On every side some rare and sensitive object seemed to be shrinking back from the false colours and crude contours of the hotel furniture . There were no books in [the room]441-the room , but the florid console under the mirror was stacked with old numbers of Town Talk and [the New [York]17-york Radiator]3573-the new york radiator . [Undine]192-undine recalled [the dingy hall - room that [Moffatt]212-moffatt had lodged in at [Mrs. Flynn]401-old mrs. flynn 's]3574-the dingy hall - room that moffatt had lodged in at mrs. flynn 's , over [Hober 's livery stable]3575-hober 's livery stable , and [her]192-undine heart beat at the signs of [his]212-moffatt altered state . " And that 's what [you]212-moffatt 're proposing to [me]3586-i ? That [you]212-moffatt and [I]3586-i should do like the rest of ['em]156-opake ? "[3586-i] [His]3582-his face had lost its comic roundness and grown harsh and dark , as it had when [[her]3576-she father]614-her father had taken [her]3576-she away from [him]3582-his at [Opake]156-opake . [He]3582-his turned on [his]3582-his heel , walked the length of [the room]441-the room and halted with [his]3582-his back to [her]3576-she in the embrasure of the window . Then [he]3582-his turned and spoke from where [he]3582-his stood . " Look here . "[3604-he] XLVI In [the great high - ceilinged library of [a private hotel]3599-a private hotel overlooking [one of [the new quarters of]3601-the new quarters of [Paris]76-paris]3600-one of the new quarters of paris]3598-the great high - ceilinged library of a private hotel overlooking one of the new quarters of paris , [Paul Marvell]218-paul stood listlessly gazing out into the twilight . The trees were budding symmetrically along [the avenue below]1733-the avenue below ; and [Paul]218-paul , looking down , saw , between windows and tree - tops , a pair of tall iron gates with gilt ornaments , the marble curb of [a semi - circular drive]3603-a semi - circular drive , and bands of spring flowers set in turf . [He]3604-he was now [a big boy of nearly nine]3605-a big boy of nearly nine , who went to [a fashionable private school]3606-a fashionable private school , and [he]3604-he had come [home]548-home that day for the Easter holidays . [He]3604-he had not been back since Christmas , and it was the first time [he]3604-he had seen [the new hotel which [[his]3604-he step - father]3255-his step - father had bought]3608-the new hotel which his step - father had bought , and in which [Mr.]3610-mr. and [Mrs. Moffatt]411-mrs. moffatt had hastily established [themselves]3611-they , a few weeks earlier , on [their]3611-they return from a flying trip to [America]77-america . [They]3611-they were always coming and going ; during the two years since [their]3611-they marriage [they]3611-they had been perpetually dashing over to [New York]8-new york and back , or rushing down to [Rome]71-rome or up to [the Engadine]288-the engadine : [Paul]218-paul never knew where [they]3611-they were except when a telegram announced that [they]3611-they were going somewhere else . [He]3604-he did not even know that there was any method of communication between [mothers]3612-mothers and [sons less laconic than that of the electric wire]3613-sons less laconic than that of the electric wire ; and once , when [a boy at school]3614-a boy at school asked [him]3604-he if [[his]3604-he mother]3752-his mother often wrote , [he]3604-he had answered in all sincerity : " Oh yes -- [I]3654-a servant passing with a tray - full of glasses got a telegram last week . "[3654-a servant passing with a tray - full of glasses] [He]3604-he had been almost sure -- as sure as [he]3604-he ever was of anything -- that [he]3604-he should find [her]3752-his mother at [home]548-home when [he]3604-he arrived ; but a message ( for [she]3752-his mother had n't had time to telegraph ) apprised [him]3604-he that [she]3752-his mother and [Mr. Moffatt]212-moffatt had run down to [Deauville]163-deauville to look at [a house [they]3618-they thought of hiring for the summer]3617-a house they thought of hiring for the summer ; [they]3618-they were taking [an early train]3619-an early train back , and would be at [home]548-home for dinner -- were in fact having a lot of [people]560-people to dine . It was just what [he]3604-he ought to have expected , and had been used to ever since [he]3604-he could remember ; and generally [he]3604-he did n't much mind , especially since [[his]3604-he mother]3752-his mother had become [Mrs. Moffatt]411-mrs. moffatt , and [the father [he]3604-he had been most used to]3623-the father he had been most used to , and liked best , had abruptly disappeared from [his]3604-he life . But [the new hotel]3624-the new hotel was big and strange , and [[his]3604-he own room]1726-his own room , in which there was not a toy or a book , or one of [his]3604-he dear battered relics ( [none of [the new servants]3627-the new servants]3626-none of the new servants -- [they]3627-the new servants were always new -- could find [his]3604-he things , or think where they had been put ) , seemed the loneliest spot in [the whole house]3628-the whole house . [He]3604-he had gone up [there]603-there after [his]3604-he solitary luncheon , served in [the immense marble dining - room]3630-the immense marble dining - room by [a footman on the same scale]3631-a footman on the same scale , and had tried to occupy [himself]3604-he with pasting post - cards into [his]3604-he album ; but the newness and sumptuousness of [the room]441-the room embarrassed [him]3604-he -- the white fur rugs and brocade chairs seemed maliciously on the watch for smears and ink - spots -- and after a while [he]3604-he pushed the album aside and began to roam through [the house]623-the house . [He]3604-he went to all [the rooms]5066-the rooms in turn : [[[his]3604-he mother]3752-his mother 's first]3636-his mother 's first , [the wonderful lacy bedroom]3637-the wonderful lacy bedroom , all pale silks and velvets , artful mirrors and veiled lamps , and the boudoir as big as [a drawing - room]4272-a drawing - room , with pictures [he]3604-he would have liked to know about , and tables and cabinets holding things [he]3604-he was afraid to touch . [[Mr. Moffatt]212-moffatt 's rooms]3639-mr. moffatt 's rooms came next . They were soberer and darker , but as big and splendid ; and in [the bedroom]3640-the bedroom , on the brown wall , hung a single picture -- the portrait of [a boy in grey velvet]3641-a boy in grey velvet -- that interested [Paul]218-paul most of all . [The boy]4296-the boy 's hand rested on the head of a big dog , and [he]3604-he looked infinitely noble and charming , and yet ( in spite of the dog ) so sad and lonely that [he]3604-he too might have come [home]548-home that very day to [a strange house in which none of [his]3604-he old things could be found]3644-a strange house in which none of his old things could be found . From [these rooms]3645-these rooms [Paul]218-paul wandered [downstairs]3746-downstairs again . [The library]2996-the library attracted [him]3604-he most : there were rows and rows of books , bound in dim browns and golds , and old faded reds as rich as velvet : they all looked as if [they]3639-mr. moffatt 's rooms might have had stories in them as splendid as [their]3639-mr. moffatt 's rooms bindings . But the bookcases were closed with gilt trellising , and when [Paul]218-paul reached up to open one , [a servant]2208-a servant told [him]3604-he that [[Mr. Moffatt]212-moffatt 's secretary]3649-mr. moffatt 's secretary kept them locked because the books were too valuable to be taken down . This seemed to make [the library]2996-the library as strange as [the rest of [the house]623-the house]2369-the rest of the house , and [he]3604-he passed on to [the ballroom at the back]3653-the ballroom at the back . Through [its]3653-the ballroom at the back closed doors [he]3604-he heard a sound of hammering , and when [he]3604-he tried the door - handle [a servant passing with a tray - full of glasses]3654-a servant passing with a tray - full of glasses told [him]3604-he that " [they]3657-mr. moffatt 's ancestors "[193-mrs. heeny] had n't finished , and would n't let [anybody]3822-anybody in . The mysterious pronoun somehow increased [Paul]218-paul 's sense of isolation , and [he]3604-he went on to [the drawing - rooms]3656-the drawing - rooms , steering [his]3604-he way prudently between the gold arm - chairs and shining tables , and wondering whether the wigged and corseleted heroes on the walls represented [[Mr. Moffatt]212-moffatt 's ancestors]3657-mr. moffatt 's ancestors , and why , if [they]3657-mr. moffatt 's ancestors did , [he]3604-he looked so little like [them]3657-mr. moffatt 's ancestors . [The dining - room beyond]3658-the dining - room beyond was more amusing , because [busy servants]3659-busy servants were already laying the long table . It was too early for [the florist]3660-the florist , and the centre of the table was empty , but down the sides were gold baskets heaped with pulpy summer fruits - figs , strawberries and big blushing nectarines . Between them stood crystal decanters with red and yellow wine , and little dishes full of sweets ; and against the walls were sideboards with great pieces of gold and silver , ewers and urns and branching candelabra , which sprinkled the green marble walls with starlike reflections . After a while [he]3604-he grew tired of watching the coming and going of [white - sleeved footmen]3661-white - sleeved footmen , and of listening to [the butler]3662-the butler 's vociferated orders , and strayed back into [the library]2996-the library . The habit of solitude had given [him]3604-he a passion for the printed page , and if [he]3604-he could have found a book anywhere -- any kind of a book -- [he]3604-he would have forgotten the long hours and [the empty house]5484-the empty house . But the tables in [the library]2996-the library held only massive unused inkstands and immense immaculate blotters ; not a single volume had slipped its golden prison . [His]3604-he loneliness had grown overwhelming , and [he]3604-he suddenly thought of [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny 's clippings . [[His]3604-he mother]3752-his mother , alarmed by an insidious gain in weight , had brought [the masseuse]460-the masseuse back from [New York]8-new york with [her]3752-his mother , and [Mrs. Heeny]193-mrs. heeny , with [her]193-mrs. heeny old black bag and waterproof , was established in [one of [the grand bedrooms lined with mirrors]3669-the grand bedrooms lined with mirrors]3668-one of the grand bedrooms lined with mirrors . [She]193-mrs. heeny had been loud in [her]193-mrs. heeny joy at seeing [[her]193-mrs. heeny little friend]3670-her little friend that morning , but four years had passed since [their]3671-their last parting , and [her]193-mrs. heeny personality had grown remote to [him]3604-he . [He]3604-he saw [too many people]3672-too many people , and [they]3672-too many people too often disappeared and were replaced by [others]807-others : [his]3604-he scattered affections had ended by concentrating themselves on the charming image of [the gentleman [he]3604-he called [[his]3604-he French father]3675-his french father]3674-the gentleman he called his french father ; and since [[his]3604-he French father]3675-his french father had vanished [no one else]890-no one else seemed to matter much to [him]3604-he . " Here , now , just [you]218-paul look at these clippings -- [I]193-mrs. heeny guess [you]218-paul 'll find a lot in them about [your]218-paul Ma.--Where do they come from ? [[His]3683-he mother]3752-his mother 's marriages , for instance : [he]3683-he was sure there was a great deal to find out about [them]3686-them . But [she]193-mrs. heeny always said : " [I]193-mrs. heeny 'll tell [you]218-paul all about it when [I]193-mrs. heeny come back"--and[193-mrs. heeny] when [she]193-mrs. heeny came back it was invariably to rush off somewhere else . " The lamps were lit , the vases full of flowers , [the foot - men]6005-the foot - men assembled on [the landing]1741-the landing and in the vestibule below , when [Undine]416-undine descended to [the drawing - room]439-the drawing - room . As [she]416-undine passed [the ballroom]5986-the ballroom door [she]416-undine glanced in approvingly at the tapestries . They really looked better than [she]416-undine had been willing to admit : they made [[her]416-undine ballroom the handsomest in [Paris]76-paris]6009-her ballroom the handsomest in paris . But something had put [her]416-undine out on the way up from [Deauville]163-deauville , and the simplest way of easing [her]416-undine nerves had been to affect indifference to the tapestries . Now [she]416-undine had quite recovered [her]416-undine good humour , and as [she]416-undine glanced down the list of [guests]6010-guests [she]416-undine was awaiting [she]416-undine said to [herself]416-undine , with a sigh of satisfaction , that [she]416-undine was glad [she]416-undine had put on [her]416-undine rubies . For the first time since [her]416-undine marriage to [Moffatt]212-moffatt [she]416-undine was about to receive in [[her]416-undine house]6011-her house [the people [she]416-undine most wished to see [there]603-there]6012-the people she most wished to see there . The beginnings had been a little difficult ; [their]6014-their first attempt in [New York]8-new york was so unpromising that [she]416-undine feared [they]6014-their might not be able to live down the sensational details of [their]6014-their reunion , and had insisted on [[her]416-undine husband]488-her husband 's taking [her]416-undine back to [Paris]76-paris . But [her]416-undine apprehensions were unfounded . It was only necessary to give [people]560-people the time to pretend [they]560-people had forgotten ; and already [they]560-people were all pretending beautifully . The French world had of course held out longest ; it had strongholds [she]416-undine might never capture . But already [seceders]6017-seceders were beginning to show [themselves]6017-seceders , and [her]416-undine dinner - list that evening was graced with the names of [an authentic Duke]6018-an authentic duke and [a not too - damaged Countess]6019-a not too - damaged countess . In addition , of course , [she]416-undine had [the Shallums]298-the shallums , [the Chauncey Ellings]211-the chauncey ellings , [May Beringer]337-may beringer , [Dicky Bowles]308-dicky bowles , [Walsingham Popple]188-walsingham popple , and [the rest of [the [New York]8-new york frequenters of [the Nouveau Luxe]2072-the nouveau luxe]6021-the new york frequenters of the nouveau luxe]6020-the rest of the new york frequenters of the nouveau luxe ; [she]416-undine had even , at the last minute , had the amusement of adding [Peter Van Degen]246-van degen to [their]560-people number . In the evening there were to be Spanish dancing and Russian singing ; and [Dicky Bowles]308-dicky bowles had promised [her]416-undine [a Grand Duke]6023-a grand duke for [her]416-undine next dinner , if [she]416-undine could secure [the new tenor who always refused to sing in [private houses]6025-private houses]6024-the new tenor who always refused to sing in private houses . Even now , however , [she]416-undine was not always happy . [She]416-undine had everything [she]416-undine wanted , but [she]416-undine still felt , at times , that there were other things [she]416-undine might want if [she]416-undine knew about [them]560-people . And there had been moments lately when [she]416-undine had had to confess to [herself]416-undine that [Moffatt]212-moffatt did not fit into the picture . At first [she]416-undine had been dazzled by [his]212-moffatt success and subdued by [his]212-moffatt authority . [He]212-moffatt had given [her]416-undine all [she]416-undine had ever wished for , and more than [she]416-undine had ever dreamed of having : [he]212-moffatt had made up to [her]416-undine for all [her]416-undine failures and blunders , and there were hours when [she]416-undine still felt [his]212-moffatt dominion and exulted in it . But there were others when [she]416-undine saw [his]212-moffatt defects and was irritated by [them]6026-them : when [his]212-moffatt loudness and redness , [his]212-moffatt misplaced joviality , [his]212-moffatt familiarity with [the servants]3544-the servants , [his]212-moffatt alternating swagger and ceremony with [[her]416-undine friends]1672-her friends , jarred on perceptions that had developed in [her]416-undine unawares . Now and then [she]416-undine caught [herself]416-undine thinking that [[his]212-moffatt two predecessors]6029-his two predecessors -- who were gradually becoming merged in [her]416-undine memory -- would have said this or that differently , behaved otherwise in such and such a case . And the comparison was almost always to [Moffatt]212-moffatt 's disadvantage . This evening , however , [she]416-undine thought of [him]212-moffatt indulgently . [She]416-undine was pleased with [his]212-moffatt clever stroke in capturing [the Saint Desert tapestries]6030-the saint desert tapestries , which [General Arlington]386-general arlington 's sudden bankruptcy , and a fresh gambling scandal of [Hubert]384-hubert 's , had compelled [[their]6030-the saint desert tapestries owner]3717-their owner to part with . [She]416-undine knew that [Raymond de Chelles]382-raymond had told [the dealers]6032-the dealers [he]382-raymond would sell [[his]382-raymond tapestries]6033-his tapestries to anyone but [Mr. Elmer Moffatt]212-moffatt , or [a buyer acting for [him]382-raymond]6034-a buyer acting for him ; and it amused [her]416-undine to think that , thanks to [Elmer]212-moffatt 's astuteness , [they]6030-the saint desert tapestries were under [her]416-undine roof after all , and that [Raymond]382-raymond and all [[his]382-raymond clan]6035-his clan were by this time aware of it . These facts disposed [her]416-undine favourably toward [[her]416-undine husband]488-her husband , and deepened the sense of well - being with which -- according to [her]416-undine invariable habit -- [she]416-undine walked up to the mirror above the mantelpiece and studied the image it reflected . [She]416-undine was still lost in this pleasing contemplation when [[her]416-undine husband]488-her husband entered , looking stouter and redder than ever , in evening clothes that were a little too tight . [His]488-her husband shirt front was as glossy as [his]488-her husband baldness , and in [his]488-her husband buttonhole [he]488-her husband wore the red ribbon bestowed on [him]488-her husband for waiving [his]488-her husband claim to a Velasquez that was wanted for [the Louvre]174-the louvre . [He]488-her husband carried a newspaper in [his]488-her husband hand , and stood looking about [the room]441-the room with a complacent eye . And immediately [she]421-madame de follerive had a great vague vision of the splendours [they]6043-they were going to -- all the banquets and ceremonies and precedences .... "[3729-she] [I]0-i should n't say [she]3729-she 'd want to , with so few jewels-- " [She]421-madame de follerive dropped the paper and turned to [[her]421-madame de follerive husband]488-her husband . "[0-i] If [you]0-i had a spark of ambition , that 's the kind of thing [you]0-i 'd try for . [You]0-i could have got it just as easily as not ! " [He]488-her husband laughed and thrust [his]488-her husband thumbs in [his]488-her husband waistcoat armholes with the gesture [she]421-madame de follerive disliked . "[0-i] As it happens , it 's about the one thing [I]0-i could n't . " "[0-i] [You]0-i could n't ? Why not ? " "[3730-they] Because [you]0-i 're divorced . [They]3730-they wo n't have divorced [Ambassadresses]422-ambassadresses . " "[0-i] [They]3730-they wo n't ? Why not , [I]0-i 'd like to know ? " "[3734-she] Well , [I]0-i guess [the court ladies]3731-the court ladies are afraid there 'd be [too many pretty women in [the Embassies]3733-the embassies]3732-too many pretty women in the embassies , " [he]0-i answered jocularly . [She]3734-she burst into an angry laugh , and the blood flamed up into [her]3734-she face . "[None-None] [I]0-i never heard of anything so insulting ! " [she]3734-she cried , as if the rule had been invented to humiliate [her]3734-she . There was a noise of motors backing and advancing in [the court]5698-the court , and [she]3734-she heard the first voices on the stairs . [She]3734-she turned to give [herself]3734-she a last look in the glass , saw the blaze of [her]3734-she rubies , the glitter of [her]3734-she hair , and remembered the brilliant names on [her]3734-she list . But under all the dazzle a tiny black cloud remained . [She]3734-she had learned that there was something [she]3734-she could never get , something that neither beauty nor influence nor [millions]3736-millions could ever buy for [her]3734-she . [She]3734-she could never be [[an Ambassador]4201-an ambassador 's wife]3738-an ambassador 's wife ; and as [she]3734-she advanced to welcome [[her]3734-she first guests]3739-her first guests [she]3734-she said to [herself]3734-she that it was the one part [she]3734-she was really made for .
